column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 10 19:05:42 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Than
\n`7Subj`6:`7 ORDERS - July 10 2003
\n`7CC`6: `7Alicia Bertram
\n\n
ORDERS - July 10th 2003\n
\n
* New Deployment created, called 'Patrol'\n
- 50 HBC from the Front will be moved to Patrol\n
- 50 HBC from the Command will be moved to Patrol\n
- 150 LC will be moved from the Supply to Patrol\n
- 97 LC will be moved from Command to Patrol\n
* TOTAL 247 LC, 100 HBC\n
* Orders for Patrol:\n
- Ride hard the length of the road, preventing Bandits\n
from further pilliaging the road.  Seek and destroy\n
all rebel met. (Between Caravan and Command)\n
- They are to rotate out tired, or fatigued units with\n
both, Front, Command, and Patrol as required \n
(these men should be as fresh and fast moving as\n
possible without exhausting the other deployments).\n
- The best scouts avaliable shall travel ahead, ordered\n
to locate any rebel activity and report back.  These\n
are hopefully the best of any professional scouts I\n
have.\n
* Order Changes for Supply\n
- 300 Men shall continue to patrol the perimeter of the\n
caravan at what is deemed a 'safe' distance by the\n
CO (as such a distance may alter depending on terrian\n
and line of sight).\n
- Patrols shall be weighted toward the front and flanks\n
(50 Rear, 75 Flanks (x2), 100 Front)\n
- 350 will remain as Constant guard, while remainder\n
clears road.\n
- In the event the patrols spot enemy activity, the\n
patrol deployment spotting the shall engage, while\n
the remaining patrols will collapse back to the Caraven.\n
The guard unit, during the collapse, will move to\n
reinforce the engaged patrol group.  The working units\n
shall also cease, and collapse back to the caraven.\n
* NOTE: Patrols are ordered not to engage, rather weight\n
to be reinforced by Guard unit if they are clearly\n
outmatched, and could not hold until the reinforcements\n
arrive without suffering serious losses.  If Rebels\n
attempt to force and engagement, Patrol group should\n
form conduct a controlled retreat in the direction of \n
the Caravan (staying out of range of the Rebels, but\n
not fleeing them entirely). \n
* Patrols are NOT to persue rebel units into areas of\n
likely ambush (woods, ravines, hills, etc) without\n
reinforcements, and then ONLY with extreme caution.\n
If the CO believes ambush and large loss of life is\n
likely (for small amount of counter kills) he is\n
authorized to withdraw, and break the persuit.\n
- No HBC shall be placed on work duty, rather they should\n
be evenly spread out amoung the Patrols and Guards\n
groups based on a LC to HBC ratio, with ratio in the\n
Guard double weighted.\n
- As for Mill production orders, their first task is to\n
get the damaged catapults upgraded and up to stuff, then\n
to divid effors between building more catapults, and\n
building the bargest.  Before I say how much man power\n
is going into each, I'd like rough ETA's for a barge\n
as well as a catapult, and also an estimate on how many\n
barges this will take.\n
- Also, I want in inventory done of the supply train we\n
have met up with, and I want it checked against what\n
we are expecting with my logisitics officer, and I want\n
to know if there are any more trains unaccounted for.\n
As well, Caemlyn should be updated to our current\n
status.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jul 19 18:19:05 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Faulen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Times =)
\nHi hon!\n
\n
I got mail! I'm so excited. =)... But anyway, here are some of my work schedules to give\n
you a better idea of when I might be online. (I live in Indiana, so we're EST... err is\n
it Central?... Doh, Indiana changes timezones every time I change underwear.)\n
\n
Monday: 1pm - 9pm  (Playtime: After 10pm)\n
Tuesday: Same as above -or- Off. (Playtime: All day! Yay!)\n
Wednesday: 9am - 5pm  (Playtime: After 6pm)\n
Thursday: Ususall have this day off, but must attend band practice at 8pm. =( Gotta love\n
us musicians. =)\n
Friday: See Monday\n
Saturday: See Wednesday\n
Sunday: Work every alternate sunday, band practice at 7. Probably wont be able to play on\n
this day. =(\n
\n
There ya go! I hope this helps... My schedule fluxuates weekly, so sometimes I work the \n
9-5 shift, other times its the 1-9. <shrug>. Any questions, lemme know!\n
\n
Fauly\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jul 22 05:45:58 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alicia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Active War?
\nPatrolling is not making active war.\n
* Orders for Patrol:\n
- Ride hard the length of the road, preventing Bandits\n
from further pilliaging the road.  Seek and destroy\n
all rebel met. (Between Caravan and Command)\n
- They are to rotate out tired, or fatigued units with\n
both, Front, Command, and Patrol as required \n
(these men should be as fresh and fast moving as\n
possible without exhausting the other deployments).\n
- The best scouts avaliable shall travel ahead, ordered\n
to locate any rebel activity and report back.  These\n
are hopefully the best of any professional scouts I\n
have.\n
\n
You have them riding up and down the road, and at\n
a hard ride...  But a maintained hard ride, so they\n
aren't going -that- much faster than normal and\n
are tired out.  If getting there faster weren't\n
exhausting, it wouldn't be getting there faster.\n
I would be normal speed cause everyone would do it.\n
\n
Bear in mind that, with the turnaround time,\n
as well as having to do active patrolling and\n
alert for traps in the road, and throw in making\n
sure they don't get sniped, they're not spending\n
much time off the road.  In other words, you're\n
still limiting your rules of engagement.\n
In other words, you are still reactive.  You are\n
not making war, you're playing defensive, and it's\n
not working along a long road lined with rough trees\n
and ambush points.\n
\n
I'm not trying to criticize.  I'm trying to help you.\n
Please listen to what I'm saying with an open mind.\n
\n
You haven't had any luck finding a saw blade in\n
any of the villages along the riverfront.  You\n
probably need to get one from a more urban setting.\n
There might be one in Aringill, though that doesn't\n
help you much.\n
\n
Btw, your supplies are starting to run low.\n
You may wish to either work with the CotL to\n
get some supplies.  Your own supply train is\n
moving slowly enough that you probably will start\n
having men go on half rations within a few days.\n
Also, things will start to break and/or wear down.\n
-Alicia\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jul 23 14:51:49 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Than
\n`7Subj`6:`7 More stuff.
\n\n
Okay, Daemien and myself have come to a little agreement, we are going to be\n
freely sharing scouts.  What this means is, basically our scouting networks are\n
going to be working together fuller.  Shared duties, co-ordinated routes, etc.\n
The scouts will be reporting to BOTH camps, so when you send out updates, you\n
can send us each the combined scout report (saves everyone time, and you just\n
need to copy and paste).  In addition, Daemien is going to be putting armed\n
Patrols into the areas around Aringill.  Particularly the shores, the woods\n
north of Aringill, south of Aringill and basically in the places where we've\n
been detecting the stealhty guys.  He should be filling you in on the\n
specifics, and if you don't already have his mail (which you should) tell\n
me please.  In addition to this, I'll be sending out some stealth patrols.\n
These will just be rotations of suitable men still at the Command, Camp, and\n
Mill. Daemien will be aware of them, but hopefully, Zals scouts will not.\n
Also, I'll forward you a copy of the letter I will be sending to Fallion,\n
but I'd like to tell you now, I will be requesting maps of the areas between\n
Caemlyn and Aringill, and using my logistics team to pick out areas of likely\n
ambush.  Once thats done, I'll be sending men out to destroy any possible \n
destroyable cover there.  The maps should come with Kolthis, I don't want to\n
have them shipped with drones of NPCs.\n
I think thats it, but you'll probably note if I left anything out, so let\n
me know if I have.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jul 23 14:51:49 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Than
\n`7Subj`6:`7 More stuff.
\n\n

Also, I'll forward you a copy of the letter I will be sending to Fallion,\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jul 23 15:03:16 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Daemien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 The War in Aringill
\nThan and I have agreed ICly and OOCly to start sharing scout reports.\n
He said he would mail you about it.  I'm mailing, too, so you don't have\n
to track me down and ask me if he was telling the truth.\n
\n
From now on, you can assume that if my scouts tell me something, they also\n
tell him, and that if his tell him something, they tell me as well.\n
Also, I'm wondering why I haven't gotten any scouting reports recently.\n
Than has.  I have also been sending out scouts, however, and nothing is\n
coming back to me.  Why is that?\n
\n
Than and I are going to be coordinating our scouting efforts now, so as\n
to cover a larger area with increased detail.  Please do not assume that\n
my scouts are only looking for things that DIRECTLY affect me.  They're\n
looking for anything important to the state of the war in the region.\n
Commanders who wait until something looks like it's a direct problem for\n
them end up losing wars.\n
\n
Finally, I'm devoting 300 men to patrols in close cooperation with Than's\n
cavalry to deal with the bandit problems along the supply lines.\n
They, as well as my scouts, will be sharing horn calls, passwords, and\n
other such matters of infrastructure.\n
\n
The men in the patrols will attempt to keep an eye on the riverbank, as\n
well as the roads and forests.  I will be taking reports from these\n
patrols as if they were scouts, as well.  If they find a place that looks\n
like a good ambush point for use against Andoran or Child of the Light\n
supply trains, they are to report its existence.  If it is approved\n
by Than, next time a patrol passes that way, the patrol will be carrying\n
torches and whiskey, which they will use to burn back any vegetation\n
providing cover at the suspected ambush point.\n
\n
The officers commanding my patrols will be under orders to exercise good\n
judgement in taking advantage of any opportunities encountered while on\n
patrol.  They'll be moving in groups of not less than 20 and not more than\n
100, with orders to bring in any bandits apprehended alive, for\n
questioning.  If they encounter masses of bandits in excess of\n
their own numbers, they're ordered to retreat in orderly fashion\n
rather than join battle and be slaughtered.  They are to return to camp\n
IMMEDIATELY to report the location and numbers of the bandits encountered.\n
\n
I'll also be looking for a handful of volunteers willing to attempt\n
to infiltrate Aringill's defenses and gather intelligence for me.  If\n
any bandits are captured, I will work with Than to attempt to extract\n
information about Aringill's passwords and other such things, so as to\n
increase the possibility that my agents will survive their endeavors.\n
\n
Please keep me posted as to any new developments in the war -- even those\n
which do not DIRECTLY affect me.  Assume that I am a nosy bastard, and\n
that I've instructed my scouts to report ANYTHING that looks odd, or\n
even just different from the last time they went out.  I am not George\n
Bush, Jr., and I do not expect my scouts to tell me WHY things are\n
happening.  But I expect them to tell me WHAT is happening, so that I can\n
try to make sense of it.\n
\n
-- Daemien's player\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 24 00:16:24 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alicia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Last mail
\nOkies, though the maps won't be as specific as you\n
may wish.  We're not in the age of reason yet.\n
Since his travel and his duties will be limited by War,\n
and since he's carrying stuff for you for War, he\n
won't be able to reach Aringill until I mail you\n
both about it.  :<  PC movement is rarely regulated,\n
but this is one of those instances where it must be\n
due to the overlap and the possibility of abuse.\n
Thanks!\n
-Alicia\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 24 00:31:59 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alicia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Patrols
\nYou haven't gotten scout reports because your scouts\n
hadn't found anything.  Than's scouts only found one\n
odd thing around Aringill, and your scouts have been\n
pretty limited around there since (until now) I hadn't\n
gotten word that you both are allowing scouts to\n
freely pass each other.\n
Your scouts just weren't in the right place, time, and\n
dice roll to get his bit of info.\n
The rest of his reports have been coming from the\n
supply train of his.\n
Speaking of, infiltration will be pretty hard.\n
Crossing the no man's land is impossible, and using small\n
watercraft to enter the city undetected would be\n
next to impossible.  Swimming is out of the question,\n
with the breakwater, the current, and the mill all\n
hampering entrance.\n
Furthermore, without assistance from other branches\n
than yours, you really have no good infiltrators.\n
Than may, but you do not.  It's one of your weaknesses.\n
Ambush points along the road?  It's in Braem Wood for\n
much of the way.  That's a huge, long ambush point...\n
And I guarantee that you don't have enough good\n
flammables to give your men.  Fermented alcohol?  Yup.\n
But that doesn't burn.  Distilled?  Perhaps an officer\n
or two has brandy, but you're probably the only one who\n
has any, due to the nature of the Children.\n
Whiskey?  To be technical, whiskey wasn't big in the\n
continental portion of Europe until the 1800s, and RJ's\n
writing reflects that in his never having mentioned it.\n
Perhaps people RP drinking it, but as far as war\n
tech goes, it's not a commoner's drink.\n
Distilling is still a pretty expensive thing, and\n
most commoners won't be able to afford wine, let alone\n
brandy.\n
Even so, had there been large amounts of alcohol in a\n
quasi-religious order that is all about intolerance\n
and temperance...  There still wouldn't be enough to\n
burn down Braem Wood, even if you wished to do so.\n
There are quite a few ambush spots that you know of\n
off the top of your head...  For instance, you can\n
recall that the road has a few turns where it follows\n
the lay of the land.  Turns are good ambush points.\n
That knowledge alone should tell you how hard a time\n
Than's group is having.\n
\n
Also, are you sure you want to send mounted troops\n
to fight in the woods?  They can, per se, but you won't\n
have the great advantages that your men normally have\n
over every other cavalry in the world...\n
-Alicia\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 24 00:31:59 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alicia

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 24 13:33:18 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Than
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Letter sent by Pigeon
\n\n
Your Majesty,\n
News of the Front is far from pleasant, Lord Zalandrel Shrewin has been \n
prepared for his arrival, and without our knowledge placed units behind \n
our lines, I believe, before we ever arrived.  It is with great \n
frustration that I must now move to re-secure the Queen's Highway \n
stretching between Caemlyn and Aringill.  It is more infuriating Majesty, \n
that I must leave the duties of these patrols to my officers, who are \n
among Andor's finest, however, they lack the ability to respond, and when \n
required, violate the set terms of engagement.  It is therefore, that I \n
ask you to personally request Lord Kolthis Traemare's presence, to take \n
command of securing your highway.  I realize he has retired from the\n
Queen's Guards, however, so had I.  It is important you ask him \n
personally, I believe he enjoys his retirement, but I require a man with \n
experience to deal with the bandits, for they are using hit and fade \n
tactics, doing everything in their power to hinder, and slow, pillaging \n
the road, and felling trees across it.  I believe he is the man to deal \n
with it, for I cannot leave my post.\n
With the Lord Traemare, I would also request all maps you have of the lands \n
that stretch between Caemlyn and Aringill, I believe it will be of his \n
benefit, and his charge, to examine and remove any likely points of ambush \n
along the road that he might.\n
In addition, I have secured no fewer then two thousand, five hundred refugees \n
from Aringill, and they are now in service of the Throne, operating a mill \n
to both furbish barges to transport the Children of the Light, in \n
accordance with our treaty, as well to construct better siege engines for \n
the siege.  It will be important that in the following supply trains, both \n
additional food, and supplies be sent to attribute for both situations.\n
Further more, in addition to the presence of Lord Traemare, I would request \n
that you deploy your Aes Sedai advisor to me.  I realize this may seem \n
unusual, however, I have experienced an Aes Sedai's worth on the field \n
during Malkier's fall.  I realize Zalandrel, despite his actions, is not a \n
trolloc, but I believe her presence would at the very least service to \n
boost my men's moral, and her warders should be able to provide advise to \n
the under-officers in means of conducting themselves in secret.\n
Finally Majesty, and it is with regret that I inform you, that Cairhien \n
forces have been slain in Aringill during the siege.  Cairhien continues \n
to supply Aringill with both supplies and weapons, and it is my belief \n
they support them with soldiers.  In fact, captured scouts from Aringill \n
report that the proportion of Cairhien forces in the city are high.  \n
Supporting, and defying Andor in her own land is an act of war Majesty, \n
and we should regard ourselves at war with Cairhien and maintain vigilance \n
against further attacks or maneuvers by them, even if no formal \n
declaration has been made.\n
Eron Dallow Norwelyn,\n
Lord of House Norwelyn,\n
High Seat of House Norwelyn,\n
Marshal-General of Andor.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jul 25 15:20:38 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Daemien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Bandits and Braem Wood
\nNot to nitpick unduly, but Braem Wood is quite a long\n
way north of the Caemlyn-Aringill highway.\n
\n
The maps that give the best-defined extent of the forest\n
of northeastern Andor are located on pp. 10-11 of Crossroads\n
of Twilight.  The distance separating its edge from the road\n
is at least half as much as the distance separating Caemlyn\n
from Aringill.  There might well be scrap forest along the\n
road, but for the most part the area described on both this map\n
and on the map inside the frontispiece of the volume indicate\n
rolling country interspersed with cleared land, sparse forest,\n
and grasslands.\n
\n
In other words, not wilderness but not-terribly dense agriculture.\n
\n
If you're not using the maps from the books, of course, that is\n
your prerogative.  But I would appreciate knowing if the picture\n
you use is strikingly different from the one I use.\n
\n
As a side note, yes, I want to send mounted troops to patrol in\n
the woods.  I am not sending them out to seek out fights.  I am\n
sending them out to discourage attempts at disrupting the traffic\n
on the roads.  Heavy patrolling is a deterrant to attempts at ambush\n
because if heavy but irregular patrols are common in a region, you\n
never quite know when you'll have your activites interrupted by\n
a lot of serious men with big swords.  If my men can't actually root\n
out the bandits/Aringill sympathizers/guerilla soldiers, they can\n
at least make life inconvenient for them.\n
\n
Essentially, my orders in regards to the patrols are to make matters\n
so that the banditos do not know when, where, or how many men they\n
may have to face at any given time.  Ambushes require some planning,\n
and I'm trying to make it harder for them to plan.\n
\n
It is one thing to know that a fat supply train is going to\n
come plodding by at regular intervals.  It is another to know that there\n
are other heavily armed men wandering the countryside looking for things\n
that are out of place, as well.\n
\n
If my men just make the bandits hunker down and try not to draw attention\n
to themselves as much, that'll accomplish my goals.  I'm not out to\n
exterminate the lot of 'em.  That's Than's problem, and Queen Fallion's.\n
I'm just giving my men something to do other than squat in camp and\n
alternate between being bored, drill, and watch refugees.  The mounts\n
need exercise anyway, and boredom is bad for morale.  Maybe they'll\n
catch some bandits.  Maybe not.\n
\n
Obviously the bandits know better than to do more than hit-and-run ambush\n
work, because otherwise they'd be dead.  And equally obviously, they are\n
not inflicting catastrophic losses on Than.  If they were, I'd have\n
gotten other messages than what I have gotten, which amount to, "I'm\n
spread too thin, here."\n
\n
Anyway, I'm about to really start rambling.  Keep me posted about what's\n
happening now that my scouts and patrols are circulating, as I am sure you\n
will.  If something happens, mail me and I'll respond.\n
\n
-- Daemien's Player\n

column5: Official Notice of Haven, its position and strengths

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jul 28 06:45:47 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Aratan
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Official Notice of Haven, its position and strengths
\n* * * * The Queens Royal Mail System * * * *\n
Date: Mon Apr 14 05:08:10 2003\n
To: Aratan\n
From: Alicia\n
CC: Aratan Talavin Vaelin\n
This is official notice that Haven is just off of the road\n
from Tar Valon to Fal Moran.  The exact location is on the\n
other side of the Erinin where it forks at the east side of\n
the Erinin and where it forks at the Shienaran border.  It\n
is in the fork, on the south side of the river from the\n
Shienaran border.  It does not encroach on any country's\n
sovereign lands, though it is rather close to Shienar.\n
Shienar agreed to this, partially because it is not their\n
land, and partially because they expect the Legion would\n
help defend them.  And because one of the leading Generals\n
of the creation was the brother to the Shienaran Queen.\n
Ranulf an'shinowa is (daes already approved) Evalyne\n
Togita's (originally an'shinowa) brother.  Building of\n
the keep started with the legion's creation, some\n
twenty-five years before Malkier's fall.\n
Haven is where the road to Tar Valon crosses the Erinin.\n
It has a nice, healthy wall along therivers on both sides\n
of the fork, with a drawbridge leading to a "driveway" to\n
the road.  The fact that the fortress is nearby protects\n
the trade route as you can't bypass a defended strongpoint\n
like that -  You might even be able to reach the road with\n
siege engines from your (nice big) walls.  Haven's a\n
pretty tough nut to crack.\n
-Alicia\n

column5: IC note warning of Lamont, given to Ara by Dafyd

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jul 28 07:01:41 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Aratan
\n`7Subj`6:`7 IC note warning of Lamont, given to Ara by Dafyd
\nThere is something written upon it:\n
* * * * The Queens Royal Mail System * * * *\n
Date: Thu Jan 23 20:21:46 2003\n
To: dafyd\n
From: rhiannon\n
** sealed with burgundy and grey wax with the impression of a tulip ** \n
** The text is written in a cursive feminine style **\n
** There is no signiture. **\n
** Messages were slipped under the doors of those who represent the White Tower, left by a maid in in the Keep or any other means it took to get the message out. **\n

After a couple encounters with the Lord Captain Commnder of the Children of the Light - word and description is being sent around to those who hail from Tar Valon. This man should be considered dangerous and not to be trusted above and beyond the usual wariness for Children. He is having various people from other factions, included an Aes Sedai and a Seanchan Captain, followed. He is quoted as saying "I dont trust the light." \n
riness for Children. He is having various people from other factions, included an Aes Sedai and a Seanchan Captain, followed. He is quoted as saying "I dont trust the light." \n
is quoted as saying "I dont trust the light." \n

Below is an artist sketch of the Lord Captain Commander of the Children of the Light. A black haired, heavy-set man of medium stature.* * * Just below the text is fairly well-done rendition of a facial penciled-sketch of the Lord Captain Commander. The sharp-planed featured man has short, close-cropped dark hair with unkempt\n
bangs hanging over his brow. Wild eyebrows rest over dark and intense beedy eyes. He is sketched broad of shoulder. * * *\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jul 29 03:40:34 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alicia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Maps
\nI'm using the map in the inside covers of the books.\n
That's the one that shows all of Randland and is\n
available to almost everyone.\n
According to that map, Braem Wood is nowhere even\n
close to as far as you suggest it is, and the map\n
you're referencing is nowhere near as detailed.\n
I'm sorry, but I'm not going to play musical maps\n
in order to make things easier or harder on one\n
side or the other.  We use the most available, most\n
detailed map in the books, as far as I'm concerned,\n
and that map is pretty clear about forest coming down\n
to the road in large tracts, including the portion\n
that Than's forces are in.\n
\n
I'll also point out that your alt is well aware that\n
mounted troops are at a severe disadvantage in\n
forest terrain.  You'll lose far more men than Than will\n
if you send mounted troops.\n
If you want to do this, that's fine, but you'll have to\n
be specific about numbers, orders, and rules of\n
engagement.\n
I'll council you one last time, though, not to\n
send mounted troops into the forest.  All your alt's\n
training and instincts would tell you to keep them on\n
roads or plains, if at all possible.\n
\n
If you want them to get some exercise and training\n
in, then you might consider scouting a new supply chain\n
because your current one, having moved north of Aringill,\n
is visible to the rebels, as well as being frightfully\n
obvious to Than, if that bothers you.\n
\n
Side note: since your scouts are mingling now, they\n
have probably noticed by now that Than's forces outside\n
Aringill have dropped significantly.  Perhaps by up\n
to half of his troops, though it's likely closer to\n
a third.\n
Also, sitting around is bad for morale.  Getting hit by\n
guerillas who are better suited and trained for the\n
terrain is worse.  Imagine Viet Nam.\n
Correct me if I'm wrong, too, but aren't your troops\n
busy guarding the mill now?\n
-Alicia\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jul 29 03:40:34 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alicia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Maps
\nI'm using the map in the inside covers of the books.\n
That's the one that shows all of Randland and is\n
available to almost everyone.\n
According to that map, Braem Wood is nowhere even\n
close to as far as you suggest it is, and the map\n
you're referencing is nowhere near as detailed.\n
I'm sorry, but I'm not going to play musical maps\n
in order to make things easier or harder on one\n
side or the other.  We use the most available, most\n
detailed map in the books, as far as I'm concerned,\n
and that map is pretty clear about forest coming down\n
to the road in large tracts, including the portion\n
that Than's forces are in.\n
\n
I'll also point out that your alt is well aware that\n
mounted troops are at a severe disadvantage in\n
forest terrain.  You'll lose far more men than Than will\n
if you send mounted troops.\n
If you want to do this, that's fine, but you'll have to\n
be specific about numbers, orders, and rules of\n
engagement.\n
I'll council you one last time, though, not to\n
send mounted troops into the forest.  All your alt's\n
training and instincts would tell you to keep them on\n
roads or plains, if at all possible.\n
\n
If you want them to get some exercise and training\n
in, then you might consider scouting a new supply chain\n
because your current one, having moved north of Aringill,\n
is visible to the rebels, as well as being frightfully\n
obvious to Than, if that bothers you.\n
\n
Side note: since your scouts are mingling now, they\n
have probably noticed by now that Than's forces outside\n
Aringill have dropped significantly.  Perhaps by up\n
to half of his troops, though it's likely closer to\n
a third.\n
Also, sitting around is bad for morale.  Getting hit by\n
guerillas who are better suited and trained for the\n
terrain is worse.  Imagine Viet Nam.\n
Correct me if I'm wrong, too, but aren't your troops\n
busy guarding the mill now?\n
-Alicia\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

carring with him maps and other information that Lord Eron has requested.  He travels with a minimum of guards \n
to better allow for speed.\n
Any more information you need, please ask\n
\n
Kolthis (Also Bertram)\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Aug 19 16:10:08 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Than
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Mini-Snipit of Channeling, Ho-rah.
\nThan archs an eyebrow, and there is a faint moment of pause in him as his eyes\n
flutter closed, and when they open they are more distant, vague, and the \n
scents drain from him.  "There is a city full of Andorans, or atleast \n
Andoran nobles inside that city out there that would like to see me dead.  \n
Are you one of his men then?  The traitor Zalandrel?"\n
Lyana rubs her nose and sighs, shaking her head. The humor is gone from her \n
eyes and her voice. "No.  My family pulled their interests out of Aringill \n
when the traitor starting preparing for the seige and I have even less \n
interest in him or his bid for a useless city-state than they." She tilts \n
her head, looking at Than much as a dog looks at an interesting toy.\n
Than frowns, and slowly the Saidin is draw into him, the tinest of strands, and \n
he smiles as the mere trickle fills him, but there is no real warmth in \n
his smile.  "Then your interest in talking seems little, be quick about \n
why you are here, and be true with your words, if I think you are lying, \n
you will be put to the hangman."  His words are not harsh, infact, they \n
are rather calm.  With the small amounts of the power now flowing through \n
him, stiffling the great urge to draw more, he watches Lyana, his ears \n
straining to listen, and he takes several steps closer to the her, his \n
eyes searching her face for signs of distress or flickers in her features, \n
his ears also strained.\n
Lyana glances at the guards and then back at Than.  She appears calm, no sweat, \n
no raising pulse in her neck, no fidgeting.  "House Traemane is being \n
drawn in to support you at the highest levels, or so the rumors go.  My \n
cousin is the Captain of the house guard, so I tend to listen a bit more \n
to some than others.  For now, I am just looking for information - if my \n
family should seek out other trading routes - with the seachen in the west \n
and now cairhien in the east it is getting difficult." She tilts her head \n
slightly and offers a smile, not a humorous one, but with a marked \n
wryness. "And as someone often between here and Caemlyn - how much longer \n
the traitor's men will be rampaging on the roads and fields?"\n
Than merely smiles that same emotionless smile, and he brings his emotions back \n
closer the surface, but when he does so there is a slight surge of Saidin \n
with him, and for a moment it appears he hesitates in his speaking, \n
resting his hand on the desk almost casualy, but not entirely so.  \n

Guards, you may leave her here with me.  I do not yet believe her story, 
but perhaps she was meant as a surprise, perhaps not.  There are many in 
the city who know I do not tend to harm ladies, although older then I 
would expect.  But fit.  I shall determine it for myself.  His eyes
flicker toward the officer, who merely smirks ever so slightly and then \n
nods his head.  "Post men around my tent, it should be no more then an \n
hour, and if she is an assassin I shall consider it a release from my \n
duties here, they have been stifled of late."  There is slight annoyance \n
in his voice at his last comment.\n
Lyana arches an eyebrow again and shrugs, "It would make more sense to shoot an \n
arrow at you when you ride than attempt a lone attack on the camp.  \n
Though, if the guard hadn't moved to relieve himself  I likely would have \n
gotten close enough to at least ask for an appointment of your secretary." \n
She's amused again, but makes no move to leave the stool. "Ask as you \n
will.  My life isn't likely much more thrilling than your own."\n
Than merely waits for the guards to depart, and then he turns his eyes back to \n
Lyana, drawing in another bit of the power, this time intentionally and he \n
makes no sway.  Nor does he simply hold it this time, he moves to place \n
himself on the other side of the desk, across from Lyana.  It is then that \n
he releases small stands of the Power, a lace of air and fire, small, too \n
small to to cause much feeling, and infact would likely be above \n
awareness.  "You wished to know of the status of Aringill?  Wouldn't \n
messangers, or scouts be more appropriate then a noblewoman?  Especially \n
one carrying Aiel blades, and dressed so oddly?"\n
Lyana shrugs slightly, "I'm a bit of a blacksheep, my lord.  No interest in \n
farming no real desire for the day to day trading life so I have always \n
wandered a bit more than most." She guestures with long and delicate \n
fingers sporting more callouses than even a lady-farmer would have towards \n
her weapons, "My husband was Aiel and the weapons are from my...in-laws as \n
we would say."  Her nose wrinkles a bit and she rubs the back of her hand \n
as it drops back into her lap, as if something she can't place has raised \n
the hairs there.\n
Than purses his lips, and the

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Aug 20 17:29:45 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Daemien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Children on Cairhienin soil
\nNo, you hadn't talked to me about it.\n
\n
But now that you have, the men in Cairhien\n
(they're camped on the bank of the Erinin)\n
indicate that they're waiting for Lord\n
Captain Saighan to muster the necessary\n
resources to move men across the river in\n
large numbers, and that the conflict around\n
Aringill has proved highly disruptive to his\n
efforts to acquire sufficient transportation\n
for them.\n
\n
They indicate, further, that an answer from the\n
Lord Captain may take time, because his command\n
post is across the river, and communications\n
are slightly bogged down by this fact.  They invite\n
you to approach him directly, if you should\n
happen to have the means to send an emissary to him.\n
\n
In the meantime, they explain that they are literally\n
unable to honor the terms of the agreement governing\n
the Children's presence in Cairhien, unless you\n
are able and willing to help their commanding officer\n
find the means to remove them.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Aug 20 17:29:45 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Daemien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Children on Cairhienin soil
\nNo, you hadn't talked to me about it.\n
\n
But now that you have, the men in Cairhien\n
(they're camped on the bank of the Erinin)\n
indicate that they're waiting for Lord\n
Captain Saighan to muster the necessary\n
resources to move men across the river in\n
large numbers, and that the conflict around\n
Aringill has proved highly disruptive to his\n
efforts to acquire sufficient transportation\n
for them.\n
\n
They indicate, further, that an answer from the\n
Lord Captain may take time, because his command\n
post is across the river, and communications\n
are slightly bogged down by this fact.  They invite\n
you to approach him directly, if you should\n
happen to have the means to send an emissary to him.\n
\n
In the meantime, they explain that they are literally\n
unable to honor the terms of the agreement governing\n
the Children's presence in Cairhien, unless you\n
are able and willing to help their commanding officer\n
find the means to remove them.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Sep  3 14:14:54 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Alythia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 RP Log

\nHi, ok here's the log...its a bit long but its good. Now, there are a few closed emotes in here, but Ambar accepted them for the interest of him having absolutely no WM or fighting skills and me having WM1 at 97%:)\n
\n
Ambar sits on the edge of a bench by the fountain, staring intently at his sack as he digs through it. Every couple of seconds his eyes flicker upwards, watching the people moving about the Oval.\n
\n

Alythia grins as she approaches the bench where Ambar is seated. "Why hello there Ambar, have any new goodies for me today?" She says this from a good enough ways away, so as to not startle him. She slides onto the bench next to him, the grin still showing.\n
\n

Ambar jumps in his seat as he is addressed, his gaze snapping towards Alythia.  Upon recognizing her, he visibly relaxes, a smile blooming on his face. "The Light favor you, my Lady Menera," he says smoothly, incling his head in a slight bow.  "It has been too long since last we met."  His manner would not be out of place in a palace, and he seems unaware that it is out of place in the current company.  Rising as Alythia approaches, he sits again only after she sits.  "Ah, I am afraid I have nothing new, as I have had no time to replenish my wares since we last spoke."\n
\n

Alythia nods, "No problem, the daggers you sold me are becoming quite useful. You were right, by the way, they are perfectly balanced." Suddenly a flash of metal and a dagger appears in her hand, poised for throwing. She throws it up, the dagger flipping a couple of times, and she catches it smoothly and slides it back into its hidden sheath somewhere in her left sleeve. "So, where have you been?"\n
\n

Amber watches closely as Alythia flourishes the dagger, seeming slightly jealous at her ease.  When he responds, however, there is nohing but warmth in his voice, "There were some people following me, and I had to lay low for a few days.  I tricked them though...made them think I left the city, then doubled back.  They're probably still searching for me on the road to Tar Valon."  He laughs, rich and hearty, much differnt than his weak, nervous laugh of several days ago.\n
\n

Alythia nods, "Good for you, hopefully they'll never catch you." She smiles, but it isn't quite a full smile. "Tell me, have you had any more trouble from the man who's henchmen we killed?" She looks about the oval quickly and returns her gaze to Ambar, eyes not showing nervousness but instead determination.\n
\n

Ambar laughs again, "No, I'm afraid he's probably cowering in some hole somewhere.  I don't think he knew what kind of enemy he would be facing."  Ambar's gaze follow's Alythia's as she searches the plaza, but snaps back just as quick as hers.  "There will be others, though, my tormentors are relentless."  His smile, once genuine, now appears forced.\n
\n

Alythia grins, "I'm sure there will be more, there always is yes?" She relaxes on the bench, lying her head back and letting the sunlight wash over her. "Mmm, such a wonderful day today...tell me, would you like some lunch?  I happen to a have a little food on me, I was planning to picnic today." She smiles warmingly, head still lying on the bench back.\n

Ambar nods in response to Alythia's first question, then again at her second.  He grins back as he reaches into his leather sack, rummaging for a moment before triumphantly pulling a round of cheese and a fresh-looking loaf of bread.  "My plans were much the same as yours, it seems," he replies in his easy manner.  "And I do indeed feel the stirrings of hunger.  Come, let us sup."  He laughs richly as if at some unspoken joke.\n

Alythia laughs with Ambar for a moment, and doesn't even look as she reaches to her side where her pouch is. She removes a hunk of cheese, a half loaf of bread and an apple. Each of the items look fresh and delicious. Alythia finally lifts her head, at least long enough to flourish a dagger into her left hand and cut a slice of cheese and another of bread. She places the cheese on the bread and pops it into her mouth. She lays her head back once again and chews delightedly. "Mmmmm..." Is the only sound that comes from her as she enjoys the food.\n

Ambar shakes his head at Alythia's ease at handling the knife.  "You know it took me weeks to learn to do that, and I fear I still do not match your skill."  He ruefully flicks his wrist, a dagger dropping into his hand, but with none of the artistry displayed by the woman next to him.  He cuts a large chunk from the fresh round of cheese, peels the pale wax from the bright orange cheese, and takes a small bite, swallowing before he continues.  "I had the finest teachers in Cairhien, but perhaps you know more than them, no?"  Tearing a hunk of bread from the loaf, he continues eating, taking alternating bites from the bread and

\n`7Subj`6:`7 Timeline
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Bethany
\n\n
Timeline, I suggest Book 4.  Probably the end, so as to let the Aiel back into\n
the world.  Since the shift is supposed to bring back these guilds, yes?\n
* Reason 1)Andor and Cairhien are still free, allowing the DD to still have some\n
wiggle room before the Iron Hand of Rand comes crashing down like a\n
sledge hammer.\n
* Reason 2)Rand and Mat are still powerful enough at this point to begin both\n
the BotRH as well as the Asha'man.  The amnesty can be declared in\n
Tear, and men can go there for training.  Mat can also reform the\n
Tairen army into the beginnings of the BotRH (as it was in part\n
founded this way anyway).\n
* Reason 3)Rand can have his bastion of power, a bit away from the central\n
RP zones (Cairhien/Andor/Tar Valon) and those following him would\n
still have enough of a reason to be in these RP zones.\n
* Why?     Because this way, there are still enough PC driven forces to allow\n
for some PC driven initives, as well there is enough Rand sloppily\n
gaining power that things can be done there as well, from an admin\n
standpoint.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Sep 11 18:19:34 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Than
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Timeline
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Bethany
\n\n
Timeline, I suggest Book 4.  Probably the end, so as to let the Aiel back into\n
the world.  Since the shift is supposed to bring back these guilds, yes?\n
* Reason 1)Andor and Cairhien are still free, allowing the DD to still have some\n
wiggle room before the Iron Hand of Rand comes crashing down like a\n
sledge hammer.\n
* Reason 2)Rand and Mat are still powerful enough at this point to begin both\n
the BotRH as well as the Asha'man.  The amnesty can be declared in\n
Tear, and men can go there for training.  Mat can also reform the\n
Tairen army into the beginnings of the BotRH (as it was in part\n
founded this way anyway).\n
* Reason 3)Rand can have his bastion of power, a bit away from the central\n
RP zones (Cairhien/Andor/Tar Valon) and those following him would\n
still have enough of a reason to be in these RP zones.\n
* Why?     Because this way, there are still enough PC driven forces to allow\n

standpoint.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Sep 12 12:32:55 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Varulv
\n`7Subj`6:`7 The fall of Saldaea
\n`7CC`6: `7Shai'tan Duren Nicodemus Varulv
\n\n
This isn't something I'd expected to find myself doing, but I'm\n
writing this mail to make a case for the fall of Saldaea, a la Malkier.\n
\n
ICly, of course, here is my reasoning.  I posted on the update board\n
quite some time ago that Saldaea was in danger of being overrun by the\n
shadow.  I personally warned the ruler of Saldaea, who has made no calls\n
for help from other borderland nations.  Regardless, the truth of the\n
matter is on the update board for any and all to see.  The legion, well\n
aware of Saldaea's plight (this came about partly at aratan's request),\n
has left for Aringill for OOC reasons, leaving Saldaea helpless.\n
\n
This went unnoticed by me for the better part of a month, because of my\n
shitty internet connection.  But the fact is that the Shadow has been\n
building up troops and making preparations for the Malkier campaign.\n
Saldaea was originally intended as a feint to draw troops and attention\n
away from Malkier and into Saldaea, but now that the legion has all but\n
withdrawn from the borderlands as a whole, there is no reason to hold back.\n
\n
At the very least, I would like to see the shadow break through Saldaea's\n
walls.  What happens from there would of course depend on the IC reactions\n
of other nations.  Saldaea doesn't have to fall like Malkier did, if more\n
troops are committed.  But I believe the possibility should be left open.\n
\n
-- Varulv\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Sep 19 17:31:15 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Zalandrel
\n`7Subj`6:`7 A message from Aringill
\n*This letter was brought to you by a messenger who insisted on delivering\n
the letter together with the signet ring of Lord Zalandrel Shrewin, General of\n
Defense of Aringill. He had come across the river after riding up river from Maerone.*\n
\n
Lord Talamanes\n
\n
I wish our correspondence could have taken place or at least have started in a\n
different situation, but alas I have never been able to forge the future after my will.\n
I'm not a politician at heart and overly noble courtesy has never been my strong\n
side. And I dare not waste any time with it when the end of Aringill seems so near.\n
\n
Aringill is in great need. After announcing ourselves an independant state the\n
Andorans has marched against us to lay siege upon our city. We are merely a \n
trading port with no real city defenses but we've been able to hold the Andorans\n
off by the sheer will of my people. Which they undoubtably would not have managed\n
if they truly didn't want freedom from Andoran reign.\n
\n
But however strong our will may be, we are still just a trading port. while\n
supplies are of no issue and neither is material, we are short of men. Men with\n
training required to wage war.\n
\n
That is why I send this letter, asking for your aid in keeping Aringill liberated.\n
\n
I have the Andorans supply line with some 200 raiders, 4 days away from Aringill\n
in Caemlyns direction. But we cannot hold them there much longer. My raiders are\n
are harassing the convoy but soon Erons forces will reach them and once the supply\n
line is cleared, I fear that Aringill will cease to exist. For we are not letting\n
them take our city whole.\n
\n
I eargently await your respons, whatever it may be.\n
\n
Light Illumine\n
\n
Lord Zalandrel Shrewin\n
General of Defense of Aringill\n
\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Oct  6 17:38:15 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Melekai
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Hunt for the Horn Update
\nThe Hunt for the Horn has begun!\n
\n
The hunt for the Horn has been called in the Square of Tammuz, the first \n
time in several years that anyone has remembered. A vast array of people \n
searching for adventure crowded into the square to swear the oaths. Many \n
are hopeful to find the Horn and bring fame to themselves, rumors about \n
that the Horn is located anywhere form the Spine of the World, to the Aryth \n
Ocean. But still some fear it's recovering, for it means Tarmon Gaidon is \n
on the horizon.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct  8 13:11:18 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Gerhard
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rough Outline
\n- Gerhard is with Elayne when Rand falls into the Palace gardens. He accompanies him to Queen Morgase and escorts him out of the Palace.\n
\n
- Gerhard travels with Elayne to Tar Valon to train with the Warders.\n
\n
- There Gerhard meets Min, Nynaeve, Egwene and many different Aes Sedai and Warders.\n
\n
- Liandrin tells Egwene and Nynaeve that they must accompany her to help Rand. Elayne and Min overhear and plan to come, too.\n
\n
- Gerhard also hears of the plot, and plans to join them.\n
\n
- Gerhard joins Egwene, Nynaeve, Elayne, Min and Liandrin through the Ways to Toman Head.\n
\n
- He escapes with Nynaeve and Elayne while Egwene and Min are captured.\n
\n
- Gerhard assists Nynaeve and Elayne with Egwene's escape.\n
\n
- Gerhard gets separated from the rest in the battle at Falme. He fights the Seanchan on the side of the heroes.\n
\n
- Gerhard then makes his own way back to Tar Valon, with a stolen Seanchan horse. He doesnt meet up with the rest of the heroes, or meet Rand.\n
\n
- Gerhard arrives in Tar Valon at around the same time as Elayne, Egwene, Nynaeve, Verin and Mat.\n
\n
- Gerhard is punished by his Warder mentors and admonished by Aes Sedai for running away. He keeps the truth of what happened to himself.\n
- Since Gerhard arrives in Tar Valon separately from the rest, he is able to pretend that he had nothing to do with their disappearances. \n
- Gerhard meets Mat. They get along well enough.\n
\n
- Gerhard continues training with the Warders.\n
\n
- Egwene, Elayne and Nynaeve leave for Tear.\n
\n
- Gerhard demands the Amyrlin tell him where his sister and Egwene are. Min returns to the Tower and runs into Gerhard as he leaves the Amyrlins study.\n
\n
- For a short time, life in the Tower is uneventful for Gerhard, outside of trying to learn the location of his sister.\n
\n

- Gerhard leads the trainees against the Warders in the battle of the White Tower, after Siuan is stilled. He does not kill Hammer or Coulin, however: that is done by other students. He does this because he doesnt trust Siuan since he feels the old Amyrlin used his friends and he feels that Siuan has been rightfully displaced, and he trusts Elaida because he has known her for all his life.\n
\n

- When confronted by Leane, Siuan and Min Gerhard realizes his mistake. Min convinces him that Elayne would have supported Siuan, if she had been here. He still doesnt trust Siuan. He helps them to escape. They have convinced him that what he has done was wrong.\n
\n

- Gerhard leaves the Younglings and the White Tower, not wanting to stay there as long as the usurper Elaida is in power. He does not ask the Younglings to come with him: he knows that they are loyal to the Tower. He explains to another chief Youngling that he has to leave for a time, and that he is in charge until he returns. Gerhard warns the Younglings to be wary of Elaida and the other Aes Sedai. He suggests that what happened isn't just. He eventually plans to come back and free the Younglings from Elaidas grasp.\n
\n

- Gerhard returns to Caemlyn for a time. He isn't there long before he has a confrontation with Gaebril and finds himself exiled from his homeland. He is worried about Elayne. He also wants to find a way to remove Gaebril and whatever hold he has over his Mother. He knows that he cant do this alone.\n
\n

- Upon leaving Caemlyn, he rides south, with a mind to find his sister. He eventually runs into a group of Aes Sedai that has fled from the White Tower and are heading to Salidar. He joins them, hoping to find Elayne, Egwene and all the rest.\n
\n

- Gerhard arrives at Salidar. He assists them in building the town, and resumes his study with the Warders. There is some tension, since he led the fight to keep Siuan captive. He tells about how he eventually assisted Siuan's escape, but many don't believe it.\n
\n

- Min, Siuan, Leane, Gareth Bryne, Nynaeve, and Elayne all arrive, each in their own time. Gerhard is relieved to see all of them, especially Elayne and Gareth Bryne. Min, Siuan and Leane are quite surprised to see them there, since they thought he was still at the Tower. Siuan affirms Gerhard's story.\n

- Gerhard is quite relieved when he hears that Gaebril has been overthrown by Rand and his crew. He is still upset, because he thinks that Gaebril killed his Mother. He is also upset because he hears that Rand is holding Caemlyn, which is not his right to do.\n

- Gerhard is very suspicious when the Salidar Aes Sedai sends Min with the nine Aes Sedai going to see Rand. He offers to come with her, but she insists that he stays. Gerhard is partly glad: he wouldn't want to leave Elayne's side again, even if she was among so many Aes Sedai.\n

column5: Things Needed for an Equipment System

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct  8 13:57:10 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Things Needed for an Equipment System
\nHeader One:  Things needed for a suffecient Equipment System -\n
\n
Coding aspect - Debugg info when Wielding. - Fixed?\n
Change in code so that AC values can be 1-100, not just 1-20.\n
Tax and Price Systems based off material composition Values.\n
Building aspect -\n
Going through zones 37 and 38, and making stats fit to the WATrialerror.DOC sheet\n
Creating shop(s) in caemlyn to sell zone 37 and 38 equipment.\n
\n
- Things that can be gotten around for now, but really ought to be done. -\n
Make certain weight value is read by the system so that an entered value of 10 is equivelent to 1 pound, not ten pounds\n

Make the AC value mean a percentage of the sustained damage that is blocked (say hit for 75, you have ac of 10(%), then 7.5 is blocked) instead of how it is currently, (you have ac of 10 and hit for 75, then you're dealt 65 damage)\n
Check the manner in which Hit Roll is handled.\n
Balance the equipment.\n
Make certain that Composition values can be applied to every item, No matter what "Type" flag.\n
Check to see how well 'range' on items works. (it seems to be slightly screwy right now)\n
\n
Go through -all- items and set their stats according to current system\n
Make a different flag for bows than crossbows, and make ranged weapons handle differently than just being a contact weapon with an ungodly range.\n
Over-haul craft system.\n
\n
That's about all I can think of for the moment, but there's probably more.\n
Like I've said here and earlier. Getting equipment in fully is going to be an ungodly task, but getting equipment in partially/suffeciently is very possible.\n
\n
Best way to do this, is to follow what's under the 1rst header. But there are two other points to consider. First. Give people Tool, and when its completed, Craft.\n

Second, if you can find a way to make the cost of items be determined in the shops you set up for zone 37/38 equipment, by their composition costs, and all the other shops by their "Value" flag costs, it would make all shops work and sell things at a reasonably appropriate price. (Players getting equipment that does nothing, if its non 37/38 battle eq, isn't an issue, as even if a player has an item created, tooled it, etc. Oediting it will still change its stats.\n

The third and last piece is an appropriate tax system. Very few people will want to buy equipment with our current tax system on items. It'll make them go broke quickly, make it so they will have to upkeep their charachters, if they want to keep the items (ie, preventing people who check in fairly regularly, but don't get to rp regularly) and generate a general apathy and distaste\n

For now, Making a timer on equipment that will make it wear out (and have them fix it once its broken (use the old (Broken) flag) or have the items break during combat, is probably a much more desirable format. Also, money should be taxed more heavily than items, and some items should be exempt from taxes (my damnable warder cloak, for instance!) \n
I think that's about it, though it probably isn't.\n
Mac\n

Balance the equipment.\n
Make certain that Composition values can be applied to every item, No matter what "Type" flag.\n
Check to see how well 'range' on items works. (it seems to be slightly screwy right now)\n
\n
Go through -all- items and set their stats according to current system\n
Make a different flag for bows than crossbows, and make ranged weapons handle differently than just being a contact weapon with an ungodly range.\n
Over-haul craft system.\n
\n
That's about all I can think of for the moment, but there's probably more.\n
Like I've said here and earlier. Getting equipment in fully is going to be an ungodly task, but getting equipment in partially/suffeciently is very possible.\n
\n
Best way to do this, is to follow what's under the 1rst header. But there are two other points to consider. First. Give people Tool, and when its completed, Craft.\n

Second, if you can find a way to make the cost of items be determined in the shops you set up for zone 37/38 equipment, by their composition costs, and all the other shops by their "Value" flag costs, it would make all shops work and sell things at a reasonably appropriate price. (Players getting equipment that does nothing, if its non 37/38 battle eq, isn't an issue, as even if a player has an item created, tooled it, etc. Oediting it will still change its stats.\n

The third and last piece is an appropriate tax system. Very few people will want to buy equipment with our current tax system on items. It'll make them go broke quickly, make it so they will have to upkeep their charachters, if they want to keep the items (ie, preventing people who check in fairly regularly, but don't get to rp regularly) and generate a general apathy and distaste\n

For now, Making a timer on equipment that will make it wear out (and have them fix it once its broken (use the old (Broken) flag) or have the items break during combat, is probably a much more desirable format. Also, money should be taxed more heavily than items, and some items should be exempt from taxes (my damnable warder cloak, for instance!) \n
I think that's about it, though it probably isn't.\n
Mac\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Oct 10 05:54:23 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Laurane
\n`7Subj`6:`7 EQ
\nHey. I was working on equip, but I only ever got access to zone\n
0, so once we had that problem on the bp and zone 0 got\n
hosed of objects, I haven't been able to edit any objects on the\n
bp. I had mail out to Cormac, but I haven't heard back from him\n
in a while.\n
\n
Anyway, I guess the short answer is yes, technically I am one of\n
the builders working on equip. I'll send you a tell when I'm\n
on later. Can't stay now, but I should be back later in the\n
day after class.\n

column5: Background for Application to join Wolfkin

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Oct 19 15:25:22 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Meldorf
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Application to join Wolfkin
\nMeldorf was born on 965 NE into a family with no other brothers\n
or sisters.  He grew up a single child into a young man and\n
found bonds with friends that he often went hunting and camping \n
together with.  He experienced his first catch of a rabbit at\n
the age of 12 and when he got to 18 he caught himself almost\n
any animal that lived in the forest but one, the wolf, always\n
deluded him.  He grew up on the out skirts of Baerlon and met\n
himself a young girl named Jenna when he was 14.  He left at\n
the age of 18 to train as a Ranger and Hunter around the area\n
of Braem Wood's and Caemlyn where he resided until this day.\n
When he turned 20 he met up with Jenna by concidence outside\n
the Lion Banner Inn where she had slept the night.  After long\n
chats with her they decided to meant up again and after many\n
meetings a relationship began to emerge and they fell in love.\n
In order to build a proper life with each other they needed a\n
home.  Meldorf began building a wooden house in Braem Woods\n
that he knew so well and felt comfitable in.  After its\n
construstion when Meldorf was still 20 but coming on 21, Jenna\n
gave birth to a baby girl that they called Sarah.  Only 3 years\n
later Jenna became ill after catching an illness that no Wisdom\n
was able to cure.  For 2 weeks and 3 days she held out against\n
the illness until she couldnt anymore.  Her body was taken back\n
to Baerlon where she was buried at the house of her parents.\n
He lived the rest of his life at home with his daughter Sarah,\n
watching her grow older and being the father he should be.  His\n
ability to catch food never left them hungry and his earnings\n
for animal skins never left them spare of money.  Now Meldorf\n
is 35 and Sarah is  coming on 15, she has recently seen an Aes\n
Sedai in town to the dislike of Meldorf, she has chosen to go\n
to Tar Valon to train to ways of Aes Sedai and learn the arts\n
of the One Power.  Now Meldorf lives alone and with noone\n
around he lives most of his life in and out of Inn's drinking\n
and often getting into fights and bets that get out of hand and\n
ends him with either an injure or a small jail time sentence.\n
His wish is to be something other than what he is now.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Oct 31 18:04:55 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Garm
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Tentative DF Application
\n`7CC`6: `7Varulv Shai'tan
\n\n
Background---\n
\n
Lugard, capital of Murandy, is reknowned for many things. Few of them are good and,\n
unfortunately, most of them are true. It is an oozing sore on civilization, a vile\n
canker filled with people who would stick you down for the handfull of coppers in\n
your purse as soon as look at you. There are few places where the difference between\n
those who have and those who do not is more palpable than here, and being born into\n
the wrong home might well mean that your life is over before it had a chance to even\n
begin.\n
\n
All in all, it was nothing short of a miracle that Garm survived the first year of\n
his life. He was born sick, and gravely so. His skin, hair and eyes lacked what gave\n
them color, making him as pale as a ghost with eerie, crimson eyes. Whatever caused\n
him to lack color, however, also caused him to be gravely ill. He was extremely\n
susceptible to disease and even the slightest cold could easily turn into a struggle\n
between life and death. As he was ravaged by diseases as a child his body grew weak,\n
and even as a grown man he would never be much stronger than a child, brittle enough\n
that he might die if struck hard.\n
\n
Garm was born into a poor merchant family, the youngest of five children. It was a \n
close call that his father, a strict man, killed him with his bare hands when he saw\n
his disfigured child there and then, but his wife restrained him. Instead the young\n
child was kept locked in a small room in the attic, safely away from prying, curious\n
eyes who might scribble the Dragon's Fang on their door. There he spent the first\n
years of his life, his only company one of his older sisters who from time to time\n
took pity on him, and the books that he was brought: his sister had passed their\n
time with teaching him his letters and numbers, and he was a quick learner.\n
\n
When Garm's mother died from consumption, however, his father showed no mercy and\n
turned the young boy onto the streets. By all rights, he should have died in the \n
first couple of days, but where his body was weak, his spirit was strong. He refused\n
to die, mostly to spite his father, and lived from hand to mouth, eating what he\n
could salvage from garbage cans, managed to beg from strangers taking pity on him, or\n
steal. The last was rare, though: he was neither quick nor strong enough, so he had\n
to find a careless merchant leaving his wares unguarded for an instant. But it was\n
enough to keep him going. Barely. \n
\n
Garm despised Lugard, and Murandy. He hated the paint, peeling from the walls of once\n
proud buildings, he hated the stench of the alleys, he could not stand the sight of\n
the thieves and beggars plying their trade, even if he was one of them. That was why\n
he saved his coin, as much as he possibly could, so that he could one day go to \n
Caemlyn, to Andor. He had heard stories of Andor, and it seemed to him a wonderful\n
place, one that he would himself want to visit. So one day, after years of living on\n
the scraps of others in one of the most unforgiving cities in the known world, the\n
young boy who had turned into a man, left for Andor.\n
\n
He would never have survived the journey if he had not, through his ability to read,\n
learned something about herbs and found a mix of common roots that could keep the\n
weakness of his sick, crippled body somewhat at bay and gain back some of the\n
strength that seemed to have been robbed from him. It was little, but something. A\n
precious something that he clung to. When you have nothing and every day might very\n
well be your last, it's the small things that make the difference. The difference\n
that can mean that you live another day.\n
\n
The beggar never arrived in Caemlyn, however, as he was somewhat distracted. While\n
resting at a small farming village, perhaps as little as half a day's walk from the\n
city proper a door opened in the empty air, something that he would later learn was\n
called a "gate". Through this "gate", three black-clad men stepped, announcing the\n
Dragon Reborn's amnesty and testing all men who were present for the ability to\n
channel the tainted male half of the One Power. As he showed the ability to learn,\n
white skin and physical disability aside, he was taken to the so-called Black Tower,\n
to learn to channel Saidin, go mad and slowly rot.\n
You can trust only yourself. If there was anything that Garm learned from his\n
early experiences in life, it was that. No man or woman, no Light or Shadow ever did\n
anything for you, so if you wanted something, you would have to reach out and grab\n
it for yourself. It was these things that turned the Murandian beggar on to the\n
path of Shadow, and if his uses were small when he was a vagrant, living on what he\n
could salvage from garbag

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 13 08:14:54 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Jerod:  Ta'veren
\nAlright, you asked for my future plans as a Ta'veren, and here they are\n
in the most vague sense of the word.  Most likely, this whole thing \n
will result in my gentling or death, but what the hell, its for a good\n
cause, right?\n
\n
Having solidified my control over Cairhien with the Bonding of Queen\n
Analinde su Riatin, I am first going to unify the region, by force if\n
necessary, but hopefully through prosperity.  At the same time, I will\n
let Analinde continue talks with a High Lord of Tear that wishes to \n
shake the Dragon's yoke.  Using this contact to make inroads into the\n
more rebellious network of High Lords, once satisfied that I have \n
identified most of them, I will enter the country enforce, and exercise\n
control in the form of both Cairhienin Troops, and Asha'man, while at\n
the same time, subverting the Dragon's actual control in this country.\n
\n
Following this, I will gear both Cairhien and Tear for war, and in the\n
Dragon's name (snicker) invade and take control of Illian and its \n
Council.   From this point on, the plan becomes more nebulous, but\n
involves taking Amadicia before the Seanchan do, and from there wielding\n
influence over Murandy and Ghealdea, and perhaps eventually Altara.\n
Mayene is another possibility, but with the existence of Berelain, it is\n
hard to disguise that in the name of the Dragon.\n
\n
Beyond this, Im not sure what else will be done, but please keep in mind\n
that it is not necessarily for himself that Jerod tries to accomplish \n
but to prepare the world for Tarmon Gaidon that Rand was supposed to do, \n
before he dropped off the face of the earth.\n
\n
Oh, and also I might cleanse Saidin.. *grin*\n
\n
Jerod.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 13 08:14:54 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Jerod:  Ta'veren
\nAlright, you asked for my future plans as a Ta'veren, and here they are\n
in the most vague sense of the word.  Most likely, this whole thing \n
will result in my gentling or death, but what the hell, its for a good\n
cause, right?\n
\n
Having solidified my control over Cairhien with the Bonding of Queen\n
Analinde su Riatin, I am first going to unify the region, by force if\n
necessary, but hopefully through prosperity.  At the same time, I will\n
let Analinde continue talks with a High Lord of Tear that wishes to \n
shake the Dragon's yoke.  Using this contact to make inroads into the\n
more rebellious network of High Lords, once satisfied that I have \n
identified most of them, I will enter the country enforce, and exercise\n
control in the form of both Cairhienin Troops, and Asha'man, while at\n
the same time, subverting the Dragon's actual control in this country.\n
\n
Following this, I will gear both Cairhien and Tear for war, and in the\n
Dragon's name (snicker) invade and take control of Illian and its \n
Council.   From this point on, the plan becomes more nebulous, but\n
involves taking Amadicia before the Seanchan do, and from there wielding\n
influence over Murandy and Ghealdea, and perhaps eventually Altara.\n
Mayene is another possibility, but with the existence of Berelain, it is\n
hard to disguise that in the name of the Dragon.\n
\n
Beyond this, Im not sure what else will be done, but please keep in mind\n
that it is not necessarily for himself that Jerod tries to accomplish \n
but to prepare the world for Tarmon Gaidon that Rand was supposed to do, \n
before he dropped off the face of the earth.\n
\n
Oh, and also I might cleanse Saidin.. *grin*\n
\n
Jerod.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Nov 19 18:00:16 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Steffan
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Greetings,
\nI just have a query and wanted to clear it with you first before anything can be done \n
about it.\n
Basically the story is that Analinde the Queen of Cairhien came to me\n
the high seat of House Damodred about moving people from the foregate\n
back to the farms, now she gave me a week to decide whether I \n
support the plan, during this week however I want to covertly employ \n
what were formerly the best farmers, and people with interests in farming and\n
and necessary skills to maintain villages, such as wisdoms and the likes.\n
Obviously my own masons would be involved in the rebuilding of the farms\n
and houses and the likes. And finally hiring extra guards to provide security\n
for the areas where farms are introduced. Obviously financial incentives would have\n
to be used:P... But I was wondering if it's doable...\n
Steffan.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 20 15:20:16 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Jaer
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Looking for rp with asha'man
\nGestahl, I just got into Caemlyn, and I'm looking for\n
roleplay with asha'man.  I'm discreetly looking for asha'man\n
because I'm tairen and noble, so it's not something I'd be\n
broadcasting.  This rp has the potential to turn into a lot\n
more, and I'm really looking forward to it.\n
\n
Thanks for your help,\n
Jaer\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Dec  2 17:02:24 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Lyana
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumors:Cairhien:Money in the Forgate?
\nWord spreads through out Cairhien of men speaking quietly with\n
well known men within the better inns of the foregate.  It appears\n
money is changing hands at an estonishing rate in this desperate area,\n
though the reasons behind it are as varied as a tinker's clothing. Some\n
whisper of insurrection, others mention a coup, more feel it is more\n
timed with the nobilities meetings about the food shortages. All that is\n
known is the flashes of colors the men hide as they enter the foregate\n
look like House Demodred.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Dec  5 15:06:24 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Lyana
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumor:Andor:Hasty Deaparture
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Beonca Bethany
\n\n
Only a week after his arrival, it seems that High Lord \n
Jaer Asegora of Tear is on the move again.  A week ago, when \n
he appeared, the High Lord rented a luxury sweet near the \n
palace, while 100 of his defenders camped outside the city.  \n
It seemed that they were going to be here for some time.\n
However, early this morning, the High Lord recieved a \n
letter.  It's contents are unknown, but apparently, it was \n
enough.  High Lord Asegora had his accounts settled and all \n
of his belongings packed in a matter of hours, and just as \n
dramatically set off on the road to Cairhien, giving no \n
explanation.\n
\n
Approved and ready to go as soon as possible - Nico, is\n
there any concerns with the rumors I sent in earlier?\n
\n
Lyana\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Dec  9 04:58:32 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Tallyn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Updates
\nAndor News 'Crossing'\n
\n
Rumors several days old tell of the crossing of the Band of the Red\n
Hand over the Erinin into Mearone. It is said in Aringill that the\n
crossing was exceptionally well planned and rehearsed, especially for\n
an army of ruffians. The army now pauses in the Cairhienin river city so\n
long dwarfed by its Andoran sibling across the river. No one seems to know\n
what the Band's next move will be or where the Dragon Reborn thinks to\n
send them. But, while they committed no acts of violence or terror as they\n
passed out of Andor many talk of their relief in seeing the departure of\n
those sworn to the Dragon.\n
\n
\n
Cairhien Rumor 'Invasion or Homecoming?'\n
\n
Pigeons from merchants in Mearone bear word of the movement of the Band\n
of the Red Hand from Aringill, over the Erinin, and into Mearone where they\n
seem to have made temporary camp. Many remember the Band as heroes from\n
the battles that forced the Shaido and White Lions from Cairhienin lands.\n
With many Carihienin warriors among the Band's number, Mearone townsfolk\n
greeted them warmly and smile with pride at rumors the Band will soon be\n
marching to glory against the Shadow. Where and when they will march\n
though, only the turning of the wheel will tell.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Dec  9 11:36:17 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Meldorf
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG
\nMeldorf was born on 966 NE into a family with no other brothers\n
or sisters.  He grew up a single child into a young man and\n
found bonds with friends that he often went hunting and camping \n
together with.  He experienced his first catch of a rabbit at\n
the age of 12 and when he got to 18 he caught himself almost\n
any animal that lived in the forest but one, the wolf, always\n
deluded him.  He grew up on the out skirts of Baerlon and met\n
himself a young girl named Jenna when he was 14.  He left at\n
the age of 18 to train as a Ranger and Hunter around the area\n
of Braem Wood's and Caemlyn where he resided until this day.\n
When he turned 20 he met up with Jenna by concidence outside\n
the Lion Banner Inn where she had slept the night.  After long\n
chats with her they decided to meant up again and after many\n
meetings a relationship began to emerge and they fell in love.\n
In order to build a proper life with each other they needed a\n
home.  Meldorf began building a wooden house in Braem Woods\n
that he knew so well and felt comfitable in.  After its\n
construstion when Meldorf was still 20 but coming on 21, Jenna\n
gave birth to a baby girl that they called Sarah.  Only 3 years\n
later Jenna became ill after catching an illness that no Wisdom\n
was able to cure.  For 2 weeks and 3 days she held out against\n
the illness until she couldnt anymore.  Her body was taken back\n
to Baerlon where she was buried at the house of her parents.\n
He lived the rest of his life at home with his daughter Sarah,\n
watching her grow older and being the father he should be.  His\n
ability to catch food never left them hungry and his earnings\n
for animal skins never left them spare of money.  Now Meldorf\n
is 35 and Sarah is  coming on 15, she has recently seen an Aes\n
Sedai in town to the dislike of Meldorf, she has chosen to go\n
to Tar Valon to train to ways of Aes Sedai and learn the arts\n
of the One Power.  Now Meldorf lives alone and with noone\n
around he lives most of his life in and out of Inn's drinking\n
and often getting into fights and bets that get out of hand and\n
ends him with either an injure or a small jail time sentence.\n
His wish is to be something other than what he is now.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Dec 15 08:56:31 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Kolthis
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Meldorf et al
\n`7CC`6: `7Matylena Cashel
\n\n
This message is mostly OOC.\n
\n
On the Matter of Meldorf - since he's already arrested - there's no need\n
for Kolthis to be involved, since another Magistrate (Maty) is already on\n
the case.\n
\n
On the matter of Lannes Andronic, as Maty said - he will be tried under\n
Andoran Law, though since he's a noble it is unlikely he would be 'formally'\n
arrested as such, rather cordiall invited (read demanded) to come to a\n
hearing.\n
For Alaura Reesad things are a little different - since she's a foreign\n
noble - or at least Claims to be, since she has nothing with her to back\n
it up ICly at the moment, as far as I'm aware.\n
\n
However, since she at least claims to be a noble, I would be wary of \n
actually arresting her, since that could cause more of an incident - so I\n
would go with the same 'cordial invitation' to a hearing.  If you want\n
Kolthis to be there - let me know when it is and I will see what I can do\n
just remember I live in a different time-zone to most people (Meldorf\n
excepted ...)\n
Kolthis\n
