However, since she at least claims to be a noble, I would be wary of \n
actually arresting her, since that could cause more of an incident - so I\n
would go with the same 'cordial invitation' to a hearing.  If you want\n
Kolthis to be there - let me know when it is and I will see what I can do\n
just remember I live in a different time-zone to most people (Meldorf\n
excepted ...)\n
Kolthis\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 13 08:14:54 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Jerod:  Ta'veren
\nAlright, you asked for my future plans as a Ta'veren, and here they are\n
in the most vague sense of the word.  Most likely, this whole thing \n
will result in my gentling or death, but what the hell, its for a good\n
cause, right?\n
\n
Having solidified my control over Cairhien with the Bonding of Queen\n
Analinde su Riatin, I am first going to unify the region, by force if\n
necessary, but hopefully through prosperity.  At the same time, I will\n
let Analinde continue talks with a High Lord of Tear that wishes to \n
shake the Dragon's yoke.  Using this contact to make inroads into the\n
more rebellious network of High Lords, once satisfied that I have \n
identified most of them, I will enter the country enforce, and exercise\n
control in the form of both Cairhienin Troops, and Asha'man, while at\n
the same time, subverting the Dragon's actual control in this country.\n
\n
Following this, I will gear both Cairhien and Tear for war, and in the\n
Dragon's name (snicker) invade and take control of Illian and its \n
Council.   From this point on, the plan becomes more nebulous, but\n
involves taking Amadicia before the Seanchan do, and from there wielding\n
influence over Murandy and Ghealdea, and perhaps eventually Altara.\n
Mayene is another possibility, but with the existence of Berelain, it is\n
hard to disguise that in the name of the Dragon.\n
\n
Beyond this, Im not sure what else will be done, but please keep in mind\n
that it is not necessarily for himself that Jerod tries to accomplish \n
but to prepare the world for Tarmon Gaidon that Rand was supposed to do, \n
before he dropped off the face of the earth.\n
\n
Oh, and also I might cleanse Saidin.. *grin*\n
\n
Jerod.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct  8 13:11:18 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Gerhard
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rough Outline
\n- Gerhard is with Elayne when Rand falls into the Palace gardens. He accompanies him to Queen Morgase and escorts him out of the Palace.\n
\n
- Gerhard travels with Elayne to Tar Valon to train with the Warders.\n
\n
- There Gerhard meets Min, Nynaeve, Egwene and many different Aes Sedai and Warders.\n
\n
- Liandrin tells Egwene and Nynaeve that they must accompany her to help Rand. Elayne and Min overhear and plan to come, too.\n
\n
- Gerhard also hears of the plot, and plans to join them.\n
\n
- Gerhard joins Egwene, Nynaeve, Elayne, Min and Liandrin through the Ways to Toman Head.\n
\n
- He escapes with Nynaeve and Elayne while Egwene and Min are captured.\n
\n
- Gerhard assists Nynaeve and Elayne with Egwene's escape.\n
\n
- Gerhard gets separated from the rest in the battle at Falme. He fights the Seanchan on the side of the heroes.\n
\n
- Gerhard then makes his own way back to Tar Valon, with a stolen Seanchan horse. He doesnt meet up with the rest of the heroes, or meet Rand.\n
\n
- Gerhard arrives in Tar Valon at around the same time as Elayne, Egwene, Nynaeve, Verin and Mat.\n
\n
- Gerhard is punished by his Warder mentors and admonished by Aes Sedai for running away. He keeps the truth of what happened to himself.\n
- Since Gerhard arrives in Tar Valon separately from the rest, he is able to pretend that he had nothing to do with their disappearances. \n
- Gerhard meets Mat. They get along well enough.\n
\n
- Gerhard continues training with the Warders.\n
\n
- Egwene, Elayne and Nynaeve leave for Tear.\n
\n
- Gerhard demands the Amyrlin tell him where his sister and Egwene are. Min returns to the Tower and runs into Gerhard as he leaves the Amyrlins study.\n
\n
- For a short time, life in the Tower is uneventful for Gerhard, outside of trying to learn the location of his sister.\n
\n

- Gerhard leads the trainees against the Warders in the battle of the White Tower, after Siuan is stilled. He does not kill Hammer or Coulin, however: that is done by other students. He does this because he doesnt trust Siuan since he feels the old Amyrlin used his friends and he feels that Siuan has been rightfully displaced, and he trusts Elaida because he has known her for all his life.\n
\n

- When confronted by Leane, Siuan and Min Gerhard realizes his mistake. Min convinces him that Elayne would have supported Siuan, if she had been here. He still doesnt trust Siuan. He helps them to escape. They have convinced him that what he has done was wrong.\n
\n

- Gerhard leaves the Younglings and the White Tower, not wanting to stay there as long as the usurper Elaida is in power. He does not ask the Younglings to come with him: he knows that they are loyal to the Tower. He explains to another chief Youngling that he has to leave for a time, and that he is in charge until he returns. Gerhard warns the Younglings to be wary of Elaida and the other Aes Sedai. He suggests that what happened isn't just. He eventually plans to come back and free the Younglings from Elaidas grasp.\n
\n

- Gerhard returns to Caemlyn for a time. He isn't there long before he has a confrontation with Gaebril and finds himself exiled from his homeland. He is worried about Elayne. He also wants to find a way to remove Gaebril and whatever hold he has over his Mother. He knows that he cant do this alone.\n
\n

- Upon leaving Caemlyn, he rides south, with a mind to find his sister. He eventually runs into a group of Aes Sedai that has fled from the White Tower and are heading to Salidar. He joins them, hoping to find Elayne, Egwene and all the rest.\n
\n

- Gerhard arrives at Salidar. He assists them in building the town, and resumes his study with the Warders. There is some tension, since he led the fight to keep Siuan captive. He tells about how he eventually assisted Siuan's escape, but many don't believe it.\n
\n

- Min, Siuan, Leane, Gareth Bryne, Nynaeve, and Elayne all arrive, each in their own time. Gerhard is relieved to see all of them, especially Elayne and Gareth Bryne. Min, Siuan and Leane are quite surprised to see them there, since they thought he was still at the Tower. Siuan affirms Gerhard's story.\n

- Gerhard is quite relieved when he hears that Gaebril has been overthrown by Rand and his crew. He is still upset, because he thinks that Gaebril killed his Mother. He is also upset because he hears that Rand is holding Caemlyn, which is not his right to do.\n

- Gerhard is very suspicious when the Salidar Aes Sedai sends Min with the nine Aes Sedai going to see Rand. He offers to come with her, but she insists that he stays. Gerhard is partly glad: he wouldn't want to leave Elayne's side again, even if she was among so many Aes Sedai.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Dec 16 16:27:12 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Agammon
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Update Request
\nFollowing some "interesting" RP, I would like to ICly spread the following rumor in Caemlyn:\n
\n
Noble Thief!\n
\n
Andoran nobles stealing from honest Caemlyners?  Word spreads of a trio from\n
Andoran House Androic, a Domani woman and two guardsmen, taking food from the\n
stores of Master Marston's inn, the Lion's Banner.  Apparently the staff of\n
the inn were tied up behind the building, while the Lady and her guardsmen took\n
food from the place and gold from the customers.  Then they simply disappeared,\n
apparently without turning the gold over to the captive staff.\n
\n
\n
\n
A small note about this update: while it is mostly true, it is not entirely so.\n
If you have any compunction about posting something that isn't completely true,\n
you should not post this.  I do, however, think there should be some concequences\n
for IC actions... and who better to twist events and plant false(ish) rumors\n
than a Child of the Light, eh?\n
\n
-Agammon.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Dec 18 08:54:44 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Contacts: Jerod
\n     Well Im not exactly sure what should be in this letter, but I suppose\n
that I will list the places that I think Jerod should have some sort of \n
contacts, and why I think they should be there, and let you decide the rest.\n
\n
Tar Valon:  Spent 4 years in training with Gaidin and Aes Sedai, so there \n
might still be some people that he has remained in contact, whether it\n
be Tower Guard, Tar Valon Commoners, Aes Sedai, or Gaidin.\n
\n
Caemlyn:  This is rather obvious, he has served in the Queen's Guard for\n
nineteen years, so it is rather expected that he has many friends and\n
contacts within the ranks, as well as in the lower society of the \n
city.  Also, he has contacts simply from his Noble status, as one of\n
higher members of Andor's aristocracy.\n
\n
Whitebridge:  This is where the Traemane family originates, and keep much\n
of their estates.  Through this, he most likely has contact with \n
the merchants that travel through the city, as well as those that \n
live within, and surrounding the city as well.\n
\n
Ghealdean and Murandian Border:  This is where Jerod first served in the\n
Queen's Guard, commanding as an Under-Lieutenant, and Lieutenant, \n
so it is likely that he still has some contacts in the area, on \n
both sides of the borders.\n
\n
Andor and Cairhien Border:  Jerod served later in the multitude of conflicts\n
that have occurred here, served part of his time as Sword Lieutenant\n
here, so it is likely that he has contacts in both Aringill and Maerone,\n
as well as up and down the river, in all levels of society.\n
\n
Cairhien:  On his own, he has started to foster contacts in this city, through\n
subordinates, and delicate use of money.  Besides this, he also has access \n
to the Riatin ring of contacts within the city.\n
\n
Borderlands:  He only remained here for a few months, though it was long enough\n
to form some enduring relationships, however, these contacts are few.\n
\n
\n
Well that I think, is the extent of Jerod's contacts in general, though\n
the argument might be made that as an Andoran Lord, he has other in those \n
nobles who have travelled through the city.\n
\n
Hope this idea gets off the ground, and doesn't become to unwieldly.\n
\n
J.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Dec 20 04:57:36 2003\n`7From`6:`7 Tallyn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Some input
\nJust wanted to know what you thought of starting our consruction\n
projects.\n
\n
Things to Build.\n
Warehouses, Barracks, Corrals, Expanded Docks, Roads, Watchtowers\n
Wagons, Weapon Forges, Armor Forges, Textile Factories (for uniforms).\n
\n
I would also like to start hiring on or buying some ships and wagon\n
teams to set up some trade routes. Maybe we can jump start some trade\n
through Mearone by offering lowered tariffs on goods coming into\n
Cairhien. That is going to perturb Queen Analinde but then, what do we\n
care. She can try to dislodge us.\n
\n
Anything else you'd like to add? I'd like to get this approved\n
by the time everyone comes back after Winter Break.\n
\n
Tal\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan  5 15:44:29 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Tallyn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Update
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Mat
\n\n
Update News Cairhien\n
\n
Word travels that there have been some changes recently in the\n
city of Mearone across the river from Aringill. Most obvious is\n
the enlargement of the city's riverfront providing more space for\n
the loading and unloading of merchant shipping. Additionally, there\n
are now more warehouses and stableyards. All the while it seems the\n
encampment of the Band of the Red Hand seems to be becoming more\n
permanent with a series of pallisades, ditches and earthen ramparts\n
encircling the city. Whatever is happening in Mearone, the merchants\n
all seem to agree that there is money to be made in this small corner\n
of stability and prosperity in southern Cairhien.\n
\n
Update rumor andor\n
\n
The talk of the city in Aringill is of the consruction across the\n
river in Mearone. The riverfront is expanded and warehouses seem to\n
be springing up like weeds. More and more ships seem to be docking\n
across the river as well. Rumors fly and grow in the teling about\n
what new wonder will be next but this is clear, what used to be\n
merely a stop on a trade route is now fast becoming a destination\n
in its own right.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan  5 15:44:29 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Tallyn

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan  7 03:37:14 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Legion Locations
\nHere's the numbers I've come up with, and I'd like your input before\n
I ship them off to Varulv. Also, the extra information, which will not be\n
sent, will end up on the guild board so that the guild knows the purpose of\n
each Legion. I'd like your thoughts on all of this, so it can be properly\n
molded into something workable. Also, I spoke with Varulv, and he stated that\n
recruitment/additional troops will most likely be postponed until we get a\n
working economy in, as that is the entire basis of troop numbers, though he\n
is going to try and find a way around this.. Anyways, here's the 'Legion report'.\n
\n
Caralain Grass:        1,000 CotL\n
Located north of Andor and west of Tar Valon, the Legion\n
encamped upon the Caralain Grass is a recruiting/training\n
center for the Children. Open plains allow them to practice\n
their horsemanship and lancing skills without drawing the\n
ire of a nation for riding down their citizens. It also\n
serves to reinforce either the Children camped within the\n
southern reaches of the Braem Wood, or the Legion camped\n
near Tar Valon.\n
\n
Braem Wood:  1,500 CotL\n
The second-half of the Caralain Grass Legion, it is under\n
seperate command, though the soldiers of both Legions\n
considering themselves one Legion. The Children of this\n
Legion are those found within Caemlyn. Five-hundred extra\n
Children have been assigned to this Legion, the Vanguard of\n
the Rising Sun. Their presence was requested by those of the\n
Hand, to aid them in their task of bringing Darkfriends to\n
the Light. The reigning Inquisitor and the Lord Captain of\n
the Vanguard have as of yet to discuss arrangements for the\n
Hand's use of the Children.\n
\n
Tar Valon:             1,500 CotL\n
Given the task of guarding Tar Valon, the Children filling\n
the ranks of this Legion seem those whose views concerning\n
the occupants of the White Tower are harshest, but also\n
restrained. They follow their orders, and provoke the denizens\n
of the White Tower only when allowed to do so.\n
\n
Tarabon/Almoth Plain:  1,000 CotL\n
A scouting force that forms the first barrier between Amadicia\n
and the Seanchan. They are scouring the lands looking for signs\n
of the invaders, and bear a diplomatic envoy to open negotiations\n
between the Children and the Seanchan.\n
\n
South of Cairhien:     750 CotL\n
Of all the Legions, those located south of Cairhien seem to\n
be scouts more than soldiers. They gather information on\n
movement of troops for the Lord Captain Commander, mainly\n
the Band of the Red Hand when it is east of the Erinin, as\n
well as the number of Aiel roaming the lands. They are also\n
the most cautious of the Legions, as they stand alone, the\n
River Erinin a barrier for reinforcements.\n
\n
Altara/Murandy/Illien: 750 CotL\n
Located within northern Illian, mid-section of Altara, and\n
southern Murandy, a Legion of half-strength operates. This is\n
the standard Legion of the Children, seeking Darkfriends and\n
putting them to the Question.\n
\n
Amadicia:              6,000 CotL - 7 Legions\n
The heart of the Children, those stationed within Amadicia are\n
divided into seven Legions. One at full strength, composed of\n
2,000 of the Children's finest. Another is composed of 1,000\n
Children of the Light, their training moderate when compared to\n
Amadicia's full Legion. Two other Legions are stationed within\n
Amadicia, their numbers set at 750 Children, experienced soldiers\n
lead by a Lord Captain seeking to familiarize themselves with\n
greater command. Three more Legions, quarter-strength, are to be\n
found within Amadicia, their numbers set at 500 Children, the\n
newest of risen Lord Captains becoming accustomed to command.\n
While no means inexperienced, these Legions are divided to ease\n
the patrols around Amadicia, and are currently preparing a\n
push in Ghealdan should the Lord Captain Commander direct the\n
Children into such a campaign.\n
\n
This sets us at our 12 LCs, though it seems a little sparse. Since you're\n
our resident expert, I await your input.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan  7 03:37:14 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Legion Locations
\nHere's the numbers I've come up with, and I'd like your input before\n
I ship them off to Varulv. Also, the extra information, which will not be\n
sent, will end up on the guild board so that the guild knows the purpose of\n
each Legion. I'd like your thoughts on all of this, so it can be properly\n
molded into something workable. Also, I spoke with Varulv, and he stated that\n
recruitment/additional troops will most likely be postponed until we get a\n
working economy in, as that is the entire basis of troop numbers, though he\n
is going to try and find a way around this.. Anyways, here's the 'Legion report'.\n
\n
Caralain Grass:        1,000 CotL\n
Located north of Andor and west of Tar Valon, the Legion\n
encamped upon the Caralain Grass is a recruiting/training\n
center for the Children. Open plains allow them to practice\n
their horsemanship and lancing skills without drawing the\n
ire of a nation for riding down their citizens. It also\n
serves to reinforce either the Children camped within the\n
southern reaches of the Braem Wood, or the Legion camped\n
near Tar Valon.\n
\n
Braem Wood:  1,500 CotL\n
The second-half of the Caralain Grass Legion, it is under\n
seperate command, though the soldiers of both Legions\n
considering themselves one Legion. The Children of this\n
Legion are those found within Caemlyn. Five-hundred extra\n
Children have been assigned to this Legion, the Vanguard of\n
the Rising Sun. Their presence was requested by those of the\n
Hand, to aid them in their task of bringing Darkfriends to\n
the Light. The reigning Inquisitor and the Lord Captain of\n
the Vanguard have as of yet to discuss arrangements for the\n
Hand's use of the Children.\n
\n
Tar Valon:             1,500 CotL\n
Given the task of guarding Tar Valon, the Children filling\n
the ranks of this Legion seem those whose views concerning\n
the occupants of the White Tower are harshest, but also\n
restrained. They follow their orders, and provoke the denizens\n
of the White Tower only when allowed to do so.\n
\n
Tarabon/Almoth Plain:  1,000 CotL\n
A scouting force that forms the first barrier between Amadicia\n
and the Seanchan. They are scouring the lands looking for signs\n
of the invaders, and bear a diplomatic envoy to open negotiations\n
between the Children and the Seanchan.\n
\n
South of Cairhien:     750 CotL\n
Of all the Legions, those located south of Cairhien seem to\n
be scouts more than soldiers. They gather information on\n
movement of troops for the Lord Captain Commander, mainly\n
the Band of the Red Hand when it is east of the Erinin, as\n
well as the number of Aiel roaming the lands. They are also\n
the most cautious of the Legions, as they stand alone, the\n
River Erinin a barrier for reinforcements.\n
\n
Altara/Murandy/Illien: 750 CotL\n
Located within northern Illian, mid-section of Altara, and\n
southern Murandy, a Legion of half-strength operates. This is\n
the standard Legion of the Children, seeking Darkfriends and\n
putting them to the Question.\n
\n
Amadicia:              6,000 CotL - 7 Legions\n
The heart of the Children, those stationed within Amadicia are\n
divided into seven Legions. One at full strength, composed of\n
2,000 of the Children's finest. Another is composed of 1,000\n
Children of the Light, their training moderate when compared to\n
Amadicia's full Legion. Two other Legions are stationed within\n
Amadicia, their numbers set at 750 Children, experienced soldiers\n
lead by a Lord Captain seeking to familiarize themselves with\n
greater command. Three more Legions, quarter-strength, are to be\n
found within Amadicia, their numbers set at 500 Children, the\n
newest of risen Lord Captains becoming accustomed to command.\n
While no means inexperienced, these Legions are divided to ease\n
the patrols around Amadicia, and are currently preparing a\n
push in Ghealdan should the Lord Captain Commander direct the\n
Children into such a campaign.\n
\n
This sets us at our 12 LCs, though it seems a little sparse. Since you're\n
our resident expert, I await your input.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan  8 12:07:02 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jayl
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG, for Laborers guild.

\nJayl was abandoned in Caemlyn at the age of 4 by his parents.  As far as he cam remember in his youth, his parents had been moving about from town to town.  He was taken in by an elderly couple, who could not give him much, nor did they pay much attention to him.  There was never enough food on the table for the three of them, so at a young age Jayl started turning to thievery to fill the aching hole in his stomach.  His slim build allowed him easy access to tight places, where he could hide from the queen's guard after a shopkeeper sent them chasing after him.  \n

He lived with the couple until the old man's wife passed away, and he went to live with family in Baerlon,  Jayl was supposed to move with the man, but he quietly slipped away one night, rather then move to a new city.  He found that he could steal more than food, taking small trinkets from street merchants that he could sell to others, to provide him with money.  He stayed in the streets during the night, often being pushed into new homes by the Queen's guard when they found him lying in the streets at night, but he'd always manage to run away within a week at the new house.\n

He quickly fell into a gang of thieves in Caemlyn, staying in a rather large manor in the inner city that the gang ran out of.  He started doing bigger jobs within the gang, often dressing up as a noble of a minor house to gain entrance into a Lord's manor.  They made contacts within the Queen's Guards, paying officers to hold back orders on starting searches for them and knowing where the patrols would be at what times.\n

Things broke up one night while they were trying to rob a merchant's house one night.  A patrol of the queen's guard that was coming back from the gates, saw the small group of thieves standing outside the merchant's house.  They ran into the house like fools, setting the queen's guard into action.  The guard caught six of the nine men who were on the job, though Jayl got away without being seen. \n

He took a room at an inn for the night,  getting out of the streets as soon as possible.  When he returned to the manor in the morning there was a group of the Guards standing outside of the manor,   every one who had been in the headquarters was thrown into the dungeon.  You could have counted the remains of the group on both hands, all of the rallying around Jayl as their leader until the others got out.   They went back to their roots, the stole golden trinkets and food, and set up in a small house where they lived. \n

Now almost 27, he stills runs the small group of thieves out of the house, their numbers up to a lucky 13.  Everything they steal goes through him and is sold, leaving them all to live in a well off style.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 10 13:11:06 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BL Ranks
\nThis is a rough draft I'm tossing in your direction. I'd\n
like your thoughts on these, suggestions if any. Thinking of\n
basing the initial ranks off of Morrowind's Thieves' Guild,\n
but I'm having trouble finding the actual ranks since my cd is\n
with a friend, and he's in rehab, so I can't access that 'research'\n
material. But here goes:\n
\n
General Thief Ranks:\n
\n
Wet-Ear: Standard starting thief, wet behind the ears, unsure of\n
how to really advance without aid from their brethren.\n
\n
Toad: A slightly experienced thief, dealt with mainly pick-pocketing\n
and other minors thefts. A few break-ins here and there, mainly at\n
small shops that carrying nothing of real value.\n
\n
Toad is also the rank where a thief could branch into a 'faction', as\n
it were. The Silver Fingers and Crimson Cudgels will take Toads into\n
their own ranks, where they advance within the heirarchy of their new\n
'guild'. The Silver Fingers deal with pick-pocketing and is an association\n
of fledgling thieves. Chaotic structure for advancement, more by word of\n
mouth and their ability to believably brag. The Crimson Cudgels are alley\n
stalkers that beat people up to gain coin. Rather simple muggers with the\n
same lack of focus within the guild. Strength and the ability to induce\n
fear allow for one to rise within the ranks.\n
\n
Footpad: These thieves are just beginning to become fully accustomed to\n
thier skills, taking more risky jobs such as break-ins of fine merchants\n
and the rooms of very minor foreign nobles visiting. They have begun to\n
round their skills, and seem more cautious than those of lower rank.\n
\n
Footpad is also the base rank where those of the Andoran Road Traders and\n
the Serpent's Fangs begin to recruit. The Andoran Road Traders look for\n
stealth and woodland potential, as they are the brigands that haunt the roads\n
of Andor and surrounding lands. They roam the wilds, seeking prey, and are\n
formed into a network, each band trading information with another. Advancement\n
is based upon skills and value of the member in regards to highway-robbery, as\n
well as evasion of authorities. The Serpent's Fangs are vicious murderers, low-key\n
assassins that are no better than cheap killers-for-hire. Their rank system is\n
based upon the number of kills the member has attained, as well as the risk involved\n
with each murder. Of all the weaker 'factions', those of the Serpent's Fangs\n
bear a semblence to order, their ranks structured.\n
\n
Prowler: These are the stalkers of the base ranks. They have attained a fair\n
measure of stealth, know when to exercise discretion in action and word, and\n
generally would rather remain alive and free, albeit poor, than imprisoned without\n
hope of release, or dead. They are more secure with second-story thefts, but are\n
not skilled enough to perform a job alone. Their skills are moderate, and as such,\n
often work in teams to execute a theft.\n
\n
The Merchants' Word takes recruits from those known as Prowlers, as they show the\n
proper discretion for their cause. The Merchants' Word is a network of charlatans,\n
gathering information on merchants, merchant and noble shipments, and anything else\n
pertaining to great wealth. They infiltrate businesses, and when a merchant leaves\n
for a trip, operate out of the shop, selling off the goods for their own profit.\n
They also excel at forgery, as they often reroute shipments so they may gain the\n
goods without having to actually risk exposure. They are the neutral 'faction' within\n
Caemlyn, acting as envoys between the 'guilds' and serving as impartial judges for\n
disputes.\n
\n
Thief: As the rank states, this is when a thief is considered skilled enough to\n
go it alone. Most thefts can be easily exercised by the thief, goods stolen through\n
the many arts they possess. This is a standard thief, skilled in various fields and\n
perhaps ready to focus upon one, to specialize in it and make a name for themselves.\n
\n
Cat-Burglar: The top of the tier, as it were. Cat-burglars are those who exercise\n
complete stealth in their tasks, often stealing into estates of Lords to make off with\n
a previously decided selection of valuables. They are those that could be considered\n
elite, and those that are humble about their skills are often those that remain free\n
and alive. Caution is a strong part of the Cat-burglar, and they often have forged a\n
cover identity to keep unwanted attention away from their illicit activities.\n
\n
This rank is also where the true Black Lions of Andor begin recruitment. Whilst all\n
thieves of Caemlyn are known as Black Lions, this is the 'elite of the elite'. The\n
true Black Lions have seperated themselves into three distinct divisions: The Ebony\n
Claws of the Lion, The Crimson Eyes of the Lion, and the Silent Roar of the Lion.\n
\n
The Ebony Cla
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 10 14:12:31 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Dubricus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for WK
\nDubricus Ulthar was born to a small family in Amador, the heart\n
of Amadicia. His childhood was unremarkable, the years spent in\n
play and learning. He was brought up to revere the Children of\n
the Light, but to also bear caution within his heart in regards\n
to their methods, mainly those of the Hand. At the age of twelve\n
he enlisted, many considering him too young. Inexperienced in\n
the ways of warfare, this only served to drive the youth's desire\n
to bear the white cloak. After a year of trials, he was accepted\n
as a recruit, and for another he drilled with the Children, his\n
form growing lean and agile. Though not as strong as his older\n
comrades, Dubricus showed a zeal in his attempts, an inner fire\n
the drove him onward. At the age of fourteen he was accepted into\n
the Children, a brother in arms allowed to don the white cloak,\n
the flaring sunburst born proudly over his heart. He served under\n
a single File Leader for the duration of five years, his duty\n
taking him from Ghealdan to Cairhien to Tear to Murandy. It\n
was in Lugard that those of his File encountered a band of thieves\n
thought to be led by a darkfriend. The eleven Children raided\n
the abandoned warehouse used as a headquarters, and fell into an\n
ambush. Dubricus and three other Children escaped. Upon reporting\n
the incident to the Squadman he served under, the man reassigned\n
him to a small force led by an Inquisitor. They stormed the\n
warehouse and slaughtered the occupants, those unlucky enough\n
to remain alive screaming in agony as they were put to the Question\n
before the soldiers of the Light, the Inquisitor harsh in his\n
ministrations of cleansing as the blood of the Children stained\n
those he was to absolve. This hardened the nineteen year old soldier,\n
and when he returned to their camp, he was summoned to the Squadman's\n
tent. There he was raised to the rank of File Leader, given command\n
over the three men he had served with as well as seven newly cloaked\n
soldiers. Two more years passed, and File Leader Ulthar led a\n
vicious campaign against the thieves of Lugard and their wilderness\n
brothers. Remaining close to the city, never venturing into the\n
woods, their training as light cavalry hindering any assault into\n
the forest, Dubricus cleansed the roads of crime to an extent.\n
When his Squadman was promoted to Bannerman, Dubricus rose as well,\n
taking command of the Files with which he had labored. Ordered\n
to Tarabon, the Squadman began to work closely with the Hand,\n
discovering the lairs of suspected Darkfriends and storming them.\n
The subsequent deaths of many 'darkfriends' drew attention to his\n
skills, and he was given a position as Bannerman after only a year\n
after being raised to Squadman. He was reassigned to Amadicia\n
to aid in the training of the Children: tactics, command structure,\n
information gathering, martial disciplines. This continued for three\n
years, and Dubricus soon tired of being away from the field.\n
Requesting a field command, Dubricus was approached by the Hand.\n
Memories of years past were rekindled, and with a grim mindset,\n
he accepted their invititation and became an Acolyte. He studied\n
under some of the coldest Inquisitors for five years, his mind\n
and soul being forged into a true Hand of the Light. Raised to\n
Assistant Inquisitor, Dubricus began to learn the methods of the\n
Hand, not just their philosphy and mental training meant to prepare\n
them for the hardships to be endured during a Questioning. For two\n
years he labored under the harsh gaze of his mentor, Seriak Derian,\n
a cold-hearted malicious Inquisitor. Upon being raised to Arch\n
Inquisitor regarding the hunt of those darkfriends not tied to\n
the White Tower, he drew Dubricus with him. An Inquisitor dedicated\n
to hunting Darkfriends, and darkfriends alone, Dubricus scoured\n
the lands of Murandy, Altara, Ghealdan, Tarabon, and even within\n
Amadicia. For eleven years he stayed true to the path, either always\n
a step behind discovered darkfriends, or forging a new generation\n
of Inquisitor within Amador. A chiseled, hardened man, Dubricus\n
was reassigned to the Vanguard of the Rising Sun, his expertise in\n
regards of Darkfriends directed to aid the Children within Caemlyn.\n
\n
\n
Rumors float through the Children, and several 'suspected' darkfriends\n
known to the Hand are said to have golden eyes. Intrigued by what he\n
has learned of such, no true knowledge held on the subject, Dubricus\n
intends to gather more information upon the Wolfkin. He often stays\n
within Caemlyn for a few days before riding back to the Braem Wood\n
where the Vanguard of the Rising Sun has set camp. More often than\n
naught he is accompanied by two Shields on the ride to and from Caemlyn.\n
As discussed, there are a few avenues to take on this, a

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan 12 21:28:23 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 CotL Updates
\nThese all fall within the rumor category, though they are based strongly\n
in fact. The relate directly to the Children's Legion locations, which are\n
true, but the tales rising remain mere rumor for the moment.\n
\n
Location: Murandy, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague southern Murandy, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Illian, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague northern Illian, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Altara, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague eastern Altara, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Cairhien and Tear, Rumor\n
Title: Peaceful Cloaks\n
Keyword: Peaceful?\n
\n
Rumors rise upon the roads between Cairhien and Tear, tales\n
of the white-cloaked Children of the Light occupying the\n
area. Word spreads that even as the Aiel roam the lands,\n
moving here and there as they desire, the Children seem to\n
be strangely non-confrontational. Peace-knots bind their\n
weapons, the stories say, and the Children stand by silently\n
as they are whispered to monitor the lands between Cairhien\n
and Tear.\n
\n
Location: Tarabon and Toman Head, Rumor\n
Title: Mounted Scouts\n
Keyword: Scouting?\n
\n
It has been heard that the Children of the Light dispatched\n
a Legion of their finest soldiers to the west, their intention\n
vaguely whispered to be scouting the western lands. Soldiers,\n
Inquisitors, and even Diplomats are said to comprise the force\n
moving westward from Amadicia.\n
\n
Location: Andor and Tar Valon, Rumor\n
Title: Slowed Travel\n
Keyword: Inspections\n
\n
Travelers upon the road between Tar Valon and Caemlyn have been\n
known to report bands of Children stopping travelers, inspecting\n
their goods and sometimes dragging 'suspicious' characters away\n
from their journey. A full Legion has been said to made camp\n
upon the Caralain grass, half their numbers having moved south\n
to the Braem Wood to watch northern Andor. Word carried by those\n
that either avoid the Children, or are allowed passage, state\n
that the white-cloaked soldiers have begun training their men\n
upon the Caralain Grass, started a recruiting drive in the area,\n
and are scouring the lands between Andor and Tar Valon for\n
darkfriends. Rumors has it that a force of the Children recently\n
arrived to the north of Andor, led by a fair number of the Hand\n
of the Light, the Inquisitors of the Children.\n
\n
\n
Two more to follow in another mail, as I believe the cut-off is\n
around 100 characters... (?)\n

Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Altara, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague eastern Altara, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Cairhien and Tear, Rumor\n
Title: Peaceful Cloaks\n
Keyword: Peaceful?\n
\n
Rumors rise upon the roads between Cairhien and Tear, tales\n
of the white-cloaked Children of the Light occupying the\n
area. Word spreads that even as the Aiel roam the lands,\n
moving here and there as they desire, the Children seem to\n
be strangely non-confrontational. Peace-knots bind their\n
weapons, the stories say, and the Children stand by silently\n
as they are whispered to monitor the lands between Cairhien\n
and Tear.\n
\n
Location: Tarabon and Toman Head, Rumor\n
Title: Mounted Scouts\n
Keyword: Scouting?\n
\n
It has been heard that the Children of the Light dispatched\n
a Legion of their finest soldiers to the west, their intention\n
vaguely whispered to be scouting the western lands. Soldiers,\n
Inquisitors, and even Diplomats are said to comprise the force\n
moving westward from Amadicia.\n
\n
Location: Andor and Tar Valon, Rumor\n
Title: Slowed Travel\n
Keyword: Inspections\n
\n
Travelers upon the road between Tar Valon and Caemlyn have been\n
known to report bands of Children stopping travelers, inspecting\n
their goods and sometimes dragging 'suspicious' characters away\n
from their journey. A full Legion has been said to made camp\n
upon the Caralain grass, half their numbers having moved south\n
to the Braem Wood to watch northern Andor. Word carried by those\n
that either avoid the Children, or are allowed passage, state\n
that the white-cloaked soldiers have begun training their men\n
upon the Caralain Grass, started a recruiting drive in the area,\n
and are scouring the lands between Andor and Tar Valon for\n
darkfriends. Rumors has it that a force of the Children recently\n
arrived to the north of Andor, led by a fair number of the Hand\n
of the Light, the Inquisitors of the Children.\n
\n
\n
Two more to follow in another mail, as I believe the cut-off is\n
around 100 characters... (?)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Jan 18 10:24:36 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Dharl
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Character BG

\nBorn the third son to a Kandori arms man, Dharl Bandyk was the third of five children, the second son.  While he was young he was always larger then the other kids his age though he wasn't the smartest kid the creator had ever seen.  Though is father spent a lot of his time patrolling the blightborder to the north, the man did have enough time to quell the young boys hopes of following his father into the army. \n

At the age of twelve when Dharl was as large as most men, his father apprenticed his son to a silversmith named Neils in Chacin, but the family lived just outside town, so the boy left to live with the man.  Though Neil had accepted he figured out that Dharl couldn't be much help, in the exact words of the man,  "He was a huge man, all brawn but no mental prowess, hands to big to be a metal worker.".   He was used to move the metal around and hammer it thin, all things that required no thinking.\n

His form growing to almost six and a half feet, Neils saw a new opportunity in the man.  He used his spare time to forge Dharl a massive sword, most men would have to use both hands to manage the thing, but Dharl could easily use it with one.  He was sent to practice with the thing behind the forge whenever he could not be useful to the silversmith.  He learnt to swing the thing with much force, and parry blows at best, never becoming graceful with the weapon, or having much speed.  His one asset was his strength, the length of the blade and the force with which he could swing were deadly.\n

The silversmith wanted not much more than that.  Ending his apprenticeship, he took the giant of a man on as a merchant guard to protect him while he traveled the lands selling his jewellery.  The man's size supposed to intimidate thieves from stealing anything from the wagon that they traveled in.  They made their way west through Saldea and Arad Doman, then back east, traveling all throughout Andor to finally come to rest for sometime in Caemlyn, where Neil is renting out a forge so that he can make more jewelry to sell and go back to the road.\n

His time in Caemlyn found him frequenting the common room, hearing a lot of the Asha'man who were patrolling the streets.  He became very interested in those men, even venturing as far as to talk to one in the Lion's Den common room one night.  They'd made arrangements for Dharl to take a trip to the farm in the near future to be tested to see if the man could harness Saidin. \n

Neils left Caemlyn during the next few days, but Dharl left his services, staying behind waiting for one of the Asha'man to take him off to be tested.  He is staying in Caemlyn right now, still waiting, living off some of the jewelry he managed to take from the wagon before Neils set out again.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan 22 15:15:16 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Alton
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Happenings.
\n`7CC`6: `7Maechan Tria
\n\n
FYI, Since we can't seem to get on at the same time, here some things.\n
We took a boat up the rivers north, and seeing as nothing would be frozen\n
over we could continue all the way north to Fal Dara.  Alton gets off in Arafel to head\n
for the capital.  What you guys do from there is up to you.  You could follow\n
after him or continue to Fal Dara, go back to Caemlyn after Alton leaves\n
*shrugs* up to you guys.  Drop me a mail though and let me know what you\n
decide.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 24 13:24:09 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Deruthias BG (2nd mail)
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Syrah Faerid Shai'tan Varulv
\n\n
The words were taken to heart, and with a\n
change of clothes, a bag full of rations, and another bearing the case (heavily\n
padded with blankets and woven wool), Deruthias set off the next morning. He\n
rode with the other three young men, each insulting the other in good humor,\n
and telling stories of their lives. This lasted only a fortnight, as Deruthias\n
overslept one morning and awoke (possessions untouched - theft between those\n
of the caralain was unheard of but for the rarest of cases), Deruthias started\n
out on his own seeking to catch up with his lost companions. He did not follow\n
the same course as they, and as such, spent three fortnights traveling alone,\n
undisturbed. He just recently arrived upon the road leading north to Tar Valon,\n
and will be there in short time even with a slow pace.\n
\n
OOC Note: I am going to be sending this to DD (authorization of ancient nobility,\n
WK (for the Forest-Lord, as I would like to have him be an WK NPC, thus I seek\n
their approval), Nicodemus (to authorize the case and contents), and the Shadow\n
as it will come into play within the Family History I intend to craft and submit.\n
If authorization does not come, then the case is ebony wood with simple steel\n
hinges and lock and contains nothing within it: the Forest-Lord but a strange\n
man wandering the woods with no connection to the Wolves: and Deruthias' family\n
not bearing a touch of ancient noble blood. ICly he knows nothing of the Shadow\n
and his Family History with it, so that will not come into play until the role-\n
play has been fleshed out down the road if indeed the connection is authorized.\n
\n
Last Years of House Everin:\n
\n
512 NE is the year, the final tremors from the fall of Caralain\n
having rippled across the Grass. The rolling plains of the river\n
valley (between the Ivo and Arienelle) near to the forests that\n
claimed the lands between the Mountains of Mist and Arienelle.\n
A mixture between rugged forested hills and rolling, cultivated\n
plains, the parcel of land was ruled over by House Everin. Nearer\n
the rugged forests than the cultivated farmlands, the center of\n
the House of Everin rose to the side of a town ringed by isolated\n
villages: their fortified manor (appearing a castle to those that\n
called the 'frontier' home), watched over the town from a recessed\n
circle upon the hill. Three sides the hill stretched around the\n
manorhouse: seeming to paint the picture that it was both a part of\n
the town whilst appearing apart from the village. The eldest of\n
House Everin had dwelled in the manorhouse generation after\n
generation, seventh in line of succession and sharing blood with\n
the now deposed King. It was here that the last three of House\n
Everin ended their old lives and set out to begin new ones.\n
Lord and Lady Everin were preparing their departure from the manor,\n
servants milling through the dwelling as the men-at-arms of House\n
Everin were holding a tense vigil. The populace was beginning to\n
rise against the final remnants of nobility, most having fled to\n
family in other realms, many not surviving the journey. Something\n
had stirred the populace under the protection of House Everin,\n
a Friend of the Dark sent to incite riots within the crumbling\n
realm. It had been more powerful here, as for years beyond count\n
the family had set itself to rooting out Darkfriends and foiling\n
their plans. They sought to protect all against the manipulations of\n
the Dark One's minions, going to great lengths to set fire to their\n
webs of deception. The House of Everin slowly dwindled over decades,\n
the Shadow actively seeking to wipe out those of the blood of\n
Everin. It came to pass that they almost succeeded in 512 NE, the\n
Lord and Lady - with their 3 year old son and entourage of servants-\n
into the night. The villagers their keep watched over filled the\n
streets of the village, their angry forms barring exit from the town.\n
Lord Stefhen Everin ordered his men to do them no harm, but part the\n
crowd so they might pass. The guards complied, the villagers seeming\n
to obey as the Lord and his family departed: a voice rose through the\n
crowd, a hiss of anger and wrath, inciting the populace into a riotous\n
mass. The Lord fled with his family, the soldiers of House Everin\n
attempting to withdraw from the battle. Blood was spilled, and many\n
of the soldiers were taken to the ground, a handful all that was able\n
to free themselves from the frenzied mass. Eight soldiers followed\n
after the Lord Everin, days turning into weeks as the mounted company\n
traveled east across the rolling plains. They neared the Black Hills\n
and turned south, crossing the river Ivo. So it came to be that\n
the b

not bearing a touch of ancient noble blood. ICly he knows nothing of the Shadow\n
and his Family History with it, so that will not come into play until the role-\n
play has been fleshed out down the road if indeed the connection is authorized.\n
\n
Last Years of House Everin:\n
\n
512 NE is the year, the final tremors from the fall of Caralain\n
having rippled across the Grass. The rolling plains of the river\n
valley (between the Ivo and Arienelle) near to the forests that\n
claimed the lands between the Mountains of Mist and Arienelle.\n
A mixture between rugged forested hills and rolling, cultivated\n
plains, the parcel of land was ruled over by House Everin. Nearer\n
the rugged forests than the cultivated farmlands, the center of\n
the House of Everin rose to the side of a town ringed by isolated\n
villages: their fortified manor (appearing a castle to those that\n
called the 'frontier' home), watched over the town from a recessed\n
circle upon the hill. Three sides the hill stretched around the\n
manorhouse: seeming to paint the picture that it was both a part of\n
the town whilst appearing apart from the village. The eldest of\n
House Everin had dwelled in the manorhouse generation after\n
generation, seventh in line of succession and sharing blood with\n
the now deposed King. It was here that the last three of House\n
Everin ended their old lives and set out to begin new ones.\n
Lord and Lady Everin were preparing their departure from the manor,\n
servants milling through the dwelling as the men-at-arms of House\n
Everin were holding a tense vigil. The populace was beginning to\n
rise against the final remnants of nobility, most having fled to\n
family in other realms, many not surviving the journey. Something\n
had stirred the populace under the protection of House Everin,\n
a Friend of the Dark sent to incite riots within the crumbling\n
realm. It had been more powerful here, as for years beyond count\n
the family had set itself to rooting out Darkfriends and foiling\n
their plans. They sought to protect all against the manipulations of\n
the Dark One's minions, going to great lengths to set fire to their\n
webs of deception. The House of Everin slowly dwindled over decades,\n
the Shadow actively seeking to wipe out those of the blood of\n
Everin. It came to pass that they almost succeeded in 512 NE, the\n
Lord and Lady - with their 3 year old son and entourage of servants-\n
into the night. The villagers their keep watched over filled the\n
streets of the village, their angry forms barring exit from the town.\n
Lord Stefhen Everin ordered his men to do them no harm, but part the\n
crowd so they might pass. The guards complied, the villagers seeming\n
to obey as the Lord and his family departed: a voice rose through the\n
crowd, a hiss of anger and wrath, inciting the populace into a riotous\n
mass. The Lord fled with his family, the soldiers of House Everin\n
attempting to withdraw from the battle. Blood was spilled, and many\n
of the soldiers were taken to the ground, a handful all that was able\n
to free themselves from the frenzied mass. Eight soldiers followed\n
after the Lord Everin, days turning into weeks as the mounted company\n
traveled east across the rolling plains. They neared the Black Hills\n
and turned south, crossing the river Ivo. So it came to be that\n
the b
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 24 13:24:09 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Deruthias BG (2nd mail)
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Syrah Faerid Shai'tan Varulv
\n\n
The words were taken to heart, and with a\n
change of clothes, a bag full of rations, and another bearing the case (heavily\n
padded with blankets and woven wool), Deruthias set off the next morning. He\n
rode with the other three young men, each insulting the other in good humor,\n
and telling stories of their lives. This lasted only a fortnight, as Deruthias\n
overslept one morning and awoke (possessions untouched - theft between those\n
of the caralain was unheard of but for the rarest of cases), Deruthias started\n
out on his own seeking to catch up with his lost companions. He did not follow\n
the same course as they, and as such, spent three fortnights traveling alone,\n
undisturbed. He just recently arrived upon the road leading north to Tar Valon,\n
and will be there in short time even with a slow pace.\n
\n
OOC Note: I am going to be sending this to DD (authorization of ancient nobility,\n
WK (for the Forest-Lord, as I would like to have him be an WK NPC, thus I seek\n
their approval), Nicodemus (to authorize the case and contents), and the Shadow\n
as it will come into play within the Family History I intend to craft and submit.\n
If authorization does not come, then the case is ebony wood with simple steel\n
hinges and lock and contains nothing within it: the Forest-Lord but a strange\n
man wandering the woods with no connection to the Wolves: and Deruthias' family\n
not bearing a touch of ancient noble blood. ICly he knows nothing of the Shadow\n
and his Family History with it, so that will not come into play until the role-\n
play has been fleshed out down the road if indeed the connection is authorized.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 24 16:04:34 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Missing pieces (apology)
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Syrah Faerid Shai'tan Varulv
\n\n
From the end of the first mail:\n
stream meandering through a forest, held within yet unknowing of all the\n
wonders surrounding it. It would have continued as such if not for the unnatural\n
heat that begun, the weather unchanging as time progressed. The village, and\n
as well as many of the others feeling the effects of the lingering heat, held\n
a council. It was decided over the course of a week that they should do something,\n
but no one could offer a true solution. It was a child, a young boy from a nearby\n
village, that offered the idea of Aes Sedai. The council saw wisdom in this,\n
though a measure of distrust came with it, their homes and lands rarely seeing\n
an Aes Sedai. It was decided that a select number of youths would ride to Tar\n
Valon, and so it came that Deruthias was selected: he had knowledge of riding,\n
he had a horse, and he was rather well-spoken. So it came to pass that Deruthias\n
returned home, preparations for his journey begun that night. His parents, his\n
father actually, drew him to the sitting room and asked a favor. He revealed\n
a finely crafted case, ebony wood with deep grooves that once bore gold imagery.\n
All that was left were rather odd steel hinges and a lock, one without a key.\n
His father explained that it was a family heirloom, though one none knew anything\n
about. It had become tradition that father pass it to his eldest son, and it\n
had continued as such from where the mists clouded history. The case, long and\n
wide enough to bear a sword (unbeknownst to the family), seemed impervious to\n
damage, the locks unable to be picked or broken. As Deruthias had come of age,\n
his father explained, it was his by right of tradition, though it had only\n
exchanged hands when a son married. With their only child departing for Tar\n
Valon, there was a chance that Deruthias would not return, and with such a\n
risk, the case was offered. " Take it to Tar Valon and see if the Aes Sedai\n
can tell you anything, Thias. See if you can find out what this means to our\n
family, but let none take it from you. It is precious, and even if you do not\n
find the information, please, do not lose it. I would like to see it come to\n
your eldest son, and his in time."\n
\n
second:\n
the blood of House Everin found its way between the Ivo and Haevin.\n
A small settlement lay deserted as the Lord rode into one of the many\n
rolling valleys found between the Rivers Ivo and Haevin: seeming\n
a fair place to begin anew, the company made their way into the\n
shallow bowl. The entourage made its way slowly into the basin, the\n
remaining soldiers of House Everin riding ahead to secure the area.\n
The town was as it appeared, deserted, a perfect place to start\n
again. As the servants, children, Lord, Lady, child made their into\n
the town, three of the soldiers went to inspect the surrounding\n
area. As wagons were unloaded and possessions organized, the Lord\n
and Lady began to designate properties. The soldiers returned as\n
property was being delivered to certain homes that would soon house\n
new owners, word brought that they had found sheep to the west.\n
The new village, as it was titled by the Lord and his household, feasted\n
that night and slept well for the first time in months. The time\n
passed rather quickly after that. The Lord's son grew, playing with\n
other children: the structure of the Lord's hierarchy dissolved. Months\n
began to pass at first, a few refugees from the fall of Caralain\n
arriving now and then. Homes began to glow at night, more and more\n
as the months turned into years. An oath had been sworn throughout\n
the remnants of House Everin: silence was to always shroud their\n
origins, lest they be hunted once more. The tale had been told many\n
times before, and it was well known to the remaining servants of\n
House Everin that all must combat the Shadow, though sometimes\n
such battles were fought without bloodshed. Life slowed, and from time\n
\n
(one more mail - so sorry - to ensure it isn't cut off again)\n

remaining soldiers of House Everin riding ahead to secure the area.\n
The town was as it appeared, deserted, a perfect place to start\n
again. As the servants, children, Lord, Lady, child made their into\n
the town, three of the soldiers went to inspect the surrounding\n
area. As wagons were unloaded and possessions organized, the Lord\n
and Lady began to designate properties. The soldiers returned as\n
property was being delivered to certain homes that would soon house\n
new owners, word brought that they had found sheep to the west.\n
The new village, as it was titled by the Lord and his household, feasted\n
that night and slept well for the first time in months. The time\n
passed rather quickly after that. The Lord's son grew, playing with\n
other children: the structure of the Lord's hierarchy dissolved. Months\n
began to pass at first, a few refugees from the fall of Caralain\n
arriving now and then. Homes began to glow at night, more and more\n
as the months turned into years. An oath had been sworn throughout\n
the remnants of House Everin: silence was to always shroud their\n
origins, lest they be hunted once more. The tale had been told many\n
times before, and it was well known to the remaining servants of\n
House Everin that all must combat the Shadow, though sometimes\n
such battles were fought without bloodshed. Life slowed, and from time\n
\n
(one more mail - so sorry - to ensure it isn't cut off again)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 24 16:04:34 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Deruthias
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Missing pieces (apology)
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Syrah Faerid Shai'tan Varulv
\n\n
From the end of the first mail:\n
stream meandering through a forest, held within yet unknowing of all the\n
wonders surrounding it. It would have continued as such if not for the unnatural\n
heat that begun, the weather unchanging as time progressed. The village, and\n
as well as many of the others feeling the effects of the lingering heat, held\n
a council. It was decided over the course of a week that they should do something,\n
but no one could offer a true solution. It was a child, a young boy from a nearby\n
village, that offered the idea of Aes Sedai. The council saw wisdom in this,\n
though a measure of distrust came with it, their homes and lands rarely seeing\n
an Aes Sedai. It was decided that a select number of youths would ride to Tar\n
Valon, and so it came that Deruthias was selected: he had knowledge of riding,\n
he had a horse, and he was rather well-spoken. So it came to pass that Deruthias\n
returned home, preparations for his journey begun that night. His parents, his\n
father actually, drew him to the sitting room and asked a favor. He revealed\n
a finely crafted case, ebony wood with deep grooves that once bore gold imagery.\n
All that was left were rather odd steel hinges and a lock, one without a key.\n
His father explained that it was a family heirloom, though one none knew anything\n
about. It had become tradition that father pass it to his eldest son, and it\n
had continued as such from where the mists clouded history. The case, long and\n
wide enough to bear a sword (unbeknownst to the family), seemed impervious to\n
damage, the locks unable to be picked or broken. As Deruthias had come of age,\n
his father explained, it was his by right of tradition, though it had only\n
exchanged hands when a son married. With their only child departing for Tar\n
Valon, there was a chance that Deruthias would not return, and with such a\n
risk, the case was offered. " Take it to Tar Valon and see if the Aes Sedai\n
can tell you anything, Thias. See if you can find out what this means to our\n
family, but let none take it from you. It is precious, and even if you do not\n
find the information, please, do not lose it. I would like to see it come to\n
your eldest son, and his in time."\n
\n
second:\n
the blood of House Everin found its way between the Ivo and Haevin.\n
A small settlement lay deserted as the Lord rode into one of the many\n
rolling valleys found between the Rivers Ivo and Haevin: seeming\n
a fair place to begin anew, the company made their way into the\n
shallow bowl. The entourage made its way slowly into the basin, the\n
remaining soldiers of House Everin riding ahead to secure the area.\n
The town was as it appeared, deserted, a perfect place to start\n
again. As the servants, children, Lord, Lady, child made their into\n
the town, three of the soldiers went to inspect the surrounding\n
area. As wagons were unloaded and possessions organized, the Lord\n
and Lady began to designate properties. The soldiers returned as\n
property was being delivered to certain homes that would soon house\n
new owners, word brought that they had found sheep to the west.\n
The new village, as it was titled by the Lord and his household, feasted\n
that night and slept well for the first time in months. The time\n
passed rather quickly after that. The Lord's son grew, playing with\n
other children: the structure of the Lord's hierarchy dissolved. Months\n
began to pass at first, a few refugees from the fall of Caralain\n
arriving now and then. Homes began to glow at night, more and more\n
as the months turned into years. An oath had been sworn throughout\n
the remnants of House Everin: silence was to always shroud their\n
origins, lest they be hunted once more. The tale had been told many\n
times before, and it was well known to the remaining servants of\n
House Everin that all must combat the Shadow, though sometimes\n
such battles were fought without bloodshed. Life slowed, and from time\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan 12 21:28:23 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 CotL Updates
\nThese all fall within the rumor category, though they are based strongly\n
in fact. The relate directly to the Children's Legion locations, which are\n
true, but the tales rising remain mere rumor for the moment.\n
\n
Location: Murandy, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague southern Murandy, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Illian, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague northern Illian, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Altara, Rumor\n
Title: Whispered Deaths\n
Keyword: Razings\n
\n
Rumors plague eastern Altara, the stories reaching into\n
the heart of the nation, tales of death, of murder, and of\n
torture. Words spreads that the Children of the Light have\n
begun hunting Darkfriends more viciously, the slaughter of\n
those named 'Friends of the Dark' growing in number. None\n
seem to know the truth, for each tale differs from another.\n
Stories ranging from entire villages burned to the ground\n
and the villagers left to feel the flames of Light to quiet\n
raids into homes, specific persons stolen away in the dead\n
of night by white-cloaked men.\n
\n
Location: Cairhien and Tear, Rumor\n
Title: Peaceful Cloaks\n
Keyword: Peaceful?\n
\n
Rumors rise upon the roads between Cairhien and Tear, tales\n
of the white-cloaked Children of the Light occupying the\n
area. Word spreads that even as the Aiel roam the lands,\n
moving here and there as they desire, the Children seem to\n
be strangely non-confrontational. Peace-knots bind their\n
weapons, the stories say, and the Children stand by silently\n
as they are whispered to monitor the lands between Cairhien\n
and Tear.\n
\n
Location: Tarabon and Toman Head, Rumor\n
Title: Mounted Scouts\n
Keyword: Scouting?\n
\n
It has been heard that the Children of the Light dispatched\n
a Legion of their finest soldiers to the west, their intention\n
vaguely whispered to be scouting the western lands. Soldiers,\n
Inquisitors, and even Diplomats are said to comprise the force\n
moving westward from Amadicia.\n
\n
Location: Andor and Tar Valon, Rumor\n
Title: Slowed Travel\n
Keyword: Inspections\n
\n
Travelers upon the road between Tar Valon and Caemlyn have been\n
known to report bands of Children stopping travelers, inspecting\n
their goods and sometimes dragging 'suspicious' characters away\n
from their journey. A full Legion has been said to made camp\n
upon the Caralain grass, half their numbers having moved south\n
to the Braem Wood to watch northern Andor. Word carried by those\n
that either avoid the Children, or are allowed passage, state\n
that the white-cloaked soldiers have begun training their men\n
upon the Caralain Grass, started a recruiting drive in the area,\n
and are scouring the lands between Andor and Tar Valon for\n
darkfriends. Rumors has it that a force of the Children recently\n
arrived to the north of Andor, led by a fair number of the Hand\n
of the Light, the Inquisitors of the Children.\n
\n
\n
Two more to follow in another mail, as I believe the cut-off is\n
around 100 characters... (?)\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan 29 11:09:33 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Sehrna
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Sehrna
\n`7CC`6: `7Mat Tallyn
\n\n
Born in Saldaea approximately 22 years ago, Sehrna Diatrabes really was an\n
unhappy girl. She didn't fit in, was too tomboyish for her own good. She\n
didn't look like all the other normal Salaean's, probably because she wasn't\n
Saldaean, just born there. Her father was originally from the two rivers, and\n
for some reason, moved to Saldaea... he never told her why, and after 15 years\n
of trying to find out, she finally gave up.\n
\n
Her father loved her the best he could. Raising his only daughter without the\n
mother is a trial for any man, especially concerning female things. So, he\n
raised her the only way he knew how... as a boy. Sehrna got all the perks of\n
learning how to track in the forest, to shoot with a bow, some swordsmanship,\n
although she's no expert by any means. She's much better with the bow. She\n
took to hunting and being a tracker like a pro, and she loved to make her father\n
proud. He was the only person she had, she really had no friends, especially\n
of the female persuasion... she didn't like dresses.\n
\n
One day, while her father was teaching her the bow, the string broke and sprung\n
back to whip along her temple, leaving a large gash there. The gash healed, but\n
harmed the roots there and the remnant she has from her learning experience is\n
a white lock of hair.\n
\n
She grew up quickly, wearing boys clothes, doing boys things, and quite happy\n
in that respect. They lived at a cottage and she was content to wander the forest\n
to track and hunt. The only time she was truly unhappy is when they went to town\n
and she realized that she wasn't a normal girl, that liked dresses and pretty,\n
frilly things.\n
\n
When her father died on a hunting expedition, the lord he was escorting was a \n
coward and didn't help her father when a freak accident caused him to break\n
his bow string while aiming at a charging boar. The Lord turned tail and ran\n
while the boar ran down her father and trampled him. Sehrna was livid and her\n
grief knew no bounds. She dealt with it though, in time, but the remnant of\n
an almost irrational hatred of Lords and nobility runs through her veins.\n
\n
Taking her fathers beloved bow, and some scarce travelling gear, Sehrna left\n
the cottage she grew up in and went to explore the world. Now she's ended up\n
in Caemlyn, a city she heard was extremely beautiful.\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan 29 19:12:36 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Need opinion on Village Reaction
\n`7CC`6: `7Lyana Lafargo Bertram
\n\n

Recently word has spread through the outskirts of Caemlyn and the Andoran countryside, that the roads are once more safe for travelers.  The Bandits it seems, have all but been swept away with the onset of new peacekeepers.  Though the re-emergence of the Queen's Guard has had some effect, most give the credit, albeit reluctantly, to the Blackcoated men who have been making patrols throughout northern, and western Andor.  Fantastic tales arise of single Asha'man, standing down perhaps twenty, and some times forty bandits, fighting the rogues with sword and fire.  Even though the fear of these men remains, as deeply ingrained in the populace as any cultural trait, now in some, there is awe as well.  Regardless of these fanciful stories, there remains one undeniable fact, the roads through Andor are once more safe and patrolled, there only remains the question of when these Black Coated men will deal with the more organized forces that are terrorizing and harassing the citizens of Andor now. \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan 29 19:12:36 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Need opinion on Village Reaction
\n`7CC`6: `7Lyana Lafargo Bertram
\n\n

Recently word has spread through the outskirts of Caemlyn and the Andoran countryside, that the roads are once more safe for travelers.  The Bandits it seems, have all but been swept away with the onset of new peacekeepers.  Though the re-emergence of the Queen's Guard has had some effect, most give the credit, albeit reluctantly, to the Blackcoated men who have been making patrols throughout northern, and western Andor.  Fantastic tales arise of single Asha'man, standing down perhaps twenty, and some times forty bandits, fighting the rogues with sword and fire.  Even though the fear of these men remains, as deeply ingrained in the populace as any cultural trait, now in some, there is awe as well.  Regardless of these fanciful stories, there remains one undeniable fact, the roads through Andor are once more safe and patrolled, there only remains the question of when these Black Coated men will deal with the more organized forces that are terrorizing and harassing the citizens of Andor now. \n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 31 02:13:08 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Envoy/Diplomatic Relations
\n`7CC`6: `7Klentira Yoshida
\n\n
Seems we've the worst of luck trying to get something set\n
up so we can meet and ICly get something rolling, whether it\n
be a massive amount of bloodshed between our two armies, or\n
massive amounts of bloodshed and domination of the known world\n
because of our armies.\n
\n
If you can, mail Willem and I with dates you guys are open, or\n
perhaps how you would like to go about this since planning seems\n
not to work for us. Also, if you've any thoughts regarding this\n
diplomatic envoys and how we could go about it ICly, I'm open for\n
suggestions.\n
\n
On a matter regarding these negotiations, from the CotL standpoint,\n
it would work better if we were to align and then move to dominate\n
the known world for a few reasons.\n
\n
1) If we go to war with each other, yes, there will be role-play, which\n
is needed on both sides right now (though the Seanchan seem in more\n
dire need, as the Children have begun to pick up ICly through role-play).\n
This would most likely be a terrible loss to the Children, and though\n
the role-play leading to our flight from Amadicia would be quite an\n
event, and rather entertaining to boot, it starts a chain-reaction\n
that could/would/will lead to the end of the CotL ICly. As GL, I'd like\n
to avoid that. If we were pushed from Amadicia, we would be forced to\n
regroup elsewhere, and such troop movements, as well as trying to\n
inhabit an area ICly to rebuild our strengths, would draw the attention\n
of several factions. The Tower would take every chance to wipe us out,\n
as we would likely be camped upon the Caralain Grass - or we would have\n
to occupy western Andor - leading to Andor/Tar Valon/Asha'man/Band of\n
the Red Hand moving in to slaughter us..\n
\n
2) With our combined might - our relations with the nations of Randland\n
and the strength of both the Children and the Seanchan army, we could\n
easily invade both Altara and Ghealdan to further establish power upon\n
the continent, and offer the Seanchan a much greater foothold as well as\n
an ally rather than a multitude of enemies.\n
\n
3) It would just be really quite the spectacle to ICly toss around every\n
other Guild out there and show them once and for all that the Children\n
and the Seanchan /are/ the best... :p\n
\n
That's it from my end. Apologies for the length, but I'm in one of those\n
'just gotta write' moods.\n
\n
Maeldrin. GL of the CotL.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb  1 11:08:32 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Isabelle
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Ranulf updates
\n`7CC`6: `7Lyana Lafargo Bertram
\n\n
Update Shienar Rumor\n
\n
Absent Shienaran Lord?\n
\n
Fanciful rumors abound concerning the absence of Lord an'Shinowa from his ancestral lands.\n
The marketplaces buzz with worry about why one of the protectors of the Borderlands would\n
be so conspicuously away for so long, and people whisper that he has abandoned his duty to\n
his people and his country. Riders from House Shinowa, the vanished Lord Ranulf's liege\n
house, have been seen on the north road, and no one is quite sure whether they are coming to \n
bolster Lord Ranulf's lands, or take them away... perhaps neither conclusion is the entire\n
truth.\n
\n
\n
Update Shienar News\n
\n
Loss of Faith in an'Shinowan Lord!\n
\n
Though a public declaration of loss of Faith was made by the High Seat of Shinowa, Demarko\n
Shinowa, there has been no response by the accused, Lord Ranulf an'Shinowa, who has been\n
seen to be currently in Andor's capitol city, Caemlyn. Lord an'Shinowa's actions will no\n
doubt cause trouble between the two men, and could result in serious consequences for the\n
conspicuously absent Lord Ranulf.\n
\n
\n
Update Andor Rumor\n
\n
Battle Lord, or Outright Lies?\n
\n
In the streets of Caemlyn, people are talking about the appearance of a Diademed Battle Lord here\n
in the city. Apparently, a Shienaran lord has been heard to refer to himself so, and make\n
claims of the title. But interjected into the presence of such an exalted personage here in\n
Andor is the rebuttal of a few who have served under the Shienaran's liege lord, who was \n
heard to say that the claims are unsubstantiated and false, and that even his title of Lord\n
may not exist much longer. Scandalous and exciting, the tales fly from mouth to mouth faster\n
than a horse can run... many hope for an open confrontation to fuel the fires of the rumors.\n
\n
Hopefully those are vague enough to work, with the exception of the News, which I pulled from Demarko's report.\n
\n
Izzy Belle.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  2 20:18:25 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Draft
\n`7CC`6: `7Varulv Beonca
\n\n
Word is spreading through the outskirts of Caemlyn and the Andoran\n
countryside that the roads are once again becoming safe for travel.\n
A rise in crime and an alarming increase in the numbers of bandits\n
since the disappearance of the Queen seems to have mostly died down.\n
Many attribute this welcome news to the re-emergence of the Queen's\n
Guard, but others pass on elaborate stories of Blackcoated men who\n
now patrol Andor, and speak of them in hushed, but emphatic tones.\n
Fantastic tales of these men tarvel in great variety and with\n
diverse conclusions.  They are said to wield sword and fire against\n
men, no, bandits, no - children, some hiss.  Deeply ingrained fear\n
still cloaks the stories of these men, but for good or ill, their\n
tales are told and invented imaginatively all over the countryside.\n
Those in a position to notice such things, agree, however, that\n
the countryside is becoming quieter, and safer, with the increased\n
activities of these men.\n
