now patrol Andor, and speak of them in hushed, but emphatic tones.\n
Fantastic tales of these men tarvel in great variety and with\n
diverse conclusions.  They are said to wield sword and fire against\n
men, no, bandits, no - children, some hiss.  Deeply ingrained fear\n
still cloaks the stories of these men, but for good or ill, their\n
tales are told and invented imaginatively all over the countryside.\n
Those in a position to notice such things, agree, however, that\n
the countryside is becoming quieter, and safer, with the increased\n
activities of these men.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan 30 18:11:26 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jerod
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumor: Bandits in Andor
\nRecently word has spread through the outskirts of Caemlyn and the \n
Andoran countryside, that the roads are once more safe for travelers.\n
The Bandits it seems, have all but been swept away with the onset of new\n
peacekeepers.  Though the re-emergence of the Queen's Guard has had some\n
effect, most give the credit, albeit reluctantly, to the Blackcoated men\n
who have been making patrols throughout northern, and western Andor.\n
Fantastic tales arise of single Asha'man, standing down perhaps twenty,\n
and some times forty bandits, fighting the rogues with sword and fire,\n
though many laugh at those estimations.  Even though the fear of these \n
men remains, as deeply ingrained in the populace as any cultural trait,\n
now in some, there is awe as well.  Regardless of these fanciful \n
stories, there remains one undeniable fact, the roads through Andor are\n
once more safe and patrolled, there only remains the question of when\n
these Black Coated men will deal with the more organized forces that are\n
terrorizing and harassing the citizens of Andor now. \n
\n
Thanks,\n
J.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb  1 11:08:32 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Isabelle
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Ranulf updates
\n`7CC`6: `7Lyana Lafargo Bertram
\n\n
Update Shienar Rumor\n
\n
Absent Shienaran Lord?\n
\n
Fanciful rumors abound concerning the absence of Lord an'Shinowa from his ancestral lands.\n
The marketplaces buzz with worry about why one of the protectors of the Borderlands would\n
be so conspicuously away for so long, and people whisper that he has abandoned his duty to\n
his people and his country. Riders from House Shinowa, the vanished Lord Ranulf's liege\n
house, have been seen on the north road, and no one is quite sure whether they are coming to \n
bolster Lord Ranulf's lands, or take them away... perhaps neither conclusion is the entire\n
truth.\n
\n
\n
Update Shienar News\n
\n
Loss of Faith in an'Shinowan Lord!\n
\n
Though a public declaration of loss of Faith was made by the High Seat of Shinowa, Demarko\n
Shinowa, there has been no response by the accused, Lord Ranulf an'Shinowa, who has been\n
seen to be currently in Andor's capitol city, Caemlyn. Lord an'Shinowa's actions will no\n
doubt cause trouble between the two men, and could result in serious consequences for the\n
conspicuously absent Lord Ranulf.\n
\n
\n
Update Andor Rumor\n
\n
Battle Lord, or Outright Lies?\n
\n
In the streets of Caemlyn, people are talking about the appearance of a Diademed Battle Lord here\n
in the city. Apparently, a Shienaran lord has been heard to refer to himself so, and make\n
claims of the title. But interjected into the presence of such an exalted personage here in\n
Andor is the rebuttal of a few who have served under the Shienaran's liege lord, who was \n
heard to say that the claims are unsubstantiated and false, and that even his title of Lord\n
may not exist much longer. Scandalous and exciting, the tales fly from mouth to mouth faster\n
than a horse can run... many hope for an open confrontation to fuel the fires of the rumors.\n
\n
Hopefully those are vague enough to work, with the exception of the News, which I pulled from Demarko's report.\n
\n
Izzy Belle.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb  5 12:25:01 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Rynn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG (Part 2)
\nHow could you explain the name Rynn in images and smells?  You\n
couldn't, the wolves all had there own names.  All there names\n
were easy enough to form into words.  Arriving at Illian, he\n
took up hunting again, but the hunting was not as good here, and\n
fishing was so much more exploited that Illian was too thriving\n
for most people to make good money.  He didn't stay here long,\n
but he took one memory from the city, the tattoo's that laden\n
his arms.  The tattooist was some sailor, having tattoo of his\n
own, and rings in so many orifices you couldn't image.  He took\n
back to Caemlyn, the same room, with more meetings with the\n
wolves.  On arrival he turned twenty-one.  The word of the Band\n
of the Red Hand was still around, only growing more as time went\n
on.  Even Illian had word of them.  The interest grew now, he\n
chose his next path, and left to join this 'Band'.  From\n
twenty-one to twenty-four, he trained, becoming a scout, raising\n
his rank more than once and earning his form of respect for his\n
skills of hunting.  Sword and bow skills refined, he found his\n
future, he found friends, and funny enough, some even had the\n
same color eye as he and spoke of the same skills, and the same\n
knowledge of what lurks in the woods.  Some even told him more\n
of what they learned on years that Rynn hadn't.  He refined his\n
ability to communicate with them also, and found friends in the\n
form of four legged fluffies.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Feb  6 00:32:00 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Rynn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG Update (Part 2)
\nSorry for the spam mudmail.\n
\n
Eventually he set off traveling again, leaving south for Illian.\n
As before, he worked for his money, he hunted for his own food.\n
It wasnt long before he noticed the strange stares he got from\n
people, and some were so wary they wouldn't let him work for a\n
bed, even if they needed it.  He found out in the end, his eyes\n
had turned gold.  Unnoticed by himself for over six weeks after\n
his meeting with the wolves.  The wolves were still sensed, and\n
there were other occasions where he saw them but ran.  His next\n
meeting, a day walk from Illian was one that he would stay.  The\n
images he got were more distinguishable, and it wasn't hard to\n
notice it was some form of communication.  He took a chance,\n
allowed the wolf to close along one of the plains, empty but for\n
the two.  The wolf stopped before him a single pace away, Rynn's\n
hands were shaking\n
his feet felt like they would give up, they\n
felt so weak.  He received more images from the wolves,\n
eventually worked out one and cut it to size, formed it into\n
human words that said, 'Rapidfire'.  He got that more than once\n
on more occasions with meeting wolves.  Even wolves he never saw\n
knew it, and it too became obvious as the knowledge it was\n
communication, that those words were the name they gave him.\n
How could you explain the name Rynn in images and smells?  You\n
couldn't, the wolves all had there own names.  All there names\n
were easy enough to form into words.  Arriving at Illian, he\n
took up hunting again, but the hunting was not as good here, and\n
fishing was so much more exploited that Illian was too thriving\n
for most people to make good money.  He didn't stay here long,\n
but he took a few memorys from the city, the tattoo's that laden\n
his arms.  The tattooist was some sailor, having tattoo of his\n
own, and rings in so many orifices you couldn't image.  And the\n
glass that same man told him.  He was a Seafolk, and had\n
practically a shop stocked with so many exotic things, he had\n
more stuff than he had pierced rings.  The glass were exotic,\n
and though they looked something of ready glasses, the lens were\n
tinted blue.  Wearing them brought him quite a surprise.  With\n
the blue tint combined to his gold eyes, they shone green in the\n
mirror.  It people were wary of him, wearing these glasses could\n
stop that.  He paid the full price, and they weren't cheap,\n
risking to leave him short on his home trip.  He took\n
back to Caemlyn, the same route, with more meetings with the\n
wolves.  On arrival he turned twenty-one, he went back to\n
hunting as before.  Life was what he considered a bore until he\n
was twenty-three and past.  Knowledge of an army had arrose, an\n
army called the Band of the Red Hand.  The interest grew now, he\n
chose his next path, and left to join this 'Band'.  From\n
twenty-three to twenty-four, he trained, becoming a scout,\n
raising his rank more than once and earning his form of respect\n
for his skills of hunting.  Sword and bow skills refined, he\n
found his future, he found friends, and funny enough, some even\n
had the same color eye as he and spoke of the same skills, and\n
the same knowledge of what lurks in the woods.  Some even told\n
him more of what they learned on years that Rynn hadn't.  He\n
refined his ability to communicate with them also, and found\n
friends in the form of four legged fluffies.\n

had the same color eye as he and spoke of the same skills, and\n
the same knowledge of what lurks in the woods.  Some even told\n
him more of what they learned on years that Rynn hadn't.  He\n
refined his ability to communicate with them also, and found\n
friends in the form of four legged fluffies.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Feb  6 00:38:19 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Rynn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG Update (Part 2)
\n`7CC`6: `7Dugoth Kaynen Rasridim
\n\n
OK, here it should be.  About the glasses and the tattoos Rynn has.  I need Seafolk confirmation if I can have that in my BG.  So unfortunatly, everyone has to wait for that first.  :(\n
\n
Eventually he set off traveling again, leaving south for Illian.\n
As before, he worked for his money, he hunted for his own food.\n
It wasnt long before he noticed the strange stares he got from\n
people, and some were so wary they wouldn't let him work for a\n
bed, even if they needed it.  He found out in the end, his eyes\n
had turned gold.  Unnoticed by himself for over six weeks after\n
his meeting with the wolves.  The wolves were still sensed, and\n
there were other occasions where he saw them but ran.  His next\n
meeting, a day walk from Illian was one that he would stay.  The\n
images he got were more distinguishable, and it wasn't hard to\n
notice it was some form of communication.  He took a chance,\n
allowed the wolf to close along one of the plains, empty but for\n
the two.  The wolf stopped before him a single pace away, Rynn's\n
hands were shaking\n
his feet felt like they would give up, they\n
felt so weak.  He received more images from the wolves,\n
eventually worked out one and cut it to size, formed it into\n
human words that said, 'Rapidfire'.  He got that more than once\n
on more occasions with meeting wolves.  Even wolves he never saw\n
knew it, and it too became obvious as the knowledge it was\n
communication, that those words were the name they gave him.\n
How could you explain the name Rynn in images and smells?  You\n
couldn't, the wolves all had there own names.  All there names\n
were easy enough to form into words.  Arriving at Illian, he\n
took up hunting again, but the hunting was not as good here, and\n
fishing was so much more exploited that Illian was too thriving\n
for most people to make good money.  He didn't stay here long,\n
but he took a few memorys from the city, the tattoo's that laden\n
his arms.  The tattooist was some sailor, having tattoo of his\n
own, and rings in so many orifices you couldn't image.  And the\n
glass that same man told him.  He was a Seafolk, and had\n
practically a shop stocked with so many exotic things, he had\n
more stuff than he had pierced rings.  The glass were exotic,\n
and though they looked something of ready glasses, the lens were\n
tinted blue.  Wearing them brought him quite a surprise.  With\n
the blue tint combined to his gold eyes, they shone green in the\n
mirror.  It people were wary of him, wearing these glasses could\n
stop that.  He paid the full price, and they weren't cheap,\n
risking to leave him short on his home trip.  He took\n
back to Caemlyn, the same route, with more meetings with the\n
wolves.  On arrival he turned twenty-one, he went back to\n
hunting as before.  Life was what he considered a bore until he\n
was twenty-three and past.  Knowledge of an army had arrose, an\n
army called the Band of the Red Hand.  The interest grew now, he\n
chose his next path, and left to join this 'Band'.  From\n
twenty-three to twenty-four, he trained, becoming a scout,\n
raising his rank more than once and earning his form of respect\n
for his skills of hunting.  Sword and bow skills refined, he\n
found his future, he found friends, and funny enough, some even\n
had the same color eye as he and spoke of the same skills, and\n
the same knowledge of what lurks in the woods.  Some even told\n
him more of what they learned on years that Rynn hadn't.  He\n
refined his ability to communicate with them also, and found\n
friends in the form of four legged fluffies.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb  8 17:51:39 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jaise
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Orders
\n*This note is delivered to you by a small child, a ward of the\n
Tower who has not yet reached sufficient age to begin training\n
but still is pledged to the Tower for some amount of years.*\n
Lieutenant,\n
You are allowed to take a full company of the guard of up to \n
one hundred men. Your charge will be to travel to Cairhien and\n
rendevous with the Runaway Accepted Analinde Riatin. She is to\n
return to Tar Valon to complete her training and your soldiers\n
are to offer escort.\n
If the Runaway Accepted resists, you are to remain in place\n
in Cairhien until aid comes.  Report back to the Tower at all\n
all stages of your mission. Your command will include a number\n
of pigeons sufficient to this task. \n
Also note that you will need to choose a route other than\n
the most direct one.  Travel due East, after leaving the city,\n
or proceed South by boat to Alindaer and then move overland to\n
Cairhien.  Avoid the Braem Wood area.\n
You will be joined by Aes Sedai, either in Cairhien or on the\n
way.\n
(insert name of TG Commander here)\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Feb 10 23:04:35 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 IC Notification
\n(a note delivered by a muddied page bearing the colors of House Laucion)\n
\n
Lady Reesad,\n
\n
I regretfully write to inform you that young Lord Ceril has\n
been struck a grievous blow whilst in Lugard. A group of thieves\n
set upon him and his men as they were about to begin a carriage\n
ride that would return them to Caemlyn. Though most of the\n
scoundrals were killed, they managed to inflict dire wounds\n
upon Lord Ceril.\n
\n
I regret to inform you that he has died, only as recently as\n
I pen this letter, the <insert date here befitting travel>.\n
It is with a heavy heart that we return him to his House for\n
burial, a private affair open only to those of Houes Laucion.\n
\n
Melecus Draius,\n
Chamberlain of Lord Ceril Laucion\n
(sealed with black wax bearing the imprint of a wineglass strangled\n
by vines)\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 10 13:11:06 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BL Ranks
\nThis is a rough draft I'm tossing in your direction. I'd\n
like your thoughts on these, suggestions if any. Thinking of\n
basing the initial ranks off of Morrowind's Thieves' Guild,\n
but I'm having trouble finding the actual ranks since my cd is\n
with a friend, and he's in rehab, so I can't access that 'research'\n
material. But here goes:\n
\n
General Thief Ranks:\n
\n
Wet-Ear: Standard starting thief, wet behind the ears, unsure of\n
how to really advance without aid from their brethren.\n
\n
Toad: A slightly experienced thief, dealt with mainly pick-pocketing\n
and other minors thefts. A few break-ins here and there, mainly at\n
small shops that carrying nothing of real value.\n
\n
Toad is also the rank where a thief could branch into a 'faction', as\n
it were. The Silver Fingers and Crimson Cudgels will take Toads into\n
their own ranks, where they advance within the heirarchy of their new\n
'guild'. The Silver Fingers deal with pick-pocketing and is an association\n
of fledgling thieves. Chaotic structure for advancement, more by word of\n
mouth and their ability to believably brag. The Crimson Cudgels are alley\n
stalkers that beat people up to gain coin. Rather simple muggers with the\n
same lack of focus within the guild. Strength and the ability to induce\n
fear allow for one to rise within the ranks.\n
\n
Footpad: These thieves are just beginning to become fully accustomed to\n
thier skills, taking more risky jobs such as break-ins of fine merchants\n
and the rooms of very minor foreign nobles visiting. They have begun to\n
round their skills, and seem more cautious than those of lower rank.\n
\n
Footpad is also the base rank where those of the Andoran Road Traders and\n
the Serpent's Fangs begin to recruit. The Andoran Road Traders look for\n
stealth and woodland potential, as they are the brigands that haunt the roads\n
of Andor and surrounding lands. They roam the wilds, seeking prey, and are\n
formed into a network, each band trading information with another. Advancement\n
is based upon skills and value of the member in regards to highway-robbery, as\n
well as evasion of authorities. The Serpent's Fangs are vicious murderers, low-key\n
assassins that are no better than cheap killers-for-hire. Their rank system is\n
based upon the number of kills the member has attained, as well as the risk involved\n
with each murder. Of all the weaker 'factions', those of the Serpent's Fangs\n
bear a semblence to order, their ranks structured.\n
\n
Prowler: These are the stalkers of the base ranks. They have attained a fair\n
measure of stealth, know when to exercise discretion in action and word, and\n
generally would rather remain alive and free, albeit poor, than imprisoned without\n
hope of release, or dead. They are more secure with second-story thefts, but are\n
not skilled enough to perform a job alone. Their skills are moderate, and as such,\n
often work in teams to execute a theft.\n
\n
The Merchants' Word takes recruits from those known as Prowlers, as they show the\n
proper discretion for their cause. The Merchants' Word is a network of charlatans,\n
gathering information on merchants, merchant and noble shipments, and anything else\n
pertaining to great wealth. They infiltrate businesses, and when a merchant leaves\n
for a trip, operate out of the shop, selling off the goods for their own profit.\n
They also excel at forgery, as they often reroute shipments so they may gain the\n
goods without having to actually risk exposure. They are the neutral 'faction' within\n
Caemlyn, acting as envoys between the 'guilds' and serving as impartial judges for\n
disputes.\n
\n
Thief: As the rank states, this is when a thief is considered skilled enough to\n
go it alone. Most thefts can be easily exercised by the thief, goods stolen through\n
the many arts they possess. This is a standard thief, skilled in various fields and\n
perhaps ready to focus upon one, to specialize in it and make a name for themselves.\n
\n
Cat-Burglar: The top of the tier, as it were. Cat-burglars are those who exercise\n
complete stealth in their tasks, often stealing into estates of Lords to make off with\n
a previously decided selection of valuables. They are those that could be considered\n
elite, and those that are humble about their skills are often those that remain free\n
and alive. Caution is a strong part of the Cat-burglar, and they often have forged a\n
cover identity to keep unwanted attention away from their illicit activities.\n
\n
This rank is also where the true Black Lions of Andor begin recruitment. Whilst all\n
thieves of Caemlyn are known as Black Lions, this is the 'elite of the elite'. The\n
true Black Lions have seperated themselves into three distinct divisions: The Ebony\n
Claws of the Lion, The Crimson Eyes of the Lion, and the Silent Roar of the Lion.\n
\n
The Ebony Cla
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 10 13:11:06 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BL Ranks
\nThis is a rough draft I'm tossing in your direction. I'd\n
like your thoughts on these, suggestions if any. Thinking of\n
basing the initial ranks off of Morrowind's Thieves' Guild,\n
but I'm having trouble finding the actual ranks since my cd is\n
with a friend, and he's in rehab, so I can't access that 'research'\n
material. But here goes:\n
\n
General Thief Ranks:\n
\n
Wet-Ear: Standard starting thief, wet behind the ears, unsure of\n
how to really advance without aid from their brethren.\n
\n
Toad: A slightly experienced thief, dealt with mainly pick-pocketing\n
and other minors thefts. A few break-ins here and there, mainly at\n
small shops that carrying nothing of real value.\n
\n
Toad is also the rank where a thief could branch into a 'faction', as\n
it were. The Silver Fingers and Crimson Cudgels will take Toads into\n
their own ranks, where they advance within the heirarchy of their new\n
'guild'. The Silver Fingers deal with pick-pocketing and is an association\n
of fledgling thieves. Chaotic structure for advancement, more by word of\n
mouth and their ability to believably brag. The Crimson Cudgels are alley\n
stalkers that beat people up to gain coin. Rather simple muggers with the\n
same lack of focus within the guild. Strength and the ability to induce\n
fear allow for one to rise within the ranks.\n
\n
Footpad: These thieves are just beginning to become fully accustomed to\n
thier skills, taking more risky jobs such as break-ins of fine merchants\n
and the rooms of very minor foreign nobles visiting. They have begun to\n
round their skills, and seem more cautious than those of lower rank.\n
\n

hope of release, or dead. They are more secure with second-story thefts, but are\n

\n
The Merchants' Word takes recruits from those known as Prowlers, as they show the\n

disputes.\n
\n
Thief: As the rank states, this is when a thief is considered skilled enough to\n

\n
Cat-Burglar: The top of the tier, as it were. Cat-burglars are those who exercise\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb 18 16:25:26 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Aust
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Aust's BG
\nThis is his background up until this point, as far as I can remember it.\n
Part of it is actual RP that's taken place somewhere along the years. Let\n
me know if you want Aust to be an existing member of the Black Lions, I\n
think that's the current guild, or if I need to go through the whole seeker\n
process and whatnot.\n
\n

It was a stormy night twelve years past that a child was born to the Khendon family, a poor merchant and wife.  This was their first child, a strong and healthy baby boy, which brought much joy into their lives.  This joy was, unfortunately, short lived.  After only a few years, the Master Khendon began staying longer hours at his shop, and at times not coming home even when we did not travel anywhere.  This, of course, made his wife quite suspicious and arguments ensured every night that he was home.  Three long years did this stay in the life of young Aust, his father disappearing for days at a time, his mother either crying or yelling in fits of rage.  They were provided for, however, even if the distance between his parents only managed to grow with each passing day.  Then, it all came to an abrupt end.\n

The day that Aust's mother lead him away from their house was not a day unlike countless others in his short six years of life.  The sun had risen, his father had only recently arrived home from a week spent in the company of another woman and Aust's mother slowly building into the crecendo that would undoubtedly lead into yet another day long argument.  This one was different, however.  No threats were made, no insults thrown into the teeth of either party.  There was just a vast silence that stretched and was more frightening by far than the shattering of dishes, or the threats.  It was on this day that Aust's mother bundled up her little boy and changed both of their lives forever.\n

Aust's mother had never been on her own before, her life spent either entirely with her parents, or her husband.  She was on her own now, however, with a child to support as well.  She knew little of the outside, only that this could not be worse than what she had just left.  She was sorely mistaken.  After weeks of hunger and a child who was still fairly new to the world, she made her first life-altering mistake.  She was given a loan, however, this was not the sort of loan that one would logically take, the interest was high and the assurance of proper legality not to be seen.  The pair lived well for a month, however, that\n

was when they came for their first payment.  Aust's mother was a comely woman, still fairly young and still too innocent for her own good, and that was all these men needed to trap her.  They offered her employment, an unskilled employment that would make her the money she needed to pay them back, the money to keep her child safe from their hands.  It was that night that her life was forever changed and her nights on the streets began.\n

Aust knew little about what was happening, his mother's nights rarely beginning before he went to sleep.  It could not last forever, though and soon, all too soon, Aust was swept away into this world as well.  Aust's mother was broken, a mere shell of a woman and she could not bring herself to sell her body any more. The loan had long since been paid, but these were not the type of men to let something as simple as being repaid lose them the money they could earn with her out on the streets.  Aust's mother did not return that night, but it would not have mattered in the slightest anyway.  For as the men crouched in the shadows, waiting for her to pass, another was already at her home, holding the hand of a child as he walked through the front door.  Little was the same for Aust after that, no one ever knew if his mother was found, but no one cared enough to look for her.  Aust was given a story, a story that he'd been betrayed by his mother and that she had given him to these men because\n
she no longer wanted him, or had a use for him.  His child's mind would not accept it at first, however, as days stretched into weeks he could not deny the truth they told him they spoke.\n

Aust's was a harsh life after that, his new masters sending him to beg on street corners, beating him when he took too little from the pockets of the citizens of Caemlyn.  Once he had served these masters for a year his talents were slowly coming to be recognized.  He was a bright lad, learning much just by sitting on a street corner and listening, or talking, or by hearing the stories of the others that served these men.  His hands were quick, either could be used with enough strength and dexterity to make a pickpocket rich.  His biggest advantage of all, however, was that he could sprint like a rabbit at the drop of a hat.  His training began in his seventh year o

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan  8 12:07:02 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jayl
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG, for Laborers guild.

\nJayl was abandoned in Caemlyn at the age of 4 by his parents.  As far as he cam remember in his youth, his parents had been moving about from town to town.  He was taken in by an elderly couple, who could not give him much, nor did they pay much attention to him.  There was never enough food on the table for the three of them, so at a young age Jayl started turning to thievery to fill the aching hole in his stomach.  His slim build allowed him easy access to tight places, where he could hide from the queen's guard after a shopkeeper sent them chasing after him.  \n

He lived with the couple until the old man's wife passed away, and he went to live with family in Baerlon,  Jayl was supposed to move with the man, but he quietly slipped away one night, rather then move to a new city.  He found that he could steal more than food, taking small trinkets from street merchants that he could sell to others, to provide him with money.  He stayed in the streets during the night, often being pushed into new homes by the Queen's guard when they found him lying in the streets at night, but he'd always manage to run away within a week at the new house.\n

He quickly fell into a gang of thieves in Caemlyn, staying in a rather large manor in the inner city that the gang ran out of.  He started doing bigger jobs within the gang, often dressing up as a noble of a minor house to gain entrance into a Lord's manor.  They made contacts within the Queen's Guards, paying officers to hold back orders on starting searches for them and knowing where the patrols would be at what times.\n

Things broke up one night while they were trying to rob a merchant's house one night.  A patrol of the queen's guard that was coming back from the gates, saw the small group of thieves standing outside the merchant's house.  They ran into the house like fools, setting the queen's guard into action.  The guard caught six of the nine men who were on the job, though Jayl got away without being seen. \n

He took a room at an inn for the night,  getting out of the streets as soon as possible.  When he returned to the manor in the morning there was a group of the Guards standing outside of the manor,   every one who had been in the headquarters was thrown into the dungeon.  You could have counted the remains of the group on both hands, all of the rallying around Jayl as their leader until the others got out.   They went back to their roots, the stole golden trinkets and food, and set up in a small house where they lived. \n

Now almost 27, he stills runs the small group of thieves out of the house, their numbers up to a lucky 13.  Everything they steal goes through him and is sold, leaving them all to live in a well off style.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb 22 18:37:34 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Anusien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 RE: Hornhunter App
\nOh screw it.  We'll stick with the name Anusien.\n
\n
Anusien is a Hornhunter, aged 24.  His prime motivation is ego - he wanted\n
to be the one to find the Horn of Valere and have his name in history.\n
His morals are questionable, in that he tends to put himself first before\n
others.  His principle goal is to be remembered, to be famous (and at\n
times, at any cost - it is better to be remembered poorly than forgotten).\n
\n
<Yes, this will probably have to go to Daes, too, but I haven't done that\n
yet>\n
Anusien was born to two poor servants, working for one of the lesser nobles\n
in Arafel.  He suffered under an abusive father and a loving but uncapable\n
and unsure mother.  The lord who employed his mother and father was a slave\n
driver, causing much of the strife in the household and in the lord's\n
manor as a whole.  Anusien trained with the guards until he reached the age\n
of sixteen, at which point he thought himself capable.  At that age (six\n
by the Altaran custom of naming by the age he was given the twin blades he\n
wears on his back), he left home.  Blaming the Blight for destroying any\n
semblance of happiness he had, he fled south to find training.  Passing\n
through Illian he found his purpose when he hear the Cycle of the Horn of\n
Valere by a gleeman.  He decided that was the way he could make himself,\n
Anusien Mersales, known in history.  From there, he made his way to Caemlyn\n
to start finding clues about the Horn.\n
\n
`7The Arafellin man stands slightly above average, with a sturdy build and\n
strong arms and legs.  His skin is lightly tanned, moreso than average for\n
an Arafellin.  He wears his `8dark `3brown `8hair`7 hair in two\n
long braids hanging halfway across his back, with `1red `3ribbons`7 lacing\n
through them, and topped with one `8silver `&bell`7 on each, producing a\n
faint twinkle as he moves.  He wears a `@green `2shirt`7, laced with a simple\n
katana over the right breast, matching the two he wears at his shoulders.  The\n
shirt is tucked into a pair of simple brown pants, belted at the waist with a\n
dagger at the left side.  The pants hang almost to his ankles, over a pair of\n
`8black `3leather `8boots`7.\n
\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb 22 20:30:53 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jhevon
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Asha
\nJhevon was born in Andor, to a rather poor family who lived on the outskirts\n
of Caemlyn.  His father worked as a blacksmith until he got his hand stepped\n
on by a horse he was shoeing, injuring his hand to the point he could no\n
longer hold the tools needed for his craft.  His mother works at a seamstress\n
shop, but doesn't make enough money to feed her large family.  Jhevon is\n
the oldest child of eight... with five brothers and two sisters.  His sisters\n
are aged 5 and 10 respectively, and even though they are learning to sew like\n
their mother, they are too young to be of much use.  His brothers, aged 1, 3,\n
6, 8, and 12 respectively, are also too young to support the family, although\n
the two older ones, Jasen and Jhaele, have become apprentice blacksmiths.\n
\n
Jhevon, being light of build, was never really cut out to be a blacksmith, and\n
had dreams as a child of being the Captain-General of the Queen's Guard.  He\n
is now 15.  Though he no longer has delusions of grandeur about being a highly\n
ranked officer in the Guard, he realizes that with his father's recent injury,\n
he needs to find a way to support his family, and soon.  He is currently in\n
the city, looking for work so he can at least support himself, even if he\n
cannot support the rest of his family.  His father, though injured, is still\n
cannot support the rest of his family.  His father, though injured, does what\n
he can to help his wife in her sewing business.  Jhevon's family will not go\n
hungry, even if he does not find a job, but yet he still feels the need to at\n
least not be a burden.\n
\n
Jhevon does have the ability to channel, though he does not know it yet.  With\n
the prominence of the Asha'man in Caemlyn, and their role as law enforcement, he\n
has become interested in them, and is willing to submit to the tests to see if\n
he can become one of them.\n
\n
If you need further information, please let me know.\n
\n
Jhevon\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb 22 20:30:53 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jhevon
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Asha
\nJhevon was born in Andor, to a rather poor family who lived on the outskirts\n
of Caemlyn.  His father worked as a blacksmith until he got his hand stepped\n
on by a horse he was shoeing, injuring his hand to the point he could no\n
longer hold the tools needed for his craft.  His mother works at a seamstress\n
shop, but doesn't make enough money to feed her large family.  Jhevon is\n
the oldest child of eight... with five brothers and two sisters.  His sisters\n
are aged 5 and 10 respectively, and even though they are learning to sew like\n
their mother, they are too young to be of much use.  His brothers, aged 1, 3,\n
6, 8, and 12 respectively, are also too young to support the family, although\n
the two older ones, Jasen and Jhaele, have become apprentice blacksmiths.\n
\n
Jhevon, being light of build, was never really cut out to be a blacksmith, and\n
had dreams as a child of being the Captain-General of the Queen's Guard.  He\n
is now 15.  Though he no longer has delusions of grandeur about being a highly\n
ranked officer in the Guard, he realizes that with his father's recent injury,\n
he needs to find a way to support his family, and soon.  He is currently in\n
the city, looking for work so he can at least support himself, even if he\n
cannot support the rest of his family.  His father, though injured, is still\n
cannot support the rest of his family.  His father, though injured, does what\n
he can to help his wife in her sewing business.  Jhevon's family will not go\n
hungry, even if he does not find a job, but yet he still feels the need to at\n
least not be a burden.\n
\n
Jhevon does have the ability to channel, though he does not know it yet.  With\n
the prominence of the Asha'man in Caemlyn, and their role as law enforcement, he\n
has become interested in them, and is willing to submit to the tests to see if\n
he can become one of them.\n
\n
If you need further information, please let me know.\n
\n
Jhevon\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb 23 06:17:02 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Anusien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 RE: Anusien
\n`7CC`6: `7Lyana Lafargo Bertram
\n\n
Hi, it's Anusien.  I was making my background to be a Hornhunter this\n
timeline, and it includes growing up in a royal household.  I guess\n
it's either informing or asking permission, whichever is appropriate.\n
\n
Anusien was born to two poor servants, working for one of the lesser nobles\n
in Arafel.  He suffered under an abusive father and a loving but uncapable\n
and unsure mother.  The lord who employed his mother and father was a slave\n
driver, causing much of the strife in the household and in the lord's\n
manor as a whole.  Anusien trained with the guards until he reached the age\n
of sixteen, at which point he thought himself capable.  At that age (six\n
by the Borderlan custom of naming by the age he was given the twin blades he\n
wears on his back), he left home.  Blaming the Blight for destroying any\n
semblance of happiness he had, he fled south to find training.  Passing\n
through Illian he found his purpose when he hear the Cycle of the Horn of\n
Valere by a gleeman.  He decided that was the way he could make himself,\n
Anusien Mersales, known in history.  From there, he made his way to Caemlyn\n
to start finding clues about the Horn.\n
\n
And any random mentioning there of Altara (I think I got them all, but I\n
may have missed one) should be Arafel - I misremembered the name.\n
\n
Anyway, thanks\n
Anusien\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Feb 10 23:04:35 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 IC Notification
\n(a note delivered by a muddied page bearing the colors of House Laucion)\n
\n
Lady Reesad,\n
\n
I regretfully write to inform you that young Lord Ceril has\n
been struck a grievous blow whilst in Lugard. A group of thieves\n
set upon him and his men as they were about to begin a carriage\n
ride that would return them to Caemlyn. Though most of the\n
scoundrals were killed, they managed to inflict dire wounds\n
upon Lord Ceril.\n
\n
I regret to inform you that he has died, only as recently as\n
I pen this letter, the <insert date here befitting travel>.\n
It is with a heavy heart that we return him to his House for\n
burial, a private affair open only to those of Houes Laucion.\n
\n
Melecus Draius,\n
Chamberlain of Lord Ceril Laucion\n
(sealed with black wax bearing the imprint of a wineglass strangled\n
by vines)\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar 21 19:39:51 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BP
\nI set you up with the stuff I could think of - on BP,\n
you have grant (so you can grant other people the following\n
OLC commands), set (for set <player> <zone number that you're\n
giving them access to>), zedit, redit, oedit, and goto.  When\n
you grant a player a command, make sure you only give it to them\n
on BP - do:\n
\n
grant Rasridim goto 9696\n
\n
If you don't do the port argument, then it gives them imm\n
commands on this port if they're using their mort's name.\n
I'm not sure what it takes to create a new zone - we're gonna\n
have to ask Ranulf (the old head builder) or syrah, if she\n
knows.  Right now zone 407 is the active one that Kinje and\n
Ranulf are working on.  Faerid is about done with the eq ones\n
(I think they were 37, maybe 38 and 39, but I don't remember\n
for certain).  Oh, come to think of it, you may have to grant\n
them things like show, for zone info, and vstat and such.  But\n
what I gave you is the essentials, I think.\n
\n
If you need anything else, beep me. :>\n
Thanks,\n
-Nico\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Mar 23 19:48:55 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Varulv
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Alton's travel times.
\nIt will take alton 13 days to reach Caemlyn, assuming that he is leaving\n
from Fal Moran.  If it's Fal Dara, tack on an extra day there.\n
\n
Before you complain about this, it is not an arbitrary decision.  I have\n
a set of pre-calculated travel times from various points on the map.  The\n
decision was made, long ago, to slow down troop movements to give PC rulers\n
the opportunity to respond.  Furthermore, the PC rulers of each nation he\n
travels to will be notified that twenty men are approaching their borders.\n
I generally advise people marching through other territories to write ICly\n
first and obtain the proper permissions, but that's a matter of curtesy, and\n
I don't dictate IC behavoirs.  If Alton thinks twenty men isn't enough\n
to cause a stir, that's fine.\n
\n
-- Varulv\n

-- Varulv\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Mar 26 01:28:01 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Handrem
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Handren Filidric

\nLife in the Borderlands revolves around war and for the Filidric family it was no different. Ryan Filidric, Handren's father, was a bowyer, his mother Regina was a uniform maker and Handren, Christoph, his older brother, and Arnol, his younger brother, were all bound for the army from their birth. From a young age the three boys were drilled in military principles such as courage, bravery and honour. They along with other boys their age would mock fight in the streets enacting what they thought were the grand battles of the Arafellan army, little did they appreciate the lives given by other warriors to allow them this freedom. \n

Life in the Borderlands revolves around war and for the Filidric family it was no different. Ryan Filidric, Handren's father, was a bowyer, his mother Regina was a uniform maker and Handren, Christoph, his older brother, and Arnol, his younger brother, were all bound for the army from their birth. From a young age the three boys were drilled in military principles such as courage, bravery and honour. They along with other boys their age would mock fight in the streets enacting what they thought were the grand battles of the Arafellan army, little did they appreciate the lives given by other warriors to allow them this freedom. \n

As the three brothers grew older their life was divided into 2 parts, learning some of their father's craft and preparing themselves for the army. This meant that on any given day they might be found studying different types of wood, learning to bend and shape a bow stave, testing the strength of different bowstrings or they could be found running laps for speed doing simple weights to build muscle or later on in their youth, learning how to fight with their fists. \n

At age 17 Handrem was accepted into the cavalry and his brother Christoph at age 18 was accepted into the elitist scouts. Both brothers relished their assignment and in celebration both went out, got drunk and tattooed themselves, a decision which Handrem questions sometimes. With his accpetance into the cavalry Handrem went through a basic training which included learning how to ride a horse(a task which initially terrified him), learning to wield duel sword hopefully giving him a chance to actually strike an opponent and also he was conditioned to carry all the armor and equiptment of a soldier. His training was cut short thought by a Trolloc raid that had made it past the signal towers and it was this raid that made him want to journey to Tar Valon. \n

imagined, huge bestial Trollocs and serpentine Myrdrraal up against scarred veterans and raw recruits. For Handrem and a few of the other new recruits their heavy armor was all that saved them from death, so pitiful were their attacks against their lumbering opponents. Handrem saw most of the battle from on his back after being knocked off his warhorse, from the ground he watched man and beast engage in savage battle with the flow of battle shifting back and forth until finally the reinforcements arrived. \n
\n

\n`7Subj`6:`7 Let me try this again.

\nLife in the Borderlands revolves around war and for the Filidric family it was no different. Ryan Filidric, Handren's father, was a bowyer, his mother Regina was a uniform maker and Handren, Christoph, his older brother, and Arnol, his younger brother, were all bound for the army from their birth. From a young age the three boys were drilled in military principles such as courage, bravery and honour. \n

As the three brothers grew older their life was divided into 2 parts, learning some of their father's craft and preparing themselves for the army. This meant that on any given day they might be found studying different types of wood, learning to bend and shape a bow stave, testing the strength of different bowstrings or they could be found running laps for speed doing simple weights to build muscle or later on in their youth, learning how to fight with their fists. \n
\n

At age 17 Handrem was accepted into the cavalry and his brother Christoph at age 18 was accepted into the elitist scouts. Both brothers relished their assignment and in celebration both went out, got drunk and tattooed themselves, a decision which Handrem questions sometimes. With his accpetance into the cavalry Handrem went through a basic training which included learning how to ride a horse(a task which initially terrified him), learning to wield duel sword hopefully giving him a chance to actually strike an opponent and also he was conditioned to carry all the armor and equiptment of a soldier. His training was cut short thought by a Trolloc raid that had made it past the signal towers and it was this raid that made him want to journey to Tar Valon. \n
\n

Riding out to battle in the heavy plate and mail armor, his golden surcoat resplendent with the the , and a heavy sword in his hand, Handrem felt a mix of terror and elation. He was finally living out what he saw as his destiny, the reality of battle was far worse than he ever could ahve imagined, huge bestial Trollocs and serpentine Myrdrraal up against scarred veterans and raw recruits. For Handrem and a few of the other new recruits their heavy armor was all that saved them from death, so pitiful were their attacks against their lumbering opponents. Handrem saw most of the battle from on his back after being knocked off his warhorse, from the ground he watched man and beast engage in savage battle with the flow of battle shifting back and forth until finally the reinforcements arrived. \n
\n

Arriving back in Shoal Arbela, his home he found that there was an easier way to fight the Shadow. An Aes Sedai was in the city, and all talk was of her, and how she could help with the fight, the One Power a better weapon against the creators of the Dark One that plauged them. With her was a man, who moved with deadly precision and grace. A Gaidin, a Battle Brother, sworn to protect the Aes Sedai. That is what he wanted, to protect those that would make their fight against the Father of Lies even a touch easier. Telling his father, and his commander his idea, he was released from the Army and set out south to Tar Valon.\n
\n

One could call this face handsome,  hair  the colour of a raven's feathers and laced with small, silver bells, hangs down far enough to be braided into dual braids down his back just shy of his mid back often wore over his shoulders, and his eyes are a stunning shade of haze, odd for an Arafellan.. His mouth, while tight, is often trying not to smile, almost as if he finds everything around him humorous is trying desperately not to burst out laughing. At a modest five-foot-nine, he carries himself confidently--the bells in his hair jingling all the while--and at first glance seems not to pose a threat. However, look into his eyes, and you'll see the truth--that stunning shade of hazel is like a deathtrap. His eyes are completely cold, as if the humor has been burned out of them, despite his almost-smiling lips. In short, this handsome fellow looks not to pose a threat, but stay away from those eyes, for while they don't drill into you, they certainly give you a nice chill. \n
\n

Upon the man's back, peaking over his shoulders are two hilts of swords. They are strapped across his back in a criss cross fashion. His clothing consists of dark woolen breaches, tucked into hard leather boots. The shirt that he wears is loose, though not billowing to allow movement without being caught on anything, yet tight enough to show the muscles in his hard body, due to years of training for the fighting on the border. All in all his clothing is rather

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Mar 30 06:54:02 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Sean
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Mapping Caemlyn
\nOK, I've mapped all of Caemlyn but for the Theatre in the north-east cornner,\n
and the guild centre west of the Oval Plaza.  I have my reasons.  I don't\n
like bad links, and links that take you instantly from one room to another,\n
unless it brings some advantage, like going strate to Cairhien via the\n
visitors centre.  If you want .gif's, just ask, I'll send them to your addy.\n
There are four, levels -1, 0, 1 and 2.\n
\n
***Sean Berator\n
\n
NOTE:  You think my choice for a last name is ok?\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  2 12:26:12 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Tells I missed
\nHey, I guess I missed some tells you sent me while I was\n
mailing last night - yes, we can add rooms to the\n
test ports without adding them to the live port.\n
You would construct them on the builderport, and\n
then:\n
from  /../builderport/lib/world\n
cp wld/407.wld /../mudback/lib/world/wld\n
cp zon/407.zon /../mudback/lib/world/zon\n
cp obj/407.obj  /../mudback/lib/world/obj\n
\n
etc, for each of the file types.  Obviously\n
there should have been a tilda in front\n
of each of the /../ in the destination\n
directory, but you get the idea.  I think\n
that's right, anyhow, but you can always\n
doublecheck before you start copying files\n
over.  Stuff done on the builderport\n
has to be implemented manually to the\n
live port, so we simply just don't\n
import it if we don't want it here yet.\n
\n
That help?\n
-Nico\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  2 17:27:58 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Timothy
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Update for Shienar
\nIn a recent meeting with the King of Shienar, Lord Alton Jagad rumored to have been \n
given an important mission.  Shortly after his visit with the King, Alton was seen leaving \n
Fal Moran heading south along the road to Tar Valon with an honor guard of twenty \n
Lancers.  While their destination is unknown there is strong speculation, given recent \n
news, as to what the mission could be and where they are heading.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  2 17:40:01 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Alton
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumor for Tar Valon
\nRumor is slowly spreading of a group of heavily armed horsemen about half a days ride\n
east of the city.  Their intentions are not clear, but they do not appear to be getting any\n
closer to the city itself, in fact it appears they are avoiding the city in their travel south\n
.  They are not openly avoiding the roads and travels and rumors of the groups travel puts\n
their origin somewhere in Shienar.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr  3 15:27:19 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Samir
\n`7Subj`6:`7 background
\nRaliv's father was of Domani and Shienaran descent, who traveled to Saldaea \n
and the other Borderlands to sell his work as merchant's guard. Raliv's mother \n
was a Saldaean woman who's grandparents were from Malkier. She was a stickler \n
for tradition, as were her parents, and theirs. While Raliv's father, Oroti, \n
was on a job, Raliv's mother -Schere- was traveling to a neighboring town to \n
sell her current husband's produce, she was mugged by a traveling group of \n
bandits. Oroti's luck found him finding her on the side of the road, with her horse \n
hamstringed and her merchandise either stolen or destroyed. The merchant \n
offered Schere passage, but she would have to stay with the guards. As it turned \n
out, they did not have enough food to feed Schere, and Oroti gave her his food, \n
and that was when they met.\n
They stopped at the town, and Oroti borrowed enough money to buy a small \n
farm. They were soon married, and before either of them could stop to think, they \n
had a child on the way. Raliv was born. As a child, Raliv grew up envying the \n
guards who were allowed to participate in defense of the city. As soon as he \n
was old enough, Raliv received the hadori, in the tradition of Malkier. Raliv \n
soon grew to be trained with his sword, and at sixteen winters, went with his \n
friend to Cairhien. Raliv was not very good at foresting, but somehow they \n
still made it to Cairhien. As he arrived, he was amazed. Unfortunately, a week \n
later, his friend went "out", and Raliv did not see him again.\n
Raliv decided to make his way to Caemlyn, and even though the journey was \n
hard, he made it. As he arrived, he looked for jobs. He scared away his first few \n
job offerings because of his hadori. Eventually, he settled into a position \n
as bouncer at a local inn. He eventually quit, and joined in a life of crime. \n
He fought in underground battles, like cockfights with humans. He won most, and \n
earned himself the name "King of Cats", from his catlike appearance. In a \n
joke, he bough livery for himself, with a brown cat with emerald eyes, to use as \n
he fought. He was later mugged, and had all of his possessions stolen, except \n
for enough money to stay for a month at the Lion Banner inn, his swords, and \n
his livery. He now can be found in the common room of the inn, racking up his \n
tab and searching about for jobs. Even so, he is currently unemployed, unable \n
to find work because of people spreading slander about his recession from \n
street fights.\n
\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr  3 15:27:19 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Samir

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr  3 15:57:24 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Kaelin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Kaelin's BG

\nKaelin Severash grew up in a region at war the second son of a minor Andoran border lord. Born and raised on his father's estate in southern Andor near the border with Murandy. Frequent border clashes between Murandy and Andor meant his childhood was spent in preparation for one day aiding his father and elder brother in the defense of Andor. \n
\n

After reaching adulthood, he spent most of his time leading a small scouting squad for his father during clashes with Murandian border troops and mercenary units. He lacked experience, but was carried through by a thirst for knowledge and the aid of a veteran subcommander. Engaging in numerous minor skirmishes against small enemy forces, he developed a knack for small-unit tactics in closed terrain. He also made a few kills, though all were at long-range... and it wasn't until much later and many hundred leagues away that he killed an opponent up-close (mainly because he was not a very good melee fighter and not ashamed to admit it.) \n
\n

During a surprise assault against the family's estate by mercenaries in the employ of a Murandian Border Lord, he found himself in an upstairs hallway, running towards the armoury to retrieve his crossbow. Rounding a corner, he came upon a mercenary about to attack his younger sister. She seemed to have every intention of standing her ground, though armed only with knives against the mercenary's sword. As he ran to her aid, he thought he was going to be too late... but he was wrong. An unseen hand grasped the mercenary and threw him with considerable force against a wall, breaking his back. At the time, it seemed that Angel had manifested the ability to channel.\n
\n

His father could not leave the estate in the wake of the attack, and his elder brother Rei was required to aid in the planning of retribution against the Murandians. With ten picked men at his disposal, Kaelin was tasked with escorting his sister to Tar Valon to be presented to the White Tower. After an uneventful journey they arrived at the Shining Walls. The first Aes Sedai they met, a Red as it happened, seemed rather excited at finding a girl who could channel, and tested her there and then. Angel passed the test\n
she could channel, and was inroled into the White Tower. \n
\n

Returning home to his father's estate he lived and worked, knowing he'd never be the Lord of his father's lands, but still. It was about five years later that the Severash family recieved word that Angel had been tested for Accepted and failed the test resulting in the loss of her life. \n
\n

Anger filled Kaelin, how could those.. witches kill his sister and not care about it. His family was devistated, Kaelin took his father aside, and spoke admetnly about wanting to do something with his life. "I want to join the Children of the Light." His father nodded and gave him his blessing. Kaelin went to Amadica to train in the ways of the Light, he swiftly rose in ranks\n
\n

Tall for and Andoran, Kaelin stands six foot in height, and weighs 190 pounds. His long hair is redish brown in colour, leaving it held back in a leather cord he hides a scar on the back of his neck. His eyes are a dark colour of brown, almost black. They are hard and intense as he peers around him. Kaelin's face is rounded, giving him a handsome feature, when conbined with his dark hair and eyes.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

During a surprise assault against the family's estate by mercenaries in the employ of a Murandian Border Lord, he found himself in an upstairs hallway, running towards the armoury to retrieve his crossbow. Rounding a corner, he came upon a mercenary about to attack his younger sister. She seemed to have every intention of standing her ground, though armed only with knives against the mercenary's sword. As he ran to her aid, he thought he was going to be too late... but he was wrong. An unseen hand grasped the mercenary and threw him with considerable force against a wall, breaking his back. At the time, it seemed that Angel had manifested the ability to channel.\n
\n

His father could not leave the estate in the wake of the attack, and his elder brother Rei was required to aid in the planning of retribution against the Murandians. With ten picked men at his disposal, Kaelin was tasked with escorting his sister to Tar Valon to be presented to the White Tower. After an uneventful journey they arrived at the Shining Walls. The first Aes Sedai they met, a Red as it happened, seemed rather excited at finding a girl who could channel, and tested her there and then. Angel passed the test\n
she could channel, and was inroled into the White Tower. \n
\n

Returning home to his father's estate he lived and worked, knowing he'd never be the Lord of his father's lands, but still. It was about five years later that the Severash family recieved word that Angel had been tested for Accepted and failed the test resulting in the loss of her life. \n
\n

Anger filled Kaelin, how could those.. witches kill his sister and not care about it. His family was devistated, Kaelin took his father aside, and spoke admetnly about wanting to do something with his life. "I want to join the Children of the Light." His father nodded and gave him his blessing. Kaelin went to Amadica to train in the ways of the Light, he swiftly rose in ranks\n
\n

Tall for and Andoran, Kaelin stands six foot in height, and weighs 190 pounds. His long hair is redish brown in colour, leaving it held back in a leather cord he hides a scar on the back of his neck. His eyes are a dark colour of brown, almost black. They are hard and intense as he peers around him. Kaelin's face is rounded, giving him a handsome feature, when conbined with his dark hair and eyes.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  2 17:27:58 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Timothy
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Update for Shienar
\nIn a recent meeting with the King of Shienar, Lord Alton Jagad rumored to have been \n
given an important mission.  Shortly after his visit with the King, Alton was seen leaving \n
Fal Moran heading south along the road to Tar Valon with an honor guard of twenty \n
Lancers.  While their destination is unknown there is strong speculation, given recent \n
news, as to what the mission could be and where they are heading.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  2 17:27:58 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Timothy

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  2 17:40:01 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Alton
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumor for Tar Valon
\nRumor is slowly spreading of a group of heavily armed horsemen about half a days ride\n
east of the city.  Their intentions are not clear, but they do not appear to be getting any\n
closer to the city itself, in fact it appears they are avoiding the city in their travel south\n
.  They are not openly avoiding the roads and travels and rumors of the groups travel puts\n
their origin somewhere in Shienar.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Apr 14 09:50:09 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Raliv
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Raliv BG
\nRaliv's father was of Domani and Shienaran descent, who traveled to Saldaea \n
and the other Borderlands to sell his work as merchant's guard. Raliv's mother \n
was a Saldaean woman. She was a stickler for tradition, as were her parents, and theirs. \n
While Raliv's father, Oroti, was on a job, Raliv's mother -Schere- was traveling to a \n
neighboring town to sell her current husband's produce, she was mugged by a traveling\n
group of bandits. Oroti's luck found him finding her on the side of the road, with her \n
horse hamstringed and her merchandise either stolen or destroyed. The merchant offered \n
Schere passage, but she would have to stay with the guards. As it turned out, they did not\n
have enough food to feed Schere, and Oroti gave her his food, and that was when they \n
met. They stopped at the town, and Oroti borrowed enough money to buy a small farm. \n
They were soon married, and before either of them could stop to think, they had a child \n
on the way. Raliv was born. As a child, Raliv grew up envying the guards who were \n
allowed to participate in defense of the city. Raliv soon grew to be trained with his sword,\n
and at sixteen winters, went with his friend to Cairhien. Raliv was not very good at \n
foresting, but somehow they still made it to Cairhien. As he arrived, he was amazed. \n
Unfortunately, a week later, his friend went "out", and Raliv did not see him again. Raliv \n
decided to make his way to Caemlyn, and even though the journey was hard, he made it. \n
As he arrived, he looked for jobs. He scared away his first few job offerings because of \n
his hadori. Eventually, he settled into a position as bouncer at a local inn. He eventually \n
quit, and joined in a life of crime. He earned the nickname "King of Cats", from his \n
catlike appearance. In a joke, he bough livery for himself, with a brown cat with emerald \n
eyes. He was later mugged, and had all of his possessions stolen, except for enough \n
money to stay for a month at the Lion Banner inn, his swords, and his livery. He now can \n
be found in the common room of the inn, racking up his tab and searching about for jobs. \n
Even so, he is currently unemployed, unable to find work because of people spreading \n
slander about his recession from street fights.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Apr 14 09:50:44 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Raliv

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb  8 17:51:39 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jaise
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Orders
\n*This note is delivered to you by a small child, a ward of the\n
Tower who has not yet reached sufficient age to begin training\n
but still is pledged to the Tower for some amount of years.*\n
Lieutenant,\n
You are allowed to take a full company of the guard of up to \n
one hundred men. Your charge will be to travel to Cairhien and\n
rendevous with the Runaway Accepted Analinde Riatin. She is to\n
return to Tar Valon to complete her training and your soldiers\n
are to offer escort.\n
If the Runaway Accepted resists, you are to remain in place\n
in Cairhien until aid comes.  Report back to the Tower at all\n
all stages of your mission. Your command will include a number\n
of pigeons sufficient to this task. \n
Also note that you will need to choose a route other than\n
the most direct one.  Travel due East, after leaving the city,\n
or proceed South by boat to Alindaer and then move overland to\n
Cairhien.  Avoid the Braem Wood area.\n
You will be joined by Aes Sedai, either in Cairhien or on the\n
way.\n
(insert name of TG Commander here)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun May 16 23:01:33 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jake
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Shadow stuff
\n`7CC`6: `7Shai'tan Varulv
\n\n
For what it's worth, the peeps involved are Caine, Ciaran, Mandi\n
and possibly Carra, though I believe she's been nixed as there\n
isn't a good reason for an accepted to be leaving the safety of\n
the tower (Melinda was talking to them last).  I'm jumping on this\n
RP wagon as well - I ran this by Syrah earlier, and she approves.\n
Mandi's receiving an IC mail from one of her eyes and ears in\n
Caemlyn - a pawn shop owner and collector - who's come across\n
a ring that he believes might be forged with the power.  It's\n
unlikely, and he's certainly no expert in these things, but Mandi\n
has decided to go and check it out in person.\n
\n
The object is a terangreal, in actuality, but Mandi won't be\n
able to do anything with it.  First off, it's for males, and\n
secondly, it appears to be broken (tiny crack in an imperfect\n
ring - it's stone, inlaid with bone slivers).  It's use is\n
unknown - what's more important is that if Mandi uses her brain\n
at all, she may come to the conclusion that the ring is not\n
ancient at all, as one would expect from any terangreal.  This\n
would be determined by the bone slivers not having colored with\n
age, as they would have if they were over 3k years old.  She may\n
decide that some of the Asha'man are experimenting with ter'angreals,\n
or I dunno what else she might come up with, but that'd be\n
the most logical assumption I'd think.  It is, of course, in\n
actuality one of Sevet's failed attempts as he gets over his\n
trauma suffered at the hands of Sammael (he's my AoL channeler\n
we'd discussed last year, hope ya remember :p I've been RPing\n
him a fair bit the last week.  It's been about 2 IC years since\n
his escape).  During one of his many flights from darkfriends/\n
people he suspects might be after him, it was lost in the streets\n
of Caemlyn and found by a boy, who thought he could pawn it for\n
money.  I'm going to tie this in with a few other things as\n
well - the idea is to set a background vibe for the mud for\n
a while.  Sevet's a real wild card and I want to do everything\n
I can to get people involved and after him before I make his\n
place obvious to anybody.  For now, Mandi will find the ring,\n
draw whatever conclusions she draws, and that's that. :p I've\n
got no problem with the darkhounds so long as you guys are\n
cool with it - it's your dept.  Why're they there?\n
\n
-Nico\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue May 18 08:42:01 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Raliad
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Gleeman BG
\nRaliad Mitsobar was born in a manor along side the river Eldar outside of Ebou Dar.  His \n
father was Lethan, a third cousin of the Mistress of the four winds, the Queen of Altara.  \n
His mothers name was Joyce and upon her bodice lay a marriage knife enameled with 5 \n
stones three red and two white.  Being the youngest, Raliads stone lay on the lowest \n
extremity of the hilt, followed by the three red stones in which the middle one had a \n
white setting, and then the eldest son, his older brother Enimerie.  During his young life \n
he did what most other Altaran youths would do, dueling endlessly with his elder siblings \n
to become a fairly decent knife fighter himself.\n
His family would travel to the Tarasin palace often, and that is where he met a young \n
noblewomans daughter named Lila.  Raliad was but twelve when he met the girl, and \n
she was his elder by two years, but still she came to visit with the siblings Mistobar when \n
the four of them came into the city of Ebou Dar.  As time went on, the visits became \n
more exclusive, and the two sisters would venture out into the city to find boys to woo for \n
themselves leaving Enimerie and Raliad alone with Lila, and needless to say each boy \n
fell head over heels for the girl.\n
The inevitable happened a few months after Raliad sixteenth birthday, when his brother \n
seven years his elder, challenged him to a duel for Lilas hand in marriage.  But Raliad \n
could not bring himself to fight his own flesh and blood and refused to accept the \n
challenge of the other young man.  Lila and his brother left the scene right away, but \n
Raliad wandered the city aimlessly for a few hours before he returned to the palace ready \n
to leave for home again, only to find what he had been dreading for the whole time hed \n
been wandering.  Walking into the anteroom where his mother sat alone the only thing \n
that drew the mans attention was the missing gem on the lowest point upon the hilt of \n
her marriage dagger.\n
Quickly he left the city and went back to the country manor before any of his family \n
could return, and left just as quickly.  If they did not want him anymore, he would not \n
hang around to see them.  Taking nothing more then a purse full of coins, he set upon a \n
long drunken wandering journey.  Quickly though he realized that two thirds of his \n
coinage had been blown on alcohol and lodging over his travels and he needed to find a \n
way to replenish it.  Not wanting to settle down just yet, he picked up a rough wooden \n
flute and went to an inn that night offering to play it for room and board.  Halfway \n
through his first performance, over the jeering crowd the young Lordling heard a voice \n
take up a song to bring attention off of him.  His eyes were drawn towards a patch-\n
worked cloaked and his savior of the night, a simple gleeman.  Raliad slipped away to \n
spend the rest of the night at the bar, and was joined afterwards by the gleeman himself.\n
Offering the young boy an apprenticeship, they traveled together all over the world for \n
years.  Seven years later, when the old gleeman deemed him a suitable performer Raliad \n
was given a cloak for his own and set upon his way.  His way was drawn towards \n
Caemlyn, where war and strife brought by the Caihrien refugees might prove a goldmine \n
for a simple entertainer such as himself.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue May 18 08:42:01 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Raliad
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Gleeman BG

take up a song to bring attention off of him.  His eyes were drawn towards a patch-\n
worked cloaked and his savior of the night, a simple gleeman.  Raliad slipped away to \n
spend the rest of the night at the bar, and was joined afterwards by the gleeman himself.\n
Offering the young boy an apprenticeship, they traveled together all over the world for \n
years.  Seven years later, when the old gleeman deemed him a suitable performer Raliad \n
was given a cloak for his own and set upon his way.  His way was drawn towards \n
Caemlyn, where war and strife brought by the Caihrien refugees might prove a goldmine \n
for a simple entertainer such as himself.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jun  2 14:39:13 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Jake
\n`7Subj`6:`7 IC report for CL
\n`7CC`6: `7Lyana Bertram
\n\n
Hey, could you guys post whatever IC info from this you feel is appropriate\n
to the CL members, and whoever else you want to know about it?\n
\n
Two assassination attempts occurred early-night IC, last night.  A number of\n
individuals were involved in the first, outside the Saucy Wench, and the main\n
targets were a man and woman - the woman may have been AS, because the power\n
appeared to be used to protect them, according to witnesses (air bubble) that\n
blocked falling furniture/arrows).  Man was injured, his wearabouts are\n
unknown now - the woman (description Deryeha) is still in Caemlyn.  An NPC\n
local homeless man took a fall from the top of a building and landed with arrows\n
sticking from his back during the attack - witnesses indicate at least four\n
assailants, including at least one skilled arrowman.  The assailants all took\n
off into the night, and an hour later, a second assassination attempt was made\n
on a man attempting to leave through the West Gate of Caemlyn.  He's believed to\n
have escaped, no further casualties.\n
\n
Please let me know if anybody wants to follow up on this and investigate in\n
an official capacity.  Any questions, please lemme know - I'm rushing and\n
I probably forgot something. :p\n
\n
-Nico\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr  3 15:57:24 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Kaelin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Kaelin's BG

\nKaelin Severash grew up in a region at war the second son of a minor Andoran border lord. Born and raised on his father's estate in southern Andor near the border with Murandy. Frequent border clashes between Murandy and Andor meant his childhood was spent in preparation for one day aiding his father and elder brother in the defense of Andor. \n
\n

After reaching adulthood, he spent most of his time leading a small scouting squad for his father during clashes with Murandian border troops and mercenary units. He lacked experience, but was carried through by a thirst for knowledge and the aid of a veteran subcommander. Engaging in numerous minor skirmishes against small enemy forces, he developed a knack for small-unit tactics in closed terrain. He also made a few kills, though all were at long-range... and it wasn't until much later and many hundred leagues away that he killed an opponent up-close (mainly because he was not a very good melee fighter and not ashamed to admit it.) \n
\n

During a surprise assault against the family's estate by mercenaries in the employ of a Murandian Border Lord, he found himself in an upstairs hallway, running towards the armoury to retrieve his crossbow. Rounding a corner, he came upon a mercenary about to attack his younger sister. She seemed to have every intention of standing her ground, though armed only with knives against the mercenary's sword. As he ran to her aid, he thought he was going to be too late... but he was wrong. An unseen hand grasped the mercenary and threw him with considerable force against a wall, breaking his back. At the time, it seemed that Angel had manifested the ability to channel.\n
\n

His father could not leave the estate in the wake of the attack, and his elder brother Rei was required to aid in the planning of retribution against the Murandians. With ten picked men at his disposal, Kaelin was tasked with escorting his sister to Tar Valon to be presented to the White Tower. After an uneventful journey they arrived at the Shining Walls. The first Aes Sedai they met, a Red as it happened, seemed rather excited at finding a girl who could channel, and tested her there and then. Angel passed the test\n
she could channel, and was inroled into the White Tower. \n
\n

Returning home to his father's estate he lived and worked, knowing he'd never be the Lord of his father's lands, but still. It was about five years later that the Severash family recieved word that Angel had been tested for Accepted and failed the test resulting in the loss of her life. \n
\n

Anger filled Kaelin, how could those.. witches kill his sister and not care about it. His family was devistated, Kaelin took his father aside, and spoke admetnly about wanting to do something with his life. "I want to join the Children of the Light." His father nodded and gave him his blessing. Kaelin went to Amadica to train in the ways of the Light, he swiftly rose in ranks\n
\n

Tall for and Andoran, Kaelin stands six foot in height, and weighs 190 pounds. His long hair is redish brown in colour, leaving it held back in a leather cord he hides a scar on the back of his neck. His eyes are a dark colour of brown, almost black. They are hard and intense as he peers around him. Kaelin's face is rounded, giving him a handsome feature, when conbined with his dark hair and eyes.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jul 19 17:18:11 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Ranulf
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Take two
\nif a first copy went through, i'm sorry, my comp stalled out in the middle of writing\n
anhow, muds name is shadows of Isildur, address is\n
aman.middle-earth.us port 4500\n
save\n
You'll be able to see most of it with the guest login, though going through the creation system (gotta get approved which blows) gives alot of interesting stuff\n
Things to look at are as follows\n
Method of knowing other fellas (you don't, except through your own memory. Probably not a wise idea here, but definately fairly cool\n
\n
The hood system (if you're wearing a hood and type hood, or wearing a faced helm, it disguises your long-description, unless someone uses 'study'\n
save\n
their movement system (would be -very- useful if we're still using our grid system. People would complain at first, but its a great idea and solves alot of the problems, particularly with combat\n
Their combat system, not so much to take, but to look at, its kinda cool\n

their health system. Half is awesome, half is sketchy. The six stars and bars for health and stamina are interesting although not the cool part. The cool part is the complex injury system they have beyond that. (go get hit by something or spar someone)\n
\n
save\n
Last, their interactive emote system. Something i've been drooling for as long as i've been here. Their objects, people, all can be tied into the emotes, (help newbie once you're there)\n
oh, and one last thing. Interactive furniture.\n
\n
Mac\n
