\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan  5 04:10:03 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Amra
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BP project
\nHey Nico,\n
\n
I wanted to let you know what I did while you weren't looking.  :)\n
\n

road square is complete in all three zones on the to do list.  The only things left on the whole list is the completed description of the general stuff in the overworld.  (Exactly, the green, blue-green, and blue vnums)\n
\n
In case anyone starts working on Zone 638 before I start in on it again, FYI, the fork of the river on the RIGHT is the River Alguenya, and the one on the LEFT is the Erinin.\n
\n

Please feel free to walk the roads and make sure they are what was requested and the descs are good enough.  I will be more than happy to change anything that needs changing - I'm new at this, so I wouldn't be surprised if I didn't do it exactly right.\n
\n

One possible problem:  the last thing I did during my first session of building was to fix the West Gate of Aringill (vnum 16522).  When I logged back in later, it had reverted back to the way it was before I changed it.  I don't know if it just didn't save correctly, or if I put a West Gate of Aringill in the wrong place somewhere.  I searched around and couldn't find a duplicate in an erroneous vnum, but you never know.  Thought you should be aware either way.\n
\n

If you have any questions, comments, concerns, or if you need to yell at me for screwing something up, please let me know.  My alts are Amra, Phaedra, and Embeth.  I'm on almost all day.  (It's 6 am now, and I'm going to bed, but I'll be back tomorrow afternoon.)\n
\n

This has been long enough, hopefully I'll be able to talk to you later.  BTW, my husband (alts Janthin and Rowen) is also interested in helping out.  He's off work all day and will be on, too, if you could still use some more volunteers.\n
\n
thanks!  Carissa\n

\n\n
Hey Syrah, I've got a good group of people working on the Caemlyn/Aringill\n
areas now - they've already knocked out the vast majority of it and are just\n
writing descs for the rest of the rooms now.  I added Phaedra and Caleb to\n
the builders guild (they're Ming and Carissa on the BP - they've been kicking\n
serious ass over there).  Nenae is doing a lot of the descs as well.\n
\n
Also, regarding your zones - I told you I can't renumber 2 digit zone\n
numbers - can't do it.  The automated command will mislink half the exits\n

so pissed off I eventually just unloaded everything in it that wasn't\n
working properly.  Otherwise, tho, which city do you think we should\n
port over next? Cairhien I've already done detailed recon for, but\n
Tar Valon is used more - but it's more junk zones too.  I havne't looked\n
at TV at all beyond noting that there are about a dozen zones reserved\n
for it for some reason.\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan  5 18:22:58 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Syrah
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Zone update
\n`7CC`6: `7Beonca Nicodemus Varulv
\n\n
Since Nico pointed out a problem with the previous numbering system, I have posted\n
a new one in the usual place:\n
\n
http://www.geocities.com/vwinters@swbell.net/MITZones01-05-05.htm\n
\n
As always, comments are welcome.\n
\n
Syrah\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan  5 23:48:19 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Phaedra
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BP Zone 639

\nI just wanted you to know that I finished all of Zone 639.  Every room is named and described.  Please, again, feel free to check behind me and make sure it's done the way it should be.  I will begin on 638 later on, starting with the river, I think.\n
\n
Just thought you'd like an update.  Thanks for letting me help out!\n
\n
Carissa\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan  7 22:54:13 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BD Update
\n`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Builders Dept
\n\n
This is for the builders and staff.\n
\n
I'm dazzled by how much everybody's getting done.  Phaedra\n
just finished the last of the zone 639 descriptions, and\n
everybody's putting a lot of work into the whole Caemlyn/Aringill\n
group of zones.  I think next I'd like to add some objects to\n
the zone to mark things better - like wagon ruts, for example.\n
\n
For my part, I've been cleaning up Caemlyn some - try it out.\n
I've added a quick navigation system on the ubermap so you can\n
teleport to any finished city by typing "goto <city name>".\n
If you type 'goto caemlyn', you teleport to a marker 'above'\n
the city zone, in a room labeled 'Ethereal Caemlyn'.  If you\n
go in any cardinal direction from there, you enter the actual\n
world at the respective gate of Caemlyn (w,n,e, or s gate).\n
I'm gonna do this for all the cities we port over.\n
\n
If you guys have any ideas or projects you'd like to do, please\n
let me and Syrah know.  I personally am interested in adding\n
a thieves guild entrance for the Caemlyn Black Lions.  Also,\n
Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map\n
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into\n
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in\n
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there\n
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when\n
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the\n
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the\n
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys\n
think?\n
\n
-Nic\n
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug\n
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files\n
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!\n

\n`7Subj`6:`7 BD Update
\n`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Builders Dept
\n\n
This is for the builders and staff.\n
\n
I'm dazzled by how much everybody's getting done.  Phaedra\n
just finished the last of the zone 639 descriptions, and\n
everybody's putting a lot of work into the whole Caemlyn/Aringill\n
group of zones.  I think next I'd like to add some objects to\n
the zone to mark things better - like wagon ruts, for example.\n
\n
For my part, I've been cleaning up Caemlyn some - try it out.\n
I've added a quick navigation system on the ubermap so you can\n
teleport to any finished city by typing "goto <city name>".\n
If you type 'goto caemlyn', you teleport to a marker 'above'\n
the city zone, in a room labeled 'Ethereal Caemlyn'.  If you\n
go in any cardinal direction from there, you enter the actual\n
world at the respective gate of Caemlyn (w,n,e, or s gate).\n
I'm gonna do this for all the cities we port over.\n
\n
If you guys have any ideas or projects you'd like to do, please\n
let me and Syrah know.  I personally am interested in adding\n
a thieves guild entrance for the Caemlyn Black Lions.  Also,\n
Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map\n
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into\n
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in\n
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there\n
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when\n
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the\n
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the\n
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys\n
think?\n
\n
-Nic\n
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug\n
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files\n
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!\n

Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map\n
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into\n
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in\n
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there\n
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when\n
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the\n
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the\n
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys\n
think?\n
\n
-Nic\n
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug\n
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files\n
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan  7 22:54:13 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BD Update
\n`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Builders Dept
\n\n
This is for the builders and staff.\n
\n
I'm dazzled by how much everybody's getting done.  Phaedra\n
just finished the last of the zone 639 descriptions, and\n
everybody's putting a lot of work into the whole Caemlyn/Aringill\n
group of zones.  I think next I'd like to add some objects to\n
the zone to mark things better - like wagon ruts, for example.\n
\n
For my part, I've been cleaning up Caemlyn some - try it out.\n
I've added a quick navigation system on the ubermap so you can\n
teleport to any finished city by typing "goto <city name>".\n
If you type 'goto caemlyn', you teleport to a marker 'above'\n
the city zone, in a room labeled 'Ethereal Caemlyn'.  If you\n
go in any cardinal direction from there, you enter the actual\n
world at the respective gate of Caemlyn (w,n,e, or s gate).\n
I'm gonna do this for all the cities we port over.\n
\n
If you guys have any ideas or projects you'd like to do, please\n
let me and Syrah know.  I personally am interested in adding\n
a thieves guild entrance for the Caemlyn Black Lions.  Also,\n
Ranulf showed me a neat way to place small towns on the map\n
by using enterable objects, that basically act like gates into\n
other rooms.  We could note a farmhouse or a small village in\n
the description of a room, and place an enterable object there\n
called 'A farmhouse' or 'A town gate' or something, and when\n
you enter it, you enter a large group of rooms that makes the\n
whole town or whatever - but it only takes up one room on the\n
ubermap, so the scale remains correct. :> What do you guys\n
think?\n
\n
-Nic\n
P.S.  Remember to save often, especially with our current bug\n
problems on the main port.  Type 'olc' and save all the files\n
listed there periodically, or they'll be lost if we crash!\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Jan  9 20:10:22 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Xephius
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Merchants application

\nHello, I'm writing to inform you of my interest in joining the Merchants. Xephius is a young man (basically to cover for my newness to this mud) from the Baerlorn originally.  He was sent by his father to obtain some goods that were increasingly hard to obtain locally due to the weather and the influx of refugees from Two Rivers.  He reaches Caemlyn, however, and slowly discovers that he has no desire to return to the farm life he grew up in and decides to become a peddler. \n

about out of ideas, short of just taking it home and coming\n
back here tomorrow.  Sorry!\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Feb 10 23:04:35 2004\n`7From`6:`7 Maeldrin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 IC Notification
\n(a note delivered by a muddied page bearing the colors of House Laucion)\n
\n
Lady Reesad,\n
\n
I regretfully write to inform you that young Lord Ceril has\n
been struck a grievous blow whilst in Lugard. A group of thieves\n
set upon him and his men as they were about to begin a carriage\n
ride that would return them to Caemlyn. Though most of the\n
scoundrals were killed, they managed to inflict dire wounds\n
upon Lord Ceril.\n
\n
I regret to inform you that he has died, only as recently as\n
I pen this letter, the <insert date here befitting travel>.\n
It is with a heavy heart that we return him to his House for\n
burial, a private affair open only to those of Houes Laucion.\n
\n
Melecus Draius,\n
Chamberlain of Lord Ceril Laucion\n
(sealed with black wax bearing the imprint of a wineglass strangled\n
by vines)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jan 25 09:03:03 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Vitor
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Vitor BG
\nVitor Belfour was born in a small village in the northern reaches\n
of Tear.  His father worked at a horse breeder's while his mother\n
tended the homestead.  From as soon as he was able, Vitor was\n
working alongside his father to help provide for his mother and\n
one sister.  Vitor was an intelligent child who early on expressed\n
a desire to learn and a gentle disposition, but his family could \n
not afford to provide him with more than a makeshift education.\n
He taught himself and his sister Aino to read from his father's\n
small collection of books.  He found that he had little interest\n
in fantastic stories, however, and only liked books about the\n
natural world or other lands.  His favorite was a book depicting\n
the various fish that could be found in the ocean of Tear, with\n
colored illustrations that he found at least as interesting as the\n
text.  When Aino was seventeen, she began suffering from\n
mysterious but violent bouts of illness.  She shook from fever and\n
chills intermittently for a few hours or a day, then was fine.\n
This lasted for several months, by the end of which his parents\n
were exchanging worried looks over Aino's head quite frequently.\n
The village wise woman came and spoke with Vitor's parents.  She\n
had seen such things before, and advised something the Belfours\n
were loathe to do - sending Aino north to Tar Valon, because she\n
could channel the One Power.  Not that the wise woman could, of\n
course, but she had seen the same pattern in several children\n
before.\n
The family was too poor to pay for an escort to take Aino \n
north, so it fell to Vitor to accompany her.  Their journey was \n
slow, and not easy, and often they hadn't the money to pay for a\n
square meal.  Vitor, however, had always trusted his luck, it saw\n
them through Far Madding, Caemlyn, and Tar Valon until Aino's name\n
was entered in the novice book.  Not wanting to linger around Aes\n
Sedai any longer than he must, Vitor bode his sister farewell and \n
began the journey home.  It was winter by then, and snow covered\n
the land around Tar Valon.  He made camp one day in a large, open \n
patch of snow surrounded by trees.  Little did he know it was a\n
frozen lake, the ice covered with a layer of new snowfall.  A\n
short time after lighting his fire, he heard the ice start to\n
crackle.  He scrambled for the treeline, but it was already too\n
late.  The ice gave way, plunging him into freezing water and\n
driving the breath from his lungs with a shock.  He flailed \n
upwards, and met a hard cold surface.  He had lost track of where\n
he was, under the ice.  Looking up he saw nothing but white in all\n
directions.  Panic set in, and desperation born of the knowledge\n
of certain death.  He beat at the ice above him, used every ounce\n
of strength in the lone breath he held in to try and break the\n
ice, all to no avail.  Conciousness was fading away, when\n
suddenly, without his striking it, the ice shattered.  Hope surged\n
in his heart - someone had come to help him!  He hauled himself\n
up, shivering, out of the water, and looked for his savior, but\n
there was nobody there.  Unease settled on him.  A thought\n
occured, but he pushed it away.\n
The next week passed without event as he slowly made his way\n
south, but his thoughts were filled with anxiety.  How had the ice\n
broken?  What did it mean?  Then the fever hit him.  Burning and\n
freezing in turns, he had to huddle for warmth and survival under\n
every blanket he had and build the fire as tall as he could.  In a\n
day, it had passed, leaving him weak but otherwise well.  It was\n
too like his sister's illness to be coincidence.  The thought that\n
had come to him right after he escaped the frozen lake solidified,\n
and it terrified him.  He knew what his fate was, now.  He had to\n
find out more about what was happening to him, and knew of only\n
one place where he might.  He rode to Caemlyn, to seek the Dragon\n
Reborn's amnesty.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jan 25 09:03:03 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Vitor

and one sister.  Vitor was an intelligent child who early on\n
expressed a desire to learn and a gentle disposition, but his\n
family could not afford to provide him with more than a makeshift\n
education.  He taught himself and his sister Aino to read from his\n
father's small collection of books.  He found that he had little \n
interest in fantastic stories, however, and only liked books about\n
the natural world or other lands.  His favorite was a book\n
depicting the various fish that could be found in the ocean of\n
Tear, with colored illustrations that he found at least as\n
interesting as the text.  When Aino was seventeen, she began \n
suffering from mysterious but violent bouts of illness.  She shook\n
from fever and chills intermittently for a few hours or a day,\n
then was fine.  This lasted for several months, by the end of\n
which his parents were exchanging worried looks over Aino's head \n
quite frequently.  The village wise woman came and spoke with\n
Vitor's parents.  She had seen such things before, and advised\n
something the Belfours were loathe to do - sending Aino north to\n
Tar Valon, because she could channel the One Power.  Not that the \n
wise woman could, of course, but she had seen the same pattern in\n
several children before.\n
The family was too poor to pay for an escort to take Aino \n
north, so it fell to Vitor to accompany her.  Their journey was\n
slow, and not easy, and often they hadn't the money to pay for a \n
square meal.  Vitor, however, had always trusted his luck, it saw\n
them through Far Madding, Caemlyn, and Tar Valon until Aino's name\n
was entered in the novice book.  Not wanting to linger around Aes\n
Sedai any longer than he must, Vitor bode his sister farewell and \n
began the journey home.  It was winter by then, and snow covered \n
the land around Tar Valon.  He made camp one day in a large, open\n
patch of snow surrounded by trees.  Little did he know it was a\n
frozen lake, the ice covered with a layer of new snowfall.  A\n
short time after lighting his fire, he heard the ice start to\n
crackle.  He scrambled for the treeline, but it was already too \n
late.  The ice gave way, plunging him into freezing water and\n
driving the breath from his lungs with a shock.  He flailed \n
upwards, and met a hard cold surface.  He had lost track of where \n
he was, under the ice.  Looking up he saw nothing but white in all\n
directions.  Panic set in, and desperation born of the knowledge\n
of certain death.  He beat at the ice above him, used every ounce\n
of strength in the lone breath he held in to try and break the\n
ice, all to no avail.  Conciousness was fading away, when \n
suddenly, without his striking it, the ice shattered.  Hope surged\n
in his heart - someone had come to help him!  He hauled himsel\n
up, shivering, out of the water, and looked for his savior, but\n
there was nobody there.  Unease settled on him.  A thought \n
occured, but he pushed it away.\n
The next week passed without event as he slowly made his way\n
south, but his thoughts were filled with anxiety.  How had the ice\n
broken?  What did it mean?  Then the fever hit him.  Burning and \n
freezing in turns, he had to huddle for warmth and survival under\n
every blanket he had and build the fire as tall as he could.  In a\n
day, it had passed, leaving him weak but otherwise well.  It was \n
too like his sister's illness to be coincidence.  The thought that\n
had come to him right after he escaped the frozen lake solidified,\n
and it terrified him.  He knew what his fate was, now.  He had to \n
find out more about what was happening to him, and knew of only\n
one place where he might.  He rode to Caemlyn, to seek the Dragon \n
Reborn's amnesty.  \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan 28 10:19:12 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BP update
\n`7CC`6: `7Syrah Duren Varulv Beonca
\n\n
Maelyn expects to have the final version (I already approved it) of TV posted\n
by Sunday at the latest, and as soon as it is I'm putting several of the\n
builders on it to construct it, minus descs.  As soon as it's built, we're\n
going to insert it where it belongs on the ubermap.  They can continue\n
to add descs at their leisure, but this way the city will at least be\n
functional.\n
\n
I ported over Alindaer and did most of the required renovations (it was\n
built sideways, courtesy Mikki, who can't read a map).  I'm gonna hook\n
it, Tar Valon, and the bridges up over the Erinin at the same time,\n
but Alindaer at least is pretty much good to go, minus some prettying\n
up.\n
\n
Syrah, I realized that I didn't port over your Cairhien zones yet, so I\n
sat down last night and set that up, but I think (hope) I left the files at\n
hope cuz otherwise I lost them somewhere and they're very gone.\n
Next chance I get, I'll port them over correctly and you can do whatever\n
you want to them.\n
\n
Big picture: These are the major cities that I care about.  Beyond\n
these, it just comes down to some zones that players particularly\n
want and use.  Most of those can be added later.  Once we get the\n
major ones in and done, I'm going to start looking at porting over\n
the ubermap.\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker BG and Desc

\nTristan was born eighteen summers ago on a small farm outside Four Kings.  His father was a distant older man, but his mother a kind young woman, married to his father through an arrangement made by her peasant parents.  His father abused his young wife horribly, cursing her for a witch each time his paltry crop failed to grow or their only child failed to grow strongly enough.\n
\n

When Tristan was seven, his mother began a love affair with one of the two young stablehands that worked their farm.  She hungered for the love of a man who treated her well, and the two plotted to murder Tristan's father.  Unfortunately, their plans came for naught when the older man discovered them amking love when he returned early from a trip into Four Kings.\n
\n

He murdered them both, slitting the farmhand's throat and beating his wife to death.  Tristan ran to the sound of his mother screaming as she was bludgeoned to death and cried as he watched her pass from this world at the hands of his maniac father.  In a rage, he turned on his young son, whipping him with his belt buckle.  The thrashing was so intense that at one point, the spike on the buckle sliced open the boy's left eye, leaving a long, thin scar from his forehead to the bottom of his cheek.  Not wanting anyone to know how it happened, Tristan's father left him to heal without assistance.  For half a year he was blind.  when he had blessedly regained his sight, his left eye had been drained of the brilliant hazel color of his right, and had turned a cold, pale blue.\n
\n

After that, his father trusted no one, forbade Tristan to mention his mother, and began drinking excessively.  For the next ten years, Tristan worked hard at the farm and rarely spoke.  When his father's drinking got too out of hand, he would beat the boy senseless with anything he could lay his gnarled hands on.  As Tristan grew to manhood, the beatings grew more frequent and more brutal.  The boy learned quickly never to speak, and over time he forgot his mother's name.  His father, when he spoke to him, he simply called 'Sir'.\n
\n

Finally about three months ago, Tristan, now grown to be a slightly emaciated but well-built young man driven half-mad with rage, anger, and ressentment, exacted his final revenge.  No longer content to wish for release from this endless nightmare through accident, he began to feel very heady and invinsible and decided on the spur of the moment to take matters into his own hands.  After a heavy night of drinking, his father, having exhausted himself hitting his only child with his fists, lay sprawled in the only chair near the fire.  Tristan retrieved some rope from the shed, tied his father tied and scattered firewood and oil throughout the room.\n
\n

He left his father there, unconscious, as he threw what few things he had in a rough satchel.  Having taken everything he could - which was not much - the young man went back downstairs, punched his helpless father awake and spit in his face.  As the man tried to rise, Tristan sneered at him, his head swimming, and stepped casually to the door, cursing his father in his soft, unused voice.  His mismatched eyes looked cold death into his father's face as he picked up the oil lamp from the stand by the door and gave it a casual toss to the floor in front of the chair.\n
\n

Turning as the fire spread out, Tristan walked to the end of the path leading to the door without looking back.  When the screams of his father being immolated reached his ears, he started to laugh and cry simultaneously, completely heedless of his own emotional reaction.  He walked aimlessly through the countryside for some time before making his way almost two weeks later to Four Kings itself.  There he remained mostly unnoticed and stole what he could to eat or to replenish his ratty clothing.  Hearing rumors of the Dragon's army of male channelers outside Caemlyn, Tristan decided that he would see if he could harness his newfound freedom and power by learning to channel.\n
\n

He set out straightaway and has been looking for the opportunity to find one of these fabled black-coated menaces.  He saw several on his arrival in Caemlyn, but always found that his unpracticed voice would be inadequate when dealing with the men, and his learned cowardice would always get the better of him before he could make himself speak to one.  He is slowly building up the mental and emotional strength to ask to be tested, accepted, taught, and one day soon, he will have it.\n
\n
Desc:\n

`8Tristan stands at an unremarkable 5'6", made to seem shorter by his constant slouch.  This is not so much an issue of bad posture, but a seemingly inherent and intentional withdrawal from the humanity around him.  His hair is a `3d`7a`3rk b`7l`3on`7d`3e`8, bordering on `3mou`7s`3y br`7o`3wn`8, and is equally unremarkable.  His shoulders are decently broad and his torso tapered, though perhaps a tad too much.  He looks like a typical farm boy\n
who has missed a few too many meals.\n

The only exception is his eyes.  His right eye is a `&briliant`8 and sparkling `3h`2a`7z`2e`3l`8 color, framed by eyelashes most women would kill for. His left, while also framed by long lashes, is the cold, `6p`^a`&l`7e b`&l`^u`6e`8 of an ice sculpture.  A long, thin `&s`7c`1a`7r`8 stretches from his forehead just above the center of that eye to the bottom of his strong cheekbone. The eyebrow that tops his left eye is sliced neatly in half by this `&s`7c`1a`7r`8, the center lacking the ability to grow hair.\n
\n

He is dressed in ratty `3w`7o`8o`3l`8 clothes, suitable for a farm or stable, dirty and obviously not cut for him.  His shoes seem to be oversized as well, though more well-made than his other clothing should allow for.  On his back is slung a small, rough satchel.  He holds\n
tight to the straps as if everything he owns is contained within.  By the looks of him, that might actually be the case.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 29 22:05:27 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Beonca
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Plot ideas etc etc etc
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Nenae Bethany Varulv
\n\n
Bowl of Winds\n
Handed out to Elayne, though Melinda has expressed interest in wanting to help finish\n
it since her character is highly involved. The Bowl has been found and brought back\n
to Caemlyn so now all that has to be done is RP of Elayne figuring out a way to work\n
the Bowl, then the actual working of the Bowl.\n
\n
Plant Beast/Age of Legends\n
I haven't offically handed it out, but both Rand and Elayne have been ICly looking\n
into it. Elayne has been speaking to the Wise Ones about getting thier aide in channeling\n
to get rid of this beast. Speak to her find out what she is planning. Rand has been\n
told by the Wise Ones about this Plant beast, so he wants to go and see this site,\n
so he'll probably want to be involved with it too. Shai'tan has the details on the\n
Plant Beast, but I'm mailing Bethany the specifics that should be known about this Plant\n
so that she can pass out the job to someone to finish for her. Very likely Shai'tan could\n
very easily finish running this quest, she saw the first one and helped with it, so she\n
has a very good idea of what is going on with it. It mainly just needs finished, and\n
whatever we wish to reward the people who investigate the ruins with needs to be\n
handed out. *glow stones etc etc btw we owe two working and two broke glow stones to the\n
Black Tower* *I'm leaving a note here that whoever runs this quest, that Kaevan *part \n
of the Black Lions* was ICly asked to get a power wrought dagger, so if he joins in the\n
quest can I request that someone give him a chance to obtain one of these.*\n
\n
Black Lions\n
This I handed out to Nenae since I originally got the idea from her, plus she is also\n
the GL of the Thieves Guild, with this quest I hoped to get more thieves as well. The \n
idea is that the black Lions which are viewed sort of like the mafia, have been paying \n
off the Queen's Guard to look the other way with all of the crimes that they pull. Now \n
the Black Lions are usually part of the larger deals though, hired out assassins, \n
kidnappings, if they steal it is usually a large job, like stealing from a nobles house.\n
Anyway the line of RP that I have been doing lately is that the Black Lions have been\n
offering out protection to local merchants and innkeeps, which means that more and more\n
merchants are winding up dead as they can't pay the demands of the Black Lions to protect\n
thier businesses. Now with this line of RP it has gotten Kheldon's attention so he has\n
been seeking out information on this very feared and hush hush group. So likely there will\n
be atempts on his life etc etc, Kheldon has now gotten Elayne involved who has given\n
him an IC force to aide him in rooting out these Black Lions members.\n
\n
Wise One stuff\n
Basically I have a hundred and one ideas here...but the most important that I am\n
worried about it getting Amra her lessons getting her rings and spire RP as well\n
as her Dreaming lessons ICly and OoCly teaching her skills. I want to see her raised\n
soon. As well I want to see Mandi have her lessons RPed out too. She has become a Wise\n
One Apprentice, and is to be sister bonded to Janae, with Anastasia as thier mother.\n
Mandi also needs to be taken though the rings. Mandi is allowed two days for Rhuidean\n
Rand has agreed to gate whoever takes her back and forth, and she is allowed to be taught\n
from whenever we summon her, till Noon, only thing is that she has to be -in- the Black\n
tower by Noon. The Wise ones ahve agreed to -try- and teach her how to channel without\n
hand gestures, very hard thing to do, so she must relearn how to channel everything, it\n
will take much much work for her to learn this ability, in return Mandi ahs agreed to \n
teach the Wise Ones things she learned in the Tower. \n
\n
Egwene Stuff\n
Ugh I could go on forever with this. Bascially Caemlyn and Cairhien are pretty\n
firmly behind Egwene. The Black Tower *Kinje* has met with Egwene to discuss\n
an alliance, Egwene thinks its a good idea, thoguh she left Kinje with no promises\n
as she did not like Gavriela Sedai one bit, especialy when the woman outright tried\n
to tell her what to do. kinje has expressed that for Egwene to get aide from the Black\n
Tower, she will most likely have to give the Male ter'angreals etc in the White Tower\n
to the Black Tower, Egwene said that she'd think on it and get back to him, though in\n
her mind she is very pissed that Kinje brought such a mouthy White Tower Sedai with him,\n
and being a stuborn Two Rivers girl in her mind doesn't want to make a deal with the Black\n
Tower when Kinje looked like a tool of Gavriela's. So she's going over kinje's head to\n
speak to Rand about this 'allinace' thing that is being spoken of, and to perhaps tactfully\n
tell Rand that she was 'threatened' by the Tower. Analinde has signed the Rebel book, and\n
is to be raised to the White Ajah once her lessons are done being taught by Nadia. *I'm\n
mailing Maelyn about this to be handled* Analinde is concerned about taking the oaths,\n
Egwene has expressed that there maybe a way that Analinde can be Aes Sedai, *or have\n
her training completed anyway* and not have to take the Oats, but Egwene hasn't promised\n
that fully yet.\n
\n
As far as everything else goes...I can't remember any other major plots that\n
I was involved with/was planning. Uhhh... last words...Try to have fun, no point\n
in being here if it isn't fun. I most certainly enjoyed my time here has an immortal\n
and Implementor, however brief. I promise to try and come back and visit at least\n
once, I'll miss you all, you've all been wonderful to me. Wish me luck!\n
\n
Bai\n
Airman Recruit\n
Kristen\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jan 29 22:05:27 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Beonca
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Plot ideas etc etc etc
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Nenae Bethany Varulv
\n\n
Bowl of Winds\n
Handed out to Elayne, though Melinda has expressed interest in wanting to help finish\n
it since her character is highly involved. The Bowl has been found and brought back\n
to Caemlyn so now all that has to be done is RP of Elayne figuring out a way to work\n
the Bowl, then the actual working of the Bowl.\n
\n
Plant Beast/Age of Legends\n
I haven't offically handed it out, but both Rand and Elayne have been ICly looking\n
into it. Elayne has been speaking to the Wise Ones about getting thier aide in channeling\n
to get rid of this beast. Speak to her find out what she is planning. Rand has been\n
told by the Wise Ones about this Plant beast, so he wants to go and see this site,\n
so he'll probably want to be involved with it too. Shai'tan has the details on the\n
Plant Beast, but I'm mailing Bethany the specifics that should be known about this Plant\n
so that she can pass out the job to someone to finish for her. Very likely Shai'tan could\n
very easily finish running this quest, she saw the first one and helped with it, so she\n
has a very good idea of what is going on with it. It mainly just needs finished, and\n
whatever we wish to reward the people who investigate the ruins with needs to be\n
handed out. *glow stones etc etc btw we owe two working and two broke glow stones to the\n
Black Tower* *I'm leaving a note here that whoever runs this quest, that Kaevan *part \n
of the Black Lions* was ICly asked to get a power wrought dagger, so if he joins in the\n
quest can I request that someone give him a chance to obtain one of these.*\n
\n
Black Lions\n
This I handed out to Nenae since I originally got the idea from her, plus she is also\n
the GL of the Thieves Guild, with this quest I hoped to get more thieves as well. The \n
idea is that the black Lions which are viewed sort of like the mafia, have been paying \n
off the Queen's Guard to look the other way with all of the crimes that they pull. Now \n
the Black Lions are usually part of the larger deals though, hired out assassins, \n
kidnappings, if they steal it is usually a large job, like stealing from a nobles house.\n
Anyway the line of RP that I have been doing lately is that the Black Lions have been\n
offering out protection to local merchants and innkeeps, which means that more and more\n
merchants are winding up dead as they can't pay the demands of the Black Lions to protect\n
thier businesses. Now with this line of RP it has gotten Kheldon's attention so he has\n
been seeking out information on this very feared and hush hush group. So likely there will\n
be atempts on his life etc etc, Kheldon has now gotten Elayne involved who has given\n
him an IC force to aide him in rooting out these Black Lions members.\n
\n
Wise One stuff\n
Basically I have a hundred and one ideas here...but the most important that I am\n
worried about it getting Amra her lessons getting her rings and spire RP as well\n
as her Dreaming lessons ICly and OoCly teaching her skills. I want to see her raised\n

tower by Noon. The Wise ones ahve agreed to -try- and teach her how to channel without\n
hand gestures, very hard thing to do, so she must relearn how to channel everything, it\n
will take much much work for her to learn this ability, in return Mandi ahs agreed to \n
teach the Wise Ones things she learned in the Tower. \n
\n
Egwene Stuff\n
Ugh I could go on forever with this. Bascially Caemlyn and Cairhien are pretty\n
firmly behind Egwene. The Black Tower *Kinje* has met with Egwene to discuss\n
an alliance, Egwene thinks its a good idea, thoguh she left Kinje with no promises\n

to tell her what to do. kinje has expressed that for Egwene to get aide from the Black\n
Tower, she will most likely have to give the Male ter'angreals etc in the White Tower\n
to the Black Tower, Egwene said that she'd think on it and get back to him, though in\n

\n
As far as everything else goes...I can't remember any other major plots that\n
I was involved with/was planning. Uhhh... last words...Try to have fun, no point\n
in being here if it isn't fun. I most certainly enjoyed my time here has an immortal\n

once, I'll miss you all, you've all been wonderful to me. Wish me luck!\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  7 10:42:20 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Tarin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Cairhien - Part II
\nMessage 56 : Thu Aug 20 (Justarius)  :: Cairhien update\n
*to all those intersted and keeping an eye on the city*\n
Within the past 3 days, King Justarius has made many issues to his\n
public and to his city, all which seem for the best.\n
He has repelled the high taxation rate on the lower classes, restricting\n
it from the high standers which it had rested so long. He has\n
also compelled the serfs and independent farmers back to the fields\n
under pain of mutiliation and death to provide food for the city\n
for the coming year. It is rumored that they may not have to depend\n
on Tear to get through the next winter.\n
He has also moved the seat of power to his own Damodred estates,\n
while the Sun Court is being rebuilt after the seige done to it.\n
It is unknown if he will rule from the Sun Throne, or from his\n
own private estates.\n
Many new buildings have begun construction since the last hours\n
of the War. Most look like large scale housing projects, intending\n
to hold many people at the same time. As there is no visible flux\n
in the population, there is much speculation as to what the large\n
buildings are for.\n
Mercanaries are on call to the city, as the King is paying well\n
for thier services. The current rate for a man of war is an astonishing\n
5 golden marks a day. The mercanaries are compelled into a 5 year\n
service for such an astounding fee, and are given the option of\n
joining the Royal Guard and to be natrualized if they so wish. It\n
is also unknown why all these warriors are pouring into the city.\n
*the local news/rumor man*\n
Message 57 : Thu Aug 20 (####)      :: *scrawled in the margins around the `#Royal `*Decree `@from `#Cairhien`7*\n
*written in smooth, flowing script*\n
Who shall remember the rise of the sun?\n
Who shall remember the fabled towers,\n
topless in the clouds?\n
Shall we walk the streets of Al'cair'rahienallen?\n
We shall hear laughter no more.\n
Mourn all, for the fall of the flame of the sun,\n
mourn for the Flame, violently extinguished.\n
Who shall remember their great Library?\n
Who shall tell tale of their Feast of the Lights,\n
now the sun has set.\n
Shall we make our way  through the homes of the foregate?\n
We shall hear only their tears.\n
Mourn all, for the sun has set on Cairhien\n
mourn for the last Flame of the Rising Sun.\n
Who shall remember usurper's assault?\n
Who shall tell tale of the valiant defense?\n
the battle is lost.\n
Shall we remember the defender's sacrifice?\n
His Right, the Sun Throne, destroyed\n
Mourn all, but recall the last Flame of the Sun\n
mourn though he denied the murd'rer his throne\n
All remember the usurper's cousin,\n
Who among us can forget Laman's Pride?\n
darkness comes once more.\n
Shall we sit again, watch, let pride destroy again?\n
We shall hear our cries once more.\n
Mourn all, for the darkness upon Cairhien,\n
mourn, and pray, for the coming of the light\n
pray, for the coming of the light\n
*unsigned*\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  7 10:42:20 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Tarin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Cairhien - Part II
\nMessage 56 : Thu Aug 20 (Justarius)  :: Cairhien update\n
*to all those intersted and keeping an eye on the city*\n
Within the past 3 days, King Justarius has made many issues to his\n
public and to his city, all which seem for the best.\n
He has repelled the high taxation rate on the lower classes, restricting\n
it from the high standers which it had rested so long. He has\n
also compelled the serfs and independent farmers back to the fields\n
under pain of mutiliation and death to provide food for the city\n
for the coming year. It is rumored that they may not have to depend\n
on Tear to get through the next winter.\n
He has also moved the seat of power to his own Damodred estates,\n
while the Sun Court is being rebuilt after the seige done to it.\n
It is unknown if he will rule from the Sun Throne, or from his\n
own private estates.\n
Many new buildings have begun construction since the last hours\n
of the War. Most look like large scale housing projects, intending\n
to hold many people at the same time. As there is no visible flux\n
in the population, there is much speculation as to what the large\n
buildings are for.\n
Mercanaries are on call to the city, as the King is paying well\n
for thier services. The current rate for a man of war is an astonishing\n
5 golden marks a day. The mercanaries are compelled into a 5 year\n
service for such an astounding fee, and are given the option of\n
joining the Royal Guard and to be natrualized if they so wish. It\n
is also unknown why all these warriors are pouring into the city.\n
*the local news/rumor man*\n

Mourn all, for the sun has set on Cairhien\n

Who shall remember usurper's assault?\n
Who shall tell tale of the valiant defense?\n
the battle is lost.\n
Shall we remember the defender's sacrifice?\n
His Right, the Sun Throne, destroyed\n
Mourn all, but recall the last Flame of the Sun\n
mourn though he denied the murd'rer his throne\n
All remember the usurper's cousin,\n
Who among us can forget Laman's Pride?\n
darkness comes once more.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  7 11:44:16 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Map
\nHey, got back in town and I downloaded your picture so I can look\n
at it on a computer with an actual program that will open it :p The\n
graphics stuff is all disabled in the labs still - dunno why.  Why'd\n
you have to downsize it, though? I sent you a mail saying the\n
overflow can go into the third zone.  Did you not want to do that?\n
\n
-Nic\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  7 19:09:04 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Maelyn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Map
\nWell, you said you wanted the third zone to be for the inns, \n
shops, grove, etc. When I adjusted the map the first time I \n
inadvertently made it 202 rooms for the roads and guard towers\n
instead of the 200 rooms we had orginally counted. So I\n
readjusted a part of one wall to bring it back to 200, so\n
it would fit into the two zones we were going to use for that\n
purpose. It really didn't change the look of the island much.\n
\n
Is the numbering ok? I wasn't sure how best to do it, so I just\n
numbered the rooms in a way that made sense to me. But I learned\n
many years ago that 'sense to Vicki' often means total\n
chaos to other people.  :)\n
\n
Mae\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  7 19:09:04 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Maelyn

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 10 10:42:04 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 TV
\nOk, looks good and we're good to go.  It's your city so you're in\n
charge of coordinating the descripting efforts of anybody you\n
can get to help - I'd ask Nenae, Phaedra and Quinlan for\n
starters - they've all worked on the ubermap - and maybe\n
Bethany as well (she's been bored during the day).  Here's\n
where we're at:\n
\n
I constructed all of zone 90 and 91 (all numbered rooms on\n
your map) - the city should be fully working except for the\n
missing tower and the missing descs.  It's connected to\n
the bridges, which connect to the ubermap.  I also redid\n
Alindaer (a half assed job but it's ok), and imported it as\n
well - the bridge to Alindaer connects to your city like it\n
should.  The other bridges just pop out at the squares on\n
the ubermap where the towns would go (see the website:)\n
`^http://www.engr.umd.edu/ maeillo/index2.htm`7  and\n
`^http://www.engr.umd.edu/ maeillo/TV_city2_feb_7.bmp`7\n
\n
Please come up with a color scheme for the city, and use it\n
in the title of the red rooms on your map.  Like `3T`#a`2r V`2a`#lo`3n`7\n
or something, but pretty :p All the cities have all their gates\n
marked that way, and each city has its own color scheme.\n
Lemme know what it is, cuz we'll have references to it outside\n
the city, as well.  Up to you what colors you want :>\n
\n
If you find any mistakes, lemme know.  I may have to do some\n
additional pfile setting for everybody to be able to edit the city,\n
but I can't remember everybody's BP names offhand so just\n
let me know or get another imm to set you.  I can do it offline\n
if you send me a list of names, too.\n
\n
There is one mistake that I fixed - but just so you know, the way\n
it's built right now is correct, so don't change it :p On your map,\n
there are two adjacent rooms numbered 9084 - the one of the\n
right is now 9011, since there is no 9011 anywhere else.  There\n
is another 9085 tho, so I kept it where it was and just recycled\n
9011.  It should be right.\n
\n
I adjusted the 'goto tv' and 'goto al' (alindaer) markers.  Alindaer\n
works exactly like caemlyn's does, and tv just pops you out at\n
in the yellow squares on your map.\n
\n
Besides just the city itself, the river around the city also needs\n
to be descripted, as do the bridges and the one-room villages\n
around the city.  They can stay one room for now, but they do\n
need a desc and the name from the books.\n
\n
You can do all new descs if you so desire, but you can also\n
pirate some of the current TV ones if you like.  Ranulf mentioned\n
the Silver Swan (never looked at it), but it'd be cool if you could\n
reconstruct it as one of the inns as well, since there's a couple\n
people that RP there on the main port.  Also, start deciding how\n
to use the white tower - if you want to just slap it as is in the\n
middle of the city, or if we need to adjust it, or what.  It's your\n
guild area and your call what you want to do with it.\n
\n
Umm.  I think that's it.  I'll be around off and on for large chunks\n
of time to help, but mailing me is fastest.  Feel free to beep me\n
if you guys need anything. :> Have fun, and thanks :)\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb 16 15:00:45 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Christa
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Hunter of the Horn
\nStupid Mud mail. Sorry, i've had a bit of trouble sending this so I don't know what you recieved.\n
\n
You glance around your gaze falling upon her, her ice blue eyes shimmering softly.\n
On the right side of her beautiful face there appears to be an odd red design painted \n
on, covering most of it. Her long dark brown hair hangs down her back in an intricate\n
braid that reaches slightly past her waist. She wears a tight black coat embroidered \n
in silver. Under the coat she wears a loose white blouse tucked into her tight fitting \n
black leather pants.  Her black boots come up over her pant legs and end just\n
below her kness. A black leather strap trimmed in silver hangs over her shoulder \n
and across her chest. The strap connects to a long slightly curved black leather \n
scabbard trimmed in silver, on her back. A foot long hilt extends from the scabbard\n
up over her shoulder, the hilt and cross guard are wrapped in black leather strips. \n
Well crafted silver work can be seen from beneath the leather strips, on the pommel, \n
and over the cross guard. On her right forearm is a black steel parrying bracer also\n
wrapped in black leather strips with a small bit of silver work showing inbetween the\n
strips. Worn on the ring finger of her right hand is an odd ring of silver which appears\n
to be a dozen serpents entwined together with small emeralds inset for their eyes,\n
\n
Christa was born into house Damodred about twenty years ago. Her father was a \n
minor noble of the house and her mother was a noble of a smaller house, House Kaer. \n
She grew up with two older brothers a three or four off from her own age. Her mother \n
died from natural causes during child birth with her. Having no real female role-model \n
she turned out to be a tom boy. Her nurse tried her best to keep her in dresses and \n
teach her the things she would need to be a lady in Cairhien. She excelled in her \n
studies be it history, court intrigue, or anything else. Only having to be shown or told \n
something once she would remember it without any problem. As a child she was found \n
more often out playing with her brothers and the other boys well they practice the sword, \n
which is where she learned what skill she has, then with anyone her own age or sex. \n
Often causing trouble or playing pranks, she was a mischievious child. At about the age \n
of eighteen her father arranged for her to marry. In secret she hired a blacksmith to make \n
her the sword and bracer she now carries and a silver smith to do the silver work on bracer \n
and sword. After the completion she gathered a few belongings, changes of clothes and \n
her mothers ring, and some coin. She ran away to become a Hunter for the Horn. Traveling \n
to Illian to take the oaths. She reached Illian in time to take the oaths using her mothers \n
maiden name she traveled far and wide searching for the horn to no avail ending up in the \n
Two Rivers area during the time when the Trollocs attacked(the second time). She came \n
across a lone trolloc who attacked her. She was saved when a young Two Rivers boy put \n
an arrow through the beast. Realizing her own in-ability to protect her self she set off for the \n
Tower in Tar Valon to learn from the warders. Her only goal, next to that of finding the Horn, \n
to become a blade master.\n
going on at the time. Some I would like to try to reestablish even with the lack of the players \n
from then. She was a distinguished Hunter for the Horn and had recieved training from two \n
warders/blade masters from the tower. One was the Aiel blade master Tarkan(sp?). The other \n
I can no longer remember his name after so long. She had also been inducted into the \n
Companions of Illian by Lord Brend/Sammael himself unknowing that he was one of the \n
forsaken. She had considerable training from the two warders in emote fighting. As well as I \n
have had years of experience emote fighting before even coming to A Moment in Tyme on \n
Prodigy's RP chat. If you need any other information just e-mail me back I will do what I can. \n
The background is fairly rough I wrote it in about a half an hour so it may need a little work.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 24 19:08:56 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Gleebook
\n`7CC`6: `7Duren Ranulf
\n\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Mar 25 18:58:51 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Lenore
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Accepted test - Hopes and Fears
\n`7CC`6: `7Maelyn Anya
\n\n
`&Past`7\n
\n

Lenore's fondest hopes of her past consisted of the pure and simple dreams of all happy, healthy young women.  She wanted to grow to be as beautiful as her mother and marry a man as wonderful as her father.  Despite, or maybe because of, the fact that she lived in Tar Valon, Lenore never entertained notions of becoming anything other than a happy, healthy wife and mother.\n
\n
Her greatest fears were the opposite.  That she would be stuck forever alone and unloved, that her family would grow apart and she would be forgotten.\n
\n
`&Present`7\n
\n

Lenore now hopes to excel at her Light-given calling.  Having been first influenced by a Grey, and having spent most of her adolescence mediating familial disputes, she hopes to attain the ring and be accepted into a path of study that will lead her toward the Grey Ajah.\n
\n

Her greatest fears now reside in that part of her mind that still tells her she is in the wrong place, that she does not belong in the Tower among the most powerful women in the world.  She takes every step forward frightened to her toes of taking a wrong move, of wasting her potential by burning herself out or killing herself.  The Power scares her in a way nothing else does and her burgeoning skill is balanced heavily by her bone-chilling fear of the consequences of failure.\n
\n
`&Future`7\n
\n

Her dream for the future builds on her present wishes in that she hopes to not only be accepted by the Grey Ajah, but to become a force of true bridge building, someone who can forge alliances and prepare the world for the storm of Tarmon Gai'don.  Only a small part of her hopes that her name will be remembered as having helped solder the world in preparation for its sundering.  Mostly, she dreams only of being a guiding light in the reinforcement of the societies of the world as the end nears.\n
\n

Her deepest fear for the future lies not in the failure to reach her goals, but rests solely in the body of the army of the Dragon Reborn - the Asha'man.  Of course the rumors of the Aes Sedai killed in Caemlyn has been circulated hundreds of times now through the Tower, and she finds herself embroiled in nightmares of coming face to face with an army of mad male channelers who will pause in their quest to break the world again just long enough to break her first.\n
\n
`#If you need anything else, let me know!!  Thanks!`7\n
\n
Lenore\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar 27 08:44:52 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Narsil
\n`7Subj`6:`7 WoW!

\nWell, WoW owns the remnants of my social life, so take that as a review. *grin* It's really good, aimed for the casual player, although it has a lot of depth as well. Lots of very different characters, vast world, well done fighting system, balanced classes (after the last patch, at least).\n
\n

I play on lots of places, but lately I really enjoy the Scarlet Crusade server - basically, it's a RP server. Yeah. I know. But they try - in fact, they can be more elitist at times since there are that many more morons and 1337 kids around, so people who can type and spell at once get all defensive about it. :p I have Horde alts there, although on RP servers you can have characters on both factions (unlike PvP servers, where you are restricted to one side only).\n
\n

PvP is also fun. I like the tension of walking in some forest and never knowing when some idiot 23887 levels higher will attack and destroy you. Woo! :p They are also making Battlegrounds for (probably) the next patch, which is like a purely PvP zone with capture the flag, etc events that can land you bonuses and special eq and the such.\n
\n

That's all! As for school, hmm. I wish I could go back to one. But a) it tends to not pay :p and b) I haaaate exams. Actually, I taught for a while, but man that's hard! You can't slack off, these people are WATCHING you, hungry, waiting to pounce, eager to see you make a mistake. It's scary. :(\n
\n
Me!\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Mar 28 06:51:03 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Narsil
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Damn subjects! Me hates them!
\nWell, depends on the character. Basically, it's a game aimed at casual players - two months\n

at the most and you can easily cap out at lvl 60 if you play just one class. If you are like me, and you get a new alt every time you see something you like (oooh! he can shoot pretty lights!!11) then you might take a bit more. :)\n
\n

The whole thing is getting what you want. At first I loved PvP, but you tend to get somewhat lower average IQs surrounding you. :p However there is a bigger thrill in everything, since after the newbie zones every time you walk around you can be attacked on sight. I kinda like RP servers also, because then when you _are_ level 60, you still have something to do than run a top level dungeon for the 61th time trying to get a helmet that's gonna make you a little bit tougher.\n
\n

It's hack'n'slash, yeah. :p But there are also professions and stuff. Some are gathering, some are making (so they compliment each other), and some are just weird (like engineering, you can make bombs, etc - TERRORIST!!!11). The graphics are awesome, of course, and the style is quirky in WC fashion - I love Tauren, myself. Although when the roof is low all you can see is your own @$$!\n
\n
A TURTLE HEAD?! WHERE???//?\n
\n
Me.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar 31 12:54:11 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Tybalt
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Tybalt's Background
\nTybalt is the son of a soldier and a merchant's daughter, and grew up learning sums and swords\n
equally.  His grandfather taught him how to ride the horses he sold, and his father and his many\n
friends taught the boy how to shoot an arrow straight, and to fight with a lance and the twin\n
swords of Arafel.  It was the time he spent with his grandfather's hostlers and drivers,\n
however, that influenced the boy's youth the most.  He grew up pulling pranks on or with them,\n
running errands, and cheating at cards.  As he grew older and seedier, his parents grew worried\n
about his habits, and his mother bought Lothair Mentelar's book, "The Way of the Light" for\n
the young man.  He read it, and gave every appearance of enjoying it.  In fact, from the day\n
he finished the book, he began declaring that he would leave for the Southlands as soon as\n
he was old enough, and join the Children of the Light.  Now, this development worried his\n
parents even more than his previous antics, and they began spoiling the boy, hoping to entice\n
him to stay in Arafel with them.  Instead, when he turned 17, he took everything they had\n
given him that was portable, stole weapons and a horse, and headed south.  He is currently\n
in Caemlyn, having spent all of his money thus far, and needing to make some more before moving\n
on to Amador.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n\n
Hey guys, I need to talk to you about the IC location of\n
the Black Tower.  We're placing everybody's guild areas\n
where they belong IC - the seafolk area is now a ship that\n
sails up the Erinin and into the ocean, the Aiel are getting\n
the waste back, etc.  How do you want to do your area, and\n
where do you want it? We can keep your existing guild area\n
and splice it into the map if you like, or we can modify it\n
or even make a new one if you prefer.  If you would, mail\n
me back with your preliminary thoughts and we'll discuss it\n
from there.  The ubermap is moving along pretty fast now and\n
I'm starting to anticipate bringing it over to the main port,\n
but I'd like to include all the major areas that belong in\n
this section now so it all goes live at the same time.\n
\n
Thanks! Hit me back.\n
Nic\n

Shadar Logoth, posted at:\n
`^http://www.lenncraft.co.uk/shadarlogoth.gif`7\n
\n
He showed it to me this afternoon, I liked it, so we went\n
ahead and built the whole thing (zones 48 and 49).  Yeah,\n
we're impulsive and efficient :p Anyway, the idea is that\n
it stresses streets since most of the buildings are collapsed\n
and all are abandoned - I've run through it quite a few times,\n
and it comes off a lot like the old SL but nicer.  He's gonna\n
have a few major buildings, and I'm gonna screw with\n
some mislinkings and enterable objects to create some\n
additional tricks.   Oh, and his builder is Aled.\n
\n
Think that's it for the moment.\n
-Nic\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Apr 26 14:08:02 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BP updates
\nHey, I've got Leara and I think it was Vivianne descripting the\n
countrysides now (Leara is doing the zone around TV,\n
Vivianne is doing the zone around Cairhien).  Also, Rasequin\n
made up a roadmap of what he thought we could do for\n
Shadar Logoth, posted at:\n
`^http://www.lenncraft.co.uk/shadarlogoth.gif`7\n
\n
He showed it to me this afternoon, I liked it, so we went\n
ahead and built the whole thing (zones 48 and 49).  Yeah,\n
we're impulsive and efficient :p Anyway, the idea is that\n
it stresses streets since most of the buildings are collapsed\n
and all are abandoned - I've run through it quite a few times,\n
and it comes off a lot like the old SL but nicer.  He's gonna\n
have a few major buildings, and I'm gonna screw with\n
some mislinkings and enterable objects to create some\n
additional tricks.   Oh, and his builder is Aled.\n
\n
Think that's it for the moment.\n
-Nic\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Apr 26 14:52:41 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 New Update
\nI went ahead and created the rooms for both tower\n
zones only - they've all been set to city, indoors,\n
of 10x10 room dimensions.  I went ahead and made\n
all 200 rooms for the two zones that way - obviously\n
some of the ones we'll have to switch to outdoors\n
but since I was aliasing it was easier to make them\n
all the same for now.\n
\n
I'm looking at the layout stuff you sent again - I\n
really like it, especially the grounds map (and the\n
bridge).  I'm still trying to decide how to map out\n
the ajah floors - I think I'm going to take that home\n
and work it out this evening.  I think when we said\n
we'd probably need to add a couple more hallway\n
rooms to those floors, we were right, but I can't\n
quite decide how many to add.  Anywho. :p\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7CC`6: `7Vivianne Leara
\n\n
Hey, couple of things - first of all I wanted to make sure\n
I've got your zones straight.  Leara, are you doing Tar\n
Valon? And Viv, you're doing Cairhien, is that right?\n
I set you both up the same weekend and couldn't\n
remember for certain :p At any rate, I noticed one of you's\n
been working on the Tar Valon zone already - thanks :>\n
I went ahead and hooked up the bridge over the river\n
in room 46875.  When you're on the road to either\n
the east or west, you walk over the bridge.  When\n
you're in the river, you swim through the river room\n
that is 'under' the bridge, heading north or south.\n
Lemme know if there're any problems :>\n
\n
Also, FYI, Rasequin and I started Shadar Logoth\n
today, and built all the streets, minus descs.\n
Syrah and I have all 200 rooms of the white\n
tower created, but not connected yet.\n
\n
-Nic\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Apr 28 18:56:55 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Lots of mails
\nYikes, ok, breaking it down:\n
Mail doesn't work on the BP - it can crash it if you try and\n
check your mail there, too, so be careful :p\n
\n
The bridge is right - it's vnum 4`^8`7618, not 46818.  Basically\n
the room in your zone is the river, and the other zone is where\n
the bridge itself is coming from.  They're spliced together.  I\n
need to give you authorization to edit the bridge zone, too.\n
\n
RP bonuses are done in game :>\n
\n
I agree with the river/road exits - there are long stretches\n
where I'm gonna purge exits along rivers.  I'll do that later\n
on though, since doing it now is just gonna make it harder\n
to cruise through the zone to error check.\n
\n
I like your color rooms - the Fields of Grass and Quaint\n
Farmland are real cool, and so's the Stand of Trees.\n
I found two typos and fixed 'em - mostly everything looks\n
really, really good.  Keep it up, and thanks :>\n
\n
-Nic\n

I dunno - do what ya think.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue May  3 22:13:30 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Tarin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Another Crazy Idea/Glee Guild Area
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Aust Nenae Tarin
\n\n
So... you had mentioned that something could be done to bring Glee into an IC area with the new overmap, and, well, after talking with Aust and Nenae we had an idea to run past you.\n

Loosely, the idea involves an Inn, tended by a retired glee, perhaps funded by some mythic NPC, off scene former court bard (thus supplying the legitimacy and OOC Guild ownership, as well as legal potential to keep the Inn in the guild should it be necessary).  The majority of the bar is like any other (upscale?) bar.  Common room, dining rooms, stage, private rooms, etc.  However, in the back are some dormitory spaces, reserved for Gleemen fallen on hard times, a seperate common room for them, perhaps one or two small spaces so that a tired glee can get away and hide from the world for a spell.  The guild areas are nothing fancy, nothing special.  Just what an old retired Gleeman who knows what the road is like can offer to his old friends and students.\n

Its also about the most we can sustain, ICly.  Lacking the glee base to fill the playhouse and run productions, we can't really justify the kind of IC organization necessary to have a large overblown structure, nor do we necessarily want to.  This is ICly the work of one or two individuals who've made a fair living for themselves, maybe earned a few favours, and now want to settle down and enjoy their older years - and maybe offer a helping hand to them as needs it.  They offer a resource, and have no authority over the gleefolk, save for what respect they are given for their age and experience, what thanks they are given for the cheap rooms they offer the patchcloaks, and what the fear of the cudgels of their bouncers confer.\n

Furthermore, Inns are already centers of RP.  An Inn where glees make a point of taking rooms and perhaps frequenting, an Inn where glees feel some sense of ownership... this has potential to further focus RP.\n

However, Caemlyn already has a surplus of inns, and more inns, even high detail inns, would be largely a waste of space.  The Queen's Blessing already often sits unused, forgotten.  Thus, rather than create a new inn, we thought it might be possible to take over an old inn, perhaps one which tends to suffer from accidents.  The Lion's Banner has been suggested, as it has never had any player owner, and is already large enough and spaced well enough, and, well, can be ICly destroyed enough to easily result in a change of title.  Some changes would need to be made, including a rename and cosmetic changes, as well as the construction of a cellar, probably finished.\n

Anyway, thats the basic idea.  It'd give us a small, low key, IC area, which, rather than drawing RP away from other areas on the MUD, might provide another focus point, most of which is fully accessible to all players.  I and the other glees would be happy to help with any desc work needed, though we'd request permission to make some moderately extensive use of extra descs (I'm going to have poems on the walls), locked doors, and perhaps a second vault room which could serve as a library such as you and I spoke of.  Unlike most guild areas this probably wouldn't involve private rooms for most of the characters.  If you can afford a private room, you rent one.  If we ever grow enough to legitimately need more, well... there is the theatre district, and a playhouse was coded for avilyn long ago that could be used.\n
Thats the basics.  I can explain more if you'd like, just drop a mudmail or a tell when next you see me on.\n
-tarin avrinson, Gleeman Provocateur/hopefully soon to be Beringil, Master Gleeman (ret.)\n

Some changes would need to be made, including a rename and cosmetic changes, as well as the construction of a cellar, probably finished.\n

Anyway, thats the basic idea.  It'd give us a small, low key, IC area, which, rather than drawing RP away from other areas on the MUD, might provide another focus point, most of which is fully accessible to all players.  I and the other glees would be happy to help with any desc work needed, though we'd request permission to make some moderately extensive use of extra descs (I'm going to have poems on the walls), locked doors, and perhaps a second vault room which could serve as a library such as you and I spoke of.  Unlike most guild areas this probably wouldn't involve private rooms for most of the characters.  If you can afford a private room, you rent one.  If we ever grow enough to legitimately need more, well... there is the theatre district, and a playhouse was coded for avilyn long ago that could be used.\n
Thats the basics.  I can explain more if you'd like, just drop a mudmail or a tell when next you see me on.\n
-tarin avrinson, Gleeman Provocateur/hopefully soon to be Beringil, Master Gleeman (ret.)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue May  3 22:13:30 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Tarin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Another Crazy Idea/Glee Guild Area
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Aust Nenae Tarin
\n\n
So... you had mentioned that something could be done to bring Glee into an IC area with the new overmap, and, well, after talking with Aust and Nenae we had an idea to run past you.\n

Loosely, the idea involves an Inn, tended by a retired glee, perhaps funded by some mythic NPC, off scene former court bard (thus supplying the legitimacy and OOC Guild ownership, as well as legal potential to keep the Inn in the guild should it be necessary).  The majority of the bar is like any other (upscale?) bar.  Common room, dining rooms, stage, private rooms, etc.  However, in the back are some dormitory spaces, reserved for Gleemen fallen on hard times, a seperate common room for them, perhaps one or two small spaces so that a tired glee can get away and hide from the world for a spell.  The guild areas are nothing fancy, nothing special.  Just what an old retired Gleeman who knows what the road is like can offer to his old friends and students.\n

Its also about the most we can sustain, ICly.  Lacking the glee base to fill the playhouse and run productions, we can't really justify the kind of IC organization necessary to have a large overblown structure, nor do we necessarily want to.  This is ICly the work of one or two individuals who've made a fair living for themselves, maybe earned a few favours, and now want to settle down and enjoy their older years - and maybe offer a helping hand to them as needs it.  They offer a resource, and have no authority over the gleefolk, save for what respect they are given for their age and experience, what thanks they are given for the cheap rooms they offer the patchcloaks, and what the fear of the cudgels of their bouncers confer.\n

Furthermore, Inns are already centers of RP.  An Inn where glees make a point of taking rooms and perhaps frequenting, an Inn where glees feel some sense of ownership... this has potential to further focus RP.\n

However, Caemlyn already has a surplus of inns, and more inns, even high detail inns, would be largely a waste of space.  The Queen's Blessing already often sits unused, forgotten.  Thus, rather than create a new inn, we thought it might be possible to take over an old inn, perhaps one which tends to suffer from accidents.  The Lion's Banner has been suggested, as it has never had any player owner, and is already large enough and spaced well enough, and, well, can be ICly destroyed enough to easily result in a change of title.  Some changes would need to be made, including a rename and cosmetic changes, as well as the construction of a cellar, probably finished.\n

Anyway, thats the basic idea.  It'd give us a small, low key, IC area, which, rather than drawing RP away from other areas on the MUD, might provide another focus point, most of which is fully accessible to all players.  I and the other glees would be happy to help with any desc work needed, though we'd request permission to make some moderately extensive use of extra descs (I'm going to have poems on the walls), locked doors, and perhaps a second vault room which could serve as a library such as you and I spoke of.  Unlike most guild areas this probably wouldn't involve private rooms for most of the characters.  If you can afford a private room, you rent one.  If we ever grow enough to legitimately need more, well... there is the theatre district, and a playhouse was coded for avilyn long ago that could be used.\n
Thats the basics.  I can explain more if you'd like, just drop a mudmail or a tell when next you see me on.\n
-tarin avrinson, Gleeman Provocateur/hopefully soon to be Beringil, Master Gleeman (ret.)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed May  4 12:21:01 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Telo
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Hello;
\nHello:\n
\n
Telo is currently a Senior Lieutenant in the Queen's Guard.  I am\n
looking to join the rebel tower's army under Gareth Bryne, and work\n
towards eventual bonding.  Description and background are included,\n
and I look forward to hearing back.\n
\n
Background:\n
Telo has been in the Queen's Guards since he was only sixteen,\n
taking the oaths much younger than most new recruits.  He worked\n
and trained hard while Gareth Bryne was Commander of the gaurds,\n
and was appauled when Bryne was removed from his office.  Telo\n
held true to his comittment however, and continued to serve dutifully\n
in the guards throughout the chaos that erupted in Caemlyn and\n
rumor of the Queen's death.\n
Currently, Telo is a Senior Lieutenant with the Guards, with\n
several men under his command.  Telo fought the shadowspawn that\n
erupted in Caemlyn when Andor was taken by the Dragon Reborn, and\n
since then, has heard rumor of Gareth Bryne leading a new band\n
of forces in the south.  Telo has inquired of this, but has not\n
heard anything substantial to follow up on.\n
\n
Description:\n
The man is of average height, with short sandy blonde hair that\n
is cut to less than an inch in length.  He has soft, brown eyes\n
that take in his surroundings.  He has a smooth face, which seems\n
to be perfectly balanced.  He is of sturdy build, and from the\n
looks of him he keeps his body well trained.  His skin is slightly\n
darkened from a tan that never seems to fade.\n
\n
Around his neck is a simple turqoise stone that has been shaped\n
into a small dagger, about an inch tall.  The stone hangs from his\n
neck by a leather string, falling to his mid-chest.  He wears a\n
dark red cloth shirt, with long sleeves that are rolled back to\n
his elbows.  The shirt has many small silver buttons up the front,\n
and is tucked neatly into his loose leather riding pants.  Around\n
his waist he wears a thick, black leather belt.  On the left hip\n
rests a longsword tucked into a sturdy wooden sheath, and a dagger\n
hangs from the right hip.  The leather riding pants are tucked\n
neatly into a pair of black leather knee-high boots he wears on\n
his feet, with small silver spurs on the heels.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri May  6 11:54:12 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 New Gleeguild area?
\n`7CC`6: `7Nenae Syrah
\n\n
Hey, I was gonna mail you both separately but I'm short on time.\n
Tarin (gleeman) mailed us about making a new inn to replace\n
the old glee area in the tower.  Since we gotta get rid of\n
the tower anyway and reintegrate the old guild areas into ICly\n
correct spots on the world map (or else make new guild areas period),\n
I'm down with this.  What he's suggesting is making an inn, owned\n
by a retired glee-man or two who made a decent living, and now\n
goes out of his/her way to help out gleefolk.  It's a regular\n
inn - common room, stuff like that, but it also has a few rooms\n
where gleefolk themselves can visit/share stuff with in private,\n
in the back.  He wrote a good letter - I'll forward it to you both.\n
What do you guys think? Also, provided you guys like it, do you\n
think it should go in Caemlyn or Tar Valon? I only say TV cuz\n
Caemlyn's got enough inns, and I'd like to see some new/cool\n
stuff there too, but whatever.\n
\n
Thanks,\n
Nic\n
