\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue May  3 22:13:30 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Tarin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Another Crazy Idea/Glee Guild Area
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Aust Nenae Tarin
\n\n
So... you had mentioned that something could be done to bring Glee into an IC area with the new overmap, and, well, after talking with Aust and Nenae we had an idea to run past you.\n

Loosely, the idea involves an Inn, tended by a retired glee, perhaps funded by some mythic NPC, off scene former court bard (thus supplying the legitimacy and OOC Guild ownership, as well as legal potential to keep the Inn in the guild should it be necessary).  The majority of the bar is like any other (upscale?) bar.  Common room, dining rooms, stage, private rooms, etc.  However, in the back are some dormitory spaces, reserved for Gleemen fallen on hard times, a seperate common room for them, perhaps one or two small spaces so that a tired glee can get away and hide from the world for a spell.  The guild areas are nothing fancy, nothing special.  Just what an old retired Gleeman who knows what the road is like can offer to his old friends and students.\n

Its also about the most we can sustain, ICly.  Lacking the glee base to fill the playhouse and run productions, we can't really justify the kind of IC organization necessary to have a large overblown structure, nor do we necessarily want to.  This is ICly the work of one or two individuals who've made a fair living for themselves, maybe earned a few favours, and now want to settle down and enjoy their older years - and maybe offer a helping hand to them as needs it.  They offer a resource, and have no authority over the gleefolk, save for what respect they are given for their age and experience, what thanks they are given for the cheap rooms they offer the patchcloaks, and what the fear of the cudgels of their bouncers confer.\n

Furthermore, Inns are already centers of RP.  An Inn where glees make a point of taking rooms and perhaps frequenting, an Inn where glees feel some sense of ownership... this has potential to further focus RP.\n

However, Caemlyn already has a surplus of inns, and more inns, even high detail inns, would be largely a waste of space.  The Queen's Blessing already often sits unused, forgotten.  Thus, rather than create a new inn, we thought it might be possible to take over an old inn, perhaps one which tends to suffer from accidents.  The Lion's Banner has been suggested, as it has never had any player owner, and is already large enough and spaced well enough, and, well, can be ICly destroyed enough to easily result in a change of title.  Some changes would need to be made, including a rename and cosmetic changes, as well as the construction of a cellar, probably finished.\n

Anyway, thats the basic idea.  It'd give us a small, low key, IC area, which, rather than drawing RP away from other areas on the MUD, might provide another focus point, most of which is fully accessible to all players.  I and the other glees would be happy to help with any desc work needed, though we'd request permission to make some moderately extensive use of extra descs (I'm going to have poems on the walls), locked doors, and perhaps a second vault room which could serve as a library such as you and I spoke of.  Unlike most guild areas this probably wouldn't involve private rooms for most of the characters.  If you can afford a private room, you rent one.  If we ever grow enough to legitimately need more, well... there is the theatre district, and a playhouse was coded for avilyn long ago that could be used.\n
Thats the basics.  I can explain more if you'd like, just drop a mudmail or a tell when next you see me on.\n
-tarin avrinson, Gleeman Provocateur/hopefully soon to be Beringil, Master Gleeman (ret.)\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed May 11 17:27:43 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Kagari
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeking Wolfkin
\nHeyas, I'd like to join the Wolfkin with this character.\n
The board didn't say whether to mudmail or email my\n
background, so I'm just assuming this is the right way.\n
\n
Kagari grew up on a farm, raised by her father with no\n
other siblings around. Her father, not really knowing\n
what to do with a daughter, raised her the best he could\n
but still ended up with quite a tomboy. Kagari's first\n
love was horses, and she knew everything there was to\n
know about riding by the time she was twelve. She even\n
learned how to shoe a horse, much to the farrier's amusement.\n
\n
When Kagari was seventeen, she began running parcels for\n
people back and forth between the small towns out in the\n
backwoods part of Andor she lived in, but one day she\n
returned home to find her farm in ashes, and all the horses\n
stolen. With noplace else to go, she began working for\n
travelling merchants, tending to their horses and helping\n
out in stables: anything she could do to make enough money to\n
live on.\n
\n
She saw a lot of Andor, and even a little bit of Murandy, but\n
one day while stopped over in Caemlyn, her employer came back\n
to the inn, drunk, and insisted she saddle the horses which she\n
had only finished grooming a few minutes before. She would\n
have been fine: the man wasn't cruel or violent, but before she\n
could get a word in, a pair of black-coated men had threatened\n
the poor merchant enough to scare him right out of the inn.\n
Kagari didn't feel that she could keep on working for him after\n
that, so she's been stuck in Caemlyn ever since, finding odd jobs\n
running parcels up and down along the road north of Caemlyn.\n
Once on a run, she met a hunter with yellow eyes who didn't share\n
his name, but who made her horse pretty nervous for some reason.\n
Other than that, she's had no contact yet with wolves or wolfkin.\n
\n
I hope that'll do: the last paragraph is all of the actual rp I've\n
done with this character so far. I'm only level four, but there\n
didn't appear to be a requirement, so I'll just keep going as I\n
have been unless I hear differently.\n
\n
Yours in the Light,\n
Kagari\n

stolen. With noplace else to go, she began working for\n
travelling merchants, tending to their horses and helping\n
out in stables: anything she could do to make enough money to\n
live on.\n
\n
She saw a lot of Andor, and even a little bit of Murandy, but\n
one day while stopped over in Caemlyn, her employer came back\n
to the inn, drunk, and insisted she saddle the horses which she\n
had only finished grooming a few minutes before. She would\n
have been fine: the man wasn't cruel or violent, but before she\n
could get a word in, a pair of black-coated men had threatened\n
the poor merchant enough to scare him right out of the inn.\n
Kagari didn't feel that she could keep on working for him after\n
that, so she's been stuck in Caemlyn ever since, finding odd jobs\n
running parcels up and down along the road north of Caemlyn.\n
Once on a run, she met a hunter with yellow eyes who didn't share\n
his name, but who made her horse pretty nervous for some reason.\n
Other than that, she's had no contact yet with wolves or wolfkin.\n
\n
I hope that'll do: the last paragraph is all of the actual rp I've\n
done with this character so far. I'm only level four, but there\n
didn't appear to be a requirement, so I'll just keep going as I\n
have been unless I hear differently.\n
\n
Yours in the Light,\n
Kagari\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu May 12 23:42:07 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Kagari
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Another Newbie Hits the Fan
\nOne day a stranger walked into\n
The broad, paved streets of Caem-e-lyn\n
A few bright coppers in his hand\n
And not a soul to speak for him\n
All that he had was a name and a dream\n
Of someday being a famous man\n
So he smiled and he nodded and whistled a tune -\n
Another nwebie hits the fan\n
\n
Now a guardsman blocked his way\n
You are not Authorized! he said\n
The stranger fumed and stomped his feet\n
But the man heard not a work he plead\n
Then Mikki, Immortal and Ruler of All\n
Appeared beside the awestruck man\n
With a thundering crash of her mighty steeds' hooves -\n
Another newbie hits the fan\n
\n
Well now, she said, with a frown and a glance\n
At the new young adventurer gazing at her\n
I don't think your name is quite fit for this place:\nWe already have someone playing 'DragonR'\n
DragonR thought for a minute or three\n
And then had her name him Rakoric the Man\n
She authed him and sent him on his merry way -\n
Another newbie hits the fan\n
\n
Rakoric, he wandered alone through the town\n
Determined to find his way on his own\n
He soon was quite lost in the wide, crowded streets\n
So he questioned a lad how to find his way home\n
The lad didn't answer, but somebody laughed,\n
Try typing RECALL, you newbie-type man.\n
He thanked them and typed it, and POOF! he was there - \n
Another newbie hits the fan\n
\n
Now then, he thought as he wandered about\n
Exploring and learning the lay of the town\n
This isn't as hard as I thought it at first:\nI'm really beginning to learn my way 'round!\n
So onward he wandered and aimlessly roamed\n
'Till he walked to the Blight where the killer trees ran\n
And suddenly found himself home once again -\n
Another newbie hits the fan\n
\n
Undaunted, Rakoric went leveling\n
So he could gain the experience quickly again\n
He got it all back and was thirsty for more\n
And the next thing he knew he was at level ten\n
Unknowing, uncaring, he fell through a hole\n
Deep in Aringill's tombs he was stranded, and then\n
When the lad was attacked, he could recall no more -\n
Another newbie hits the fan\n
\n
This tale is not ended - it's barely begun -\n
But Rakoric was very discouraged by then\n
He know not the limits, he knew not the rules\n
Of this wonderful world that he'd found himself in\n
So he questioned, and learned all the things that he wished\n
He had asked long before, when he'd first entered in\n
Then deleted and quit and created again -\n
Another newbie hits the fan\n
\n
One day a stranger walked into\n
The broad, paved streets of Caem-e-lyn\n
A few bright coppers in her hand\n
And nary a clue what she'd got herself in\n
Rakoric remembered, and offered his help\n
But she just walked away with a nod and a grin\n
So he chuckled and thought as she wandered away,\n
Another newbie hits the fan.\n
\n
Lyrics (and music) by Ticara the Gleewoman\n
aka Lironah the CrAZy Wolf\n
aka Kaerin Ravensbane - `1I`!l`#l`&u`#m`!i`1n`5a`1t`!o`#r`7 extraordinaire\n
aka Kagari Yurehl\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat May 21 13:05:18 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Time to kick ass, fellas
\n`7Guild Mail`6:`7 Immortals
\n\n
Hey all, those of us still at school are between semesters atm\n
so Duren and I are taking advantage of this time to get as\n
much done as humanly possible on MM3.2.  This includes\n
all the major projects, most especially combat.  I want to\n
get the ubermap online as well, and I'll be logging on to spam-\n
desc zones whenever I can get into a lab.  If there's anything\n
you've been asked to do or know you can contribute to,\n
please weigh in.  These work-icide sessions of ours only\n
come around about twice a year, and it's important that we\n
get as much done as we can so that we can get the mud\n
running for real.\n
\n
Since the labs are generally locked right now, I'm going\n
to be doing my own work at home and then when I can\n
get online I'm gonna bust it out as fast as possible.  I\n
won't be on all day, but I will be working LOTS.  Please\n
throw in whatever time you can spare as well.  It's important!\n
\n
Things to do:\n
Ubermap: Most especially finishing Tar Valon proper, the\n
white tower, and the remaining countryside zones.\n
\n
Combat: All aspects, highest priority.\n
\n
Channeling: Hale and I still need a large list of all the\n
weaves and all the things you guys want them to do.  We've\n
got several partial lists, but I really want a 'This is all we\n
ever want to see' list of weaves and affects.\n
\n
RP: Get some RP plots going again.  This place is looking\n
dead.  Events and fun quests (OOC or IC) would hit the spot\n
if you can get enough people on.\n
\n
Everybody else: Find something to do.  I want every imm and\n
staff member to contribute - whatever way you want or can is\n
fine.  This is a team effort and we need everybody on board.\n
\n
-Nicodemus is ready to say 'fuck you' to MM3 and move on\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat May 28 16:51:35 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower Update
\nI've added more floors and worked out the attachment\n
for the bridge to the mini-tower.  The vnums don't\n
always go in order cuz I got sloppy and had to go\n
back and correct things cuz of the bridge, but what\n
is there now won't be going anywhere so it's fair\n
game to write descs for now.  Syrah, if it's cool\n
with you (I don't have your list on me atm), yellows\n
can go with the greens on the fifth floor, so they\n
can go play medic to the men in the warder tower (mae's\n
idea).  That work for everybody?\n
\n
I'm gonna keep building the tower down towards the\n
ground.  Then i'm gonna need to write everything else\n
out on paper to see how many rooms we've got, then I'll\n
do the outdoors, the warder tower, and finally the\n
bridge between the two.  Very last thing will be\n
connecting the four gates to the Tar Valon island.\n
\n
-Nic\n

column5: Here is a background for Simion's re-name.  I'd like to keep my position in the Asha'man if that is alright.  Let me know if the background is acceptable please.

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jun 17 06:27:11 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Cashik
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Here is a background for Simion's re-name.  I'd like to keep my position in the Asha'man if that is alright.  Let me know if the background is acceptable please.

\nCashik was born in Mayene near the coast bordering the Sea of Storms.  His father was a trader with the Seafolk.  Cashik's mother died when he was very young, from sickness, and so, his father raised the boy alone.  Cashik was born on the exact day that is the feast of Bel Tine.  It is a belief in some parts of Mayene that if a child is born on the Great Feast then a great destiny awaits them.\n
\n

From an early age, Cashik aspired to be part of the Mayene military.  Stories of the famed Winged Guards and the resistance they led against the oppressive Tairen's made him feel proud to live in Mayene.  Even though Tear claims Mayene is a province, Mayeners strongly refute this, and they fight to maintain their independence.\n
\n

Cashik trained hard as a youth, studying the martial arts of the region and swordplay.  It was tough for him at first because he had little money for a tutor but he found a job trading like his father, and that was suitable for him and it helped along his progress.  He had only one real goal in life, and that was to become one of the famed Winged Guards he had heard so much about.\n
\n

He eventually made it in to the military but it seemed fate had more in store for him than that.  His ability to channel manifested itself slowly and he was unaware of it at first.  Unexpected events and excessive luck led him to be given the name 'Machin' by his comrades.  They called him such because he was so fast, able to bend the flow of air about himself without realising it.  His light frame and sharp mind also helped him a great deal.  Not very strong, Cashik uses his speed to his advantage in battle.\n
\n

A number of skirmishes was really all Cashik saw in his first few years serving in the Winged Guards.  The Tairen's launched attacks from time to time, in their efforts to conquer Mayene, but the Mayener's always seemed to have the upper hand, their nation much like a fortress in itself, surrounded by mountains, raging seas and of course, the drowned lands - a swampy terrain filled with dangerous predators.  The Tairen's never really stood much of a chance and so they more often resorted to assassins instead, and tried to cut off Mayene's supplies. \n
\n

Cashik was one of many very pleased Mayeners when Tear fell, and to the Dragon Reborn no less, aided by the Aiel.  The news spread quickly through the land, finally the fighting was over and Tear would not bother them any more, and yet, deep down they all knew that lurking around the corner a far greater battle was to come.  With the Dragon Reborn's arrival, his taking of the Stone of Tear as was written in the prophecies, there was little doubt in Cashik's mind that Tarmon Gai'don was coming.  Everyone could feel it as the land began to turn dry and burn under the endless days of scorching sun.  An un-natural head that never seemed to end.\n
\n

Cashik took it upon himself to volunteer straight away when Berelain travelled to the Stone.  He wanted to continue to protect Mayene, nothing mattered more to him, but it was clear to him that the battle was no longer to be fought in his home land.  Trollocs and Fades, creatures he had long thought to be myth, he found out were real.  The Aiel had come across the Spine of the World, the Dark One was starting to break free from his prison.\n
\n

The Stone was flooded with Shadowspawn soon after his arrival, and all his training flew out of the window when that first eyeless stare settled upon him.  Unable to move, paralysed by it, he thought he would die there and then.  And yet the creature he encountered hesitated.  To this day, Cashik still remembers that event of his life more clearly than any other and it puzzles him greatly.  Some Fades were rumoured to even be fighting each other, Trollocs as well, they appeared in a chaotic state.\n
\n

Because of the Dragon Reborn the shadowspawn were defeated and the people in Stone spared, and Cashik witnessed that power with awe, lighting bolts streaking down the corridors, striking into the Fades and Trollocs and destroying them.  He felt the radiance of menace coming from the man and fell to his knees in worship of that power.  Still very much unaware that he could channel, Cashik continued in ignorance believing that everyone could feel it, those odd times when he saw the Dragon Reborn down the corridor and felt that menace.  He never once mentioned it, believing it was simply his power radiating off him, because he was who he was.\n
\n

It was only a few years later, in Caemlyn, that he really found out what he was, when one of the newly formed group called the Asha'man came across him in Palace.  As they tested the men who had travelled from all over the world, for the amnesty, Cashik again felt that twinge of menace.  Investigating its source brought him to the Asha'man, and after a long process he agreed to be tested as well, out of curiosity more than anything else.\n
\n

The confirmation actually came as a real shock to him and as he considered what he should do, he found the decision made for him.  The Asha'man took him to the Black Tower despite his protests about his duty to Berelain.  It is likely that the Lord Captain of the Winged Guards would have let Cashik go willingly, submitting to the will of the Dragon Reborn and so, of the Asha'man.  A letter of resignation was written and sent from Cashik and he began his life anew.\n
\n

As a Recruit in the Black Tower, he found himself quickly humbled by the harsh regime.  Something called a 'block' Cashik found had to be broken before he could learn to channel.  Apparently his was always anger - at the Tairens.  To bring that anger out, a Tairen Soldier was the obvious choice, and it was broken with a fierce display that had him beaten to the ground until all that was left was nothingness.  He was able to hold Saidin freely from that day forth and, after he recovered, he began, learning, developing particular skill with air and fire.  His restlessness at being held at the Farm was toned down by the amazing power he found he could wield.  Consumed by it, always seeking to improve himself, he often had to be told to 'stop' to avoid burning himself out.  \n
\n

Fireballs, lightning, balls of light, shields of air, the ability to make things explode, never in his wildest dreams did Cashik believe such things were possible, but he learned to make them happen, realising that the adaptations could be endless.  He waits for his Soldier test, eager to get out there and put his new found skills to good use.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jun 17 07:19:20 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Cashik
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Cashik's Background.  Need DD approval?

\nThis is Cashik's background (Simion's re-name)  I thought I should send it to you because my involvement with the Winged Guards in my background might need your approval?  If Kinje doesn't want my re-name back in the AM guild, then then the last part of this background will have to be disregarded, and he would still be in the Winged Guards, with your approval?\n
\n

So, for the moment, please let me know if the background mentioning of being in the Winged Guards is acceptable to you, since you are the DD leader, and also, what rank you think I would have attained (squadman, lieutenant.. etc.)\n
\n

Cashik was born in Mayene near the coast bordering the Sea of Storms.  His father was a trader with the Seafolk.  Cashik's mother died when he was very young, from sickness, and so, his father raised the boy alone.  Cashik was born on the exact day that is the feast of Bel Tine.  It is a belief in some parts of Mayene that if a child is born on the Great Feast then a great destiny awaits them.\n
\n

From an early age, Cashik aspired to be part of the Mayene military.  Stories of the famed Winged Guards and the resistance they led against the oppressive Tairen's made him feel proud to live in Mayene.  Even though Tear claims Mayene is a province, Mayeners strongly refute this, and they fight to maintain their independence.\n
\n

Cashik trained hard as a youth, studying the martial arts of the region and swordplay.  It was tough for him at first because he had little money for a tutor but he found a job trading like his father, and that was suitable for him and it helped along his progress.  He had only one real goal in life, and that was to become one of the famed Winged Guards he had heard so much about.\n
\n

He eventually made it in to the military but it seemed fate had more in store for him than that.  His ability to channel manifested itself slowly and he was unaware of it at first.  Unexpected events and excessive luck led him to be given the name 'Machin' by his comrades.  They called him such because he was so fast, able to bend the flow of air about himself without realising it.  His light frame and sharp mind also helped him a great deal.  Not very strong, Cashik uses his speed to his advantage in battle.\n
\n

A number of skirmishes was really all Cashik saw in his first few years serving in the Winged Guards.  The Tairen's launched attacks from time to time, in their efforts to conquer Mayene, but the Mayener's always seemed to have the upper hand, their nation much like a fortress in itself, surrounded by mountains, raging seas and of course, the drowned lands - a swampy terrain filled with dangerous predators.  The Tairen's never really stood much of a chance and so they more often resorted to assassins instead, and tried to cut off Mayene's supplies. \n
\n

Cashik was one of many very pleased Mayeners when Tear fell, and to the Dragon Reborn no less, aided by the Aiel.  The news spread quickly through the land, finally the fighting was over and Tear would not bother them any more, and yet, deep down they all knew that lurking around the corner a far greater battle was to come.  With the Dragon Reborn's arrival, his taking of the Stone of Tear as was written in the prophecies, there was little doubt in Cashik's mind that Tarmon Gai'don was coming.  Everyone could feel it as the land began to turn dry and burn under the endless days of scorching sun.  An un-natural head that never seemed to end.\n
\n

Cashik took it upon himself to volunteer straight away when Berelain travelled to the Stone.  He wanted to continue to protect Mayene, nothing mattered more to him, but it was clear to him that the battle was no longer to be fought in his home land.  Trollocs and Fades, creatures he had long thought to be myth, he found out were real.  The Aiel had come across the Spine of the World, the Dark One was starting to break free from his prison.\n
\n

The Stone was flooded with Shadowspawn soon after his arrival, and all his training flew out of the window when that first eyeless stare settled upon him.  Unable to move, paralysed by it, he thought he would die there and then.  And yet the creature he encountered hesitated.  To this day, Cashik still remembers that event of his life more clearly than any other and it puzzles him greatly.  Some Fades were rumoured to even be fighting each other, Trollocs as well, they appeared in a chaotic state.\n
\n

Because of the Dragon Reborn the shadowspawn were defeated and the people in Stone spared, and Cashik witnessed that power with awe, lighting bolts streaking down the corridors, striking into the Fades and Trollocs and destroying them.  He felt the radiance of menace coming from the man and fell to his knees in worship of that power.  Still very much unaware that he could channel, Cashik continued in ignorance believing that everyone could feel it, those odd times when he saw the Dragon Reborn down the corridor and felt that menace.  He never once mentioned it, believing it was simply his power radiating off him, because he was who he was.\n
\n

It was only a few years later, in Caemlyn, that he really found out what he was, when one of the newly formed group called the Asha'man came across him in Palace.  As they tested the men who had travelled from all over the world, for the amnesty, Cashik again felt that twinge of menace.  Investigating its source brought him to the Asha'man, and after a long process he agreed to be tested as well, out of curiosity more than anything else.\n
\n

The confirmation actually came as a real shock to him and as he considered what he should do, he found the decision made for him.  The Asha'man took him to the Black Tower despite his protests about his duty to Berelain.  It is likely that the Lord Captain of the Winged Guards would have let Cashik go willingly, submitting to the will of the Dragon Reborn and so, of the Asha'man.  A letter of resignation was written and sent from Cashik and he began his life anew.\n
\n

As a Recruit in the Black Tower, he found himself quickly humbled by the harsh regime.  Something called a 'block' Cashik found had to be broken before he could learn to channel.  Apparently his was always anger - at the Tairens.  To bring that anger out, a Tairen Soldier was the obvious choice, and it was broken with a fierce display that had him beaten to the ground until all that was left was nothingness.  He was able to hold Saidin freely from that day forth and, after he recovered, he began, learning, developing particular skill with air and fire.  His restlessness at being held at the Farm was toned down by the amazing power he found he could wield.  Consumed by it, always seeking to improve himself, he often had to be told to 'stop' to avoid burning himself out.  \n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jun 17 07:19:20 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Cashik
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Cashik's Background.  Need DD approval?

\nThis is Cashik's background (Simion's re-name)  I thought I should send it to you because my involvement with the Winged Guards in my background might need your approval?  If Kinje doesn't want my re-name back in the AM guild, then then the last part of this background will have to be disregarded, and he would still be in the Winged Guards, with your approval?\n
\n

So, for the moment, please let me know if the background mentioning of being in the Winged Guards is acceptable to you, since you are the DD leader, and also, what rank you think I would have attained (squadman, lieutenant.. etc.)\n
\n

Cashik was born in Mayene near the coast bordering the Sea of Storms.  His father was a trader with the Seafolk.  Cashik's mother died when he was very young, from sickness, and so, his father raised the boy alone.  Cashik was born on the exact day that is the feast of Bel Tine.  It is a belief in some parts of Mayene that if a child is born on the Great Feast then a great destiny awaits them.\n
\n

From an early age, Cashik aspired to be part of the Mayene military. \n

With the Dragon Reborn's arrival, his taking of the Stone of Tear as was written in the prophecies, there was little doubt in Cashik's mind that Tarmon Gai'don was coming.  Everyone could feel it as the land began to turn dry and burn under the endless days of scorching sun.  An un-natural head that never seemed to end.\n
\n

Cashik took it upon himself to volunteer straight away when Berelain travelled to the Stone.  He wanted to continue to protect Mayene, nothing mattered more to him, but it was clear to him that the battle was no longer to be fought in his home land.  Trollocs and Fades, creatures he had long thought to be myth, he found out were real.  The Aiel had come across the Spine of the World, the Dark One was starting to break free from his prison.\n

\n

Because of the Dragon Reborn the shadowspawn were defeated and the people in Stone spared, and Cashik witnessed that power with awe, lighting bolts streaking down the corridors, striking into the Fades and Trollocs and destroying them.  He felt the radiance of menace coming from the man and fell to his knees in worship of that power.  Still very much unaware that he could channel, Cashik continued in ignorance believing that everyone could feel it, those odd times when he saw the Dragon Reborn down the corridor and felt that menace.  He never once mentioned it, believing it was simply his power radiating off him, because he was who he was.\n
\n

It was only a few years later, in Caemlyn, that he really found out what he was, when one of the newly formed group called the Asha'man came across him in Palace. It is likely that the Lord Captain of the Winged Guards would have let Cashik go willingly, submitting to the will of the Dragon Reborn and so, of the Asha'man. \n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jun 21 23:48:46 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Cathbad
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Channeling History (tentative)
\nHere's the Channeling History of Cathbad,\n
Begining, most appropriately at it's beginning.\n
The following is a rememberance of the RP that happened.\n
This originally occured around Dec of '99, if I remember.\n
Tyme was in the book-timeline, with bookies.\n
Cathbad, Illuminator, had gone to the Oval Plaza one day,\n
where he chatted nicely with a few people, but through the\n
course of one conversation, managed to anger one with whom\n
he was talking, Lironah.\n
You're a MADMAN!, Lironah said  With this, Cathbad's\n
annoyance turned fully and completely into anger.\n
Holding his staff horizontal with both hands, he gave it a\n
shove towards Lironah, and though she is some ten feet back,\n
she reeled back as if struck, landing on her rump.\n
What Cathbad did not know is that he siezed Saidin, and with\n
the shove of his staff, wove air into a similar force that\n
shoved Lironah backwards.\n
Then, all too aware of the sickeningly sweet churning within\n
his mind, he held onto it with all his might, both repulsed\n
and filled with wonder at what now is, a male channeller.\n
This next part originally happened immediately after the\n
above section.  If this next would be a problem to keep, it\n
can be taken out without any problem.  However, if it isn't\n
a problem, I'd just as rather keep it, with a few changes.\n
Cathbad was shielded my a male channeler, which marked the\n
first flows Cathbad really saw.  He was led out of the Oval\n
to some other place, where he was given the option of going\n
with them to a place where he could learn to Channel and be\n
a weapon, or eventually going insane and causing a big mess.\n
Having no desire to harm anyone, Cathbad outright refused to\n
join the group, since leaving the Illuminators would mean\n
betraying his heritage.  So, they gave him a third option,\n
to serve as their spy.  Coincidently, the person who let him\n
choose this option wasn't long for the world (left Tyme),\n
and no Asha ever bothered Cathbad again, until it happened\n
again (to the same effect).\n
What I'd like to keep is that he was given the option to\n
learn, though it was to be as the Dragon's weapon, and he\n
refused on those grounds.  This being in the early stages,\n
of Asha gathering, I'm guessing he was a 'lost recruit'\n
or something (I don't know Asha current policy).\n
Essentially, they might know there was one who didn't take\n
to recruitment in the Caemlyn area, but despite the /small/\n
area, Cathbad still spends most of his time in the Illum\n
Chapterhouse, only coming out for the rare visit outside\n
their grounds.\n
Now, fast-forward a while, and Cathbad had gotten over the\n
sickness that comes with first channeling on his own.\n
I heavily considered having Cathbad succumb to the pains of\n
being a Wilder, and die, and left it up to RL dice.  It\n
sounds odd, but yes, I did, leaving a 01-25 on %ile dice to\n
Cathbad living.  What came up was a 24%.  I came to use the\n
RL dice to sim in RP what % grasp/weave/release I had in\n
code.\n
As far as a block, Cathbad's was two-fold.  First, he could\n
only sieze Saidin when he was angry or filled with hate or\n
disgust, and second, his weaves needed an accompanying\n
physical gesture to work.\n
Similar to Nynaeve, Cathbad began to learn to force himself\n
to become angry enough to channel, but still, was loathe to\n
even when circumstances were against him.\n
Most of the time, when things turned ill, Cathbad would use\n
some Illuminator trick to escape, rather than Channeling.\n
Eventually, he got decent at weaving a bit of air, though\n
has not practiced much of the other.  He'd prefer to not\n
use it, because if he goes mad, there is the chance his\n
insane uses of the One Power could blow up the Chapterhouse\n
and a fair section of Caemlyn as well.\n
Cathbad eventually got to be able to grasp and release\n
decently well, though it is not always certain, even if he\n
is angry.  Sometimes, Saidin is loathe to release from his\n
grasp (aka lower release).  As to tying weaves, Cathbad\n
has no knowledge of it.\n
The reason I only did minor Air stuff was that Cathbad\n
only had one Weave, and that was Dart of Air.\n
One thing I'm leaving out is that Cathbad was on scene for\n
an assassination the Asha'man attempted, failed, and fled\n
from.  In it, Cath dove to the right, avoiding a deadly\n
disc of air being hurled at him, though Cath's two npc\n
guards died, not being able to see what was coming.  That,\n
and Cathbad got Shielded again.  There was a policy issue\n
with one of the Asha doing 8 things at once, and some\n
other muck.  Of course, this was 2 rp-shifts ago, so, I'm\n
fine with it going the way of the dodo.\n
I would like Cathbad to begin experimenting with a few\n
things.  The first of these being small weaves of fire,\n
seeing if he can light things, specifically if he can\n
touch off one thing while nearby items remain unsinged.\n
The second being Earth weaves.  By now, Cathbad would\n
have probably heard of the five flows, and may have\n
considered trying to turn one substance into another.\n
Mostly, for refining exisitng firework materials and\n
developing new ones.\n
As to where he could've heard of the flows, well, I had\n
an RP going with a Yellow (probably gone now) that\n
Cathbad was Eyes/Ears for, and who promised to keep his\n
secret (didn't know what it was until said).  She was\n
trying to help him with his limp, ended up lessening\n
the pain he was in, but the limp remained.  She was\n
also helping another Illuminator with a stress-related\n
illness.  I'm hoping to keep this, even though nothing\n
more will happen, but some info getting funneled to WT.\n
The Yellow recommended that Cathbad go for 'gentling',\n
and seriously considered it, but put the good he is\n
currently doing for the Illuminators above the future\n
potential problem of leaving a large area in rubble.\n
I know this isn't your area, but I'm hoping to keep\n
this piece of Cathbad's RP history, as it gave him a\n
new perspective, and a second person he could talk to\n
about being a Male Channeler. (The first being Lironah)\n
If I have been rambling, I apologize.  I am staying up\n
later than I expected to be, so I could finish this up.\n
I hope to discuss all this with you some time soon.\n
Cathbad - Illuminator Extraordinaire\n
- Channeler Mediocre\n

Cathbad eventually got to be able to grasp and release\n
decently well, though it is not always certain, even if he\n
is angry.  Sometimes, Saidin is loathe to release from his\n
grasp (aka lower release).  As to tying weaves, Cathbad\n
has no knowledge of it.\n
The reason I only did minor Air stuff was that Cathbad\n
only had one Weave, and that was Dart of Air.\n
One thing I'm leaving out is that Cathbad was on scene for\n
an assassination the Asha'man attempted, failed, and fled\n
from.  In it, Cath dove to the right, avoiding a deadly\n
disc of air being hurled at him, though Cath's two npc\n
guards died, not being able to see what was coming.  That,\n
and Cathbad got Shielded again.  There was a policy issue\n
with one of the Asha doing 8 things at once, and some\n
other muck.  Of course, this was 2 rp-shifts ago, so, I'm\n
fine with it going the way of the dodo.\n
I would like Cathbad to begin experimenting with a few\n
things.  The first of these being small weaves of fire,\n
seeing if he can light things, specifically if he can\n
touch off one thing while nearby items remain unsinged.\n
The second being Earth weaves.  By now, Cathbad would\n
have probably heard of the five flows, and may have\n
considered trying to turn one substance into another.\n
Mostly, for refining exisitng firework materials and\n
developing new ones.\n
As to where he could've heard of the flows, well, I had\n
an RP going with a Yellow (probably gone now) that\n
Cathbad was Eyes/Ears for, and who promised to keep his\n
secret (didn't know what it was until said).  She was\n
trying to help him with his limp, ended up lessening\n
the pain he was in, but the limp remained.  She was\n
also helping another Illuminator with a stress-related\n
illness.  I'm hoping to keep this, even though nothing\n
more will happen, but some info getting funneled to WT.\n
The Yellow recommended that Cathbad go for 'gentling',\n
and seriously considered it, but put the good he is\n
currently doing for the Illuminators above the future\n
potential problem of leaving a large area in rubble.\n
I know this isn't your area, but I'm hoping to keep\n
this piece of Cathbad's RP history, as it gave him a\n
new perspective, and a second person he could talk to\n
about being a Male Channeler. (The first being Lironah)\n
If I have been rambling, I apologize.  I am staying up\n
later than I expected to be, so I could finish this up.\n
I hope to discuss all this with you some time soon.\n
Cathbad - Illuminator Extraordinaire\n
- Channeler Mediocre\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jun 21 23:53:48 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Cathbad
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Beginning of Cathbad's Channeling
\nThe following is a rememberance of the RP that happened.\n
This originally occured around Dec of '99, if I remember.\n
Cathbad, Illuminator, had gone to the Oval Plaza one day,\n
where he chatted nicely with a few people, but through the\n
course of one conversation, managed to anger one with whom\n
he was talking, Lironah.\n
You're a MADMAN!, Lironah said  With this, Cathbad's\n
annoyance turned fully and completely into anger.\n
Holding his staff horizontal with both hands, he gave it a\n
shove towards Lironah, and though she is some ten feet back,\n
she reeled back as if struck, landing on her rump.\n
What Cathbad did not know is that he siezed Saidin, and with\n
the shove of his staff, wove air into a similar force that\n
shoved Lironah backwards.\n
Then, all too aware of the sickeningly sweet churning within\n
his mind, he held onto it with all his might, both repulsed\n
and filled with wonder at what now is, a male channeller.\n
The conversation was (in that time) due to Cath having a \n
viewing of Lironah with wolves, and mentioning that she must\n
be liked by them, commanded them, or that they followed her.\n
Obviously, with no viewing talent now, I'm editing out that\n
part, but I'd really like to keep the rest.\n
Well, here's the copy of that section, as you asked for.\n
Hope you enjoy,\n
Cathbad - Illuminator Extraordinaire\n
- Channeler Mediocre\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Aug  1 09:58:06 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Cashik
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Asha'man

\nI am re-sending my rename character's background to you.  Please read and let me know if it is okay for Cashik to be in the Asha'man in Simion's place.  (Simion died and Cashik is his rename.)  All stats are being transferred -still-, and it is taking forever....  Simion was ready to take the Soldier test I think, and yet you had not set him with any of the channeling skills - all my 'grasp' 'tie' 'weave' etc skills were still set to 'unskilled'  Also, Simion was a recruit for waaaay longer than he should have been, considering all he learned, he should have had the test.  \n
I have logs to back that up as well!\n
Here is Cashik's background:\n

Cashik was born in Mayene near the coast bordering the Sea of Storms.  His father was a trader with the Seafolk.  Cashik's mother died when he was very young, from sickness, and so, his father raised the boy alone.  Cashik was born on the exact day that is the feast of Bel Tine.  It is a belief in some parts of Mayene that if a child is born on the Great Feast then a great destiny awaits them.\n

From an early age, Cashik aspired to be part of the Mayene military.  Stories of the famed Winged Guards and the resistance they led against the oppressive Tairen's made him feel proud to live in Mayene.  Even though Tear claimed Mayene as a province, Mayeners strongly refuted this, and they kept fighting to maintain their independence.\n

Cashik trained hard as a youth, studying the martial arts of the region and swordplay.  It was tough for him at first because he had little money for a tutor but he found a job trading like his father, and that was suitable for him and helped along his progress.  He had only one real goal in life, and that was to become one of the famed Winged Guards he had heard so much about.\n

He eventually made it into the military but it seemed fate had more in store for him than that.  His ability to channel manifested itself slowly and he was unaware of it at first.  Unexpected events and excessive luck led him to be given the name 'Machin' by his comrades.  They called him such because he was so fast, able to bend the flow of air about himself without realising it.  His light frame and sharp mind also helped him a great deal.  Not very strong, Cashik uses his speed to advantage in battle.\n

A number of skirmishes was really all Cashik was in his first few years serving in the Winged Guards.  The Tairen's launched attacks from time to time, in their efforts to conquer Mayene, but the Mayener's always seemed to have the upper hand, their nation much like a fortress in itself, surrounded by mountains, raging seas and of course, the drowned lands - a swampy terrain filled with dangerous predators.  The Tairen's never really stood much of a chance and so they more often resorted to assasins instead and tried to cut off Mayene's supplies.\n

Cashik was one of many very pleased Mayener's when Tear fell, and to the Dragon Reborn no less, aided by the Aiel.  The news spread quickly throughout the land, finally the fighting was over and Tear would not bother them any more, and yet, deep down they all knew that lurking around the corner a far greater battle was to come.  With the Dragon Reborn's arrival, his taking of the Stone of Tear as was written in the prophecies, there was little doubt in Cashik's mind that Tarmon Gaidon was coming.  Everyone could feel it as the land began to turn dry and burn under the endless days of scorching sun.  An un-natural heat that never seemed to end.\n

Cashik took it upon himself to volunteer straight away when Berelain travelled to the Stone.  He wanted to continue to protect Mayene, nothing mattered more to him, but it was clear to him that the battle was no longer to be fought in his home land.  Trollocs and Fades, creatures he had long thought to be myth, he found out were real.  The Aiel had come across the Spien of the World, the Dark One was starting to break free from his prison.\n

The Stone was flooded with Shadowspawn soon after his arrival, and all his training flew out of the window when that first eyeless stare settled upon him.  Unable to move, paralysed by it, he thought he would die there and then.  And yet the creature he encountered hesitated.  To this day, Cashik still remembers that event of his life more clearly than any other and it puzzles him greatly.  Some Fades were rumoured to even be fighting each other, Trollocs as well, they appeared to be in a chaotic state.\n

Because of the Dragon Reborn the shadowspawn were defeated and the people in the Stone spared, and Cashik witnessed that power with awe, lighting bolts streaking down the corridors, striking into the Fades and Trollocs and destroying them.  He felt the radiance of menace coming from the man and fell to his knees in worship of that power.  Still vey much unaware that he could channel, Cashik continued in ignorance believing that everyone could feel it, those odd times when he saw the Dragon Reborn down the corridor and felt that menace.  He never once mentioned it, believing it was simply his power radiating off him, because he was who he was.\n

It was only a few years later, in Caemlyn, that he found out what he was, when one of the newly formed group called the Asha'man came across him in the Palace.  As they tested the men who had travelled from all over the world, for the amnesty, Cashik again felt that twinge of menace.  Investigating its source brought him to the Asha'man, and after a long process he agreed to be tested as well, out of curiosity more than anything else.\n

The confirmation actually came as a real shock to him and as he considered what he should do, he found the decision made for him.  The Asha'man took him to the Black Tower despite his protests about his duty to Berelain.  It is likely that the Lord Captain of the Winged Guards would have let Cashik go willingly, submitting to the will of the Dragon Reborn and so, of the Asha'man.  A letter of resignation was written and sent from Cashik and he began his life anew.\n

As a Recruit in the Black Tower, he found himself quickly humbled by the harsh regime.  Something called a 'block' Cashik found had to be broken before he could learn to channel.  Apparently his was always anger - at the Tairens.  To bring that anger out, a Tairen Soldier was the obvious choice, and it was broken with a fierce display that had him beaten to the ground until all that was left was nothingness.  He was able to hold Saidin freely from that day forth and, after he recovered, he began learning, developing particular skill with air and fire.  His restlessness at being held at the Farm was toned down by the amazing power he found he could wield.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Aug 21 11:13:45 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Anousha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker of the White Tower
\nHello Maelyn.  I seek to join the White Tower as a Novice, and to arrange\n
for the necessary RP with one of your guildees who can bring be in and get\n
me started.  I read the short story of where we currently are in the\n
time line, when I log on.  I was hoping you could enlighten me further on\n
how I can successfully join the guild, since I am some what confused on the\n
condition of Tar Valon and the White Tower.\n
\n
Here is my short Biography:\n
\n
From birth to the age of fifteen, Anousha had lived in the respectful nation\n
of Andor with both her parents.  Their house, a small but comfortable farm a\n
little west of Caemlyn's east gate and east of Four Kings, was build by\n
Anousha's father before she was born.  With the money he had, he bought the\n
lands where their house sits, and some land about it, and started up a small\n
crop farm to bring in an earning he could live on.  What he didn't expect\n
was that in this kingdom, he would meet the woman he would love, Elisha.\n
Her visit was a surprise, her carriage had broken, a wheel fractured from a\n
stray rock across the main road.  What she saw in her father was more than\n
just looks.  He was far from the most handsome man to bare this earth, but\n
he was great with words, and perhaps the exotic of his origin was an\n
attraction, and Illian far from his homeland.  He offered to fix the\n
carriage, and gave her a roof to sleep under for the night and when she\n
left, it was only two days since, when they met again at the market.  He was\n
selling his goods, she was buying her vegetables.\n
\n
Since the age of eight, Anousha would be fed the same stories by her father,\n
about life in Illian, about why he left.  The tension and the hatred between\n
the cities of Illian and Tear.  How he felt bad about being in the center of\n
it, not wanting to be part of it anymore and seeking a new life to the\n
north.  Then the trip he spent three years to save and prepare for, of the\n
adventures of a the young Illian Biron.  Anousha never grew bored of the\n
stories, hoping he might write a book of it.  She always sat and smiled when\n
her Father's eyes grew wide, and his words and expressions together brought\n
life to the story.  He could be a Gleeman, Anousha would think, but never\n
mentioned it.\n
\n
The three of them lived comfortably at their farm.  Not rich, but not\n
exactly poor.  They could afford the odd luxury, and by saving up for a\n
number of years, they bought Anousha's education.  Having an Illian Father\n
and an Andoran Mother had an affect on her accent.  Most would think she was\n
Illian, but she did speak like one, at least, not most of the time.  The odd\n
'do be' did slip from her tongue, but it came as fluent as any Illian might\n
use it.\n
\n
Hope to hear from you soon.\n
\n
Anousha\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Aug 25 20:51:30 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Nicodemus
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Couple of things
\nHow big a deal is it to add one more integer value field\n
to zedit? I want to be able to identify each zone as a\n
certain country or region (Andor, Cairhien, SF, etc).  That\n
way players make money according to whichever region they're\n
RPing in, not where they're from originally.  Otherwise\n
everybody would just choose the richest econ country and RP\n
being from wherever they want to be.\n
\n
Also, I'm looking at making containers out of things like\n
pants and whatnot.  Currently, if you do that, the pants\n
can't have armor values.  I was thinking about recoding it\n
somehow (either so they can be both armor and a container,\n
and the values for each don't overlap).  What do you think?\n
\n
-Nico\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct  5 12:19:52 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Theodoric
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Theodoric's Background
\n`7CC`6: `7Morodrim Theodoric
\n\n
Name: Theodoric al'Daen\n
Origin: Unknown\n
Age: 30\n
\n
Theodoric was raised in an orphanage in Caemlyn when discovered by two women who\n
ran the orphanage off the main road leading from Caelmyn to Tar Valon when he\n
was a baby. He had apparently been left to die.\n
\n
The women who ran the orphanage were cruel. They raised their children more as\n
slaves than as loved wards, putting the children to work cooking, cleaning and\n
begging on the streets, keeping them in check with either promises of putting\n
the children out in the cold to fend for themselves or beating a fear of leaving\n
into them.\n
\n
Naturally, Theodoric was a part of this vicious upbringing, as well as the abuse\n
that came from the older children in the orphanage. He was a small child, thin\n
with an odd appearance. This was more than enough reason to be singled out by the\n
others for teasing and fights and other types of more disturbing abuse. Thus, it\n
was early on in life that Theodoric withdrew into himself, becoming a withdrawn\n
and cold boy with no care or love for anything in the world. Another important\n
development in this stage of his life was the first manifestation of his ability\n
to channel. Certain situations in the orphanage, the most terrible ones, would\n
trigger a reaction in the boy that he could not describe or control, but which\n
would help him nonetheless. He found that, when that trigger went off inside him,\n
he would "lash out" at the person or people involved, causing varying types of\n
reactions in the victims. Some would feel tremendous pain, others go into fits of\n
convulsions. Once, he was pushed so far that his reaction killed the other person.\n
It was at this time, in his mid-teen years, that the two orphanage women kicked\n
him out on the street, now afraid that his whispered power would eventually be\n
turned on them.\n
\n
Theodoric travelled out of Caemlyn, begging his way at first. His thoroughly\n
ingrained psychotic qualities coupled with his poverty lead him quickly from\n
begging to more rewarding, if not permanent, means of satisfying his needs. He\n
would rob people for their money and he even killed two or three of his victims,\n
with no care for the consequences. In turn, his lifestyle also exposed him to\n
bigger, stronger and meaner people who would in turn rob him. Twice, attempts were\n
made to kill him, but his innate, self-defense mechanism would kick in, and twice\n
he killed a man without even touching him.\n
\n
In his mid-twenties, Theodoric tired even of this life and left the city to travel\n
the lands. He travelled east to Cairhien, where he hired on as a nobleman's spy,\n
using his ability with a dagger and his cold nature to serve his master. For five\n
years, he has been working for this nobleman, which has now brought him to Caemlyn\n
again.\n
\n
His innate ability to cause pain and reactions under extreme duress is obviously\n
a manifestation of his ability to channel. He has the potential to be a powerful\n
channeler if given the proper training and being in Caemlyn will give him the\n
necessary exposure to the Asha'man to allow him to leave his current employment\n
for their ranks.\n
\n
Note:\n
If you are willing to credit me with training to a full rank in the Asha'man based\n
on past experience, then this background ends just after the Asha'man were found.\n
Theodoric joined among the first of the recruits, displayed a thirst to learn the\n
ability to focus and control his power as well as a cold, calculating, uncaring\n
manner with which he could kill. He is now a seasoned Asha'man (or whatever rank\n
you find appropriate), dangerous in his lack of human nature and channelling power.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct  5 12:19:52 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Theodoric
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Theodoric's Background

using his ability with a dagger and his cold nature to serve his master. For five\n
years, he has been working for this nobleman, which has now brought him to Caemlyn\n
again.\n
\n
His innate ability to cause pain and reactions under extreme duress is obviously\n
a manifestation of his ability to channel. He has the potential to be a powerful\n
channeler if given the proper training and being in Caemlyn will give him the\n
necessary exposure to the Asha'man to allow him to leave his current employment\n
for their ranks.\n
\n
Note:\n
If you are willing to credit me with training to a full rank in the Asha'man based\n
on past experience, then this background ends just after the Asha'man were found.\n
Theodoric joined among the first of the recruits, displayed a thirst to learn the\n
ability to focus and control his power as well as a cold, calculating, uncaring\n
manner with which he could kill. He is now a seasoned Asha'man (or whatever rank\n
you find appropriate), dangerous in his lack of human nature and channelling power.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct  5 12:19:52 2005\n`7From`6:`7 Theodoric
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Theodoric's Background
\n`7CC`6: `7Morodrim Theodoric
\n\n
Name: Theodoric al'Daen\n
Origin: Unknown\n
Age: 30\n
\n
Theodoric was raised in an orphanage in Caemlyn when discovered by two women who\n
ran the orphanage off the main road leading from Caelmyn to Tar Valon when he\n
was a baby. He had apparently been left to die.\n
\n
The women who ran the orphanage were cruel. They raised their children more as\n
slaves than as loved wards, putting the children to work cooking, cleaning and\n
begging on the streets, keeping them in check with either promises of putting\n
the children out in the cold to fend for themselves or beating a fear of leaving\n
into them.\n
\n
Naturally, Theodoric was a part of this vicious upbringing, as well as the abuse\n
that came from the older children in the orphanage. He was a small child, thin\n
with an odd appearance. This was more than enough reason to be singled out by the\n
others for teasing and fights and other types of more disturbing abuse. Thus, it\n
was early on in life that Theodoric withdrew into himself, becoming a withdrawn\n
and cold boy with no care or love for anything in the world. Another important\n
development in this stage of his life was the first manifestation of his ability\n
to channel. Certain situations in the orphanage, the most terrible ones, would\n
trigger a reaction in the boy that he could not describe or control, but which\n
would help him nonetheless. He found that, when that trigger went off inside him,\n
he would "lash out" at the person or people involved, causing varying types of\n
reactions in the victims. Some would feel tremendous pain, others go into fits of\n
convulsions. Once, he was pushed so far that his reaction killed the other person.\n
It was at this time, in his mid-teen years, that the two orphanage women kicked\n
him out on the street, now afraid that his whispered power would eventually be\n
turned on them.\n
\n
Theodoric travelled out of Caemlyn, begging his way at first. His thoroughly\n
ingrained psychotic qualities coupled with his poverty lead him quickly from\n
begging to more rewarding, if not permanent, means of satisfying his needs. He\n
would rob people for their money and he even killed two or three of his victims,\n
with no care for the consequences. In turn, his lifestyle also exposed him to\n
bigger, stronger and meaner people who would in turn rob him. Twice, attempts were\n
made to kill him, but his innate, self-defense mechanism would kick in, and twice\n
he killed a man without even touching him.\n
\n
In his mid-twenties, Theodoric tired even of this life and left the city to travel\n
the lands. He travelled east to Cairhien, where he hired on as a nobleman's spy,\n
using his ability with a dagger and his cold nature to serve his master. For five\n
years, he has been working for this nobleman, which has now brought him to Caemlyn\n
again.\n
\n
His innate ability to cause pain and reactions under extreme duress is obviously\n
a manifestation of his ability to channel. He has the potential to be a powerful\n
channeler if given the proper training and being in Caemlyn will give him the\n
necessary exposure to the Asha'man to allow him to leave his current employment\n
for their ranks.\n
\n
Note:\n
If you are willing to credit me with training to a full rank in the Asha'man based\n
on past experience, then this background ends just after the Asha'man were found.\n
Theodoric joined among the first of the recruits, displayed a thirst to learn the\n
ability to focus and control his power as well as a cold, calculating, uncaring\n
manner with which he could kill. He is now a seasoned Asha'man (or whatever rank\n
you find appropriate), dangerous in his lack of human nature and channelling power.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Oct 17 20:09:26 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Marek
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background

\nMarek was born to an Andoran man, Kailen Deligaris and a Saldean woman, Misha Rosham. Where he was born is a mystery to him, and to make it worse his parents hardly remember. They were always on the move, particularly as Merchants or at least that was the faade. Kailen was still young when he began thieving, killing, stealing and smuggling. \n

Starting in Caemlyn, he slowly worked his way around Andor, never staying in one place for long, fearing he might overstay his welcome. Wherever there was good "business", Kailen traveled there. When he was in his mid twenties, he ended up in Saldea where he met Misha. After meeting Misha and falling in love, he wanted to try and keep his business honest as possible, but his past caught up with him and the money was too great to turn away. \n

Misha, as good a woman as she was, cared little about his Kailen's business. After a few years of dating, and working together, they married. Once Misha was with child, near their early thirties, the two decided to take to the road and keep on the move so that no one knew where they were. Marek was born somewhere along those travels along the way.\n

Kailen decided it would be best after a few years of traveling to move back to Andor, and "set up shop" so to speak. With the money the two made, and Marek now a few years old, they bought a small house near the woods nearest Caemlyn, Kailen's old territory. It was there that The Red Dagger was born. By the time Marek was ten years old, Kailen had seven men that served him, with skills that are not considered lawful in most cases.\n

They were and are to this day his eyes, his ears, his dagger and sword. Misha fell into the background in most of this, being a loving mother was all that she worried about, regardless of the life she undoubtedly knew her son would someday have. At the age of fourteen, Kailen began teaching Marek how to throw daggers, climb trees, houses and walls, pick locks, and fight with daggers and short swords. By the time Marek was eighteen, Kailen's grasp on the business had tightened and his power increased by much, and his reach by far.\n

Owning several lucrative establishments around the known world, owning a mine in the Mountain of Mists, and of course expanding The Red Dagger. The group that was once a single man now consisted of Kailen and thirteen other men. It was at this point that Marek was initiated into the group, and his training truly began.\n

Each of the men that served Kailen then had their chance to teach Marek the trade that each specialized in. Marek was taught about everything from poisons to traps, from tightrope walking to pick locking, from hunting to combat. He was going to be part of the team soon and they needed him to be at his best.\n
\n
There it is in all of its glory :-P Feel free to mail me back around what you think of it, or just talk to me online.\n
Any questions, comments, concerns, flames, etc. Just tell me.\n
\n
Travis\n
Player of: Eradin, Jerryn, Owen, Draen, Marek.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Oct 25 14:22:44 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Hadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Hadren
\n  Hey, I was talking with Nico, and he told me I needed to get your \n
approval for this, so here goes.\n
\n
\n
Hadren was born the son of an innkeeper in northeastern Andor, about \n
halfway between Caemlyn and the Cairhienen border.  There he lived \n
until he was in his mid-twenties, enjoying the company of both the \n
long time patrons from the small community in which the Inn was based, \n
and the frequent travellers passing through from one country to \n
another.\n
\n
Eventually, when he was about twenty-five years old, Hadren left the \n
Inn for a few years to go wandering about, specifically with the \n
purpose of learning more about people, and how they interacted with \n
eachother: something he had always found fascinating.  He spent the \n
next five or so years wandering about the countryside, everywhere from \n
Tarabon to the Borderlands, eventually noticing that his travels had \n
taken him close to home.  He returned, once more aiding his father in \n
running the inn, until several years later his father finally died.\n
\n
With Hadren now past fourty years of age, he finally made the \n
decision that in order to try to put to use some of what he learned \n
while wandering, he was going to sell his family home, the Inn at \n
which he had spent over three fourths of his life.  It didn't take \n
long to convince one of the merchants who was always passing through \n
that the fairly profitable Inn at a good location would be a \n
worthwhile investment, and he left most of the staff behind to run the \n
place, as the merchant himself was not likely to stay to oversee the \n
operations.  With that money, he picked up and began to travel to \n
Caemlyn.\n
\n
Once arrived, he set out to find a building suitable for his needs: \n
what he is seeking is a little different from what he once owned.  \n
What he wants is more of a bar and restaurant than a full inn, with \n
only a few rooms above for those who aren't able to go elsewhere.  The \n
fact that real estate in Caemlyn is quite a bit more expensive than in \n
the countryside of Andor means that the place he'll be able to afford \n
will be be on the small side, rather than sprawling like the Inn he \n
once ran.  Likely, it will not be in the upper-scale district of \n
Caemlyn, but rather directly in the center of the middle-class \n
district: this is perfect for his needs, giving him a fairly close \n
area with which he can work.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Nov 14 16:53:13 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Mithrid
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG

\nMithrid was born an Arafellan High Lord, his house was the Hyaras, not heard of by most. He was the only son of the High Lord Mithriddin, supposed to grow to be the greatest warrior ever of the Hyara house, and the next High Lord of the house. House Hyara was noble and did not tolerate Shaitan. They usually made Lords of battle, who would fight the evil along to Borderlands. Mithrid though, never received his full training from the Hyara house, only a year he was trained, and his weapon skills adequate with a sword and small with a bow. That was at the age of six, when his house died to a raid of shadow spawn and darkfriends. \n

As the next High Lord he was escorted by six Lords, supposed to remain alive to raise the Hyara house again. As they traveled, shadow spawn followed, with darkfriends, allowing the Hyara house to survive and be reborn later would be a crushing blow against Shaitan and all his servants would feel his rage. As a final, crude attempt to save Mithrids life, the Lords fought against thirty darkfriends, a raging battle. Each Lord brought down eight darkfriends for his death, and one by one they fell from sword and knife strikes. When only two Lords survived to take the High Lord of the Hyaras towards Tar Valon. As they were just about to stop for a meal, one of the Lords turned out to be a darkfriend. Mithrid ran as the steel clashed, fleeing towards the Borderlands. He was found almost dead by a farmer, who brought him into his home.\n

After living on the farm till he was sixteen, manhood in the Hyara house, Mithrid discovered he could channel, doing it in short bursts of energy where his senses were heightened momentarily and something strange happened. He left the farm he had lived in and defended from evil since twelve because of this power. Mithrid had a solid idea in his mind to rebuild the Hyara house in its glory. As he ventured into Chachin again after ten years on that farm, almost everyone had forgotten about the Hyara house. Moving towards Arafel, his home, where people were sure to remember. When he arrived he was surprised by feuding of the houses in Arafel. Asking a few houses that the Hyara house had assisted once in a while brought frowns and loss of memory. Only a few remembered, and fewer helped. \n

He gathered only twenty people to help rebuild his house. They tried four times but during the night each time what they had built would be in ruins in the morning. They set guards who would disappear in the night. Giving up hope on building the Hyara house again, he set out to meet the Lord, if he had survived, who fought the fake darkfriend Lord. To Caemlyn Mithrid ventured. The long walk brought him misery. Along his travels he met an old man, who smiled kindly.\n

The old man took Mithrid in for a month, a long time. A claim that made Mithrid stay was the old man said he was dieing, and could help him before it happened. On discovering that the old man could channel years ago brought small fear to Mithrill. Apparently the old man had been a false dragon at one point. Escaping Aes Sedai hold and coming to live in this cave for his life. The old man knew that Mithrid could channel at the rapid things that happened around him, desks lit on fire, chairs hovered, and the cave changed formations some times. Telling Mithrill that he could help him learn to control his channeling, the old man set off to the task before he died. Mithrid learned to touch the true source using the Void.\n

Then he learned a few weaves before the old man died, how to use air as a shield or weapon, how to use fire and air to create light balls, and finally how to use air and fire to create a fireball to throw at enemies. Then the old man died after teaching him one more twist to Saidin, how to tie your weaves. Leaving and heading for Caemlyn, Mithrid met a traveling warrior going to Caemlyn. Befriending the man and arriving in Caemlyn, he found that the real Lord that had guarded him \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Nov 15 16:00:44 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Mithrid
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Channeling

\nMithrid was born an Arafellan High Lord, his house was the Hyaras, not heard of by most. He was the only son of the High Lord Mithriddin, supposed to grow to be the greatest warrior ever of the Hyara house, and the next High Lord of the house. House Hyara was noble and did not tolerate Shaitan. They usually made Lords of battle, who would fight the evil along to Borderlands. Mithrid though, never received his full training from the Hyara house, only a year he was trained, and his weapon skills adequate with a sword and small with a bow. That was at the age of six, when his house died to a raid of shadow spawn and darkfriends. As the next High Lord he was escorted by six Lords, supposed to remain alive to raise the Hyara house again. \n

As they traveled, shadow spawn followed, with darkfriends, allowing the Hyara house to survive and be reborn later would be a crushing blow against Shaitan and all his servants would feel his rage. As a final, crude attempt to save Mithrids life, the Lords fought against thirty darkfriends, a raging battle. Each Lord brought down eight darkfriends for his death, and one by one they fell from sword and knife strikes. When only two Lords survived to take the High Lord of the Hyaras towards Tar Valon. As they were just about to stop for a meal, one of the Lords turned out to be a darkfriend. Mithrid ran as the steel clashed, fleeing towards the Borderlands. He was found almost dead by a farmer, who brought him into his home.\n

After living on the farm till he was sixteen, manhood in the Hyara house, Mithrid discovered he could channel, doing it in short bursts of energy where his senses were heightened momentarily and something strange happened. He left the farm he had lived in and defended from evil since twelve because of this power. Mithrid had a solid idea in his mind to rebuild the Hyara house in its glory. As he ventured into Chachin again after ten years on that farm, almost everyone had forgotten about the Hyara house. Moving towards Arafel, his home, where people were sure to remember. When he arrived he was surprised by feuding of the houses in Arafel. Asking a few houses that the Hyara house had assisted once in a while brought frowns and loss of memory. \n

Only a few remembered, and fewer helped. He gathered only twenty people to help rebuild his house. They tried four times but during the night each time what they had built would be in ruins in the morning. They set guards who would disappear in the night. Giving up hope on building the Hyara house again, he set out to meet the Lord, if he had survived, who fought the fake darkfriend Lord. To Caemlyn Mithrid ventured. The long walk brought him misery. Along his travels he met an old man, who smiled kindly.\n

The old man took Mithrid in for a month, a long time. A claim that made Mithrid stay was the old man said he was dieing, and could help him before it happened. On discovering that the old man could channel years ago brought small fear to Mithrill. Apparently the old man had been a false dragon at one point. Escaping Aes Sedai hold and coming to live in this cave for his life. The old man knew that Mithrid could channel at the rapid things that happened around him, desks lit on fire, chairs hovered, and the cave changed formations some times. Telling Mithrill that he could help him learn to control his channeling, the old man set off to the task before he died. Mithrid learned to touch the true source using the Void. Then he learned a few weaves before the old man died, how to use air as a shield or weapon, how to use fire and air to create light balls, and finally how to use air and fire to create a fireball to throw at enemies. Then the old man died after teaching him one more twist to Saidin, how to tie your weaves. \n

Leaving and heading for Caemlyn, Mithrid met a traveling warrior going to Caemlyn. Befriending the man and arriving in Caemlyn, he found that the real Lord that had guarded him towards Tar Valon was dead. He continued on though, looking for the darkfriend for revenge\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Nov 17 17:05:46 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 bg

\nTelen was born in southern Arafel outside of a small town by a swift running river.  His parents trapped for furs and raised livestock for wool, milk and meat.  He has relatives in Shol Arbola who export into Shienar and occasionally make the longer trip to Tar Valon to exchange goods for profit.  He stays with them during the long winters and learns the business, writing and tallying, and he is given swords at twelve.  Summers, with spring and fall a short violent reckoning between warmth and cold, are spent herding and hiding and farming.  It is a welcome change, the faces and personalities of the city exchanged willingly for the simple adoration and stubbornness of animals, learning to reap and sow and something too of herbal lore.\n

At fifteen summers he is at his full height and beginning to lose the ranginess of a boy.  The fall of that year, he helps put down a man turned feral, his own kin but unrecognizable, inhuman and dangerous.  The act of kindness sickens him, but he can see the reason for it, at least.  Later he will wonder if it was less kindness and more fear, but it is years later.\n

He learns his family has spawned two of these in the last century, though until seeing the animal madness, he'd assumed the tales were nothing more than fanciful exaggeration of the temper afflicting many of his city relatives.\n

When he is twenty, an Aes Sedai with a brown shawl tells his parents he must accompany her.  There is no promise he will be returned.  Evasion meets queries of why, but his mother tells him, when he travels home within two years, that they had suspected why, and she could not say how the Sedai would have known anything of their family, they are a private people, but Aes Sedai often know secret things.\n

During his time with the Aes Sedai, he discovered some things about them, and he decides there is little reason to have taken him other than infernal curiosity.  It was a monumental waste of time, at his expense, and to his family's detriment.  His mother moves back into the city when the farm dwindles, and he thinks he will be helping in his relatives thriving business.\n

It is tedious work, and he does well at it, but there is no real place for him, everything he can do, another in the family can do and better.  He becomes withdrawn and disinterested.  He returns to Tar Valon and demands healing.  He is told the same thing as before he returned to Arafel, that they have already healed him.  Whatever health he has, he is as whole as the One Power can make him.  It is enough to make him believe the Three Oaths a political myth.\n

Feeling cheated and wrecked, he retrieves gold with a note gifted him and adds it to pay he has saved from his work in Arafel.  It seems a fair amount until he puts his skills to use tallying expenses.  It might last him a year, if he did no work, in a city, much longer outside of the city, though living in an outlying town entailed varying degrees of labor, sometimes continuous, whether he wanted it or not.\n

For many reasons, instead of settling with his family in the borderland, instead of serving in the army of Arafel or Shienar, he begins traveling south for better fortune.  Away from a quiet Blight into a land newly furrowed by the heavy turning of the Wheel.  It should be interesting.  He feels he has not much to lose.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Nov 17 21:45:02 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Maelyn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Tower questions
\nI was wandering around the Tower on the builder port, \n
and a couple of questions occurred to me. One, is there\n
a map of the current layout anywhere? If so, that will\n
make this so much easier. And two, do you realize there\n
are 6 zones used in TV/Tower rooms??? Good gracious!\n
Once I either get a map or make one, I'll see what I can do\n
to cut that down substantially. And three, do you have\n
a target for how small you want the place? Personally, \n
I think we could do the Tower in one zone, maybe the grounds\n
in another. What do you think? Go from 6 to 4? Or 3? TV\n
itself uses 2, I think. I'll have to check to be sure, might\n
be 3. Anyway, just a couple of things that popped in my head.\n
TTYS\n
Mae\n
