column5: *a letter sealed with the Great Tree of Life*

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Nov 18 12:04:04 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 *a letter sealed with the Great Tree of Life*
\nRazyc,\n
\n
I am sending this to you with all haste. It appears that\n
our friend, Jerod Traemane, has had me Gated to Tear instead\n
of Tar Valon. I am headed to the river so I can charter a\n
ship heading north to Aringill and beyond. \n
\n
Lord Jerod Traemane is an Asha'man, poppet. You must avoid\n
him at all costs. He will do anything to advance his own agenda.\n
It appears that the Asha'man have entrenched themselves deeply\n
into Andoran politics. I doubt Elayne has any firm control\n
beyond what they let her have.\n
\n
I do not know what I shall do when I arrive in Tar Valon.\n
There is the threat the black-coats bring lingering over the\n
Tower, the threat of Tarmon Gai'don lingering over the world.\n
I have done my best to get things in order, but my best\n
has been woefully deficient.\n
\n
Few times in my life before have I been at a loss for what\n
to do. This is one of those times. The only thing that I can\n
suggest to you, my sweetling, is that you do your best to\n
out Jerod Traemane. You must do so in the shadows, however,\n
and prevent him from knowing it is you. I have a small purse\n
of diamonds.. the diamonds that studded my hair during your\n
birthday party. Take them. Use them as payment, if you must.\n
They are in a secret hole hidden under a wood panel in the \n
closet in the Queen's Blessing. Use them to help spread the\n
word and do what you must to bring Jerod Traemane to his\n
knees. But do not be seen to be connected with it yourself.\n
\n
I said I shall send word when I arrive at the Tower.. I\n
still will, but I do not expect you to come. You are not ready\n
to handle the difficulties that shall exist once I arrive there.\n
Be patient, be loyal, be steadfast. We shall be together once\n
more.\n
\n
I send you love with this letter. The love of a mother over\n
her blossoming young boy.. the love of a woman for her heart.\n
The love I send is tenfold now that I have been parted from\n
you. Be steadfast, my lion. We shall be together again.\n
\n
*signed simply*\n
The Blood of Tarabon\n

column5: BG for Tiaret Rohan, Accepted (Rebel Tower)

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Nov 19 00:08:29 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Tiaret
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Tiaret Rohan, Accepted (Rebel Tower)
\n \n
Rissa! This is my bg.. I have my desc!  Let me know what I\n
need to do to get guilded, mmKay?\n
\n
Tiaret was born on a spring morning to Roenal and Dahria \n
Rohan in Arad Doman. Her mother, Dahria was a tabac merchant\n
who traveled a great deal. Her father, Roenal, was a carpenter.\n
Her mother traveled a great deal leaving her to be raised\n
mostly by her father.\n
Her mother was not nearly as important of a figure in her\n
life as her father was, but she did do her motherly duties\n
in teaching Tiaret the arts of the Domani woman. She took\n
a special interest in teaching her the many ways that Domani\n
have mastered of touching a man's face.\n
Tiaret lead a rather sheltered life, often spending her\n
days as a child near her father's workbench. She marveled\n
at the way he created something from nothing, carving \n
intricate pictures into the wood, making them appear as\n
though they were always there. \n
When she was six years old, she scampered off from her\n
father's workbench. So deep into his work, he did not\n
notice her gone for nearly an hour. When he did, he rushed\n
off to find her but she was nowhere to be found. He and the\n
few servants that lived at the house searched well into the\n
night. It was only chance that one of the servants found\n
her fallen down a well, nearly overcome with exhaustion\n
and quietly whimpering for her father.\n
This caused a lifelong fear of the dark, mingled with\n
a great discomfort around water. She was always a brave\n
little girl,  but she became much less adventurous after\n
this. She grew up daddy's little girl, although she had a\n
great deal of her mother's manipulative streak. She always\n
knew how to get her father to do exactly what she wanted\n
him to. \n
When she was fifteen years old, they held a Testing for\n
girls in the main plaza of Bander Eban. Tiaret and her\n
father were there shopping and she was quite excited by\n
what was going on. When it was her turn, she beamed broadly\n
at her father never expecting the path her new life would\n
take.\n
The smile that beamed so brightly the moment before\n
she found out that she had the spark was met by a dark frown \n
from her father. She never realized that she would be forced\n
to leave her family forever. Tiaret spent the entire trip\n
to the Tower in tears. She stifled sobs during her interview\n
with the Mistress of Novices. But slowly, very slowly, she\n
became accustomed to her new life in the Tower.\n
She threw herself into her lessons. When finally she\n
became Accepted, she thrived by giving lessons to the Novices\n
and blossomed when Aes Sedai praised her. She settled into\n
her routine quite well. Quite well, that is until the day\n
the Tower split.\n
Tiaret was finishing up a Novice class when the fighting\n
started. The older Accepted was uncertain of what to do, but\n
she led the gaggle of girls behind her through a back way to\n
the Novice quarters. She commanded them to stay, and then left\n
the Novice wing to see if she could find out what was going\n
on. It was during this time that she bumped into Jasmyne\n
and Esrahd, who were fleeing the Tower. They took her with\n
them.\n
Tiaret followed Jasmyne along, learning and gathering\n
what she could from the Yellow. They settled in Salidar for\n
a short time, but Jasmyne, Esrahd and Tiaret left the Little\n
Tower and headed towards Caemlyn. Jasmyne had plans for the\n
girl, and gained permission to take her with her as long\n
as her studies were kept up.\n

column5: BG for Tiaret Rohan, Accepted (Rebel Tower)

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Nov 19 00:08:29 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Tiaret
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Tiaret Rohan, Accepted (Rebel Tower)
\n \n
Rissa! This is my bg.. I have my desc!  Let me know what I\n
need to do to get guilded, mmKay?\n
\n
Tiaret was born on a spring morning to Roenal and Dahria \n
Rohan in Arad Doman. Her mother, Dahria was a tabac merchant\n
who traveled a great deal. Her father, Roenal, was a carpenter.\n
Her mother traveled a great deal leaving her to be raised\n
mostly by her father.\n
Her mother was not nearly as important of a figure in her\n
life as her father was, but she did do her motherly duties\n
in teaching Tiaret the arts of the Domani woman. She took\n
a special interest in teaching her the many ways that Domani\n
have mastered of touching a man's face.\n
Tiaret lead a rather sheltered life, often spending her\n
days as a child near her father's workbench. She marveled\n
at the way he created something from nothing, carving \n
intricate pictures into the wood, making them appear as\n
though they were always there. \n
When she was six years old, she scampered off from her\n
father's workbench. So deep into his work, he did not\n
notice her gone for nearly an hour. When he did, he rushed\n
off to find her but she was nowhere to be found. He and the\n
few servants that lived at the house searched well into the\n
night. It was only chance that one of the servants found\n
her fallen down a well, nearly overcome with exhaustion\n
and quietly whimpering for her father.\n
This caused a lifelong fear of the dark, mingled with\n
a great discomfort around water. She was always a brave\n
little girl,  but she became much less adventurous after\n
this. She grew up daddy's little girl, although she had a\n
great deal of her mother's manipulative streak. She always\n
knew how to get her father to do exactly what she wanted\n
him to. \n
When she was fifteen years old, they held a Testing for\n
girls in the main plaza of Bander Eban. Tiaret and her\n
father were there shopping and she was quite excited by\n
what was going on. When it was her turn, she beamed broadly\n
at her father never expecting the path her new life would\n
take.\n
The smile that beamed so brightly the moment before\n
she found out that she had the spark was met by a dark frown \n
from her father. She never realized that she would be forced\n
to leave her family forever. Tiaret spent the entire trip\n
to the Tower in tears. She stifled sobs during her interview\n
with the Mistress of Novices. But slowly, very slowly, she\n
became accustomed to her new life in the Tower.\n
She threw herself into her lessons. When finally she\n
became Accepted, she thrived by giving lessons to the Novices\n
and blossomed when Aes Sedai praised her. She settled into\n
her routine quite well. Quite well, that is until the day\n
the Tower split.\n
Tiaret was finishing up a Novice class when the fighting\n
started. The older Accepted was uncertain of what to do, but\n
she led the gaggle of girls behind her through a back way to\n
the Novice quarters. She commanded them to stay, and then left\n
the Novice wing to see if she could find out what was going\n
on. It was during this time that she bumped into Jasmyne\n
and Esrahd, who were fleeing the Tower. They took her with\n
them.\n
Tiaret followed Jasmyne along, learning and gathering\n
what she could from the Yellow. They settled in Salidar for\n
a short time, but Jasmyne, Esrahd and Tiaret left the Little\n
Tower and headed towards Caemlyn. Jasmyne had plans for the\n
girl, and gained permission to take her with her as long\n
as her studies were kept up.\n

column5: BG for Tiaret Rohan, Accepted (Rebel Tower)

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Nov 22 08:22:00 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Sabrina
\n`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower vs Asha'man
\nHi Lucardo\n
I'm going to be another voice of sanity in defense of the White Tower and the tilt of power toward the Asha'man. \n

1) I would hope that Rand has enough control over his leaders to dissuade such a public attack, especially with the Last Battle on the horizon. It weakens the Light powers, the Asha'man and the Aes Sedai, which only gives the dark powers (like myself) more advantage when the Last Battle happens. Not like I dont want the Great Lord to win, but I dont think the Light Powers would want that, so why do something which would sacrifice everyone?\n

2)Along those same lines, with the Seanchan pushing through Murandy, it would be suicide to engage in warfare when an alliance without blood shed would be more beneficial, practical and probable. I hope Rand feels the tug and puts Peyton, and his followers, down like the rabid dogs they are. I'm sure Kinje would be thrilled to administer the wine cup. :)\n

3) The White Tower isnt going to roll over and die just because the Asha'man decide to attack. With the warning, the Tower -should- have started preparing. Wards and the like which would target the channeling of Saidin, etc. Drills in the case that Asha'man invade. If anyone knew that the Asha'man can gate, then it would be a matter of being prepared for it. There's a reason not even Artur Hawkwing could penetrate the Island.\n

3) This is a power-grab. (Name) tells you, '*grumbles*  Peyton was talking to me in tells last night.  He did this solely so he could have power over the Aes Sedai, the Saidin relics, access to the Tower library, etc.  It's a power grab, nothing more.' - Just because someone wants all this power, doesnt mean it should be -allowed- to happen AND should be seen as a sign of insubordination to Rand, which means anyone following Peyton is considered a traitor.\n

4) Without conflict, the game is no longer fun anymore. When there are certain figures, firmly in place, such as Rand's puppet.. er Analinde.. in Cairhein :) or Elayne in Caemlyn... then Putting the Asha in charge of the White Tower? Then why bother? Its the thrill of the power struggle. If everyone is made to play nice....Again I ask, Why bother? I might as well go back to Warcraft to get my conflict. \n
\n
Sabrina, player of\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Nov 27 11:50:03 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Volkare
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Death of a Weaponsmaster
\nSmoke recently smudged the cold winter sky above Caemlyn, the flames emanating from the\n
site of Ajara's Training and Tactics, the business and home of Gerrit Ajara, a noted\n
instructor in the martial arts. Master Ajara's body was found within. Strangely, reports\n
vary as to what caused his death. The most obvious explanation is his crushed ribs,\n
broken by some heavy impact. Some voices, however, whisper that it was poison that killed\n
the weaponsmaster, as when the Guard arrived, he was still alive, but unable to move.\n
What most agree upon is the fact that the weaponsmaster had an altercation with Lord\n
Jerod Traemane, High Seat of House Traemane and a Captain of the Queen's Guard immediately\n
preceding his death. Rumor says that the Lord was furious, yelling wildly at Master Ajara\n
while the trainer simply stood calmly by. It is unclear how the fire started, but the\n
upper floor, which was evidently Master Ajara's living quarters, was burned out. The\n
lower floor, where Master Ajara conducted his business, was almost unharmed, as melting\n
snow put the fire out when the roof collapsed. This is the second incident to take place\n
at Ajara's Training and Tactics within the last week involving fire, although the last\n
event merely damaged the building.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 30 14:14:25 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Kinje
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Mithramidimaruthid
\nProblem A) House Hyara.\n
While there could easily be a House Hyara, the idea of a house \n
producing multiple Lords of Battle, and yet never being well known, is \n
paradoxical.\n
Suggestion A) If you wish to be the member of an Arafellin Noble \n
House, make it a minor one without multiple Battle Lords in the past.\n
\n
Problem B) High Lord abroad?\n
A High Lord of a Noble House that abandoned that House would not \n
remain High Lord long, as the House would either fall apart, or \n
appoint a new leader.\n
Suggestion B) Instead of being a High Lord, try being a Lord that's a \n
few steps away from taking command of the House: there's more \n
flexibility that way.\n
\n
Problem C) Wilder?\n
Being a Wilder seldom ends well, and Wilders nearly always form some \n
kind of block from handling the One Power freely, yet no block is \n
mentioned.\n
While you can continue to apply as a Wilder, keep in mind that playing \n
any sort of untrained Male Channeler is an extremely dangerous path to \n
take.  With both better trained Asha'man and Aes Sedai on the lookout \n
for potential Darkfriends, you're unlikely to find much for allies \n
with that as your background.\n
Suggestion C) If you wish to play a channeler, play an untrained one.  \n
If you wish to play a Wilder, decide on a block, conditions that must \n
be met before channeling is possible.\n
\n
Problem D) Old Man in a Cave?\n
Until recently, there was no training available to Male Channelers, so \n
all Male Channelers were Wilders.  Wilders begin manifesting the One \n
Power a short time after puberty, and generally go mad or are killed \n
within few years.  While that time could potentially be stretched out, \n
there have not been any old male channelers in thousands of years.  \n
Further, even if the man in the cave was young, there have been no \n
false dragon male channelers that evaded capture in recorded history \n
save Mazrim Taim.  The last false dragon who could channel was Guaire \n
Amalasan, who was gentled nearly sixty years before present day in the \n
MUD.\n
Solution D) Let your character begin play untrained in channeling.  \n
There's no realistic way to have any sort of tutoring on Saidin have \n
been given to him before the start of the books.\n
\n
Problem E) Trollocs\n
There are no Trollocs in Caemlyn.  South of the borderlands they're \n
considered fairly widely to be a myth.\n
Solution E) Hunting darkfriends might work, but remember that Andor \n
has its own laws and law enforcement.  They do not take kindly to \n
freelance workers meddling.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 30 18:14:03 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Termiane
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Caemlyn Sellswords
\n`7CC`6: `7Jonah Ilorin
\n\n
A report on the possibility of gathering a company of mercenaries in Caemlyn with an eye\n
towards using them to disrupt the defense of Andor when the time comes.\n
\n
Compiled by Lieutenant Termiane Koronel.\n
\n
Given the number of sellswords currently looking for work in the city of Caemlyn,\n
I believe it is possible to start a hiring company to find work for them. The benefit\n
of this would be that when the time comes, we could ensure that all of their contracts\n
led back to the Ever Victorious Army, and they were hired to strike targets of our\n
choice. This would require some prior planning, including some outlay of initial funds\n
to hire a location and staff for the hiring company, someone who speaks without apparent\n
Seanchan accent to be the head of the hiring company, and people in place prepared to\n
hire the mercenaries when the time is right.\n
\n
An outlay of some ten gold a month should be sufficient to rent a room at an inn, or\n
some twenty gold a month for a storefront if we wish some greater respectability.\n
Either way, some additional funding will be necessary to hire a few mercenaries, because\n
a hiring company without references will not attract other sellswords. Once these first\n
mercenaries have been hired, I believe that the business will become self-sustaining to\n
some degree. At that point, we only need have people and funds ready to hire the sell-\n
swords when we are ready to use them to strike at selected targets within Andor.\n
\n
Throughout this process, there will need to be someone in charge of being the primary\n
contact for the mercenaries being hired. This should be someone trusted with the truth\n
of the mission, but also someone who can blend into the masses of the oathbreakers without\n
attracting too much notice. This person should likely be different from the apparent\n
financial backer, as the latter role will need stature and respectability, while the\n
former will need credit amongst sell-swords, which is something different entirely.\n
\n
This hiring company would not be large enough to be of great use immediately, and would\n
take some time to build into a useful force, but I believe that it could certainly take\n
out key targets more covertly than any unit of the Ever Victorious Army, simply because\n
it can blend into the local populace.\n
\n
All Glory to the Empress, may She live forever.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 30 18:14:03 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Termiane
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Caemlyn Sellswords
\n`7CC`6: `7Jonah Ilorin
\n\n
A report on the possibility of gathering a company of mercenaries in Caemlyn with an eye\n
towards using them to disrupt the defense of Andor when the time comes.\n
\n
Compiled by Lieutenant Termiane Koronel.\n
\n
Given the number of sellswords currently looking for work in the city of Caemlyn,\n
I believe it is possible to start a hiring company to find work for them. The benefit\n
of this would be that when the time comes, we could ensure that all of their contracts\n
led back to the Ever Victorious Army, and they were hired to strike targets of our\n
choice. This would require some prior planning, including some outlay of initial funds\n
to hire a location and staff for the hiring company, someone who speaks without apparent\n
Seanchan accent to be the head of the hiring company, and people in place prepared to\n
hire the mercenaries when the time is right.\n
\n
An outlay of some ten gold a month should be sufficient to rent a room at an inn, or\n
some twenty gold a month for a storefront if we wish some greater respectability.\n
Either way, some additional funding will be necessary to hire a few mercenaries, because\n
a hiring company without references will not attract other sellswords. Once these first\n
mercenaries have been hired, I believe that the business will become self-sustaining to\n
some degree. At that point, we only need have people and funds ready to hire the sell-\n
swords when we are ready to use them to strike at selected targets within Andor.\n
\n
Throughout this process, there will need to be someone in charge of being the primary\n
contact for the mercenaries being hired. This should be someone trusted with the truth\n
of the mission, but also someone who can blend into the masses of the oathbreakers without\n
attracting too much notice. This person should likely be different from the apparent\n
financial backer, as the latter role will need stature and respectability, while the\n
former will need credit amongst sell-swords, which is something different entirely.\n
\n
This hiring company would not be large enough to be of great use immediately, and would\n
take some time to build into a useful force, but I believe that it could certainly take\n
out key targets more covertly than any unit of the Ever Victorious Army, simply because\n
it can blend into the local populace.\n
\n
All Glory to the Empress, may She live forever.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Dec  1 18:28:49 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Parol
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Travel Time to TV

\nTheoretically, it should take 1 week RL time to get to Tar Valon from Caemlyn. That would be somewhere around 3 weeks IC time. You could probably cut that down by killing horses, maybe to 3 RL days (yes, I underestimated Sadren's travel time from Tear). Going to Aringill than up-river would probably be about the same. Going through 7-8 horses would probably be cheaper than 1-2 horses and paying a ship to leave immediately and not stop between Aringill and TV. However, neither would be cheap by any means.\n
\n
-Parol.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Dec 19 12:13:06 2006\n`7From`6:`7 Rissa
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background
\nYour background has been disapproved.  Below is a brief list of the key reasons why.  Please revise as requested or try for a new character background entirely.  Thank you.\n
\n
Problem A) House Hyara.\n
While there could easily be a House Hyara, the idea of a house\n
producing multiple Lords of Battle, and yet never being well known, is\n
paradoxical.\n
Suggestion A) If you wish to be the member of an Arafellin Noble\n
House, make it a minor one without multiple Battle Lords in the past.\n
\n
Problem B) High Lord abroad?\n
A High Lord of a Noble House that abandoned that House would not\n
remain High Lord long, as the House would either fall apart, or\n
appoint a new leader.\n
Suggestion B) Instead of being a High Lord, try being a Lord that's a\n
few steps away from taking command of the House: there's more\n
flexibility that way.\n
\n
Problem C) Wilder?\n
Being a Wilder seldom ends well, and Wilders nearly always form some\n
kind of block from handling the One Power freely, yet no block is\n
mentioned.\n
While you can continue to apply as a Wilder, keep in mind that playing\n
any sort of untrained Male Channeler is an extremely dangerous path to\n
take.  With both better trained Asha'man and Aes Sedai on the lookout\n
for potential Darkfriends, you're unlikely to find much for allies\n
with that as your background.\n
Suggestion C) If you wish to play a channeler, play an untrained one.\n
If you wish to play a Wilder, decide on a block, conditions that must\n
be met before channeling is possible.\n
\n
Problem D) Old Man in a Cave?\n
Until recently, there was no training available to Male Channelers, so\n
all Male Channelers were Wilders.  Wilders begin manifesting the One\n
Power a short time after puberty, and generally go mad or are killed\n
within few years.  While that time could potentially be stretched out,\n
there have not been any old male channelers in thousands of years.\n
Further, even if the man in the cave was young, there have been no\n
false dragon male channelers that evaded capture in recorded history\n
save Mazrim Taim.  The last false dragon who could channel was Guaire\n
Amalasan, who was gentled nearly sixty years before present day in the\n
MUD.\n
Solution D) Let your character begin play untrained in channeling.\n
There's no realistic way to have any sort of tutoring on Saidin have\n
been given to him before the start of the books.\n
\n
Problem E) Trollocs\n
There are no Trollocs in Caemlyn.  South of the borderlands they're\n
considered fairly widely to be a myth.\n
Solution E) Hunting darkfriends might work, but remember that Andor\n
has its own laws and law enforcement.  They do not take kindly to\n
freelance workers meddling.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan  8 12:41:49 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Raja
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Raja's background
\nOki, here's what I got so far. Let me know if I need to work on it more.\n
\n
Galantin is an old House of Cairhien which has never really been in the higher circles of power in the \n
country. Having lands mostly southwest of the country, besides the river, the House and has mostly been \n
involved in trade rather than the politics of Cairhien, though its importance as a strong financial ally grew \n
over the centuries.\n
\n
Trading ventures through the Silk Road and ships to Shara and trade with the Sea Folk, House Galantin has \n
built up a considerable array of businesses and a huge amount of wealth. There are now banks and \n
companies owned by the House operating in most nations in one form or another.\n
\n
Over the years this wealth and financial influence has made House Galantin a favourable ally in the Game \n
of Houses\n
not because of its almost non-existent political influence but because of its financials. The ray \n
less sun that is the symbol of House Galantin is often referred to as the Coin, and never in a favourable \n
manner.\n
\n
The small House is being led by Raja Sheal Galantin, a position he rose to only recently when his older \n
brothers, his parents and his immediate family where lost in the Shaido War.\n
\n
He is 32 years old now, and has lived all his life in luxury. He has had private tutors since he could walk \n
and has dabbled in almost every subject throughout his rather young life, settling to focus on history and \n
artefacts besides the compulsory economics and commerce, much taught to him by his own father, Rohanes \n
Galantin.\n
\n
Given anything he desired whether he deserved it or not has had its marks on the young man and the only \n
real loss he has ever felt was the death of his mother when Raja was 18 years old. It was also then that Raja \n
started proving his worth by actively engaging in business for the various companies owned by the House , \n
having a hand in many of the expansions and closed deals which has led the family's assets to grow \n
substantially under his leadership.\n
\n
Lately, the leader of his House has shown even more aggression in its business ventures and rumours in the Game\n
of Houses suggest that the family is looking for other goals to achieve as well.\n
\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan  8 13:40:22 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Athasil
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Athasil Description & Background
\nDescription:\n
Before you stands a youth more boy than man. He is average height, with gentle\n
features and kind eyes. His brown hair sits in a tousle on top of his head, cut\n
short but ragged. His large, hazel eyes bear a light of innocence and wonder,\n
as if he is seeing many things for the first time. He wears simple brown pants,\n
held up by a pair of suspenders, and a white shirt, buttoned up save for the top\n
button. You notice he wears a pair of solid work boots that are quite dirty and\n
his hands are extremely calloused. He is neither thin nor overweight nor heavily\n
muscled - just an average build hidden beneath his non-descript clothing.\n
\n
Background:\n
Athasil is a twenty year old man born and raised in a small town just outside of\n
Whitebridge. His father is a carpenter and his mother a homemaker and he was\n
raised learning his father's trade. He was always a gentle, kind soul, soft-\n
spoken, and because of these traits, he didn't have many friends and was often\n
teased throughout his schooling years. His mother taught him to read and write\n
at home and his father spent much of their extra money on buying books for the\n
boy to read (though his father liked to read them too). Consequently, Athasil\n
became quite a smart lad through his on self-directed reading and studies, on\n
topics ranging from mathematics to history to military tactics to sociology.\n
After finishing school, Athasil would spend the days in the shop with his father,\n
building furniture and other such items or tending to repairs in the village,\n
and at night he would read and study and discuss with his father and mother.\n
\n
Changing times in the world brought about change in Athasil's life too. Hearing\n
of events in Caemlyn and of the Lord Dragon and the Asha'man. His curiousity\n
mounted with passing time as he listened to stories from travellers passing\n
through town, and finally he made up his mind to go to Caemlyn and see more of\n
these events for himself.\n
\n
Currently, Athasil has no idea that he is going to decide to join the Asha'man.\n
He has been in Caemlyn now for a few weeks and has found himself room and board\n
with a local carpenter (a friend of his father's), in exchange for his daily\n
work in the carpenter's shop. During evenings, Athasil has been frequenting the\n
local establishments, listening to new stories of the Dragon Reborn and the\n
Asha'man.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan  8 13:40:22 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Athasil

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker BG and Desc

\nTristan was born eighteen summers ago on a small farm outside Four Kings.  His father was a distant older man, but his mother a kind young woman, married to his father through an arrangement made by her peasant parents.  His father abused his young wife horribly, cursing her for a witch each time his paltry crop failed to grow or their only child failed to grow strongly enough.\n
\n

When Tristan was seven, his mother began a love affair with one of the two young stablehands that worked their farm.  She hungered for the love of a man who treated her well, and the two plotted to murder Tristan's father.  Unfortunately, their plans came for naught when the older man discovered them amking love when he returned early from a trip into Four Kings.\n
\n

He murdered them both, slitting the farmhand's throat and beating his wife to death.  Tristan ran to the sound of his mother screaming as she was bludgeoned to death and cried as he watched her pass from this world at the hands of his maniac father.  In a rage, he turned on his young son, whipping him with his belt buckle.  The thrashing was so intense that at one point, the spike on the buckle sliced open the boy's left eye, leaving a long, thin scar from his forehead to the bottom of his cheek.  Not wanting anyone to know how it happened, Tristan's father left him to heal without assistance.  For half a year he was blind.  when he had blessedly regained his sight, his left eye had been drained of the brilliant hazel color of his right, and had turned a cold, pale blue.\n
\n

After that, his father trusted no one, forbade Tristan to mention his mother, and began drinking excessively.  For the next ten years, Tristan worked hard at the farm and rarely spoke.  When his father's drinking got too out of hand, he would beat the boy senseless with anything he could lay his gnarled hands on.  As Tristan grew to manhood, the beatings grew more frequent and more brutal.  The boy learned quickly never to speak, and over time he forgot his mother's name.  His father, when he spoke to him, he simply called 'Sir'.\n
\n

Finally about three months ago, Tristan, now grown to be a slightly emaciated but well-built young man driven half-mad with rage, anger, and ressentment, exacted his final revenge.  No longer content to wish for release from this endless nightmare through accident, he began to feel very heady and invinsible and decided on the spur of the moment to take matters into his own hands.  After a heavy night of drinking, his father, having exhausted himself hitting his only child with his fists, lay sprawled in the only chair near the fire.  Tristan retrieved some rope from the shed, tied his father tied and scattered firewood and oil throughout the room.\n
\n

He left his father there, unconscious, as he threw what few things he had in a rough satchel.  Having taken everything he could - which was not much - the young man went back downstairs, punched his helpless father awake and spit in his face.  As the man tried to rise, Tristan sneered at him, his head swimming, and stepped casually to the door, cursing his father in his soft, unused voice.  His mismatched eyes looked cold death into his father's face as he picked up the oil lamp from the stand by the door and gave it a casual toss to the floor in front of the chair.\n
\n

Turning as the fire spread out, Tristan walked to the end of the path leading to the door without looking back.  When the screams of his father being immolated reached his ears, he started to laugh and cry simultaneously, completely heedless of his own emotional reaction.  He walked aimlessly through the countryside for some time before making his way almost two weeks later to Four Kings itself.  There he remained mostly unnoticed and stole what he could to eat or to replenish his ratty clothing.  Hearing rumors of the Dragon's army of male channelers outside Caemlyn, Tristan decided that he would see if he could harness his newfound freedom and power by learning to channel.\n
\n

He set out straightaway and has been looking for the opportunity to find one of these fabled black-coated menaces.  He saw several on his arrival in Caemlyn, but always found that his unpracticed voice would be inadequate when dealing with the men, and his learned cowardice would always get the better of him before he could make himself speak to one.  He is slowly building up the mental and emotional strength to ask to be tested, accepted, taught, and one day soon, he will have it.\n
\n
Desc:\n

`8Tristan stands at an unremarkable 5'6", made to seem shorter by his constant slouch.  This is not so much an issue of bad posture, but a seemingly inherent and intentional withdrawal from the humanity around him.  His hair is a `3d`7a`3rk b`7l`3on`7d`3e`8, bordering on `3mou`7s`3y br`7o`3wn`8, and is equally unremarkable.  His shoulders are decently broad and his torso tapered, though perhaps a tad too much.  He looks like a typical farm boy\n
who has missed a few too many meals.\n

The only exception is his eyes.  His right eye is a `&briliant`8 and sparkling `3h`2a`7z`2e`3l`8 color, framed by eyelashes most women would kill for. His left, while also framed by long lashes, is the cold, `6p`^a`&l`7e b`&l`^u`6e`8 of an ice sculpture.  A long, thin `&s`7c`1a`7r`8 stretches from his forehead just above the center of that eye to the bottom of his strong cheekbone. The eyebrow that tops his left eye is sliced neatly in half by this `&s`7c`1a`7r`8, the center lacking the ability to grow hair.\n
\n

He is dressed in ratty `3w`7o`8o`3l`8 clothes, suitable for a farm or stable, dirty and obviously not cut for him.  His shoes seem to be oversized as well, though more well-made than his other clothing should allow for.  On his back is slung a small, rough satchel.  He holds\n
tight to the straps as if everything he owns is contained within.  By the looks of him, that might actually be the case.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker BG and Desc

\nTristan was born eighteen summers ago on a small farm outside Four Kings.  His father was a distant older man, but his mother a kind young woman, married to his father through an arrangement made by her peasant parents.  His father abused his young wife horribly, cursing her for a witch each time his paltry crop failed to grow or their only child failed to grow strongly enough.\n
\n

When Tristan was seven, his mother began a love affair with one of the two young stablehands that worked their farm.  She hungered for the love of a man who treated her well, and the two plotted to murder Tristan's father.  Unfortunately, their plans came for naught when the older man discovered them amking love when he returned early from a trip into Four Kings.\n
\n

He murdered them both, slitting the farmhand's throat and beating his wife to death.  Tristan ran to the sound of his mother screaming as she was bludgeoned to death and cried as he watched her pass from this world at the hands of his maniac father.  In a rage, he turned on his young son, whipping him with his belt buckle.  The thrashing was so intense that at one point, the spike on the buckle sliced open the boy's left eye, leaving a long, thin scar from his forehead to the bottom of his cheek.  Not wanting anyone to know how it happened, Tristan's father left him to heal without assistance.  For half a year he was blind.  when he had blessedly regained his sight, his left eye had been drained of the brilliant hazel color of his right, and had turned a cold, pale blue.\n
\n

After that, his father trusted no one, forbade Tristan to mention his mother, and began drinking excessively.  For the next ten years, Tristan worked hard at the farm and rarely spoke.  When his father's drinking got too out of hand, he would beat the boy senseless with anything he could lay his gnarled hands on.  As Tristan grew to manhood, the beatings grew more frequent and more brutal.  The boy learned quickly never to speak, and over time he forgot his mother's name.  His father, when he spoke to him, he simply called 'Sir'.\n
\n

Finally about three months ago, Tristan, now grown to be a slightly emaciated but well-built young man driven half-mad with rage, anger, and ressentment, exacted his final revenge.  No longer content to wish for release from this endless nightmare through accident, he began to feel very heady and invinsible and decided on the spur of the moment to take matters into his own hands.  After a heavy night of drinking, his father, having exhausted himself hitting his only child with his fists, lay sprawled in the only chair near the fire.  Tristan retrieved some rope from the shed, tied his father tied and scattered firewood and oil throughout the room.\n
\n

He left his father there, unconscious, as he threw what few things he had in a rough satchel.  Having taken everything he could - which was not much - the young man went back downstairs, punched his helpless father awake and spit in his face.  As the man tried to rise, Tristan sneered at him, his head swimming, and stepped casually to the door, cursing his father in his soft, unused voice.  His mismatched eyes looked cold death into his father's face as he picked up the oil lamp from the stand by the door and gave it a casual toss to the floor in front of the chair.\n
\n

Turning as the fire spread out, Tristan walked to the end of the path leading to the door without looking back.  When the screams of his father being immolated reached his ears, he started to laugh and cry simultaneously, completely heedless of his own emotional reaction.  He walked aimlessly through the countryside for some time before making his way almost two weeks later to Four Kings itself.  There he remained mostly unnoticed and stole what he could to eat or to replenish his ratty clothing.  Hearing rumors of the Dragon's army of male channelers outside Caemlyn, Tristan decided that he would see if he could harness his newfound freedom and power by learning to channel.\n
\n

He set out straightaway and has been looking for the opportunity to find one of these fabled black-coated menaces.  He saw several on his arrival in Caemlyn, but always found that his unpracticed voice would be inadequate when dealing with the men, and his learned cowardice would always get the better of him before he could make himself speak to one.  He is slowly building up the mental and emotional strength to ask to be tested, accepted, taught, and one day soon, he will have it.\n
\n

His hair is a `3d`7a`3rk b`7l`3on`7d`3e`8, bordering on `3mou`7s`3y br`7o`3wn`8, and is equally unremarkable.  His shoulders are decently broad and his torso tapered, though perhaps a tad too much. \n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan 17 08:27:47 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Tallyn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Banner-General Tallyn Steihl (IC)
\n-A message sealed with a Red Hand given to an Asha'man in Caemlyn\n
by a soldier in dull green armor marked with a Red Hand and a\n
Black Snake with instructions to deliver the message to the\n
Commander of the Asha'man-\n
\n
Greetings,\n
\n
I am Lord Tallyn Steihl, Banner-General of the Shen an Calhar\n
and military emissary to Andor from the Band of the Red Hand. As\n
you are likely well aware the invaders from the west, who go by\n
the name of Seanchan, have continued to press closer to the lands\n
of Andor. My purpose in contacting you is to gain an understanding\n
of what sort of military force you might be able to bring to bear\n
should the Seanchan threat continue to spread and if you would\n
consider operations to curtail and push back that threat.\n
\n
I need to make it clear that I do not in any way speak for Andor.\n
My interest and concern is in the threat the Seanchan pose with\n
the Last Battle obviously on the horizon.\n
\n
In the Light\n
\n
Tallyn Steihl\n
Banner-General of the Shen an Calhar\n
Lord of House Steihl\n
\n
-sealed with a bearprint in red and gold wax-\n

column5: Letter delivered to your Caemlyn manor

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan 17 17:25:06 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Termiane
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Letter delivered to your Caemlyn manor
\n*written in a plain, blocky script on fine paper*\n
\n
My Lord Traemane,\n
\n
It has come to my attention that you or House Traemane are the owners of a piece of\n
property which interests me. The property in question is a building in the Inner City,\n
apparently previously used as a training hall by the late Master Ajara. I believe it is\n
ideal for my purposes, despite the damage done to it, and would like to purchase it. I\n
am, of course, at your pleasure, or the pleasure of whomever of your House might be\n
available to speak with me on the subject. If your agent would like to arrange a time\n
to meet with me, letters left at the Merry Company will find me. I thank you for your\n
consideration, and beg forgiveness for the temerity of addressing you personally.\n
\n
I am,\n
\n
Term Delray.\n
Commander, Heron Company.\n
\n
*sealed with a heron on the wing in plain white wax*\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb 14 12:11:04 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Mudconnector
\nWhat do you think?\n
\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme (MiT) is one of the oldest Wheel of Time \n
based Muds on the Internet.  Since 1994, our coders and \n
builders have been working hard to bring in unique new \n
features and our own original areas.  MiT is currently on \n
our second major revision of the codebase, and our areas \n
are all completely original.  At A Moment in Tyme, we have \n
a dedicated playerbase and an excellent, committed staff of \n
Immortals.  We have unique systems in place to rank \n
players' mastery in swordplay and channeling (Wheel of \n
Time's magic system).\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme is set on a Timeline that is based on the\n
first six books. After that, though, Tyme has broken away\n
to become a mirror world of the books. The Bowl of the Winds\n
has been found and used, breaking the long winter. Elayne\n
has returned to Andor and taken the Throne. After a long\n
struggle, Analinde su Riaten Rie now controls Cairhien\n
with Rand al'Thor's, the Dragon Reborn, approval. \n
\n
The White Tower has split, but after a Black Tower raid \n
against the Aes Sedai, Elaida has been kidnapped and now \n
awaits trial before the newly reunified Tower. Who will be\n
Amyrlin now? Already several woman are seeking the title.\n
\n
And the Seanchan? Tarabon, Arad Doman, and Altara are\n
all victims of the Ever Victorious Army. The High Lady\n
Suroth invaded, and conquered Murandy, instead of reaching\n
into Amadicia. Because of this, High Lady Ilorin Shayndel \n
Paendrag, fourth in line for the Crystal Throne, has \n
officially settled into the Panarch's Palace and taken\n
control of the Hailene. Who will stop them? Word is that \n
a mercenary group called the Heron Company is being raised\n
to retake Arad Doman...\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme is a RP-intensive MUD. We have an RPexp\n
system which rewards RP by giving EXP based on emotes. \n
Combat Code is currently offline, as it is being completely\n
remodified and built from the ground up. It will utilize\n
50 different body parts as well as have very realistically\n
coded forms with special procedures. \n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Feb 20 19:21:50 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 dream

\nThere is nothing unusual about the day.  Sunlight is warm at his back and a cool breeze touches his skin, muted where thin fabric shelters his torso from biting insects.  The breeze helps with that, confusing their delicate flight away from a determined path to his sweat and breath.  He might have seen nineteen summers, seven years old almost to the day, and he has all of his height and most of his weight.  In fact, it is not until much later that he loses muscle mass gained from farm work and training, and loses it rapidly at that.  Those things are far away from him now, his senses filled with quiet sounds punctuated by the sharp calls of birds and the occasional blare of nearby rodents' argument over resources.\n
\n

The most remarkable aspect of the day --of which he is unaware at this moment-- is his complete and poignant lack of discomfort.  He slaps at a fly or gnat that has clung to his skin, more out of irritation than pain as he scarcely notices it.  There are other dangers here, the Blight reaching out under the land and through the waterways into the south, sometimes so far as his family's holdings.  His scent therefore is scrubbed away from him and replaced as well as possible with the smell of leafed and woody plants, dulled by clay and altered by fir.  Although his hair is braided, the bells on strands woven into it are silent, well-spaced and hollow decoration, present for tradition but non-functional.  In the city, he will have to redo the braids and replace the bells.\n

It is no great disturbance to him that while he walks the quiet forest, he is suddenly not just outside of his familial holdings but at the side of a road as he emerges from the woods, and if he had to guess a position, which he doesn't, he would say he was south of Shol Arbola and not too far away at that.  He takes the road toward the city, the sunlight bright and hot, and the flies thick as they converge to movement, darting away from piles of dung from many sorts of cart and pack animals.\n

A wagon sits at the side of the road at a bend, both front wheels off, with a guard leaning against the back wheel as a woman in ornate clothing inspects the front axle.  There is nothing odd about this, to his mind, and as he approaches, he nods to Vance, who shrugs at him and gives him a mixed look of long suffering and tolerance both.  Telen says, "You're farther north than I expected you would be," and he isn't sure why he expected Vance to be south, but it is a good thing he caught him before going into the city.  He feels it is a good thing, though how Vance is here south of Shol Arbola with Brienne and Lierna, he could not say.  No, it isn't Lierna, it is Rienne straightening up from her inspection of the wagon's axle, with her inexpert wield of Domani wiles and sloppy execution of Light given graces.  Bloody hell.  He had been looking forward to seeing Lierna.  Resignation combines sickeningly with arousal.\n

He shrugs off the disappointment.  He is still looking forward to seeing her in the city.  Isn't he? He turns away from Rienne smiling at him to scan the woods and stare down the road toward the south.  Southeast.  No, no, she's here, somewhere.  For an instant, he knows he is dreaming and all his will twists at the fabric of it.  It is a fabric of woven bands of steel, flexible but noncompliant, and his will abrades and bleeds upon it.  Dreamscape resumes as if uninterrupted.  Bright sun beats down upon sandy hair and warms his shoulders.  Light pales the primary colors of noon with brightness, casting deep black shadows in pools below pines thickly carpeted in green grey needles.  \n

What should remain memory is drawn out on silken threads and blends seamlessly with strands of possibility.  It is and it isn't Rienne's hand on his shoulder, one finger laid against the skin of his neck so that from between his shoulder blades to the nape of his neck all of the fine hairs are standing.  By the tingle of it, those at the nape of his neck are bristling as well.  He has walked the forest beside his family's house with only his long dagger and walked the road with a longsword at his hip, but when a dark shape wheels a shadow across the road, he is stepping forward away from warmth like a second sun and drawing twin blades from his back sheath.  His linen and wool are leathers, and there is thin metal plate reinforcing a cuirass and bracers laced to his chest and forearms.\n

The forest explodes with darkness, hoary and ragged shapes emerging from light and shadow as if the pools below the pines are rearing to shake ham fists, sprouting weapons and charging forward.  A cloud passes over the sun and the land becomes many shades of grey, the distinction between glowing highlight and velvet shadow blurring.  There is a tinny shriek, cut off.  He trusts that while he is facing the charge, Vance and Conar -Conar is here? he feels inappropriately exponential relief in the knowledge-are backing or flanking him and Rienne has retreated to the relative safety of the wagon.  Which might not be safe at all, if something else beside the young woman's hand stilled her foolish shriek.  He cannot think about it, he tells himself, but his heart is already constricting with dread.  A trolloc taller than the oxhead beast he saw in Tar Valon (his memory skips to encompass bits of events in the future, giving him the comparison neatly) bends its serrated beak down to slash at him, his reflexes dragging enough that the tip of it touches his chest and furrows fire across it through leather, snapping the cuirass and breaking the strap of his baldrick.\n

Twin blades then snap forward, crossing as he stumbles back.  Time yawns and the ground cants beneath his soft leather boots.  Guttural roars and growling groans co-mingle.  The Trolloc's leather collar is slashed to expose beaten metal.  He did no damage to the beast at all.  Beside and somewhat behind him there is a wet crunch and thud amidst the shrill scream of metal sliding on metal, and another sound of impact, that of something large and yielding hitting something below it that is less so.  His next step backward meets a wagon wheel as the Dha'vol chortles and lunges again, though it is shouldered aside by a squatter beast with a wide spiky furred snout with a helm covering the exact distortion of its nature.  A cleaver the size of a small table sweeps out in a metal armored and clawed hand, and Telen drops to the ground and rolls, finding he is under the wagon, which has a rent through the center of it looking up into a charcoal sky.  At the edges of the tunnel view, an arm dangles, ribboned red.  It is yanked up and away bonelessly as he is rolling again to the other side of the wagon to face whatever carnage awaits.  Still living?\n

As he gains his feet, the wagon creaks and wood snaps staccato behind him.  He spins and backpedals, stepping around the corpse of a friend and watching wide-eyed as the wagon is lifted by two hulking forms and shook violently with as much ease as a dog might take a stick in wide jaws and shake it.  The whole thing comes toward him like the side of a barn, propelled by the combined strength of Trollocs' muscular fury.  He has time to try to dodge and then it hits him and carries him.  One foot drags through stunted grey grass before the trunk of a knotted tree meets his back and searing pain sends flames outward from the point of impact.  A split second later, the wagon pins him to it and he is blind for long seconds (though he can feel the positioning and shape of everything around him).  He can hear, through a distant roaring and oddly arrhythmic pounding, the straining wood of the tree creak and whine.  Or is it he that is whining?\n

His next breaths are shallow.  His vision returns and color with it as the sun appears weakly, a white glowing sphere that fades into a grey mass, leaching the red out of ichors running down the broken wood inches from his face.  Easier to not breathe.  Minutes pass and he can discern temperature difference within pain.  The sounds immediately apparent are not so easily deciphered.  Thick growls turn over rough tongues and the clack of a beak or tapping teeth form a crude language, most of the harsh sound emitted paces away from him.  A groan nearby and human restarts his slowing heart, and he tries to speak, fails, adding faint sound to the crunch of heavy booted feet and shod hooves and the manipulation of wood and metal and perhaps dead bodies.\n
\n

Just as he is thinking the city should send aid, he can smell smoke.  Not the rich aroma of cookfires and campfires but the thick oily stench of burning hair and lacquer and smoldering stained and painted woods.  Smoke from the fire of a city burning.  The groaning continues from inside the wagon.  He thinks it might be Brienne and each low sound of fear and pain suffuses him with adrenaline to combat agony enough for him to heave at the wagon, once, and be still, head spinning and sight blacking.\n

He waits.  His heartbeat slowly saturates all of the surrounding sound.  As sight returns, he turns his head to see the ichors black and drying on the scratched and glossy surface of coated boards.  A tremble from weakness or damage or some other cause increases to shaking throughout his frame.  He strains for the presence of mind to listen for signs of life other than bestial.  The wagon shifts away from him suddenly and he falls like a rag doll dropped by a disinterested child.  One of his legs is hooked deeply through the calf and a casual throwing motion sends his body across the ground to roll to a stop at clawed feet.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Feb 20 19:21:50 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 dream

\nThere is nothing unusual about the day.  Sunlight is warm at his back and a cool breeze touches his skin, muted where thin fabric shelters his torso from biting insects.  The breeze helps with that, confusing their delicate flight away from a determined path to his sweat and breath.  He might have seen nineteen summers, seven years old almost to the day, and he has all of his height and most of his weight.  In fact, it is not until much later that he loses muscle mass gained from farm work and training, and loses it rapidly at that.  Those things are far away from him now, his senses filled with quiet sounds punctuated by the sharp calls of birds and the occasional blare of nearby rodents' argument over resources.\n
\n

The most remarkable aspect of the day --of which he is unaware at this moment-- is his complete and poignant lack of discomfort.  He slaps at a fly or gnat that has clung to his skin, more out of irritation than pain as he scarcely notices it.  There are other dangers here, the Blight reaching out under the land and through the waterways into the south, sometimes so far as his family's holdings.  His scent therefore is scrubbed away from him and replaced as well as possible with the smell of leafed and woody plants, dulled by clay and altered by fir.  Although his hair is braided, the bells on strands woven into it are silent, well-spaced and hollow decoration, present for tradition but non-functional.  In the city, he will have to redo the braids and replace the bells.\n

It is no great disturbance to him that while he walks the quiet forest, he is suddenly not just outside of his familial holdings but at the side of a road as he emerges from the woods, and if he had to guess a position, which he doesn't, he would say he was south of Shol Arbola and not too far away at that.  He takes the road toward the city, the sunlight bright and hot, and the flies thick as they converge to movement, darting away from piles of dung from many sorts of cart and pack animals.\n

A wagon sits at the side of the road at a bend, both front wheels off, with a guard leaning against the back wheel as a woman in ornate clothing inspects the front axle.  There is nothing odd about this, to his mind, and as he approaches, he nods to Vance, who shrugs at him and gives him a mixed look of long suffering and tolerance both.  Telen says, "You're farther north than I expected you would be," and he isn't sure why he expected Vance to be south, but it is a good thing he caught him before going into the city.  He feels it is a good thing, though how Vance is here south of Shol Arbola with Brienne and Lierna, he could not say.  No, it isn't Lierna, it is Rienne straightening up from her inspection of the wagon's axle, with her inexpert wield of Domani wiles and sloppy execution of Light given graces.  Bloody hell.  He had been looking forward to seeing Lierna.  Resignation combines sickeningly with arousal.\n

He shrugs off the disappointment.  He is still looking forward to seeing her in the city.  Isn't he? He turns away from Rienne smiling at him to scan the woods and stare down the road toward the south.  Southeast.  No, no, she's here, somewhere.  For an instant, he knows he is dreaming and all his will twists at the fabric of it.  It is a fabric of woven bands of steel, flexible but noncompliant, and his will abrades and bleeds upon it.  Dreamscape resumes as if uninterrupted.  Bright sun beats down upon sandy hair and warms his shoulders.  Light pales the primary colors of noon with brightness, casting deep black shadows in pools below pines thickly carpeted in green grey needles.  \n

What should remain memory is drawn out on silken threads and blends seamlessly with strands of possibility.  It is and it isn't Rienne's hand on his shoulder, one finger laid against the skin of his neck so that from between his shoulder blades to the nape of his neck all of the fine hairs are standing.  By the tingle of it, those at the nape of his neck are bristling as well.  He has walked the forest beside his family's house with only his long dagger and walked the road with a longsword at his hip, but when a dark shape wheels a shadow across the road, he is stepping forward away from warmth like a second sun and drawing twin blades from his back sheath.  His linen and wool are leathers, and there is thin metal plate reinforcing a cuirass and bracers laced to his chest and forearms.\n

The forest explodes with darkness, hoary and ragged shapes emerging from light and shadow as if the pools below the pines are rearing to shake ham fists, sprouting weapons and charging forward.  A cloud passes over the sun and the land becomes many shades of grey, the distinction between glowing highlight and velvet shadow blurring.  There is a tinny shriek, cut off.  He trusts that while he is facing the charge, Vance and Conar -Conar is here? he feels inappropriately exponential relief in the knowledge-are backing or flanking him and Rienne has retreated to the relative safety of the wagon.  Which might not be safe at all, if something else beside the young woman's hand stilled her foolish shriek.  He cannot think about it, he tells himself, but his heart is already constricting with dread.  A trolloc taller than the oxhead beast he saw in Tar Valon (his memory skips to encompass bits of events in the future, giving him the comparison neatly) bends its serrated beak down to slash at him, his reflexes dragging enough that the tip of it touches his chest and furrows fire across it through leather, snapping the cuirass and breaking the strap of his baldrick.\n

Twin blades then snap forward, crossing as he stumbles back.  Time yawns and the ground cants beneath his soft leather boots.  Guttural roars and growling groans co-mingle.  The Trolloc's leather collar is slashed to expose beaten metal.  He did no damage to the beast at all.  Beside and somewhat behind him there is a wet crunch and thud amidst the shrill scream of metal sliding on metal, and another sound of impact, that of something large and yielding hitting something below it that is less so.  His next step backward meets a wagon wheel as the Dha'vol chortles and lunges again, though it is shouldered aside by a squatter beast with a wide spiky furred snout with a helm covering the exact distortion of its nature.  A cleaver the size of a small table sweeps out in a metal armored and clawed hand, and Telen drops to the ground and rolls, finding he is under the wagon, which has a rent through the center of it looking up into a charcoal sky.  At the edges of the tunnel view, an arm dangles, ribboned red.  It is yanked up and away bonelessly as he is rolling again to the other side of the wagon to face whatever carnage awaits.  Still living?\n

As he gains his feet, the wagon creaks and wood snaps staccato behind him.  He spins and backpedals, stepping around the corpse of a friend and watching wide-eyed as the wagon is lifted by two hulking forms and shook violently with as much ease as a dog might take a stick in wide jaws and shake it.  The whole thing comes toward him like the side of a barn, propelled by the combined strength of Trollocs' muscular fury.  He has time to try to dodge and then it hits him and carries him.  One foot drags through stunted grey grass before the trunk of a knotted tree meets his back and searing pain sends flames outward from the point of impact.  A split second later, the wagon pins him to it and he is blind for long seconds (though he can feel the positioning and shape of everything around him).  He can hear, through a distant roaring and oddly arrhythmic pounding, the straining wood of the tree creak and whine.  Or is it he that is whining?\n

His next breaths are shallow.  His vision returns and color with it as the sun appears weakly, a white glowing sphere that fades into a grey mass, leaching the red out of ichors running down the broken wood inches from his face.  Easier to not breathe.  Minutes pass and he can discern temperature difference within pain.  The sounds immediately apparent are not so easily deciphered.  Thick growls turn over rough tongues and the clack of a beak or tapping teeth form a crude language, most of the harsh sound emitted paces away from him.  A groan nearby and human restarts his slowing heart, and he tries to speak, fails, adding faint sound to the crunch of heavy booted feet and shod hooves and the manipulation of wood and metal and perhaps dead bodies.\n
\n

Just as he is thinking the city should send aid, he can smell smoke.  Not the rich aroma of cookfires and campfires but the thick oily stench of burning hair and lacquer and smoldering stained and painted woods.  Smoke from the fire of a city burning.  The groaning continues from inside the wagon.  He thinks it might be Brienne and each low sound of fear and pain suffuses him with adrenaline to combat agony enough for him to heave at the wagon, once, and be still, head spinning and sight blacking.\n

He waits.  His heartbeat slowly saturates all of the surrounding sound.  As sight returns, he turns his head to see the ichors black and drying on the scratched and glossy surface of coated boards.  A tremble from weakness or damage or some other cause increases to shaking throughout his frame.  He strains for the presence of mind to listen for signs of life other than bestial.  The wagon shifts away from him suddenly and he falls like a rag doll dropped by a disinterested child.  One of his legs is hooked deeply through the calf and a casual throwing motion sends his body across the ground to roll to a stop at clawed feet.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 22 23:41:01 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Balinor
\n`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower Major RP/Event Thread
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Balinor Maelyn Shai'tan Syrah Rissa Lucardo
\n\n
To: Nicodemus, Lucardo, Rissa, Syrah, Shai'tan, Maelyn, Balinor\n
Re: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread\n
Ladies and Gentlemen:\n
Maelyn and I sat down tonight and discussed the possibilities for\n
an event for the Tower that would capture the interest of many of\n
the guildmembers while at the same time rewarding the members of\n
the guild for their participation. We agreed that, given events\n
of the past few months (namely the Asha'man raid and the reunifi-\n
cation of the White Tower), the best idea would be for the Tower\n
to recover an item of great value that would somehow shift the\n
dynamic of the relationship with the Black Tower. We brainstormed\n
for some time on what the item would be - whether it would be an\n
offensive or defensive item, how powerful it would, the effects\n
it would create. In the end, we agreed on a ter'angreal that would\n
have the effects of a Stedding, but only on men and their ability\n
to grasp Saidin. The ter'angreal would affect the entire city of\n
Tar Valon, or if not that big an area, definitely the entire White\n
Tower and associated grounds. Realizing that this is an extremely\n
important item in terms of affecting the RP between the White and\n
Black Towers, we decided that an extensive set of RP events would\n
be undertaken by the Tower GLs to recover this lost artifact. We\n
even went so far as to develop the prelude to this event, a small\n
set of passages that follow below that will kick the RP off at the\n
White Tower and that will lead a group of Tower guildmembers into\n
the Blight in search of this ter'angreal. \n
An exerpt of the passage discovered by Rosalyn Aes Sedai, a Brown \n
Sister studying the Tower histories for references to male channelers: \n

.... the statue seems to have been carved by a master from the darkest 
obsidian. It depicts a forlorn man, blindfolded and bound in chains. 
He hangs his head, an expression of despair carved on his features. 
The statue reflects the light in odd ways. The shifting shadows on 
its surface make it appear the man is struggling against his bonds, 
though of course, a statue cannot move. This was the account by 
Tielle Notura of the White Ajah, advisor to Mabriam en Shareed, 
Queen of Aramaelle. Tielle Notura's account tells of the item 
creating the same affect as the Ogier Stedding, a dampening of the 
ability to sense the source, but strangely enough, that it only had 
this affect on men and the male half of the True Source, Saidin. She 
mused that it was possibly created during the Breaking of the World 
to allow men to travel while still provided the sanctuary they sought 
at that time in Steddings, a defense against the madness of the time. 
It may have been created at a later time, as an aid to capturing and 
protecting those men who still roamed free. The passage continues,
describing the parties that would be sent out to search for madmen, \n
but the statue is not mentioned again.\n
Yet another passage is found, this one in a diary written by Stasi \n
Sedai, a Brown who lived around FY 150, a centuary and a half after \n
the end of the Trolloc Wars. She is relating her travels to the city \n
of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, and describing some of the sights. She \n
mentions an "odd statue of a man set on a table in the manor house \n
courtyard. The shadows played oddly about it. Unfortunately, I did \n
not have the time to study it properly. I only noticed it as the \n
caravan was pulling out. Perhaps I will be able to return soon and \n
give it the study it deserves. I did ask Rhodan about it, but he \n
said he knew little about it, other than it had been in his family \n
for generations. He said it made him feel uneasy, and thought he \n
might one day sell it to someone else. I asked him to let me know if \n
he decided to be rid of it, as I would consider purchasing it myself." \n
The diary continues for many years, but the only other reference to \n
the statue is near the end. Stasi Sedai laments that she regrets never \n
having gotten back to study the statue, and makes a note to herself to \n
mention it to one of the younger Sedai to follow up.\n
Rosalyn realized the magnitude of this discovery, of the potential \n
such an item might have in the world today, with male channelers \n
running free across the lands. Her continued research revealed that \n
the city of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, was located in what today is \n
the fallen nation of Malkier, in the Blight. Pouring over old maps \n
and correlating it with new maps, she was able to determine the general \n
area in Malkier where the city was located, but could not refine it any \n
further.\n
From here, Rosalyn Sedai reports these finds to the Hall of the Tower,\n
who will form a committee to determine whether or not this holds enough\n
merit upon which they will base an exploratory expedition. It is here\n
that the RP events will kick-off. I fully expect at least a dozen events\n
(and much likely more), with small RP between guildmembers and even\n
outside of the guild spawning as a result.\n
Maelyn and I feel that the item we've proposed is significant enough\n
to warrant a major RP event as this, but that it will also not shift\n
the balance enough to majorly impact RP on the mud. It also would be\n
a major reward for the White Tower, which would effectively by protected\n
against male channelers as long as the statue was in the White Tower.\n
Please reply to me with comments. I am spearheading the effort to get\n
this RP event going and will be putting some major time in when I get\n
back from Mexico to organize and kick things off. Basically, I believe\n
that I need buy-in from all of the Imms I've sent this to in order for\n
it to be a successful event, so please consider this carefully and\n
let us know as soon as you can so that we can move forward.\n
On behalf of Maelyn and myself, thanks.\n
Regards,\n
Balinor\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

outside of the guild spawning as a result.\n
Maelyn and I feel that the item we've proposed is significant enough\n
to warrant a major RP event as this, but that it will also not shift\n
the balance enough to majorly impact RP on the mud. It also would be\n
a major reward for the White Tower, which would effectively by protected\n
against male channelers as long as the statue was in the White Tower.\n
Please reply to me with comments. I am spearheading the effort to get\n
this RP event going and will be putting some major time in when I get\n
back from Mexico to organize and kick things off. Basically, I believe\n
that I need buy-in from all of the Imms I've sent this to in order for\n
it to be a successful event, so please consider this carefully and\n
let us know as soon as you can so that we can move forward.\n
On behalf of Maelyn and myself, thanks.\n
Regards,\n
Balinor\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 22 23:41:01 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Balinor
\n`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower Major RP/Event Thread
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Balinor Maelyn Shai'tan Syrah Rissa Lucardo
\n\n
To: Nicodemus, Lucardo, Rissa, Syrah, Shai'tan, Maelyn, Balinor\n
Re: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread\n
Ladies and Gentlemen:\n
Maelyn and I sat down tonight and discussed the possibilities for\n
an event for the Tower that would capture the interest of many of\n
the guildmembers while at the same time rewarding the members of\n
the guild for their participation. We agreed that, given events\n
of the past few months (namely the Asha'man raid and the reunifi-\n
cation of the White Tower), the best idea would be for the Tower\n
to recover an item of great value that would somehow shift the\n
dynamic of the relationship with the Black Tower. We brainstormed\n
for some time on what the item would be - whether it would be an\n
offensive or defensive item, how powerful it would, the effects\n
it would create. In the end, we agreed on a ter'angreal that would\n
have the effects of a Stedding, but only on men and their ability\n
to grasp Saidin. The ter'angreal would affect the entire city of\n
Tar Valon, or if not that big an area, definitely the entire White\n
Tower and associated grounds. Realizing that this is an extremely\n
important item in terms of affecting the RP between the White and\n
Black Towers, we decided that an extensive set of RP events would\n
be undertaken by the Tower GLs to recover this lost artifact. We\n
even went so far as to develop the prelude to this event, a small\n
set of passages that follow below that will kick the RP off at the\n
White Tower and that will lead a group of Tower guildmembers into\n
the Blight in search of this ter'angreal. \n
An exerpt of the passage discovered by Rosalyn Aes Sedai, a Brown \n
Sister studying the Tower histories for references to male channelers: \n

.... the statue seems to have been carved by a master from the darkest 
obsidian. It depicts a forlorn man, blindfolded and bound in chains. 
He hangs his head, an expression of despair carved on his features. 
The statue reflects the light in odd ways. The shifting shadows on 
its surface make it appear the man is struggling against his bonds, 
though of course, a statue cannot move. This was the account by 
Tielle Notura of the White Ajah, advisor to Mabriam en Shareed, 
Queen of Aramaelle. Tielle Notura's account tells of the item 
creating the same affect as the Ogier Stedding, a dampening of the 
ability to sense the source, but strangely enough, that it only had 
this affect on men and the male half of the True Source, Saidin. She 
mused that it was possibly created during the Breaking of the World 
to allow men to travel while still provided the sanctuary they sought 
at that time in Steddings, a defense against the madness of the time. 
It may have been created at a later time, as an aid to capturing and 
protecting those men who still roamed free. The passage continues,
describing the parties that would be sent out to search for madmen, \n
but the statue is not mentioned again.\n
Yet another passage is found, this one in a diary written by Stasi \n
Sedai, a Brown who lived around FY 150, a centuary and a half after \n
the end of the Trolloc Wars. She is relating her travels to the city \n
of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, and describing some of the sights. She \n
mentions an "odd statue of a man set on a table in the manor house \n
courtyard. The shadows played oddly about it. Unfortunately, I did \n
not have the time to study it properly. I only noticed it as the \n
caravan was pulling out. Perhaps I will be able to return soon and \n
give it the study it deserves. I did ask Rhodan about it, but he \n
said he knew little about it, other than it had been in his family \n
for generations. He said it made him feel uneasy, and thought he \n
might one day sell it to someone else. I asked him to let me know if \n
he decided to be rid of it, as I would consider purchasing it myself." \n
The diary continues for many years, but the only other reference to \n
the statue is near the end. Stasi Sedai laments that she regrets never \n
having gotten back to study the statue, and makes a note to herself to \n
mention it to one of the younger Sedai to follow up.\n
Rosalyn realized the magnitude of this discovery, of the potential \n
such an item might have in the world today, with male channelers \n
running free across the lands. Her continued research revealed that \n
the city of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, was located in what today is \n
the fallen nation of Malkier, in the Blight. Pouring over old maps \n
and correlating it with new maps, she was able to determine the general \n
area in Malkier where the city was located, but could not refine it any \n
further.\n
From here, Rosalyn Sedai reports these finds to the Hall of the Tower,\n
who will form a committee to determine whether or not this holds enough\n
merit upon which they will base an exploratory expedition. It is here\n
that the RP events will kick-off. I fully expect at least a dozen events\n
(and much likely more), with small RP between guildmembers and even\n
outside of the guild spawning as a result.\n
Maelyn and I feel that the item we've proposed is significant enough\n
to warrant a major RP event as this, but that it will also not shift\n
the balance enough to majorly impact RP on the mud. It also would be\n
a major reward for the White Tower, which would effectively by protected\n
against male channelers as long as the statue was in the White Tower.\n
Please reply to me with comments. I am spearheading the effort to get\n
this RP event going and will be putting some major time in when I get\n
back from Mexico to organize and kick things off. Basically, I believe\n
that I need buy-in from all of the Imms I've sent this to in order for\n
it to be a successful event, so please consider this carefully and\n
let us know as soon as you can so that we can move forward.\n
On behalf of Maelyn and myself, thanks.\n
Regards,\n
Balinor\n
