\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb 26 14:26:39 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Volkare
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Heron Hall Rooms
\nJust for your perusal, and to see if you want to add in the rooms for Valk.\n
\n
1st Floor:\n
`&The `#H`3eron `#H`3all`& Meeting Room`7 (public, Outer Street to South, Dining Room to East, Training Room to West, Second Floor Hallway to Up)\n

`7Broad windows at the front of the building let in a great deal of `#l`&ight`7, as well as providing a good view of the street outside and the `1Sau`!c`1y `!Wen`1c`1h`7 across it. There are several small clusters of `3wooden`7 chairs around low tables scattered about the room, apparently set up as places to talk business with the mercenaries of `#H`3eron `8Company`7. A stairway leads from the front of the building up to the second floor at the east side of the room, with another door beneath the stairs leading to the Dining Room. The lone doorway on the west side of the room leads to the Training Room.\n
\n
`&The `#H`3eron `#H`3all`& Dining Room`7 (public, Meeting Room to West, Kitchens to North)\n

`7This long, low room has a series of `3d`8a`2r`8k `2w`8o`2o`8d`7 tables with benches running alongside. A few round `3tables`7 circled by chairs fill up the empty space along the west wall, and a wide `1f`!i`7r`1e`!p`7l`1a`!c`7e rests at the north end of the room, alongside a door to the kitchens. The door back to the Meeting Room lies on the west wall.\n
\n
`&The `#H`3eron `#H`3all`& Kitchens`7 (public, Dining Room to South, Stables to North)\n

`7S`8t`&o`7n`8e`7 ovens and heavy `8i`7r`8o`7n stoves line this room, making it warm no matter what time of year it is. By the equipment, smells, and the small amount of food visible when the cooks aren't working, the fare made here tends towards good and solid, with little flare or fancy doings. The door to the south leads into the Dining Room, and another door on the north side of the room leads outside to the Stableyard.\n
\n
`&The Stables of `#H`3eron `#H`3all`7 (public, Kitchen to South)\n

`7Behind the three-story building that serves as the headquarters of `#H`3eron `8Company`7 lies an open stableyard almost the same size. A large stable juts off from the main building like the arm of an 'L,' holding the horses of `#H`3eron `8Company`7 in small but comfortable stalls. One can often see small units of mercenaries drilling with pikes or spears in the open space between the stable and the barracks.\n
\n
`&The `#H`3eron `#H`3all`& Training Room`7 (public, Meeting Room to East)\n

`7This room takes up the majority of the first floor of the building. A few `3wooden`7 pillars are scattered around to support the upper floors, but otherwise the room is completely open. `&C`3a`7n`&v`7a`&s`7 covers the floor, with `!r`1e`!d`7 circles painted on it, and racks of `3lathes`7 and other `&w`7e`&a`7p`&o`7n`&s`7 line the walls. There is a `1f`!i`7r`1e`!p`7l`1a`!c`7e along the west wall to take some of the chill off, but it seems to be rarely used, given how often there are mercenaries practicing their livelihood in the room. There is an ostentatiously large `&lo`7ok`8ing g`7la`&ss`7 along one wall, for practicing forms in front of. The door back to the Meeting Room is in the east wall.\n
\n
2nd Floor:\n
`&The Second Floor Hallway`7 (public, Barracks to West, File Leader's Room to South, Volante's room to East, Telen's room to North, Meeting Room to Down, Third Floor Landing to Up)\n

`7This hallway connects the stairs at the front of the building that lead down to the first floor with the ones at the back of the building that lead up to the top floor. Several `3doors`7 on the west side of the hallway open out into a large barracks, while `3doors`7 on the east side of the hall lead to the individual rooms of the File Leaders. `&W`6i`7ndo`6w`&s`7 at either end of the hallway and `8la`1n`3t`#e`3r`1n`8s`7 between each of the doors keep the place bright day or night.\n
\n
`&The `#H`3eron `#H`3all`& Barracks`7 (public, Second Floor Hallway to East)\n

`7This cavernous room is filled with double-stacked `3bunks`7, five to a row. There looks to be room for at least a hundred mercenaries to sleep in the room. `1F`!i`7r`1e`!p`7l`1a`!c`7e`1s`7 stand on the west and north ends of the room, and the southwest corner is curtained off by simple `3c`7anva`3s`7 sheets, providing some measure of privacy for the female members of `#H`3eron `8Company`7.\n
\n
`&A File Leader's Room`7 (public, Second Floor Hallway to North)\n

`7This small but comfortable room is set aside for the use of one of `#H`3eron `8Company`7's File Leaders. It has a wardrobe and small weapons rack along one wall, a bed along another, and a writing `3desk`7 under a `&w`6i`7nd`6o`&w`7 along a third.\n
\n
File Leader Denshanai's Room (private, Second Floor Hallway to West)\n
To be desced by Volante if she wants the room.\n
\n
File Leader Kerraid's Room (private, Second Floor Hallway to South)\n
To be desced by Telen if he wants the room.\n
\n
3rd Floor:\n
`&The Third Floor Landing`7 (public, Second Floor Hallway to Down, Commander Delray's Room to East, Lady Ankaer's Sitting Room to West) \n

`7The stairs from the second floor rise to a small landing at the back of the building. To the south is the unassuming `3door`7 to the Commander's room, while a `3door`7 with a single `#H`3eron `8Company`7 mercenary standing guard outside leads to the sitting room of the `8Company `5P`%a`5tron`7.\n
\n
`&Commander Delray's Room`7 (private, Third Floor Landing to West)\n

`7A larger version of the File Leaders' rooms downstairs, this is a large if somewhat sparse room that takes up the eastern third of the building. A rack by the door holds a coat of `2d`8a`2r`8k `2g`8r`2e`8e`2n`8 s`7c`8a`7l`8e `7m`8a`7i`8l`7, a conical `8h`7e`8l`7m`8e`7t with a barred face-guard and a single thin `&white`7 plume, a broad-headed `8b`7o`&a`8r`7-`3spear`7, and a trio of `&s`7w`&o`7r`&d`7s, each straight and double-edged. Along the western wall runs a broad bed, with a small table set beside it. A `3desk`7 sits in the southeast corner beneath a pair of `&w`6i`7ndo`6w`&s`7, covered in `&papers`7. Further `&w`6i`7ndo`6w`&s`7 line the eastern wall, with a tall wardrobe standing between two of them, and a small `1f`!i`7r`1e`!p`7l`1a`!c`7e between two others. A small `3door`7 in the northeastern corner of the room leads to a clothes closet. A heavy `8i`7r`8o`7n-bound `3chest`7 sits at the foot of the `8iron`7-framed bed, locked down to it, and with a thick padlock holding it closed. A wide variety of `&k`7n`&i`7v`&e`7s and `&d`7a`&g`7g`&e`7r`&s`7 sit on the various horizontal surfaces, ranging from small, thin blades suitable for throwing to heavy curved affairs that are very nearly swords.\n
\n
Lady Ankaer's Sitting Room (private, Third Floor Landing to East, Lady Ankaer's Room to South)\n
To be desced by you if you want the room.\n
\n
Lady Ankaer's Room (private, Lady Ankaer's Sitting Room to North)\n
To be desced if you want the room.\n

your teleporter. \n
\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Feb 27 20:29:50 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Meian
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker - Meian
\nBackground\n

Meian Keyns was born in Cairhien to an upper-class family of merchants. Both sides of her family speculated on shipping deliveries and other such investments. In a household with innumerable older siblings (and, eventually, even younger ones) Meian has never been given much attention. She has always been a part of the crowd, another face in the giant family.\n

It would be false to say that Meian's life thus far has been filled with satisfying experiences. She's been schooled in all the things a good merchant's daughter should know: the academic subjects, basic economics, proper etiquette and the basic foundation for the Great Game. Yet for the 16 year old, this provides nothing of the accomplishment that she wants. It will never matter what she does in Cairhien, for her siblings have already done it, excelled at it, or gained recognition elsewhere.\n

Even for the most timid of character, this is an amazing motivator. In a blend of anger, frustration and sheer annoyance, Meian has left Cairhien for Tar Valon with the very clear intent to enroll in the White Tower's training program. She isn't clear if this is something she wants for herself or just to do it because no one has ever been educated at the White Tower in her family, but there will be time enough to discover that. Meian has channeled before, but she is completely unaware of this fact. Instead of Compulsion, or listening in on other people... Meian's drinks were always as cool as she wanted them or as hot: she particularly despised temperature discrepancies as a very impatient young person.\n
Description\n

Diminutive and sleek, this Cairhien woman tops off at 5'7, but there is so little else to her form that she looks much shorter. A broad forehead is divided between a Widow's peak of dark black hair and dark eyebrows above large brown-black eyes. Her skin is a pure shade of "pale" which obscures the small nose, her refined cheekbones, and her lips. A long neck and narrow shoulders repeat shape in the wasp waist and narrow hips. Narrow hips to long legs matched in stride by long arms. Her body is sharp as her ovaline face. \n

She wears simple pleated skirts of fine cotton which are made fuller with petticoats, all of them varying shades of blue and gray. Her blouse is a crisp light blue and has Andoran cuffs at the sleeves, and the tips of brown boots peak from under the hem of her skirts.\n
Level: 1\n
Talents:\n

active channeler / mighty channeler / cloud dancing / talent healing / finesse air / finesse water / finesse spirit / finesse fire / inept earth / strength air / strength water / strength spirit / strength fire / weakness earth\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar  1 15:52:02 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Kelran
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG for Guild entry.
\nKelran is the younger son of a Kandori merchant, though his size and\n
quiet demeanor left little chance of him ever becoming a merchant \n
himself.  He was briefly apprenticed to a blacksmith, but was \n
released for his singular lack of ability at the forge.  It was \n
shortly after this that he began training with one of the soldiers \n
of Chachin.  This soldier also told him that the White Tower trained \n
the best swordsmen in all the world, since he was good with a blade, \n
and precious little else... that is where he sought to make his \n
goal after stepping off a riverboat and onto the docks of Tar Valon.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar  1 15:52:02 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Kelran

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar  1 16:48:25 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 alternate BG
\n\n

You had mentioned compromise of having a darkfriend mess with Telen (with an angreal/ter'angreal).  It would not change his RP up until now, if that option remains acceptable.  Rissa did say that since I am RPing latent, I should send you Telen's BG for approval instead of resubmitting it to her.  When I first created, I did not choose channeling, and then I re-created with some ability.\n

Telen was born in southern Arafel outside of a small town by a swift running river.  His parents trapped for furs and raised livestock for wool, milk and meat.  He has relatives in Shol Arbola who export into Shienar and occasionally make the longer trip to Tar Valon to exchange goods for profit.  He stays with them during the long winters and learns the business, writing and tallying.  He is gifted swords at twelve.  Summers, with spring and fall a short violent reckoning between warmth and cold, are spent herding and hiding and farming.  It is a welcome change, the faces and personalities of the city exchanged willingly for the simple adoration and stubbornness of animals, learning to reap and sow and something too of herbal lore.\n

At fifteen summers he is at his full height and beginning to lose the ranginess of a boy.  The fall of that year, he helps put down a man turned feral, his own kin but unrecognizable, nearly inhuman, and dangerous.  The act of kindness sickens him, but he can see the reason for it, at least.  Later he will wonder if it was less kindness and more fear, but it is years later.\n

He learns his family has spawned two of these in the last century, though until seeing the animal madness, he'd assumed the tales were nothing more than fanciful exaggeration of the temper afflicting many of his city relatives.\n

When he is twenty, an Aes Sedai with a brown shawl tells his parents he must accompany her.  There is no promise he will be returned.  Evasion meets queries of why, but his mother tells him, when he travels home within two years, that they had suspected why, and she could not say how the Sedai would have known anything of their family, they are a private people, but Aes Sedai often know secret things.\n

During his time with the Aes Sedai, there is little time where he is not occupied with training of one sort or another.  It may be that he would have continued to train with the Tower guard and some few of the Gaidin and remained a servant of the White Tower.  After nearly two years, he is performing chores for an Aes Sedai outside of the Brown's study.  His memory of exact events is unclear.  He does recall being told that if he had done what he was told and no more or less, he should have suffered no ill.  There had been a few instances of curiosity costing him, easily remedied, and he accepts his fault.  Aes Sedai do not lie, he must have done.  It is after he is told he cannot be Healed that the weight of tragedy hits him.  He is released from the study and given notes for coin to cover difficulty in making a living.  He believes it is also for his silence, though that is never demanded.  It might have been said in so many words.\n

His mother moves back into the city when the farm dwindles, and when he arrives in Arafel, he will be helping in his relatives' thriving business.  It is tedious work, and he does well at it, but there is no real place for him, everything he can do, another in the family can do and better.  He becomes withdrawn and disinterested.\n

Feeling cheated and wrecked, he retrieves gold with a note gifted him and adds it to pay he has saved from his work in Arafel.  It seems a fair amount until he puts his skills to use tallying expenses.  It might last him a year, if he did no work, in a city, much longer outside of the city, though living in an outlying town entailed varying degrees of labor, sometimes continuous, whether he wanted it or not.\n

For many reasons, instead of settling with his family in the borderland, instead of serving in the army of Arafel or Shienar, he begins traveling south for better fortune.  Away from a quiet Blight into a land newly furrowed by the heavy turning of the Wheel.  It should be interesting.  He feels he has not much to lose.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar  1 16:48:25 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 alternate BG

When I first created, I did not choose channeling, and then I re-created with some ability.\n

Telen was born in southern Arafel outside of a small town by a swift running river.  His parents trapped for furs and raised livestock for wool, milk and meat.  He has relatives in Shol Arbola who export into Shienar and occasionally make the longer trip to Tar Valon to exchange goods for profit.  He stays with them during the long winters and learns the business, writing and tallying.  He is gifted swords at twelve.  Summers, with spring and fall a short violent reckoning between warmth and cold, are spent herding and hiding and farming.  It is a welcome change, the faces and personalities of the city exchanged willingly for the simple adoration and stubbornness of animals, learning to reap and sow and something too of herbal lore.\n

At fifteen summers he is at his full height and beginning to lose the ranginess of a boy.  The fall of that year, he helps put down a man turned feral, his own kin but unrecognizable, nearly inhuman, and dangerous.  The act of kindness sickens him, but he can see the reason for it, at least.  Later he will wonder if it was less kindness and more fear, but it is years later.\n

He learns his family has spawned two of these in the last century, though until seeing the animal madness, he'd assumed the tales were nothing more than fanciful exaggeration of the temper afflicting many of his city relatives.\n

When he is twenty, an Aes Sedai with a brown shawl tells his parents he must accompany her.  There is no promise he will be returned.  Evasion meets queries of why, but his mother tells him, when he travels home within two years, that they had suspected why, and she could not say how the Sedai would have known anything of their family, they are a private people, but Aes Sedai often know secret things.\n

During his time with the Aes Sedai, there is little time where he is not occupied with training of one sort or another.  It may be that he would have continued to train with the Tower guard and some few of the Gaidin and remained a servant of the White Tower.  After nearly two years, he is performing chores for an Aes Sedai outside of the Brown's study.  His memory of exact events is unclear.  He does recall being told that if he had done what he was told and no more or less, he should have suffered no ill.  There had been a few instances of curiosity costing him, easily remedied, and he accepts his fault.  Aes Sedai do not lie, he must have done.  It is after he is told he cannot be Healed that the weight of tragedy hits him.  He is released from the study and given notes for coin to cover difficulty in making a living.  He believes it is also for his silence, though that is never demanded.  It might have been said in so many words.\n

His mother moves back into the city when the farm dwindles, and when he arrives in Arafel, he will be helping in his relatives' thriving business.  It is tedious work, and he does well at it, but there is no real place for him, everything he can do, another in the family can do and better.  He becomes withdrawn and disinterested.\n

Feeling cheated and wrecked, he retrieves gold with a note gifted him and adds it to pay he has saved from his work in Arafel.  It seems a fair amount until he puts his skills to use tallying expenses.  It might last him a year, if he did no work, in a city, much longer outside of the city, though living in an outlying town entailed varying degrees of labor, sometimes continuous, whether he wanted it or not.\n

For many reasons, instead of settling with his family in the borderland, instead of serving in the army of Arafel or Shienar, he begins traveling south for better fortune.  Away from a quiet Blight into a land newly furrowed by the heavy turning of the Wheel.  It should be interesting.  He feels he has not much to lose.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar  1 17:28:08 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Julian
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker Background and Description

\nJulian Greaves is a middle child with one older brother and a younger sister.  His parents own and operate a small, self-sufficient farm just southeast of Tar Valon along with his father's two brothers and their small families.  He was raised by all the adults and taught the values of hard work, politeness, and discipline, and never disallowed from having fun when it was warranted.  Basically, he lived a fairly ideal life.\n
\n

When he was twelve, he was helping his uncle hook up an oxcart when something spooked the oxen in the pen and caused a small, short stampede that was easily smoothed over.  In the rush of the initial panic, though, the boy was knocked over and his left forearm caught under the hooves of one of the frightened giants, crushing it instantly.  His uncle wrapped a tourinquet above the elbow and hoisted the boy up to the drive. Without delay, he was rushed to the Tower, a scant and interminable couple hours away from the farm.  He thankfully passed out from the pain shortly after the ride began, and woke up upon the cold shock of Healing.  Unfortunately, thanks to the complete shattering of the bones and crushing of muscle in his forearm, combined with the cut off of blood and subsequent deadening of the tissue from the tourinquet, everything below the left elbow had to come off.\n
\n

It was a freak accident that no one could have prevented or helped, and Julian bore up to it well.  Since it was Healed, he felt no pain once the Aes Sedai let him go, and he merely went back to being a boy on the verge of manhood.  His parents, however, became quite cautious and turned slightly overprotective of their middle child.  Never actually stifling him, they nevertheless cut him off, perhaps without even meaning to, from many things they would never before have bat an eye at.  He had to sneak work in, as they tried to keep him away from the fields: he had to trade favors with his brother to go chop wood instead of stay in the house (his brother always encouraged him to push himself, but would rarely let him do so without his watchful eye).  Well-meaning, his parents did keep him back somewhat, always just a little too worried about their young son.\n
\n

A friendly and outgoing sort, Julian was rarely without company or good times, but even his friends seemed not completely sure how to deal with his injury.  For his part, Julian just lived his life the way he had always intended to, never letting his half-arm slow him down and learning to get around the limitations his deformity set for him.  He dreamed of doing something worthwhile, to prove to himself and everyone else that he was no less a man, even though he was less of a man now than he should have been - at least physically.\n
\n

After the recent news of the attack on the Tower, the crystalline obelisk that had been a constant presence in his life for all of his time on earth, he decided this was his chance.  With the grudging support of his older brother, he shared his new dream to be a Tower Guardsman with his family, who could do nothing to stop him, but tried mightily anyway.  Their pity, their pleas, their arguments all fell on deaf ears and were blocked by his indomitable will, a trait his family had seen fit to instill in him and which they now were coming to regret.  So, he packed up, took a little money, and moved off into the Shining City to seek a simple destiny of worth and responsibility.\n
\n
Desc:\n
\n
This young man stands maybe an inch over average height and\n
his build is perhaps slightly broader than that of most men\n
around his age, probably late teens or early twenties.  He\n
has short, wavy hair that is light brown in color with just\n
a hint of coppery highlights that can only be seen in the right\n
light.  His eyes have a greenish-hazel hue, though much like\n
his hair, they can seem to shift color slightly depending on\n
the ambient light or the color clothes he happens to be wearing.\n
It looks as though the man is used to smiling, even when he is\n
not actively doing so, and when he does, he reveals slightly\n
crooked white teeth.\n
\n
Generally fit and trim, there is one feature that stands out\n
above all the others.  His left arm is half as long as his\n
right, having nothing past the elbow.  Whether he wears a jacket\n
or not, the malformed arm is always covered in a long sleeve,\n
crisply folded and pinned up to hide the end of his stump.\n
Nothing about the way he moves or interacts with others indicates\n
the deformity is a hindrance to him, but it is impossible to miss.\n
\n
He dresses most often in clean if simple work pants and a shirt,\n
usually covered by a jacket for propriety's sake.  His feet are\n
covered by well-worn black leather boots with hardened soles and\n
toes, perfect for general labor.  Tucked into the back waistline\n
of his pants is a long knife, good for just about any purpose a\n
short blade might be put to.  He moves with constant purpose,\n
back straight and chin high, and if he displays no particular\n
grace about it, there is yet a fluidity in his sure posture.\n
\n
Hope to see you soon.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Mar  5 15:34:21 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Tanen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background
\n   Tanen was raised by a farming family in the unclaimed territory northeast of Far Madding, not far from the Erinin.  The\n
region was a poor one, and as a boy he had very little, living the simple life of a country child.  He knew very little of the world\n
outside his home, and was little concerned with it, being largely occupied by the many chores given to him (and his man \n
siblings) by his parents.  At a very young age, he lost his mother to illness, and from then on his life revolved largely around\n
avoiding the attention of his increasingly embittered father.  As he and his brothers came closer to adulthood, his father\n
became increasingly abusive towards them, particularly towards Tanen, who was slow in developing the knack of avoiding the\n
old man's temper.\n
After a particularly poor harvest one year, seeing his father grow increasingly sullen and intemperate, Tanen decided that\n
discretion was the better course of valor, and struck off on his own, in part with the young man's typically ill conceived ideas\n
about seeing the world and having grand adventures.  The world, as is its wont, quickly cured him of any romantic illusions, \n
and based upon his meager experience with his father's old plow horse (long dead before he left), he secured work as a \n
stableboy at a good Inn just inside the walls of Caemlyn.  There he discovered that in fact, he had quite a way with animals, \n
better than any of the other grooms, at least.  Having worked there for a while, he once again felt a certain urge to be on his \n
way, (The head groom reminded him, somewhat unpleasantly, of his father and home) and with the last romantic illusions of \n
childhood beating in his breast, made his way north to the fabled White Tower.  Losing the purse containing his few saved \n
coins to a band of ruffians on the road, he arrived in Tar Valon entirely penniless, and concerned solely with finding a way to \n
put food in his mouth.  Oblivious to the city's wonders, he set out to find work, using his brief experience as a stableboy.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Subj`6:`7 The Library
\n`7CC`6: `7Rosabelle Lila
\n\n
The Entryway to the Great Library\n
- library built like towering waves frozen in stone. (IV: 778)\n
\n
The Great Library of Tar Valon\n
- black and white floor tiles. \n
- stairway up, locked stairway down.\n
\n
Between the Shelves\n
- Make many book shelves here, and this area will be between\n
- two shelves.\n
\n
The Great Hall\n
- cathedral celings with books stacked all the way up to the top, large ladders-on-wheels sliding across the sides so that - the Browns can find the books they need.'\n
- Add a circulation desk to check out books.\n
- Add a bespectacled librarian who scowls at people who are loud.\n
\n
The Grand Stairwell\n
\n
\n
The Lecture Hall\n
\n
A Quiet Study\n
\n
The Copy Room\n
- Room for copying texts. Lots of inkwells and stuff.\n
\n
The Entrance to the Secret Archives \n
- the library basement corridor is made of grey stone walls set with wooden doors. (III: 303)\n
- there are two sets of stairs by each other in the main library basement hallway. The hallway has a high ceiling, and some - of the doors are the size of barn doors. (III: 303)\n
- I intend to broaden this area, and perhaps make a bottom entrance to the basements.\n
- I am making a key that only the Browns will have.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Mar  7 01:38:50 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 The Stairwell.
\nI was talking with Maelyn about the stairwell, and the whole forty\n
flights is really time consuming to try and get up.\n
\n
What I had in mind was removing most of them, and putting in\n
teleporters between the zones. The first, main floor, then\n
a teleporter, the novice halls, then a teleporter, etc etc\n
until you reach the top. \n
\n
I didn't want to make any changes without consulting you though.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Mar  7 01:38:50 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 The Stairwell.
\nI was talking with Maelyn about the stairwell, and the whole forty\n
flights is really time consuming to try and get up.\n
\n
What I had in mind was removing most of them, and putting in\n
teleporters between the zones. The first, main floor, then\n
a teleporter, the novice halls, then a teleporter, etc etc\n
until you reach the top. \n
\n
I didn't want to make any changes without consulting you though.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb 14 12:26:56 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Mudconnector
\nA Moment in Tyme (MiT) is one of the oldest Wheel of Time \n
based Muds on the Internet.  Since 1994, our coders and \n
builders have been working hard to bring in unique new \n
features and our own original areas.  MiT is currently on \n
our second major revision of the codebase, and our areas \n
are all completely original.  At A Moment in Tyme, we have \n
a dedicated playerbase and an excellent, committed staff of \n
Immortals.  We have unique systems in place to rank \n
players' mastery in swordplay and channeling (Wheel of \n
Time's magic system).\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme is set on a Timeline that is based on the\n
first six books. After that, though, Tyme has broken away\n
to become a mirror world of the books. The Bowl of the Winds\n
has been found and used, breaking the long winter. Elayne\n
has returned to Andor and taken the Throne. After a long\n
struggle, Analinde su Riaten Rie now controls Cairhien\n
with Rand al'Thor's, the Dragon Reborn, approval. \n
\n
The White Tower has split, but after a Black Tower raid \n
against the Aes Sedai, Elaida has been kidnapped and now \n
awaits trial before the newly reunified Tower. Who will be\n
Amyrlin now? Already several woman are seeking the title.\n
\n
And the Seanchan? Tarabon, Arad Doman, and Altara are\n
all victims of the Ever Victorious Army. The High Lady\n
Suroth invaded, and conquered Murandy, instead of reaching\n
into Amadicia. Because of this, High Lady Ilorin Shayndel \n
Paendrag, fourth in line for the Crystal Throne, has \n
officially settled into the Panarch's Palace and taken\n
control of the Hailene. Who will stop them? Word is that \n
a mercenary group called the Heron Company is being raised\n
to retake Arad Doman...\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme is a RP-intensive MUD. We have an RPexp\n
system which rewards RP by giving EXP based on emotes. \n
Combat Code is currently offline, as it is being completely\n
remodified and built from the ground up. It will utilize\n
50 different body parts as well as have very realistically\n
coded forms with special procedures. \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Mar 12 13:51:24 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sorin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG

\nSorin was born into a noble family of Arafel: he is the next heir of the house. They were a group of warriors, well known through Arafel. He was raised as a noble, his views and life based on fighting. He had never liked weapons though. He began his training at the age of six, where he began to study and learn about war, the nobility, and the void. At ten he began to wield weapons and learn about anatomy. At sixteen he was a warrior, trained thoroughly, he could fight battles and keep up with soldier, by then he had been in three battles.\n

His father was murdered on his seventeenth birthday and he was to become heir. He declined after several attempts were made on his life. The house was tearing itself apart to become the heir. Within a month he had barely escaped death and they were still warring to become the heir. Sorin could not stand it so he left, he swore someday he would rebuild the Fenix nobility. Soon he found his plans would not carry out and he headed for Caemlyn. He would stop in Tar Valon first though.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Mar  1 16:48:25 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 alternate BG
\n\n

You had mentioned compromise of having a darkfriend mess with Telen (with an angreal/ter'angreal).  It would not change his RP up until now, if that option remains acceptable.  Rissa did say that since I am RPing latent, I should send you Telen's BG for approval instead of resubmitting it to her.  When I first created, I did not choose channeling, and then I re-created with some ability.\n

Telen was born in southern Arafel outside of a small town by a swift running river.  His parents trapped for furs and raised livestock for wool, milk and meat.  He has relatives in Shol Arbola who export into Shienar and occasionally make the longer trip to Tar Valon to exchange goods for profit.  He stays with them during the long winters and learns the business, writing and tallying.  He is gifted swords at twelve.  Summers, with spring and fall a short violent reckoning between warmth and cold, are spent herding and hiding and farming.  It is a welcome change, the faces and personalities of the city exchanged willingly for the simple adoration and stubbornness of animals, learning to reap and sow and something too of herbal lore.\n

At fifteen summers he is at his full height and beginning to lose the ranginess of a boy.  The fall of that year, he helps put down a man turned feral, his own kin but unrecognizable, nearly inhuman, and dangerous.  The act of kindness sickens him, but he can see the reason for it, at least.  Later he will wonder if it was less kindness and more fear, but it is years later.\n

He learns his family has spawned two of these in the last century, though until seeing the animal madness, he'd assumed the tales were nothing more than fanciful exaggeration of the temper afflicting many of his city relatives.\n

When he is twenty, an Aes Sedai with a brown shawl tells his parents he must accompany her.  There is no promise he will be returned.  Evasion meets queries of why, but his mother tells him, when he travels home within two years, that they had suspected why, and she could not say how the Sedai would have known anything of their family, they are a private people, but Aes Sedai often know secret things.\n

During his time with the Aes Sedai, there is little time where he is not occupied with training of one sort or another.  It may be that he would have continued to train with the Tower guard and some few of the Gaidin and remained a servant of the White Tower.  After nearly two years, he is performing chores for an Aes Sedai outside of the Brown's study.  His memory of exact events is unclear.  He does recall being told that if he had done what he was told and no more or less, he should have suffered no ill.  There had been a few instances of curiosity costing him, easily remedied, and he accepts his fault.  Aes Sedai do not lie, he must have done.  It is after he is told he cannot be Healed that the weight of tragedy hits him.  He is released from the study and given notes for coin to cover difficulty in making a living.  He believes it is also for his silence, though that is never demanded.  It might have been said in so many words.\n

His mother moves back into the city when the farm dwindles, and when he arrives in Arafel, he will be helping in his relatives' thriving business.  It is tedious work, and he does well at it, but there is no real place for him, everything he can do, another in the family can do and better.  He becomes withdrawn and disinterested.\n

Feeling cheated and wrecked, he retrieves gold with a note gifted him and adds it to pay he has saved from his work in Arafel.  It seems a fair amount until he puts his skills to use tallying expenses.  It might last him a year, if he did no work, in a city, much longer outside of the city, though living in an outlying town entailed varying degrees of labor, sometimes continuous, whether he wanted it or not.\n

For many reasons, instead of settling with his family in the borderland, instead of serving in the army of Arafel or Shienar, he begins traveling south for better fortune.  Away from a quiet Blight into a land newly furrowed by the heavy turning of the Wheel.  It should be interesting.  He feels he has not much to lose.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Apr  1 14:51:43 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Darien
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Training Deficiencies/Prior Experiences

\nThis is in regards to your recent GLB post for the Warders guild. I've played 3 Warder/TG characters before this one. On Dragon's Fang, I played the same character for over 4 RL years before the MUD transferred, and I went to Iraq. \n
His background:\n

Darien al'Shain was born to Leorin and Mikel al'Shain in a large town half a day's ride from Maradon in Saldaea. Shortly after conception, his parents migrated north from Andor. He grew up quite happy, with a younger brother and sister. His father started in the army, and for courage and valor in battle was granted a tract of land and a minor title(Nothing more than a knight, really) from the Queen. As a young boy, he was prenticed to his uncle in Maradon, learning the trade of blacksmithing. However, as young men go, he hungered for more adventure, and having heard rumors of the split in the White Tower, he set off south to see what he could learn.\n

He eventually fell in with the Rebel Tower, and with them not being willing to let him go, he entered into their training program, quickly distinguishing himself as an excellent student. Trained in stealth and guerilla maneuvers due to the forested terrain, as well as bowmanship, swordsmanship, and the use of a staff, he was a model student, for a time.\n

After a Shadowspawn attack on Salidar, in which he managed to save his Instructor's life from a Fade, he set upon the idea that though the Aes Sedai were planning their offensive, they were poorly informed. He set out from Caemlyn while there one day recruiting, and made his way to Tar Valon, playing at being a defector to their cause, but in truth, hiding his nature, that of being a spy. Not even close to being a covert op, those in Salidar did truly think him a defector. He did what he could, recording information and learning everything he could, still continuing his training in the process. Upon receiving his promotion to Gaidin, he felt he could do no more, and returned to Salidar, with a warrant out in Tar Valon for his arrest.\n

Upon his return, few believed him at first, and he had to go through the process of proving himself again, while avoiding a particularly insistent Gaidin intent on having him tried as a traitor to the Rebels. During the period after he returned, he met his first and only Bond that he would ever carry, a tried and proven Green named Lio Ezara(Same one from here). They were an inseperable team, for years, until she felt compelled to release him from his Bond for personal reasons. He took on the role of scout and Instructor in Salidar, and remained that way for a couple years until Lio reappeared in his life, and Bonded him once more.\n
\n
After that, it's all pretty mundane stuff, because the MUD had started to die, and everyone switched here or elsewhere.\n
\n

The syllabus on the MUD was quite similar to the one here, though they focused on the different points at different times in training. Tracking, stealth, unarmed combat as well as secondary and tertiary weapons training, the Flame and Void. Also included were lessons on the Nature of the One Power in relation to their Aes Sedai, the Dangers of the One Power, Nature of the Bond, Tactics and strategy classes, Mounted combat, endless spars. Also, I dunno if it's relevant, but I had started the process on Fang of attaining Blademaster status. \n
\n
Well, if there's anything else you need, let me know.\n
\n
Darien\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Apr  2 09:58:46 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 rp

\nTelen is convinced he has Termiane's attention before speaking.  He has thought a while on how to say a few things, and now that he has to actually speak a few words in a fairly sensible manner, he cannot recall how he had thought to say them.  No matter.  He will sound like an idiot, and no one will be surprised, least of all himself.  "I had, no I was -" he says and there is a pause where he collects thoughts.  "When I was sick for those weeks, many of the nights, someone was in my room.  I know Renlor stayed there often, and he told me Rhyse was there once, and others visited.  So I survived, and somehow, Renlor did too.  I don't think well when I wake, and when I first took a room at the White Stag, I had to repair the room so often I was told I could either pay more or move out.  I believe about that time, you hired me.  Maybe exactly that time.  So I stayed there.  I am coming to the reason I am mentioning all of this."  Distaste has invaded the neutral expression he maintains when amicability falls flat.\n

Telen continues, "The brawl in the White Stag either woke me, or I started it, but I recall entering a quiet common room, and trying to stay awake, and then waking and looking for something with an edge to throw.  I did not find anything so I threw the table.  Lifted and kicked it, meaning to hit the fellow in front of me and for no reason.  Since I stopped drinking," and other things, "every morning I would wake up trying for violence, some times worse than others.  I would bar my door from the inside, and that seemed to work well enough."  'Well enough' has the same kind subtle irony in it as 'May the Creator shelter you'.  Like a tar patch on a bucket of coals, or a block of ice set out in the sun to weight a stack of hides.  Sure, that, kind of works.  "On a trip overland, I figured I would be traveling alone and if I tried to put my knife through a tree, well, it might delay me a bit getting it out again, but no great harm done."\n

I will control the violence waking, but there is a trade:  I am hard to wake until some hours have passed.  A bit of paste for your face hardly seems worth complaining about, I cannot believe I did it.  The comment gathers weariness and discards it for self-recrimination.  "I can show you how to wake me, but still, there is that, that it might have to be done."  He remembers now he had suggestions on how this might be less of a problem.  They sound incredibly dumb to him now, in retrospect.  It is only what he did in his travel from Arafel to Caemlyn.  Yes, incredibly dumb.  He is lucky he didn't break his neck falling out of a tree.  "If you would like me to find my own way to Bandar Eban, I will do that.  If I am going with you, I need to show you, and the lady Duriel, some few things before we arrive."  Though not necessarily before they leave.  Would be good though.\n
OOC.. probably best if the RP takes him solo into the west.  I don't want to hold up RP, either, for folks who are on most of the time.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Apr  2 09:58:46 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 rp

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Apr  4 10:32:42 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 travel and RP

\nHey there.  If you want to NPC something meantime, cool.  If not, I can add another short section to this.  Route -overland to Illian, by sea to the west coast.  Guess the borderlander will be learning to sail.\n

(Description after several weeks of travel:  At his hip is a single straight sword sheathed in a hard scabbard, and directly behind it hangs a long knife with a similarly styled -plain and darkly wrapped-- grip.  Fitted clothing on the moderately tall man makes for a relatively slim silhouette.  His boots are soft-soled and his head is shaved, his eyebrows and lashes bleached a bronze gold by the sun, though it could be assumed the original color was much darker.  His grey eyes have a variegated concentration of color near the rim of the iris that is midnight blue, and charcoal outlines a center of ice.  He is deeply tanned over every inch of exposed skin, and his large hands are calloused with a fine network of odd scarring across the backs.  Determination compresses the set of his mouth and jaw when he is not paying mind to keeping his face impassive.  Heat and cold appear to bother him not at all.)\n

In a small town south of Caemlyn, between Caemlyn and Illian in a more or less direct route, Telen settles in his rented room and pulls off his shirt to examine his back and shoulders.  The faint ruddiness of sunburn has faded to dull tan, but he removes a jar of oil from one of the few tins he has squirreled, pours a bit out into his palm and rubs it into his skin so that, he hopes, the skin will darken and not peel.  Daily baths are part of his past life, and so with nothing to deliberately remove what he applies, he preserves his scant stores.  If he makes no friends, well, it is a small thing.  He wants none here.\n

He removes his hat and his braids flop down from their confinement about his skull to fall over his shoulders.  Wasting no time, and thinking nothing of it, he unbinds the ends and unbraids the hair.  It does not have much color in it to his mind.  Like sodden, earthy straw.  He supposes one might call it a medium brown, though the color is odd, he thinks there might be shades of green in it.  Grimacing, he slips his knife from its sheathe at his belt and gathers his hair at the nape of his neck, twists it, places the edge of the knife against the thick column, the spine at his neck, and saws outward.  The hairs part easily but the process takes much longer than he expects.  Loose hair falls forward slowly in a fan, tickling skin.\n

Hours later, after supper when the evening stretches shadows out from every corner, Telen makes use of a mirror at the end of the upstairs hall of the inn before going into his room.  It is a small mirror, and the frame looks as though it has been secured well to the wood paneled wall.  The silver reflects his image back to him half draped in shadow, but he stares at it, repressing an urge to look behind him.  It isn't Telen, which is good.  The man staring back at him has shoulder length curling hair of some medium color.  It could be dark blond.  His eyes appear pale also, even in the poor lighting.  His skin has an obviously new tan, but he hardly notices such things.  The hair is an unruly mane and he runs both hands through it, bewilderment in wide eyes.  His uneven trimming is hidden by a mass of curl.  Where it all came from, he has no idea.  It was straight before he cut it, and it was straight when he looked at it after he cut it.  It must go.  The bloody mirror shows a fair likeness of a Light-stricken fool poet.  Either that or a child in a man's body.\n

What is left of his hair in the morning is tucked into his hat, which is short brimmed and of thick leather, black as pitch like the rest of his clothing.  He is not sure what he will do with the clippings.  Leave it in the forest maybe for birds and mice to scavenge for nests.  It felt strange coiled in his hands, like a small, sleek furred animal, warming quickly within his hold.  Hard to describe how he felt without hair that, unbraided, hung below his waist, except lighter somehow.  Somehow being different than literally, lighter, and less impeded with movement of his head and neck.  The town must have a barber or seamstress who would shave his head.  Or he could -his thoughts stumble and halt.  Telen is dead.  What does it matter how he behaves? So long as the goal is served.  As when he said it in Caemlyn, something in him dies a little more.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Apr  4 10:32:42 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 travel and RP

\nHey there.  If you want to NPC something meantime, cool.  If not, I can add another short section to this.  Route -overland to Illian, by sea to the west coast.  Guess the borderlander will be learning to sail.\n

(Description after several weeks of travel:  At his hip is a single straight sword sheathed in a hard scabbard, and directly behind it hangs a long knife with a similarly styled -plain and darkly wrapped-- grip.  Fitted clothing on the moderately tall man makes for a relatively slim silhouette.  His boots are soft-soled and his head is shaved, his eyebrows and lashes bleached a bronze gold by the sun, though it could be assumed the original color was much darker.  His grey eyes have a variegated concentration of color near the rim of the iris that is midnight blue, and charcoal outlines a center of ice.  He is deeply tanned over every inch of exposed skin, and his large hands are calloused with a fine network of odd scarring across the backs.  Determination compresses the set of his mouth and jaw when he is not paying mind to keeping his face impassive.  Heat and cold appear to bother him not at all.)\n

In a small town south of Caemlyn, between Caemlyn and Illian in a more or less direct route, Telen settles in his rented room and pulls off his shirt to examine his back and shoulders.  The faint ruddiness of sunburn has faded to dull tan, but he removes a jar of oil from one of the few tins he has squirreled, pours a bit out into his palm and rubs it into his skin so that, he hopes, the skin will darken and not peel.  Daily baths are part of his past life, and so with nothing to deliberately remove what he applies, he preserves his scant stores.  If he makes no friends, well, it is a small thing.  He wants none here.\n

He removes his hat and his braids flop down from their confinement about his skull to fall over his shoulders.  Wasting no time, and thinking nothing of it, he unbinds the ends and unbraids the hair.  It does not have much color in it to his mind.  Like sodden, earthy straw.  He supposes one might call it a medium brown, though the color is odd, he thinks there might be shades of green in it.  Grimacing, he slips his knife from its sheathe at his belt and gathers his hair at the nape of his neck, twists it, places the edge of the knife against the thick column, the spine at his neck, and saws outward.  The hairs part easily but the process takes much longer than he expects.  Loose hair falls forward slowly in a fan, tickling skin.\n

Hours later, after supper when the evening stretches shadows out from every corner, Telen makes use of a mirror at the end of the upstairs hall of the inn before going into his room.  It is a small mirror, and the frame looks as though it has been secured well to the wood paneled wall.  The silver reflects his image back to him half draped in shadow, but he stares at it, repressing an urge to look behind him.  It isn't Telen, which is good.  The man staring back at him has shoulder length curling hair of some medium color.  It could be dark blond.  His eyes appear pale also, even in the poor lighting.  His skin has an obviously new tan, but he hardly notices such things.  The hair is an unruly mane and he runs both hands through it, bewilderment in wide eyes.  His uneven trimming is hidden by a mass of curl.  Where it all came from, he has no idea.  It was straight before he cut it, and it was straight when he looked at it after he cut it.  It must go.  The bloody mirror shows a fair likeness of a Light-stricken fool poet.  Either that or a child in a man's body.\n

What is left of his hair in the morning is tucked into his hat, which is short brimmed and of thick leather, black as pitch like the rest of his clothing.  He is not sure what he will do with the clippings.  Leave it in the forest maybe for birds and mice to scavenge for nests.  It felt strange coiled in his hands, like a small, sleek furred animal, warming quickly within his hold.  Hard to describe how he felt without hair that, unbraided, hung below his waist, except lighter somehow.  Somehow being different than literally, lighter, and less impeded with movement of his head and neck.  The town must have a barber or seamstress who would shave his head.  Or he could -his thoughts stumble and halt.  Telen is dead.  What does it matter how he behaves? So long as the goal is served.  As when he said it in Caemlyn, something in him dies a little more.\n

column5: Fwd: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 22 23:41:01 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Balinor
\n`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower Major RP/Event Thread
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Balinor Maelyn Shai'tan Syrah Rissa Lucardo
\n\n
To: Nicodemus, Lucardo, Rissa, Syrah, Shai'tan, Maelyn, Balinor\n
Re: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread\n
Ladies and Gentlemen:\n
Maelyn and I sat down tonight and discussed the possibilities for\n
an event for the Tower that would capture the interest of many of\n
the guildmembers while at the same time rewarding the members of\n
the guild for their participation. We agreed that, given events\n
of the past few months (namely the Asha'man raid and the reunifi-\n
cation of the White Tower), the best idea would be for the Tower\n
to recover an item of great value that would somehow shift the\n
dynamic of the relationship with the Black Tower. We brainstormed\n
for some time on what the item would be - whether it would be an\n
offensive or defensive item, how powerful it would, the effects\n
it would create. In the end, we agreed on a ter'angreal that would\n
have the effects of a Stedding, but only on men and their ability\n
to grasp Saidin. The ter'angreal would affect the entire city of\n
Tar Valon, or if not that big an area, definitely the entire White\n
Tower and associated grounds. Realizing that this is an extremely\n
important item in terms of affecting the RP between the White and\n
Black Towers, we decided that an extensive set of RP events would\n
be undertaken by the Tower GLs to recover this lost artifact. We\n
even went so far as to develop the prelude to this event, a small\n
set of passages that follow below that will kick the RP off at the\n
White Tower and that will lead a group of Tower guildmembers into\n
the Blight in search of this ter'angreal. \n
An exerpt of the passage discovered by Rosalyn Aes Sedai, a Brown \n
Sister studying the Tower histories for references to male channelers: \n

.... the statue seems to have been carved by a master from the darkest 
obsidian. It depicts a forlorn man, blindfolded and bound in chains. 
He hangs his head, an expression of despair carved on his features. 
The statue reflects the light in odd ways. The shifting shadows on 
its surface make it appear the man is struggling against his bonds, 
though of course, a statue cannot move. This was the account by 
Tielle Notura of the White Ajah, advisor to Mabriam en Shareed, 
Queen of Aramaelle. Tielle Notura's account tells of the item 
creating the same affect as the Ogier Stedding, a dampening of the 
ability to sense the source, but strangely enough, that it only had 
this affect on men and the male half of the True Source, Saidin. She 
mused that it was possibly created during the Breaking of the World 
to allow men to travel while still provided the sanctuary they sought 
at that time in Steddings, a defense against the madness of the time. 
It may have been created at a later time, as an aid to capturing and 
protecting those men who still roamed free. The passage continues,
describing the parties that would be sent out to search for madmen, \n
but the statue is not mentioned again.\n
Yet another passage is found, this one in a diary written by Stasi \n
Sedai, a Brown who lived around FY 150, a centuary and a half after \n
the end of the Trolloc Wars. She is relating her travels to the city \n
of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, and describing some of the sights. She \n
mentions an "odd statue of a man set on a table in the manor house \n
courtyard. The shadows played oddly about it. Unfortunately, I did \n
not have the time to study it properly. I only noticed it as the \n
caravan was pulling out. Perhaps I will be able to return soon and \n
give it the study it deserves. I did ask Rhodan about it, but he \n
said he knew little about it, other than it had been in his family \n
for generations. He said it made him feel uneasy, and thought he \n
might one day sell it to someone else. I asked him to let me know if \n
he decided to be rid of it, as I would consider purchasing it myself." \n
The diary continues for many years, but the only other reference to \n
the statue is near the end. Stasi Sedai laments that she regrets never \n
having gotten back to study the statue, and makes a note to herself to \n
mention it to one of the younger Sedai to follow up.\n
Rosalyn realized the magnitude of this discovery, of the potential \n
such an item might have in the world today, with male channelers \n
running free across the lands. Her continued research revealed that \n
the city of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, was located in what today is \n
the fallen nation of Malkier, in the Blight. Pouring over old maps \n
and correlating it with new maps, she was able to determine the general \n
area in Malkier where the city was located, but could not refine it any \n
further.\n
From here, Rosalyn Sedai reports these finds to the Hall of the Tower,\n
who will form a committee to determine whether or not this holds enough\n
merit upon which they will base an exploratory expedition. It is here\n
that the RP events will kick-off. I fully expect at least a dozen events\n
(and much likely more), with small RP between guildmembers and even\n
outside of the guild spawning as a result.\n
Maelyn and I feel that the item we've proposed is significant enough\n
to warrant a major RP event as this, but that it will also not shift\n
the balance enough to majorly impact RP on the mud. It also would be\n
a major reward for the White Tower, which would effectively by protected\n
against male channelers as long as the statue was in the White Tower.\n
Please reply to me with comments. I am spearheading the effort to get\n
this RP event going and will be putting some major time in when I get\n
back from Mexico to organize and kick things off. Basically, I believe\n
that I need buy-in from all of the Imms I've sent this to in order for\n
it to be a successful event, so please consider this carefully and\n
let us know as soon as you can so that we can move forward.\n
On behalf of Maelyn and myself, thanks.\n
Regards,\n
Balinor\n

column5: Fwd: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr 20 10:28:33 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 short rp

\nTelen's hands tremor despite the finer control he's learned in the last month.  He whines and the sound impresses upon him the need for silence.  He removes wet clothing and allows his skin to dry as he works.  The body laid out on the dark floorboards is still warm, eerily so.  He strips the corpse and folds the clothing small enough to stuff into the man's undershirt, making of it a small bolster.  He might be able to use the boots.  Taking a shuddering breath, he tucks a finger under the window's dingy curtain and shifts it so that he can see out, except that, after moving the curtain, all he can see is what he believes must be years of oily grime cemented with dust on rippled glass.  It allows enough light in the small room to tell the time by, though with no real precision.\n

Other than the one time in Illian where he was poisoned by bad food, he has been hale and so far escaped serious injury.  Even during those two brawls.  The bruises healed fast, and nothing broke, so far as he could tell.  He stills an urge to run a hand over the velvet on the top of his head, a habit now.  He supposes, when he thinks about it and wishes not to do it, that he likes the feel of it as the hair starts growing back in.  A dry swallow reminds him he has eaten only enough to prevent his stomach from cramping with hunger.\n

The corpse was once a young man, though that young man was unkept and aged by what one assumes was a harsh life.  His teeth are dull streaked orange like mushroom paste and sported fairly large gaps where some were missing, knocked out or rotted out.  The man's hair is black and short, raggedly cut and before he died had been tucked under a stiff scarf dyed or stained red black.  The cool humid air does not bother him, but the corpse and its clothing reeks of all that is vile.  The shore is a short distance southeast.  There is no water in the shack, no clean cloth, no soap nor any other usable amenity.  Two sides of the building form part of narrow alleys, another is nearly abutting a similar shack, probably empty but it is hard to tell.  The air without is full of small sounds, waves moving the docks, moving against the docks, ropes creaking, wood protesting as it is strained and shifted.  Shore and sea birds in abundance cry as they wheel and dive, though while he was outside he could not hear voice of man or bird except in the distance.\n

He had thought to find work for a day or two and absorb information borne by dockworkers, fishermen and other tradesmen near the shore.  Not that he would be able to remember it all, nor would it be as much as he feels he needs to know, but it would be something.  It would be more than he knows now.  He would like to know a little less right now, too.  No reason for the man to follow him, unless instructed by those who had given Telen direction earlier, and he supposes it makes sense they would have.  Telen is dressed well by comparison and the clothing is clean.  His fastidious habits have not degraded so much that he does not wash his clothing.  Exceptionally displeased with that thought -that maybe he should not wash his clothing so often--, he scowls and considers his situation.  A dead man and his clothing, likely a cutpurse but possibly worse, certainly a man willing to do violence.  And Telen unscathed but without clothing, all hidden for the moment in an abandoned shack.\n

Not entirely unscathed, he thinks as he twists to look at his sides and the back of his legs.  There is a sore spot on one shoulder and scrapes and light bruising along his shins, and one hand is stiff and the wrist swollen.  He is only just noticing it, though he does remember fumbling with the one hand and then favoring it.\n

Telen stops thinking about reasons.  The man is dead.  What he needs to do is wash his clothing and find a new inn, leaving the body to decay and be devoured by creeping things.  An ignoble end, fitting to the man's short and ignoble life.  He shrugs.  It is either that or drag it to the shore, weight it down and drop it in the water.  He runs his nails across his skin, flaking off residue where liquid soaked through and smeared across his chest and arms.  The rest of his body is inspected and similarly cleansed.  He dons his trousers, dark enough to hide most of the spatter, and slides his sheathed knife into a long pocket.  The entire length does not fit, but it will probably stay put.  His belt is ruined and he balls the rest of his own clothing with the dead man's and buckles the belt around it.  The neat ball goes into the water on his roundabout way back into the city.\n

For an annoyingly tense moment, the ball bobs on the surface of the dark water, though heavily and, feeling exposed and vulnerable silhouetted against a grey sky, he has to watch it to make sure it does sink.  It does.  Wearing only the boots and trousers, he finds a back way into his inn and climbs three sets of narrow stairs to his room.  The day's events crash down and cover him like a landslide and for long minutes, he sits in the center of his room on the floor bowed down, elbows on knees, head in hands.\n

There is some comfort in the stillness and quiet, and after sitting long enough for his muscles to begin to protest, he unfolds and stands, locks his door and washes with tepid water from a ceramic basin on the floor by his bed.  It is a cheap room, and there is only the basin and the thin mattress on a rough legged frame, and one window that opens and can be shuttered and latched tight from the inside.  He leaves it open.  He has paid for the room for two days and leaving will not attract untoward attention.  So his few days in the city have drained his resources doubly, as he will again rent a room at a new inn for more than a day, and he does not plan to stay past a night.\n

His new room has lice in it.  Or, specifically, the mattress has lice in it.  In a fit of peeve, he powders it and pounds the lumpy cloth, certain he is crushing as many insects as the powder poisons.  He will not wake covered in sores and bites in the morning.  He realizes the attitude must change, but cannot do it yet.  Tomorrow, after he's eaten, he will better deal with what is left of his integrity.  He might even be able to laugh at the pain.\n

A small, wobbly table is lifted and set next to the low bed.  An impulse to disassemble the table and reseat the joints is ignored for the second time.  He sits on the bed and draws his legs up to tuck under his knees.  All of his possessions fit into a small trunk, strapped for hauling, and a large satchel, which is open and the canvas pulled down to reveal the contents jammed into the wide mouth.  He should write a note to those in Caemlyn, though he has nothing much to say.  It is only preparation for things to come, but necessary.  He should write a letter to Lierna, telling her -everything he is thinking.  Though maybe less of what he is feeling.  Has he not said that, already? Better to leave her alone, and let what he expects will happen, to happen.  This will only take time, and time will pass, whether he wills it or no.\n

He dons his trousers, dark enough to hide most of the spatter, and slides his sheathed knife into a long pocket.  The entire length does not fit, but it will probably stay put.  His belt is ruined and he balls the rest of his own clothing with the dead man's and buckles the belt around it.  The neat ball goes into the water on his roundabout way back into the city.\n

For an annoyingly tense moment, the ball bobs on the surface of the dark water, though heavily and, feeling exposed and vulnerable silhouetted against a grey sky, he has to watch it to make sure it does sink.  It does.  Wearing only the boots and trousers, he finds a back way into his inn and climbs three sets of narrow stairs to his room.  The day's events crash down and cover him like a landslide and for long minutes, he sits in the center of his room on the floor bowed down, elbows on knees, head in hands.\n

There is some comfort in the stillness and quiet, and after sitting long enough for his muscles to begin to protest, he unfolds and stands, locks his door and washes with tepid water from a ceramic basin on the floor by his bed.  It is a cheap room, and there is only the basin and the thin mattress on a rough legged frame, and one window that opens and can be shuttered and latched tight from the inside.  He leaves it open.  He has paid for the room for two days and leaving will not attract untoward attention.  So his few days in the city have drained his resources doubly, as he will again rent a room at a new inn for more than a day, and he does not plan to stay past a night.\n

His new room has lice in it.  Or, specifically, the mattress has lice in it.  In a fit of peeve, he powders it and pounds the lumpy cloth, certain he is crushing as many insects as the powder poisons.  He will not wake covered in sores and bites in the morning.  He realizes the attitude must change, but cannot do it yet.  Tomorrow, after he's eaten, he will better deal with what is left of his integrity.  He might even be able to laugh at the pain.\n

A small, wobbly table is lifted and set next to the low bed.  An impulse to disassemble the table and reseat the joints is ignored for the second time.  He sits on the bed and draws his legs up to tuck under his knees.  All of his possessions fit into a small trunk, strapped for hauling, and a large satchel, which is open and the canvas pulled down to reveal the contents jammed into the wide mouth.  He should write a note to those in Caemlyn, though he has nothing much to say.  It is only preparation for things to come, but necessary.  He should write a letter to Lierna, telling her -everything he is thinking.  Though maybe less of what he is feeling.  Has he not said that, already? Better to leave her alone, and let what he expects will happen, to happen.  This will only take time, and time will pass, whether he wills it or no.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Apr 23 15:38:19 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Telen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 brief letter
\nAnother last letter to Lierna, mostly because he has hours and hours of evading sleep and nothing much to fill them with except memories he should not revive:\n

It still escapes me, how I could have allowed the misconstruction of our relationship to continue.  Even now, I think I should let it go as it is for it will change with time, surely it must.  In your hometown when I met you, you were a child and I thought of you as the sister I lost in mine.  I would have given my life to protect yours and sacrificed much for your comfort.  Of course I will, if it happens you need protection or comfort.  I do not see how you would need it from me.  So I said a few words, thinking with your new horizon, far above me, there would be no time for your thoughts to come my way with more than passing affection.  When you achieve your goals, you will look back and think the match foolish at best.  I know, there is new healing, and I should seek it.  That is a separate issue.  I need it, and for a few days all I could think of was, what if, obsessively.\n

I thought my heart would give out and had to stop thinking.  Well, what if? I would offer my sword and service to the Watch, as is my duty.  And yet, I gave you my word, should you want it.  You may release me from my promise, if it suits you.  I expect you will outgrow me, so to speak.  I am not rejecting you.  I think of you as lovely and skilled, and I wish I were worthy of what you will become.  By then, however, I will not know you.  You will be changed, as different from what you were as a butterfly differs from the pallid plump cocoon from which it emerges after a long sleep.  Now, I have said all of that, and it is much more likely that you will be facing Tarmon Gai'don with a strong sword arm or two at your side, and I will spend my life in some small war or such long before then.\n
May the Creator shelter you.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu May 24 19:07:44 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Rissa
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Proof
\nMake sure I got it all please:\n
\n

The recent power vacuum left in Cairhien has been filled.  With the Dragon Reborn's black-coated Asha'man still holding the Sun Palace safe and devoid of any contention for the throne, there has been a tentative peace in the city while the nobles floundered for position they could not fully enforce.  Lord Dobraine Taborwin has been raised as regent for the Lord Dragon in Cairhien.\n
\n

Power struggles fizzled with as much fanfare as they started up, though bets are fair that the scheming has simply moved under the table.  Peace is maintained, as few are foolish enough to outright challenge the Dragon's ruling, though just as few are perfectly content with the decision, and grumbling is fairly constant.\n
\n

Optimists point out that at least Dobraine is Cairhienin, while pessimists proclaim his kowtowing to the Dragon Reborn makes him unsuitable, stating that their country has been handed over to the mad, menacing Asha'man.  The Sun Palace is still secured, though, and commerce continues apace as the city rebuilds from the shock of losing its monarch.\n
\n

column5: Fwd: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 22 23:41:01 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Balinor
\n`7Subj`6:`7 White Tower Major RP/Event Thread
\n`7CC`6: `7Nicodemus Balinor Maelyn Shai'tan Syrah Rissa Lucardo
\n\n
To: Nicodemus, Lucardo, Rissa, Syrah, Shai'tan, Maelyn, Balinor\n
Re: White Tower Major RP/Event Thread\n
Ladies and Gentlemen:\n
Maelyn and I sat down tonight and discussed the possibilities for\n
an event for the Tower that would capture the interest of many of\n
the guildmembers while at the same time rewarding the members of\n
the guild for their participation. We agreed that, given events\n
of the past few months (namely the Asha'man raid and the reunifi-\n
cation of the White Tower), the best idea would be for the Tower\n
to recover an item of great value that would somehow shift the\n
dynamic of the relationship with the Black Tower. We brainstormed\n
for some time on what the item would be - whether it would be an\n
offensive or defensive item, how powerful it would, the effects\n
it would create. In the end, we agreed on a ter'angreal that would\n
have the effects of a Stedding, but only on men and their ability\n
to grasp Saidin. The ter'angreal would affect the entire city of\n
Tar Valon, or if not that big an area, definitely the entire White\n
Tower and associated grounds. Realizing that this is an extremely\n
important item in terms of affecting the RP between the White and\n
Black Towers, we decided that an extensive set of RP events would\n
be undertaken by the Tower GLs to recover this lost artifact. We\n
even went so far as to develop the prelude to this event, a small\n
set of passages that follow below that will kick the RP off at the\n
White Tower and that will lead a group of Tower guildmembers into\n
the Blight in search of this ter'angreal. \n
An exerpt of the passage discovered by Rosalyn Aes Sedai, a Brown \n
Sister studying the Tower histories for references to male channelers: \n

.... the statue seems to have been carved by a master from the darkest 
obsidian. It depicts a forlorn man, blindfolded and bound in chains. 
He hangs his head, an expression of despair carved on his features. 
The statue reflects the light in odd ways. The shifting shadows on 
its surface make it appear the man is struggling against his bonds, 
though of course, a statue cannot move. This was the account by 
Tielle Notura of the White Ajah, advisor to Mabriam en Shareed, 
Queen of Aramaelle. Tielle Notura's account tells of the item 
creating the same affect as the Ogier Stedding, a dampening of the 
ability to sense the source, but strangely enough, that it only had 
this affect on men and the male half of the True Source, Saidin. She 
mused that it was possibly created during the Breaking of the World 
to allow men to travel while still provided the sanctuary they sought 
at that time in Steddings, a defense against the madness of the time. 
It may have been created at a later time, as an aid to capturing and 
protecting those men who still roamed free. The passage continues,
describing the parties that would be sent out to search for madmen, \n
but the statue is not mentioned again.\n
Yet another passage is found, this one in a diary written by Stasi \n
Sedai, a Brown who lived around FY 150, a centuary and a half after \n
the end of the Trolloc Wars. She is relating her travels to the city \n
of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, and describing some of the sights. She \n
mentions an "odd statue of a man set on a table in the manor house \n
courtyard. The shadows played oddly about it. Unfortunately, I did \n
not have the time to study it properly. I only noticed it as the \n
caravan was pulling out. Perhaps I will be able to return soon and \n
give it the study it deserves. I did ask Rhodan about it, but he \n
said he knew little about it, other than it had been in his family \n
for generations. He said it made him feel uneasy, and thought he \n
might one day sell it to someone else. I asked him to let me know if \n
he decided to be rid of it, as I would consider purchasing it myself." \n
The diary continues for many years, but the only other reference to \n
the statue is near the end. Stasi Sedai laments that she regrets never \n
having gotten back to study the statue, and makes a note to herself to \n
mention it to one of the younger Sedai to follow up.\n
Rosalyn realized the magnitude of this discovery, of the potential \n
such an item might have in the world today, with male channelers \n
running free across the lands. Her continued research revealed that \n
the city of Jieranelle, in Rhamdashar, was located in what today is \n
the fallen nation of Malkier, in the Blight. Pouring over old maps \n
and correlating it with new maps, she was able to determine the general \n
area in Malkier where the city was located, but could not refine it any \n
further.\n
From here, Rosalyn Sedai reports these finds to the Hall of the Tower,\n
who will form a committee to determine whether or not this holds enough\n
merit upon which they will base an exploratory expedition. It is here\n
that the RP events will kick-off. I fully expect at least a dozen events\n
(and much likely more), with small RP between guildmembers and even\n
outside of the guild spawning as a result.\n
Maelyn and I feel that the item we've proposed is significant enough\n
to warrant a major RP event as this, but that it will also not shift\n
the balance enough to majorly impact RP on the mud. It also would be\n
a major reward for the White Tower, which would effectively by protected\n
against male channelers as long as the statue was in the White Tower.\n
Please reply to me with comments. I am spearheading the effort to get\n
this RP event going and will be putting some major time in when I get\n
back from Mexico to organize and kick things off. Basically, I believe\n
that I need buy-in from all of the Imms I've sent this to in order for\n
it to be a successful event, so please consider this carefully and\n
let us know as soon as you can so that we can move forward.\n
On behalf of Maelyn and myself, thanks.\n
Regards,\n
Balinor\n

\n`7Subj`6:`7 Your portrait
\n`6This woman in this portrait carries the ageless features\n
and the serene expression that marks an `7A`&e`7s S`&e`7d`&ai`6.  Her \n
eyes are `^p`6a`^le `6b`^lu`6e, quite striking but odd on a woman that\n
appears to be from Cairhien. Her skin is `7f`&ai`7r`6, her lips full,\n
and it appears that a smile is hiding among that serene\n
expression. \n
\n
Her hair is `3bro`8w`3n`6, though a great deal of `8gr`7ay`8 `6has begun \n
to show through her dark tresses. Her long hair has been\n
swept up with `7s`8i`&l`7v`8e`7r `6combs which go well with the fine\n
blue silk dress that fits her so well. She stands in the\n
rose garden, surrounded by `7w`&h`7ite `6roses.`0\n
`&- `6C`^a`6llyndr`^a `6Da'v`^ie`6n `&-`0\n
\n
\n
--- Your portrait will be in the Blue Lounge. I have some more to finish\n
before my next zone import, but it should be in soon. :D\n
\n
Sads\n
