\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jun 13 23:32:26 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Building
\nI think that we should focus on building areas for the areas we\n
intend to have RP. Right now, our RP is focused in Tar Valon, \n
Caemlyn, and Seanchan (Tanchico).\n
\n
We have a Cairhien in, but not much RP happens in that area.\n
\n
I had an Aiel Waste built, but it is gone. No idea what happened\n
to it. I think some zones that we should definitely have since\n
we are getting a fight code in would be the Blight, for very\n
difficult monsters, the Waste, also for difficult monsters,\n
and the Shaido Hold in the wetlands, again, for hard monsters to\n
fight. \n
\n
I don't really know if we need to have many more zones put in\n
because we don't have a population to sustain their use. However,\n
if we get people in certain guilds that would require an area, \n
I'd have no problem seeing one put in. \n
\n
\n
What else would you like concerning building? Just let me know what\n
kind of information you'd like, and I'll find it. \n
\n
Going to look up EQ stuff right now, but I have to wade through\n
all of the boards to find it. \n
\n
-Sads\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jun 19 07:09:42 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Duren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: EQ/Coding
\nHey Sadren,\n
\n
No problem.  Are you enjoying the new job? :p\n
\n
As far as the EQ goes, Cormac drew up the numbers that are posted on the builders board.\n
I guess the big thing would just be to do some spot checking and make sure all the eq in\n
those zones are finished.  They may very well be finished already.\n
\n
Also, if you have time, check out the craft code on builderport, and make sure that it creates objects properly.\n
\n
Aside from objects, I think the only thing holding me back on combat code is forms, which Parol has \n
promised he will get started on as soon as he gets back from his trip.\n
\n
Hopefully we can get things moving again.\n
\n
-Duren\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jun 21 21:17:14 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 EQ
\n`7CC`6: `7Duren Syrah
\n\n
Hey guys!\n
\n
I was wondering about the EQ. I have all of the values from\n
the BD board, but I wasn't sure where to start. Should I get\n
a clean zone and use it just for objects, or should I use\n
existing zones, like Tar Valon, if I plan on making EQ that you\n
can purchase in TV?\n
\n
Also, should I make setts of matching EQ, should I use color,\n
and how many types of weapons and eq can I make? Do we have\n
ranged combat, so should I make bows/crossbows? Also, I plan\n
on making poor/fair/good/great weapons, but you guys need to\n
give me some direction on how it should be done. \n
\n
Just let me know so I can start. \n
\n
-Sads.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jun 21 21:17:14 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 EQ
\n`7CC`6: `7Duren Syrah
\n\n
Hey guys!\n
\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 26 11:51:15 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Volkare
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Liahm Dalren
\nI'm not looking for inclusion of Liahm (my rename for Volkare) in the DD guild (I think\n
there are too many Asha'man there already), just looking to get approval for the bits\n
of the background that touch on DD subjects (service with House Tarborwin).\n
\n
Liahm Dalren was never satisfied with his life. The first child of a minor \n
Cairhienin merchant, he was trained from a young age to take over his father's \n
business, and so he spent from age 6 to age 13 drearily behind a desk, learning \n
to balance ledgers and follow trading trends. His mother, a seamstress by \n
trade, always told the most amazing stories of adventure and travel, much at \n
odds with the boring life that Liahm was quickly growing into. His younger \n
sister had to learn as well, but she wasn't pushed as much as Liahm by their \n
father. The situation quickly grew to grate on the young boy, and he ran off, \n
hitching his fortunes to a passing menangerie. Running messages and tending to \n
props wasn't much more exciting, but at least he was around exciting people, \n
and constantly moving through new lands. \n
\n
He lasted four years with the menagerie, and then found himself back in \n
Cairhien, bored to tears of mucking out stalls and no closer to performing in \n
any way, shape, or form. By this time, his mother and father were dead (she \n
grew sick shortly after he fled home, he passed on shortly after she did) and \n
his sister had been taken away to Tar Valon (the loss of the second child was \n
what pushed his mother over the edge). With nothing of his family left, Liahm \n
swore himself to House Tarborwin as a guardsman, sure that this was the way to \n
glory, adventure, and excitement. And in a way, he was right.\n
\n
His training progressed rapidly enough, as the young man was used to physical \n
exertion, and learned quickly, and soon he was a newly minted Guardsman of \n
House Tarborwin. He served the House for several years, skirmishing against \n
Andorans and Tairens before he was 20 and the world changed. Aiel poured over \n
the Dragonwall again. Liahm fought with the rest of his House, doing what he \n
could to save the city of his birth. The intervention of the Lord Dragon and \n
his Aiel undoubtedly saved the young Guardsman's life, and Liahm was left to \n
help his House rebuild in the wake of the war.\n
\n
Then the Lord Dragon was taken from the very Sun Palace, and Liahm, now a \n
Squadman, was chosen to accompany Lord Dobraine to succor the Savior of \n
Cairhien. He fought long and hard, seeing the devastation wrought by women who \n
could channel. That wrath was surpassed as the sun outshines a candle by the \n
fury of the black-coated men who arrived and ended the battle. Then and there, \n
Liahm Dalren decided that he would serve the Lord Dragon whose subjects had \n
saved him twice now. On the first recruiting trip to Cairhien, the young man \n
made himself available to the Asha'man, his awe of the black-coated \n
slaughterers overshadowing his family's particular fear and hatred of male \n
channelers. Expecting to be shunted aside to train the Legion of the Dragon, \n
Liahm was surprised and frightened when it was found that he could learn to \n
channel.\n
\n
He was taken to the Farm just weeks after the battle of Dumai's Wells, and \n
there his true training began. Crispness and precision marked the young \n
Cairhienin's style, although now and then hints of the showmanship learned with \n
the menagerie showed through. He quickly became a Soldier, and his strength and \n
ability with the One Power marked him for quick promotion, and he quickly \n
became a specialist in combating other channelers. It was his loyalty to Mazrim \n
Taim, however, that gained him the sword pin of a Dedicated, and sent him to \n
the White Tower in the Raid. He was one of the men who Traveled into the Ajah \n
Halls, and he spent the entire duration of the Raid subduing recalcitrant Aes \n
Sedai with all indication of great enjoyment.\n
\n
Although his sense of adventure chafes at the forced inactivity at the Black \n
Tower, he trains for the day when the Aes Sedai once more decide that they are \n
more important than the Asha'man, fully intending to put them back in their \n
place (beneath the polished boots of the Asha'man, in his mind) when that day \n
comes. How this belief will change when it becomes apparent that his sister \n
Kadiana, now an Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, is at the Black Tower is yet to be \n
seen.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul 26 11:55:55 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Volkare
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Liahm Dalren
\nMostly just using you as a double-check since I'm my own GL, but also getting approval\n
for non-channeler participation in Dumai's Wells.\n
\n

Liahm Dalren was never satisfied with his life. The first child of a minor Cairhienin merchant, he was trained from a young age to take over his father's business, and so he spent from age 6 to age 13 drearily behind a desk, learning to balance ledgers and follow trading trends. His mother, a seamstress by trade, always told the most amazing stories of adventure and travel, much at odds with the boring life that Liahm was quickly growing into. His younger sister had to learn as well, but she wasn't pushed as much as Liahm by their father. The situation quickly grew to grate on the young boy, and he ran off, hitching his fortunes to a passing menangerie. Running messages and tending to props wasn't much more exciting, but at least he was around exciting people, and constantly moving through new lands.\n
\n

He lasted four years with the menagerie, and then found himself back in Cairhien, bored to tears of mucking out stalls and no closer to performing in any way, shape, or form. By this time, his mother and father were dead (she grew sick shortly after he fled home, he passed on shortly after she did) and his sister had been taken away to Tar Valon (the loss of the second child was what pushed his mother over the edge). With nothing of his family left, Liahm swore himself to House Tarborwin as a guardsman, sure that this was the way to glory, adventure, and excitement. And in a way, he was right.\n
\n

His training progressed rapidly enough, as the young man was used to physical exertion, and learned quickly, and soon he was a newly minted Guardsman of House Tarborwin. He served the House for several years, skirmishing against Andorans and Tairens before he was 20 and the world changed. Aiel poured over the Dragonwall again. Liahm fought with the rest of his House, doing what he could to save the city of his birth. The intervention of the Lord Dragon and his Aiel undoubtedly saved the young Guardsman's life, and Liahm was left to help his House rebuild in the wake of the war.\n
\n

Then the Lord Dragon was taken from the very Sun Palace, and Liahm, now a Squadman, was chosen to accompany Lord Dobraine to succor the Savior of Cairhien. He fought long and hard, seeing the devastation wrought by women who could channel. That wrath was surpassed as the sun outshines a candle by the fury of the black-coated men who arrived and ended the battle. Then and there, Liahm Dalren decided that he would serve the Lord Dragon whose subjects had saved him twice now. On the first recruiting trip to Cairhien, the young man made himself available to the Asha'man, his awe of the black-coated slaughterers overshadowing his family's particular fear and hatred of male channelers. Expecting to be shunted aside to train the Legion of the Dragon, Liahm was surprised and frightened when it was found that he could learn to channel.\n
\n

He was taken to the Farm just weeks after the battle of Dumai's Wells, and there his true training began. Crispness and precision marked the young Cairhienin's style, although now and then hints of the showmanship learned with the menagerie showed through. He quickly became a Soldier, and his strength and ability with the One Power marked him for quick promotion, and he quickly became a specialist in combating other channelers. It was his loyalty to Mazrim Taim, however, that gained him the sword pin of a Dedicated, and sent him to the White Tower in the Raid. He was one of the men who Traveled into the Ajah Halls, and he spent the entire duration of the Raid subduing recalcitrant Aes Sedai with all indication of great enjoyment.\n
\n

Although his sense of adventure chafes at the forced inactivity at the Black Tower, he trains for the day when the Aes Sedai once more decide that they are more important than the Asha'man, fully intending to put them back in their place (beneath the polished boots of the Asha'man, in his mind) when that day comes. How this belief will change when it becomes apparent that his sister Kadiana, now an Aes Sedai of the Red Ajah, is at the Black Tower is yet to be seen.\n

With nothing of his family left, Liahm swore himself to House Tarborwin as a guardsman, sure that this was the way to glory, adventure, and excitement. And in a way, he was right.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jul 31 21:59:31 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Asana
\n`7Subj`6:`7 background and description for Asana

\nBackground: Born in Andor, the daughter of a fairly well off farming family, Asana is the youngest of seven children and the only girl born of a loving family. Like many rural women she was trained by her mother and other women of her village to cook, clean, care for their family and heal using herbs and ancient techniques. By the age of thirteen she already showed great promise in helping those in neighboring villages, aiding her mother as the local midwife. The village located in River Erinin Region, was not so backward as to not notice when the girl showed exceptional talent with healing arts. Though with all the trouble and turmoil in the realms she was immediately sent from her home to Tar Valon in the hopes she will either be trained as Aes Sedai or she will come home "cured" of any attachments of the one power.\n

Description: Too old to be a child, too young to be a full grown adult, the girl stands on the cusp of becoming a woman. She is slender and petite, standing at approximately five feet, and moving with poise and grace that gives her a sylphlike appearance. Large silk like rich curls of light blond hair cascade past her shoulders to brush mid-back, the lengthy locks brushed to sheen and pinned back with small combs. Large almond shaped eyes dominate her features, the deep blue orbs flecked with soft hues of light blue and silver. Long dark lashes frame her large eyes the natural curl sweeping up towards neatly shaped brow. A slender nose, creamy ivory complexion, and petite and full lips give her an innocent look. A gracefully long neck only adds to her sylphlike appearance as it slopes down to meet with her slender shoulders.\n
\n

She is clad in a summery frock of soft white linen, the lightweight dress cut in an empress style waistline gathered just beneath the bust and falling in soft folds to the floor. The empress waistline is trimmed with a  pale green ribbon that is embroidered with little vines dotted with flowers. The sleeves are long and form fitting, held closed with a bronze button at the wrist.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jul 31 21:59:31 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Asana
\n`7Subj`6:`7 background and description for Asana

\nBackground: Born in Andor, the daughter of a fairly well off farming family, Asana is the youngest of seven children and the only girl born of a loving family. Like many rural women she was trained by her mother and other women of her village to cook, clean, care for their family and heal using herbs and ancient techniques. By the age of thirteen she already showed great promise in helping those in neighboring villages, aiding her mother as the local midwife. The village located in River Erinin Region, was not so backward as to not notice when the girl showed exceptional talent with healing arts. Though with all the trouble and turmoil in the realms she was immediately sent from her home to Tar Valon in the hopes she will either be trained as Aes Sedai or she will come home "cured" of any attachments of the one power.\n

Description: Too old to be a child, too young to be a full grown adult, the girl stands on the cusp of becoming a woman. She is slender and petite, standing at approximately five feet, and moving with poise and grace that gives her a sylphlike appearance. Large silk like rich curls of light blond hair cascade past her shoulders to brush mid-back, the lengthy locks brushed to sheen and pinned back with small combs. Large almond shaped eyes dominate her features, the deep blue orbs flecked with soft hues of light blue and silver. Long dark lashes frame her large eyes the natural curl sweeping up towards neatly shaped brow. A slender nose, creamy ivory complexion, and petite and full lips give her an innocent look. A gracefully long neck only adds to her sylphlike appearance as it slopes down to meet with her slender shoulders.\n
\n

She is clad in a summery frock of soft white linen, the lightweight dress cut in an empress style waistline gathered just beneath the bust and falling in soft folds to the floor. The empress waistline is trimmed with a  pale green ribbon that is embroidered with little vines dotted with flowers. The sleeves are long and form fitting, held closed with a bronze button at the wrist.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Aug  4 16:42:15 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 The new MiT mudconnector description.
\nHey guys,\n
\n
I updated the MudConnector desc a bit. Not much, just a few lines.\n
Any other coments or ideas before I go and repost this? Anything\n
I can add to make it better?\n
\n
-Sads\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme (MiT) is one of the oldest Wheel of Time \n
based Muds on the Internet.  Since 1994, our coders and \n
builders have been working hard to bring in unique new \n
features and our own original areas.  MiT is currently on \n
our third major revision of the codebase, and our areas \n
are all completely original.  At A Moment in Tyme, we have \n
a dedicated playerbase and an excellent, committed staff of \n
Immortals.  We have unique systems in place to rank \n
players' mastery in swordplay and channeling (Wheel of \n
Time's magic system).\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme is set on a Timeline that is based on the\n
first six books. After that, though, Tyme has broken away\n
to become a mirror world of those books. The Bowl of the Winds\n
has been found and used, breaking the long winter. Elayne\n
has returned to Andor and taken the Throne. After the death\n
of Queen Analinde Su Riaten Rie, Lord Dobraine of House \n
Taborwin acts as Cairhien's Regent.\n
\n
The White Tower split pit Sister versus Sister, but an attack \n
from the Black Tower resulted in Elaida's kidnapping and\n
subsequent desposing. Now, the White Tower stands united\n
against the coming of Tarmon Gaidon, with Matylena Taravin\n
presiding as the new Amyrlin. She has named the Rand al'Thor\n
as the Dragon Reborn, and there is talk of cleansing the Taint.\n
\n
And the Seanchan? Tarabon, Arad Doman, and Altara are\n
all victims of the Ever Victorious Army. The High Lady\n
Suroth invaded, and conquered Murandy, instead of reaching\n
into Amadicia. Because of this, High Lady Ilorin Shayndel \n
Paendrag, fourth in line for the Crystal Throne, has \n
officially settled into the Panarch's Palace and taken\n
control of the Hailene. Who will stop them? Word is that \n
a mercenary group called the Heron Company is being raised\n
to retake Arad Doman...\n
\n
A Moment in Tyme is a RP-intensive MUD that features over\n
twenty guilds. On this MUD, experience is received\n
exclusively for roleplaying based on emotes. Combat code\n
is currently being remodified and rebuilt from the ground\n
up, and will offer a system based on 50 different body \n
parts as well as have very realistically coded forms with \n
special procedures. \n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Sep  3 09:36:40 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Duren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: turn info
\nThe combat code you currently see is not what we're working on.  It was someone\n
elses failed attempt to build a turn based combat system.  However it lacks\n
all of the basic features of our new system.  The whole grid system is going away\n
also, because it prevents combat use with mobs.\n
\n
Don't hesitate to let us know about any other MUD features that are not accessible,\n
and if you're around when we open the new code for beta testing, be sure to sign up\n
and test it out for us.  :)\n
\n
-Duren\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Sep 13 20:07:20 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Dawynn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Asha'man
\nA slender young man with a set of slightly narrowed light brown eyes framed in a smooth, almost silky face were it not for a slight tan. Clean cheeks meet a \n
slim nose, all set above an oval shaped jaw.\n
Background\n
Dawynn staggered to his knees, head ringing and blood trickling down his temples. Not his blood, was it? His eyes darted around the tent, colorful spots \n
blinking in and out of his vision. A painting hung from the southern entrance, depicting a disproportionaly large man in the lookout post of a small vessel, \n
floating in the sky with a hand pointing towards something afront, in the distance. Ironically, the man's head had been pierced by a stray piece of wood. The \n
room was covered in dirt and... and blood. A gaping hole in the tent wall revealed the street and the burning tents across.\n
Alarming shouts and the sound of thunder and ringing of steel foreshadowed the sight that was about to meet Dawynn. Flinching, he stood up and covered the \n
five paces of ground that lead out to the large, gaping hole and the street. The large pool of smeared blood that lead to the street looked as if someone had \n
crawled or been dragged across, out of the hole into chaos while bleeding profously. His eyes darted across the ground outside the tents in the Shaido camp \n
and he saw men lying about, groaning in pain at the loss of limbs or holes torn up by the ball of flame that had hid the tent. He winced, seeing his uncle \n
lying with stumps where there had been legs, clothes charred and turning into ashes.\n
He did not have time to mourn. He needed to run, right this instant. He \n
tossed away the white garnments of gai'shain and scurried about, looking for clothes. He would not be made an Aiel slave again.\n
Dawynn is a Tar Valoner orphan who grew up in the care of his uncle, Hamin. His uncle was a merchant of sorts, serving as a middle-man, or as he himself \n
preferred to call it, 'the vital link between the interest and the interested'. In his company, he grew up on the roads, travelling along the trade-routes by \n
road from Cairhien in the east to Arad Doman in the East. He had seen a lot of interesting things in the world but never quite felt at ease not having a \n
home. At one point, when he was 12, they stayed in Tar Valon for more than two years, which was the longest \n
he had ever stayed in a single place. His uncle \n
took good care of him, as well as he could considering he was not very wealthy and could not settle down in a place long enough. His bargain with two \n
merchants from Two Rivers who would sell him their acquired tobacco in Tar Valon ensured that he could stay in Tar Valon for those two years, finally \n
granting Dawynn and opportunity to sleep under the same roof.\n
The boy though, never felt that being sedentary granted him any special sense of belonging. His home was simply someplace else, with someone else, and he \n
never found himself being like the next person. He always had questions, as if there should be more to life than existing, that in these times, turning \n
increasingly menacing every year, there was some place out there where he could do something extraordinary. On their way from Malden, the town was overtaken \n
by Shaido and him and his uncle were forced to become gai'shain. Not long after, the Shaido suffered a terrible defeat and Dawynn fled along with others, \n
making his way to Lugard, where he is at present.\n
(Hoping to be picked up by a recruiting crew of Asha'man)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Sep 13 20:07:20 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Dawynn

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Sep 23 14:55:46 2007\n`7From`6:`7 Salome
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Prelim Report
\nMundane things you would have received from Salome that we don't need to RP:\n
\n
1) Detailed map of the Andoran palace, including layout and who stays where, and\n
location of guard postings.\n
\n
2) Detailed descriptions of Andoran Guard uniforms, enough to be able to reproduce\n
them convincingly.\n
\n
3) Detailed information on the marath'damane in the Palace, including the Andoran\n
Queen and her closest advisors.\n
\n
4) Detailed information on the other residents of the palace, as can be gleaned by\n
one of Elayne's personal guards.\n
\n
5) A list of those reponsible for setting up guard rosters in andor and in Elayne's\n
personal guard, as well as an outline of when shift changes occur.\n
\n
6) Detailed map of Caemlyn, again with guard locations and with annotations of areas\n
of interest and security vulnerabilities.\n
\n
7) General progress report of Salome's position in Elayne's guard, and plans to advance\n
in rank to be able to set guard rosters, with the assistance of Lt. Koronel.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan  4 02:30:15 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Bakur
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background - Bakur Ardal
\nDescription\n
\n
A short man maybe five feet seven inches tall with dark hair and eyes stands here.\n
He is a stocky man with a nice build, by his looks you may say he is in his late twenties.\n
He features are fair, delicate, yet handsome. He bears a small scar above his left eye. His\n
eyes are a deep dark brown and hair deep brown as well almost mistaken for black. His\n
looks are very normal to say he is of Cairhienin descent, other than the style of his hair\n
From the looks of him it seems he hasn't had to do much hard work, don't let that fool\n
you. From the look of his smile and eyes you know how cunning and strong this man\n
really is.\n
\n
He wears a silk loose fitting black shirt and dark blue fancy wool trousers. Over\n
his shirt he wears an black leather vest, starting from the neck of the vest to the\n
bottom small blue and white strips run across one after the other, covering the\n
front of it. Over all of this he wears a very nice fitted white wool coat that he keeps\n
open usually. Ivory cuff-links in the easily recognizable shape of a Rising Sun adorn\n
his wrists. There is also a well made stitching of a Rising Sun sewn into the left\n
breast of the coat, made well for good view of the eye. His boots are a highly\n
polished black leather they come up to just above the ankle. Around his waist is a\n
polished black leather belt with a white ivory buckle. From the belt hangs three\n
sheaths one for a sword the other for two daggers. The short sword has a silver handle\n
with black leather braided in a fancy design around it, the blade is curved and single\n
fancy design around it, the blade is straight and double edged. The other dagger has a\n
edged. One dagger has a white ivory handle with black leather braid in another \n
clear almost crystal handle and double edged curved blade.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

looks are very normal to say he is of Cairhienin descent, other than the style of his hair\n
From the looks of him it seems he hasn't had to do much hard work, don't let that fool\n
you. From the look of his smile and eyes you know how cunning and strong this man\n
really is.\n
\n
He wears a silk loose fitting black shirt and dark blue fancy wool trousers. Over\n
his shirt he wears an black leather vest, starting from the neck of the vest to the\n
bottom small blue and white strips run across one after the other, covering the\n
front of it. Over all of this he wears a very nice fitted white wool coat that he keeps\n
open usually. Ivory cuff-links in the easily recognizable shape of a Rising Sun adorn\n
his wrists. There is also a well made stitching of a Rising Sun sewn into the left\n
breast of the coat, made well for good view of the eye. His boots are a highly\n
polished black leather they come up to just above the ankle. Around his waist is a\n
polished black leather belt with a white ivory buckle. From the belt hangs three\n
sheaths one for a sword the other for two daggers. The short sword has a silver handle\n
with black leather braided in a fancy design around it, the blade is curved and single\n
fancy design around it, the blade is straight and double edged. The other dagger has a\n
edged. One dagger has a white ivory handle with black leather braid in another \n
clear almost crystal handle and double edged curved blade.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan  4 13:07:00 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Yacoub
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Report
\nM'hael Vallin,\n

I write to you with a report concerning Term Del Ray and the Mercenary Heron Company. I scouted their men and followed them once they left the tower grounds. They did indeed stop to mark landmarks and make a map to the Black Tower. They have also returned to Caemlyn. Term Del Ray has a bounty on his head from Arad Doman. He also has spoken of knowing the Seanchan. I can't attest to whether this is first hand knowledge or not, but he does seem to have significant knowledge of them and lead me to believe he may know more than we have. He also likely still has contacts behind Seanchan lines. These contacts could provide information or even smuggle our agents into Seanchan territory. He has invited me to Heron Hall to receive a sword lesson. I told him when we met that the late Gerrit was my teacher and that he had died. He offered to teach me for a price. He does not know of my affiliation with the black tower. I plan to travel there to get the lesson and establish raport in hopes that I may soon use this advantage to gain intelligence on the Seanchan. As always, I am ready to serve you and welcome any instructions.\n
\n
Yacoub DeCoeur\n
Soldier of the Black Tower\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan  4 23:02:09 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Maylea
\n`7Subj`6:`7 A Message
\n*this message will likely not arrive for a month or so after\n
you find the lock of hair and the key to the room at the inn*\n
\n
Dear Uncle,\n
\n
I have arrived safely in Saldaea, thanks to the generosity\n
of a friend whom you saw me conversing with in the Lion Banner\n
some time ago.  He saw myself and Mistress Shora to Saldaea,\n
and the journey was so quick!  It was as if we took a step,\n
and suddenly, we arrived.  Now we are in a little town called\n
Faerdon, near the River Arinelle.  Poor Mistress Shora broke\n
her hip after she was thrown from her horse, and I have\n
promised to see her tended to and safely on her way to the\n
Border.  I am expected back to the place where my friend who\n
wears the black coat left me in four days' time.  After that,\n
I know not where we shall go, though I do hope to see the\n
great city of Maradon before we leave!\n
\n
Please give my regards to everyone back home, and tell\n
them not to worry too much.  Especially give my regards to\n
my Lady, whom I sorely miss, and to whom I remain faithful,\n
even unto death.\n
\n
*sighed*\n
\n
Your Niece\n
\n
*the letter is sealed with a dancing girl in blue wax*\n
\n
*it will have been delivered to one of Maylea's Listeners\n
in Caemlyn, who then would have arranged for it to be very\n
discreetly delivered to Heron Hall to the attention of Term\n
Delrey*\n
\n
*it also would have been written before Maylea met up with\n
her current travelling companions*\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan  9 22:51:51 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Caleb
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Yo
\nNashida and I are on the road to Tar Valon from Tarabon.  We're heading around\n
the south end of the Mountains of Mist.  Just an idea, but think you might be\n
able to throw a little havoc and fun our way en route?\n
\n
- Caleb\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jan 11 18:24:33 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Brailon
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seanchan spy info

\nBrailon writes up another report stating that he ran across a spy in Caemlyn though he did not know she was at the outset.  Once he discovered what she was, the spy killed herself before he could get any information.  He did find some differently colored threads he thinks she used as signals and also a small ivory plaque inset with a raven in solid gold.  His not brilliant conclusions are the Seanchan are obviously interested in Andor and Caemlyn and it may be worth capturing another Seanchan to interrogate to find if there is any significance to the plaque.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan 16 11:22:56 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Matylena
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Parol's Comments
\nCC: Maelyn Balinor\n
\n
\n
So, this is what Parol and I discussed yesterday when we\n
were talking about the whole overcrowding issue.\n
\n
1. The returning Aes Sedai and Gaidin are not really the main\n
problem.  It's the large amount of Novices, soldiers and camp\n
followers.\n
\n
2. Parol asserted that he was underestimating the number of\n
Novices, because of one reference that suggested the Rebel\n
Tower actually had 1,000 novices.  I looked this up, and it\n
does say 'near a thousand' in Crossroads of Twilight.  So,\n
400-450 is actually quite a generously small number.\n
\n
3. Parol feels that Tar Valon can maintain about 15,000 soldiers\n
if about 10,000 of them are sent away and the last 5,000 are\n
sent back to their regular jobs around Tar Valon to be called\n
up as needed.  "Of course, they'd probably be maintained in\n
the state that the Rebel Camp was maintained - slightly short\n
rations and going without any luxuries.  The Aes Sedai, of\n
course, wouldn't be under any such restrictions, since they'd\n
still be in the White Tower, which was designed for their\n
full number and then some."\n
\n
4. Parol suggested using Traveling to bring supplies to the\n
camp and relieve some of the stress, if Aes Sedai powerful\n
enough to Travel can be convinced to do something so mundane\n
as to help carts move into Tar Valon, 'but that won't solve\n
everything in and of itself either.'\n
\n
So, that's his take on it.  Here is mine. :>\n
\n
I agree with his first point.  The returning Aes Sedai and\n
Gaidin are not the issue, nor are the Accepted.  It is the\n
excess number of Novices, the army, and camp followers.\n
Even with the reduced numbers (400-450 as opposed to 1000),\n
Novice rooms would still be overcrowded, assuming we go by\n
book Novice rooms... if the double-bunking Novice thing is\n
unique to this game and timeline, that's fine... then I guess\n
there's nothing to worry about.  But I did want to point out\n
that Novice rooms are SMALL, as mentioned in my previous mail.\n
But double-bunking in the Accepted quarters would probably\n
solve the problem.\n
\n
Now to the soldiers and camp followers.  I honestly don't\n
think we need to send them away.  They came to Tar Valon for\n
a reason, and Maty is not likely to just send them packing,\n
when she can likely make use of them.  For now, they can do\n
like in the books, and stay in the towns alongside the river.\n
\n
As for supplying them and feeding them... this is where I\n
believe Parol is wrong.  I was reading through Crossroads of\n
Twilight last night, and came across a comment from Gareth\n
Bryne to Egwene, saying how, once they took the city, they\n
would be able to eat better, but they couldn't, because of\n
Elaida allowing ships in to carry more soldiers that she had\n
Chubain recruiting.\n
\n
1. We don't have an Elaida overcrowding the harbor with ships\n
full of freshly recruited soldiers.\n
\n
2. Tar Valon is welcoming Gareth's soldiers, and it never came\n
to war.  And it isnt winter yet, and as far as I know, there\n
aren't weevils and rot and the like infesting the food.  So,\n
food supplies are not going to be as much of an issue as\n
they were in the books.  Parol is trying to convince us that\n
these soldiers are going to have to live in conditions that\n
are exactly like they were in the books, and this simply is\n
not the case.\n
\n
Finally, I've got an idea that might give Gareth's soldiers\n
something to do besides sit around.  Tarmon Gai'don is on\n
its way.  I've thought about the idea of seeing a couple of\n
outposts built south of the Border Nations, sort of as a\n
semi-long-term goal.  These outposts would house soldiers...\n
Bryne's Boys... and perhaps Aes Sedai as well, to act sort\n
of as a reinforcement in case the Shield of the North should\n
somehow fail, or in case the Borderlands need aid should the\n
Shadow suddenly decide to wake up and start moving.  That's\n
if I could convince Bryne to agree to it.  Meanwhile, this\n
leaves these soldiers close enough to Tar Valon in case they\n
are needed as well.  The area I am thinking of are the forest\n
areas north of Tar Valon, and south of Arafel/Kandor/Shienar.\n
There is plenty of water and the possibility of trade along\n
the river, there is plenty of forest for lumber for building.\n
There are major roads leading to and from the Borderlands for\n
further commerce, and there are flatlands and the like that\n
would be ideal for farming.  I was thinking, basically of\n
building two 'fort' towns, each with 5000 soldiers.  It's a\n
long-term goal, and doesn't solve our immediate problems,\n
but it might be an option, so we don't have to just send all\n
the soldiers away, when we could put them to good use. :)\n
Finally, I think Tar Valon could easily support the remaining\n
soldiers.  That's assuming I'm correct in my assumption that\n
Elaida didn't have a chance to build up the Tower Guard as\n
much as she did by book 10.  Anyway, this is getting long. :)\n
\n
Maty\n

\n
Finally, I've got an idea that might give Gareth's soldiers\n
something to do besides sit around.  Tarmon Gai'don is on\n
its way.  I've thought about the idea of seeing a couple of\n
outposts built south of the Border Nations, sort of as a\n
semi-long-term goal.  These outposts would house soldiers...\n
Bryne's Boys... and perhaps Aes Sedai as well, to act sort\n
of as a reinforcement in case the Shield of the North should\n
somehow fail, or in case the Borderlands need aid should the\n
Shadow suddenly decide to wake up and start moving.  That's\n
if I could convince Bryne to agree to it.  Meanwhile, this\n
leaves these soldiers close enough to Tar Valon in case they\n
are needed as well.  The area I am thinking of are the forest\n
areas north of Tar Valon, and south of Arafel/Kandor/Shienar.\n
There is plenty of water and the possibility of trade along\n
the river, there is plenty of forest for lumber for building.\n
There are major roads leading to and from the Borderlands for\n
further commerce, and there are flatlands and the like that\n
would be ideal for farming.  I was thinking, basically of\n
building two 'fort' towns, each with 5000 soldiers.  It's a\n
long-term goal, and doesn't solve our immediate problems,\n
but it might be an option, so we don't have to just send all\n
the soldiers away, when we could put them to good use. :)\n
Finally, I think Tar Valon could easily support the remaining\n
soldiers.  That's assuming I'm correct in my assumption that\n
Elaida didn't have a chance to build up the Tower Guard as\n
much as she did by book 10.  Anyway, this is getting long. :)\n
\n
Maty\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan 17 10:22:55 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Matylena
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Merchants
\nActually, we do have a merchant's guild still!\n
\n
Kinje and Isleen are the most active members.  There is\n
also the possibility of negotiating trade with the nobles,\n
who own the land that the supplies would come from.  I\n
wouldn't recommend Cairhien though, since it's still in\n
recovery from the Aiel War, and the more recent return\n
of the Aiel again, among other things.  Maybe Andor, or\n
even as far south as Illian?  River trade. :>\n
\n
Maty might be able to use her Andoran ties to work out\n
some sort of agreement with Elayne too.\n
\n
Overall, I don't think supplies will be a huge problem.\n
Might not be ideal, but I doubt it will be enough of a\n
problem to cause riots in the streets and the like.\n
\n
Anyway, I'm out of steam on it for the moment.  And\n
thanks for the clarification on the Novice room situation. :)\n
\n
Maty\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

of the Aiel again, among other things.  Maybe Andor, or\n
even as far south as Illian?  River trade. :>\n
\n
Maty might be able to use her Andoran ties to work out\n
some sort of agreement with Elayne too.\n
\n
Overall, I don't think supplies will be a huge problem.\n
Might not be ideal, but I doubt it will be enough of a\n
problem to cause riots in the streets and the like.\n
\n
Anyway, I'm out of steam on it for the moment.  And\n

\n
Maty\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Jan 20 20:16:14 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Isleen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumor Update for Andor
\nRumor - Andor\n
\n
\n
Asha'man Patroling Caemlyn Again?\n
\n
A number of people poured out of the Lion Banner inn, as\n
if running for their very lives, shouting about an Asha'man\n
going berserk.  No wait!  He wasn't so berzerk as all that.\n
At least poor Master Marston didn't have to rebuild his inn\n
again!  No wait!  Master Marston seems to have hired the man\n
himself!  The babble is inane and difficult to understand,\n
but tongues are definitely wagging about how a bald man in a\n
black coat came into the Lion Banner, threatened three men,\n
lifted them out of their chairs with the One Power, and gave\n
them a stern warning about acts of thievery, muggings and\n
assault.  It's said it was done in the presence of an Andoran\n
noblewoman even, after she had just berated a man for throwing\n
knives in the Oval Plaza.  What is going on?  Are the Asha'man\n
once again patrolling the streets of Andor?  Is it with the\n
Queen's blessing?  Or is it in spite of the Queen's edict?\n
There is even some talk that the Queen is working -with-\n
the Dragon Reborn now, and that the two are lovers!  Maybe\n
there is some truth to the possibility that the Dragon is\n
plotting to hold the Sun Throne as well for Elayne Trakand.\n
After all, if she is allowing the Dragon's men to police the\n
streets of Caemlyn again, it must mean something more is\n
going on than meets the eye.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Jan 27 15:17:37 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Isleen
\n`7Subj`6:`7 *a pigeon arrives from Andor*
\n\n
*the pigeon carries a message in a small tube, addressed to\n
Sadren Sedai of the White Ajah*\n
\n
Greetings to Sadren Sedai of the White Ajah,\n
\n
It has been some time since I have made contact, but I\n
wished you to know, Aes Sedai, that I had not forgotten your\n
request for various colors.  Unfortunately, I have not seen\n
even one lately, except for some black coats, which seem to\n
be very much in style, these days.  Perhaps even too much so,\n
for they seem to be everywhere!  The style may, perhaps,\n
even find its way to Tar Valon.  It all starts with one man,\n
you see, and then the fashion spreads, and before you know\n
it, everyone is wearing a black coat!\n
\n
The bugs are crawling to the south, and the lions are like\n
frightened cubs who don't know what to do.  The weather is\n
chilly, and I suspect a storm is brewing.  I do hope it will\n
not disrupt trade.  I have not heard from my supplier of\n
Murandian wine and lace in months.\n
\n
I hope all is well with the White Tower.  I will write\n
again in the near future.\n
\n
*signed*\n
\n
Your costume designer.\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan 28 04:17:45 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Ogier
\nLander, Son of Colum, Son of Maston is a young Ogier that has\n
been staying at the Tower for some time now. However, he spends\n
most of his at the Ogier Grove northwest of Tar Valon. He's\n
requested a book and asked that it be sent to the Ogier Grove\n
so he can read it there.\n
\n
If you leave from Tarmolen's Gate, you should head east down the \n
White Tower Way. Go east down Osenrein Road and the Grove\n
will be around there.\n
\n
Thanks!\n

\n
I was trying to name a new zone, and I looked online for the\n
command (zedit new <zone>)\n
\n
However, this is an IMP only command. I'm not godly enough\n

I will be able to handle it from there.\n
\n
-Sads\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Jan 28 13:52:14 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Duren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Automated Quest List
\nWill there be a way to somehow organize automated quests so that Imms can see them?\n
\n
This is a very low priority, but I just want a way to somehow keep track of quests.\n
Perhaps by zone, or something?\n
\n
Ok, I'm a little confused by this.  Do you mean listing the mob-progs?  Wouldn't\n
that be, mpstat, mpdump, mproglist, etc?\n
\n
Or am I missing something?\n
\n
-Duren\n

column5: Your wish is my command, again

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jan 29 00:59:49 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Duren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Your wish is my command, again
\nOk, I finally fixed mpedit list so it always lists in sequential order from lowest to highest.\n
I also made it so you can type:  mpedit list [zone] and see only the programs in that\n
zones range of vnums (Note that this command works regardless of whether a zone with\n
that number really exists or not, because mob programs aren't actually tied to zones\n
in any way.)\n
\n
Also, my new creation system here is almost finished, and is mostly working, so you shouldn't\n
have any trouble creating new characters now.\n
\n
Also, I updated the help files (MPEDIT, MOBPROGRAMS, and added a new one:  MOB LOGIC)\n
The MOB LOGIC file contains a reference for how to use the if-else statements, as well\n
as examples, and also includes a reference for how to use the for-loop code I created.\n
\n
I believe that takes care of all your requests regarding mob progs so far.  :)\n
\n
-Duren\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan 30 02:34:51 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 re: Builders
\n`7CC`6: `7Syrah Rissa Duren
\n\n
Hey bosses. *salute*\n
\n
I recruited Myrene to help me build. So far, she has been excellent.\n
\n
Duren mentioned to me that I should try and recruit more builders.\n
I'd like to do that, but so far the players we have now show little\n
sign of wanting to actually build.\n
\n
I spoke with Duren about recruiting experienced builders from\n
outside of the MUD. Before doing this, though, I wanted to talk\n
to Rissa and Syrah about what we could offer potential builders\n
who apply to the MUD.\n
Generally, it's hard to retain skilled builders. I would say\n
that having two more would be the perfect amount in order\n
to finish Tar Valon and the surrounding areas. However,\n
what can we offer thos builders to stay and actually work?\n
\n
I wanted to throw the question out to you all, to see if you\n
would be comfortable with me recruiting from without, and\n
what we could offer those people in the event they might work\n
out.\n
\n
Let me know your thoughts on this and how I should proceed.\n
\n
Tar Valon has been a year long process, but if we have 4 or so\n
dedicated builders, it could possibly be done in a month or two.\n
\n
Also, I could work on teaching mob scripting, and also over see\n
work being done on the other centers of RP.\n
\n
Thanks,\n
\n
A very busy,\n
-Sads\n

\n\n
Hey bosses. *salute*\n
\n
I recruited Myrene to help me build. So far, she has been excellent.\n
\n
Duren mentioned to me that I should try and recruit more builders.\n
I'd like to do that, but so far the players we have now show little\n
sign of wanting to actually build.\n
\n
I spoke with Duren about recruiting experienced builders from\n
outside of the MUD. Before doing this, though, I wanted to talk\n
to Rissa and Syrah about what we could offer potential builders\n
who apply to the MUD.\n
Generally, it's hard to retain skilled builders. I would say\n
that having two more would be the perfect amount in order\n
to finish Tar Valon and the surrounding areas. However,\n
what can we offer thos builders to stay and actually work?\n
\n
I wanted to throw the question out to you all, to see if you\n
would be comfortable with me recruiting from without, and\n
what we could offer those people in the event they might work\n
out.\n
\n
Let me know your thoughts on this and how I should proceed.\n
\n
Tar Valon has been a year long process, but if we have 4 or so\n
dedicated builders, it could possibly be done in a month or two.\n
\n
Also, I could work on teaching mob scripting, and also over see\n
work being done on the other centers of RP.\n
\n
Thanks,\n
\n
A very busy,\n
-Sads\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  4 10:15:07 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Duren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Stuff
\nHey Sadren,\n
\n
I deleted your latest task on dotproject.  Before you go and get upset, here's why:\n
\n
1.)  We already have said RP log system.  We've had it for years, just no-one uses it.\n
2.)  I already have a task on the dotproject board about revamping the RP log system to make it even more feature-complete.\n
\n
Also, I made another very significant improvement to the mob program code.  You know\n
how before it would respond immediately to events?  So if you were following someone\n
and you followed someone into a room, the mob would greet him before you made it into\n
the room, so you never saw the first greeting?\n
\n
Well, I changed all that.  Now when an event occurs, it gets added to a list.\n
And then after all players commands have been processed, the mud goes through\n
this list, and processes all the events in the order they were received.\n
Now as part of this same code, I added a delay variable, so each event can\n
have a different delay.  The delay being how long it will sit in that events\n
list before it executes.  This also allowed me to create an even better way\n
of handling delays than with mob pause.\n
\n
Remember I said mob pause actually leaves your script in memory, and your script just calls the\n
main game loop a given number of times (depending on how long you delay) ?\n
So here's what happens:\n
\n
game_loop calls command_interpreter (Lets say command is 'east' and you walk into a mob)\n
command_interpreter calls move_character function (to move you 'east'\n
move_character checks for mob triggers, finds one, and calls mp_greet_trigger\n
mp_greet_trigger calls program_flow, to execute your script.\n
program_flow executes your script, encounters a 'mob pause' and begins calling game_loop\n

game_loop goes through and processes any pending character commands and output.  However, anything the original game_loop was working on (Such as processing people who are following you) won't be taken care of by this game loop.\n
Notice now we have two game_loops, and when someone else types a command, we'll have two instances\n
of command_interpreter, and then that may cause another mob trigger, which will cause another instance\n
of program_flow, and that second script may have a delay in it as well.  And now we have another copy\n
of game loop running while we wait for that delay.  -Plus-, the original program_flow now has to wait\n
for the second one to finish before it can ever regain control.  So if player A triggers a 5 second\n
mob pause delay, and Player B triggers a 30 second delay while program A is in the process of\n
it's 5 second delay, then player A will end up waiting over 30 seconds, because he has to wait for\n
the second program to finish (Even if it's in another room or zone).\n
\n
Basically, even though it's better than the original delay code, it's\n
still far from ideal.  My new code fixes all this.\n
\n
I introduced a new command, called 'halt'  It works just like mob pause, only\n
better.  So you can do 'halt 5', to interupt your program for half a second.\n
The halt command actually saves all the data about where the script was when it stopped,\n
and then adds an event onto that events buffer I added, setting the delay for whatever you\n
specify.  Then once that delay is up, the MUD will re-open the script, jump back to where\n
it left off, and resume execution from that point.\n
\n
So halt is definitely the preferred way to pause programs now.\n
\n
I also changed mprogadd so it expects a delay variable now.  If you want the mob\n
to continue responding instantly to an event, without ever going on the event list,\n
you can specify a -1.  You will need to use -1 for some scripts, such as if you want\n
to have a script that only blocks an exit under certain rules.  If you use the \n
event buffer, your script won't end before the move_character code needs to know whether\n
or not you used 'end' or 'end 1'.  So it will assume you just did a regular 'end' and block\n
the character.\n
\n
Alright, now next topic.  Brailon sent me a mudmail offering to help build some.  He's\n
built before but he's probably a little rusty on the commands.  I'll forward the mudmail to you and syrah.\n
\n
-Duren\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

Alright, now next topic.  Brailon sent me a mudmail offering to help build some.  He's\n

\n
-Duren\n

column5: Lysander BG (Shadow and Black Tower both)

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  4 13:45:51 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Lysander
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Lysander BG (Shadow and Black Tower both)
\nPart One of Two (sorry, it's a long background :D)\n
\n
`#L`3YSANDER `#G`3RAYDON `8- `!B`1ACKGROUND`7\n
\n
Requested Guilding: I would like Lysander to eventually join\n
the Shadow as a Darkfriend while also get recruited into the\n
Black Tower as well.\n
\n
Channeler Type: He has the ability to channel inborn. He has\n
involuntarily seized saidin on three known occasions.\n
If there's anything else you need, please `&mail`7 or `1tell`7 me.\n
\n
\n
Lysander Graydon was born just over eighteen years ago to a\n
Tuatha'an couple named Frey and Almeida Graydon. His father,\n
Frey Graydon, once chartered a small sailing vessel along\n
the Alguenya River just outside the walls of Cairhien, trading\n
both fresh fish and local wares between the citizens of the\n
city and the occasional travelers he encountered on his trips\n
up and down the banks of the river.\n
\n
It was during one of these trips to Cairhien that he met the\n
fair Almeida Sabates, a handmaid to House Riatin at the time.\n
She had been sent to the docks to pick up the freshest catch\n
for the evening meal and happened upon Frey's barge. The two\n
struck up a friendship that slowly developed each time they\n
met when Frey was docked at Cairhien. About two years after\n
first meeting, Frey Graydon and Almeida Sabates were wed in\n
Cairhien. Joining him on his vessel, Almeida made a simple\n
life for herself selling wares along each journey.\n
\n
It was actually a storm that brought the unlikely couple to\n
the Tinker encampment. After stopping off at Cairhien, they\n
continued north along the Alguenya only to discover a fierce\n
storm brewing in the west. The couple quickly moored in a\n
reedy shoal near a small grove and made camp within the trees.\n
In the morning, they were awakened to the sound of a Tinker\n
camp not half a league away. Curiosity got the better of them\n
and they entered the camp. This would be the first of several\n
visits over the next three years before they decided to settle\n
within the camp as Tuatha'an themselves.\n
\n
Lysander was born only two short months after they had settled\n
in. His Cairhienin looks - pale skin and black hair - made him\n
an object of interest to the girls in camp, as many of them had\n
the traditional colors of western Andor instead. He was always\n
a quiet child, reserved and respectful of others. His parents\n
impressed upon him the Way of the Leaf at an early age, and the\n
teachings seem to have stuck. He quickly excelled at reading\n
barrier against friendship with the other Tinker children. The\n
camp was never disrespectful to him openly - the Way of the Leaf\n
forbid such acts, of course - but there was a sense of disdain\n
among the others as he developed into a young man.\n
\n
He became somewhat reclusive in his teens, choosing to spend\n
most of his time with his small collection of books - most of\n
which he had read dozens of times already. He became more with-\n
drawn over time, and the few friends he had until this time\n
quickly found other, better playmates.\n
\n
(Concluded in next mail)\n

column5: Lysander BG (Shadow and Black Tower both)

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

forbid such acts, of course - but there was a sense of disdain\n

\n
He became somewhat reclusive in his teens, choosing to spend\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  4 13:48:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Lysander
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Lysander BG (Part Two)
\nWhat neither Lysander nor his parents knew at the time was that\n
his isolation was also a sign of his dispondancy to life in\n
general, and to the well-being of his fellow Tinkers to an even\n
greater degree. There was an invisible wall between the rest of\n
the camp and Lysander that simply would never be breached. They\n
kept their distance from him and he from them. But this barely-\n
concealed tolerance wore on the poor boy throughout his later\n
childhood, giving him many sleepless nights and stiring dark\n
thoughts in his mind... thoughts that went against every word\n
of the Way that he had followed for so long.\n
\n
He felt the urge to rend the life from the things around him.\n
It was a carnal urge, something born from deep inside his soul\n
after long years of neglect and disdain. It was a scream in the\n
dark that only he could hear. He was seventeen when he first\n
acted on this impulse, and it would prove to be one of the\n
darkest days in his life.\n
\n
One of his playmates from years ago - one he hadn't spoken with\n
for days, of course - named Elsbet found him sleeping under the\n
shade of an old oak tree... or so she thought. His mind was\n
quite awake, actually, and he was fighting back thoughts of\n
despair and pain from a recent jest that he had become the butt\n
of. Elsbet startled him from his thoughts as she approached,\n
and with a lighthearted giggle she teased him about his the\n
Way of the Leaf not meaning to live under a tree forever. There\n
was nothing malicious in her words, but something in him broke\n
that day - a tender chord snapped - and he did the unthinkable.\n
Without any conscious thought, he performed his First Touching\n
of saidin and sent skeins of Fire into her face. The result was\n
terrible.\n
\n
The girl would never be called beautiful again, nor would she\n
likely find herself the object of anyone's affection, least of\n
all her own, from the scarred tissue across her cheeks and nose.\n
That same day, as she lay in a delirious fever mumbling about\n
Lysander burning her, the boy was forced from the caravan and\n
told never to return. His parents were heartbroken, but they\n
were unwilling to leave the Tinkers even for him. Their faith\n
in the Way was stronger than familial bonds, it appeared. This\n
exile and rejection spurred Lysander on into a dark fury, and\n
he left the Tuatha'an without another word.\n
\n
Upon reaching Cairhien, the channeling sickness finally struck\n
him. Burning with fever and freezing with chills, he was at the\n
mercy of the elements for two days as he lay unmoving in the\n
shadows of an abandoned stall just outside the city walls. Luck\n
would favor him this time, though, and he recovered with no\n
lasting damage. Well, at least no physical damage. Psycholo-\n
gically, he was an empty shell devoid of any feelings except\n
hatred and vengeance. Over the next two weeks, he quickly found\n
that he would have to control these urges if he wanted to live.\n
No one was willing to give food to a murderous loon, after all.\n
\n
By the time his eighteenth naming day arrived, he had pushed the\n
dark thoughts into his subconscious, letting them build roots in\n
his mind without giving any outward indication of the corrupt\n
nature of his soul. Two more times he accidentally channeled in\n
Cairhien, although neither with the disasterous results his\n
First Touching had wrought. It was on a whim that he decided to\n
leave Cairhien after hearing of a band of Tinkers spotted at\n
Four Kings, a small village west of Caemlyn in Andor.\n
\n
As of now, he has just arrived in Caemlyn. He doesn't really\n
know what brought him to the capital. Perhaps he needed to get\n
away from his heritage completely. Maybe those dark thoughts\n
festering in his soul are leading him toward the eventual,\n
cataclysmic reunion with his people. Only time will tell. It\n
might be interesting to note that he's been seeking out news of\n
Friends of the Dark quietly, however. But then again, pledging\n
his soul to the Dark One seems like a small step compared with\n
the journey into darkness his soul has already taken.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  4 13:48:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Lysander
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Lysander BG (Part Two)

shadows of an abandoned stall just outside the city walls. Luck\n
would favor him this time, though, and he recovered with no\n
lasting damage. Well, at least no physical damage. Psycholo-\n
gically, he was an empty shell devoid of any feelings except\n
hatred and vengeance. Over the next two weeks, he quickly found\n
that he would have to control these urges if he wanted to live.\n
No one was willing to give food to a murderous loon, after all.\n
\n
By the time his eighteenth naming day arrived, he had pushed the\n
dark thoughts into his subconscious, letting them build roots in\n
his mind without giving any outward indication of the corrupt\n
nature of his soul. Two more times he accidentally channeled in\n
Cairhien, although neither with the disasterous results his\n
First Touching had wrought. It was on a whim that he decided to\n
leave Cairhien after hearing of a band of Tinkers spotted at\n
Four Kings, a small village west of Caemlyn in Andor.\n
\n
As of now, he has just arrived in Caemlyn. He doesn't really\n
know what brought him to the capital. Perhaps he needed to get\n
away from his heritage completely. Maybe those dark thoughts\n
festering in his soul are leading him toward the eventual,\n
cataclysmic reunion with his people. Only time will tell. It\n
might be interesting to note that he's been seeking out news of\n
Friends of the Dark quietly, however. But then again, pledging\n
his soul to the Dark One seems like a small step compared with\n
the journey into darkness his soul has already taken.\n

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  4 13:45:51 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Lysander
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Lysander BG (Shadow and Black Tower both)
\nPart One of Two (sorry, it's a long background :D)\n
\n
`#L`3YSANDER `#G`3RAYDON `8- `!B`1ACKGROUND`7\n
\n
Requested Guilding: I would like Lysander to eventually join\n
the Shadow as a Darkfriend while also get recruited into the\n
Black Tower as well.\n
\n
Channeler Type: He has the ability to channel inborn. He has\n
involuntarily seized saidin on three known occasions.\n
If there's anything else you need, please `&mail`7 or `1tell`7 me.\n
\n
\n
Lysander Graydon was born just over eighteen years ago to a\n
Tuatha'an couple named Frey and Almeida Graydon. His father,\n
Frey Graydon, once chartered a small sailing vessel along\n
the Alguenya River just outside the walls of Cairhien, trading\n
both fresh fish and local wares between the citizens of the\n
city and the occasional travelers he encountered on his trips\n
up and down the banks of the river.\n
\n
It was during one of these trips to Cairhien that he met the\n
fair Almeida Sabates, a handmaid to House Riatin at the time.\n
She had been sent to the docks to pick up the freshest catch\n
for the evening meal and happened upon Frey's barge. The two\n
struck up a friendship that slowly developed each time they\n
met when Frey was docked at Cairhien. About two years after\n
first meeting, Frey Graydon and Almeida Sabates were wed in\n
Cairhien. Joining him on his vessel, Almeida made a simple\n
life for herself selling wares along each journey.\n
\n
It was actually a storm that brought the unlikely couple to\n
the Tinker encampment. After stopping off at Cairhien, they\n
continued north along the Alguenya only to discover a fierce\n
storm brewing in the west. The couple quickly moored in a\n
reedy shoal near a small grove and made camp within the trees.\n
In the morning, they were awakened to the sound of a Tinker\n
camp not half a league away. Curiosity got the better of them\n
and they entered the camp. This would be the first of several\n
visits over the next three years before they decided to settle\n
within the camp as Tuatha'an themselves.\n
\n
Lysander was born only two short months after they had settled\n
in. His Cairhienin looks - pale skin and black hair - made him\n
an object of interest to the girls in camp, as many of them had\n
the traditional colors of western Andor instead. He was always\n
a quiet child, reserved and respectful of others. His parents\n
impressed upon him the Way of the Leaf at an early age, and the\n
teachings seem to have stuck. He quickly excelled at reading\n
barrier against friendship with the other Tinker children. The\n
camp was never disrespectful to him openly - the Way of the Leaf\n
forbid such acts, of course - but there was a sense of disdain\n
among the others as he developed into a young man.\n
\n
He became somewhat reclusive in his teens, choosing to spend\n
most of his time with his small collection of books - most of\n
which he had read dozens of times already. He became more with-\n
drawn over time, and the few friends he had until this time\n
quickly found other, better playmates.\n
\n
(Concluded in next mail)\n

column5: Fwd: Lysander BG (Shadow and Black Tower both)

\n

\n

the Shadow as a Darkfriend while also get recruited into the\n
Black Tower as well.\n
\n
Channeler Type: He has the ability to channel inborn. He has\n
involuntarily seized saidin on three known occasions.\n
If there's anything else you need, please `&mail`7 or `1tell`7 me.\n
\n
\n
Lysander Graydon was born just over eighteen years ago to a\n
Tuatha'an couple named Frey and Almeida Graydon. His father,\n

\n
It was during one of these trips to Cairhien that he met the\n

She had been sent to the docks to pick up the freshest catch\n
for the evening meal and happened upon Frey's barge. The two\n

met when Frey was docked at Cairhien. About two years after\n

Cairhien. Joining him on his vessel, Almeida made a simple\n
life for herself selling wares along each journey.\n
\n
It was actually a storm that brought the unlikely couple to\n
the Tinker encampment. After stopping off at Cairhien, they\n
continued north along the Alguenya only to discover a fierce\n
storm brewing in the west. The couple quickly moored in a\n
reedy shoal near a small grove and made camp within the trees.\n
In the morning, they were awakened to the sound of a Tinker\n
camp not half a league away. Curiosity got the better of them\n
and they entered the camp. This would be the first of several\n
visits over the next three years before they decided to settle\n
within the camp as Tuatha'an themselves.\n
\n
Lysander was born only two short months after they had settled\n
in. His Cairhienin looks - pale skin and black hair - made him\n
an object of interest to the girls in camp, as many of them had\n
the traditional colors of western Andor instead. He was always\n
a quiet child, reserved and respectful of others. His parents\n
impressed upon him the Way of the Leaf at an early age, and the\n
teachings seem to have stuck. He quickly excelled at reading\n
barrier against friendship with the other Tinker children. The\n
camp was never disrespectful to him openly - the Way of the Leaf\n
forbid such acts, of course - but there was a sense of disdain\n
among the others as he developed into a young man.\n
\n
He became somewhat reclusive in his teens, choosing to spend\n
most of his time with his small collection of books - most of\n
which he had read dozens of times already. He became more with-\n
drawn over time, and the few friends he had until this time\n
quickly found other, better playmates.\n
\n
(Concluded in next mail)\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Feb  4 13:48:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Lysander
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Lysander BG (Part Two)
\nWhat neither Lysander nor his parents knew at the time was that\n
his isolation was also a sign of his dispondancy to life in\n
general, and to the well-being of his fellow Tinkers to an even\n
greater degree. There was an invisible wall between the rest of\n
the camp and Lysander that simply would never be breached. They\n
kept their distance from him and he from them. But this barely-\n
concealed tolerance wore on the poor boy throughout his later\n
childhood, giving him many sleepless nights and stiring dark\n
thoughts in his mind... thoughts that went against every word\n
of the Way that he had followed for so long.\n
\n
He felt the urge to rend the life from the things around him.\n
It was a carnal urge, something born from deep inside his soul\n
after long years of neglect and disdain. It was a scream in the\n
dark that only he could hear. He was seventeen when he first\n
acted on this impulse, and it would prove to be one of the\n
darkest days in his life.\n
\n
One of his playmates from years ago - one he hadn't spoken with\n
for days, of course - named Elsbet found him sleeping under the\n
shade of an old oak tree... or so she thought. His mind was\n
quite awake, actually, and he was fighting back thoughts of\n
despair and pain from a recent jest that he had become the butt\n
of. Elsbet startled him from his thoughts as she approached,\n
and with a lighthearted giggle she teased him about his the\n
Way of the Leaf not meaning to live under a tree forever. There\n
was nothing malicious in her words, but something in him broke\n
that day - a tender chord snapped - and he did the unthinkable.\n
Without any conscious thought, he performed his First Touching\n
of saidin and sent skeins of Fire into her face. The result was\n
terrible.\n
\n
The girl would never be called beautiful again, nor would she\n
likely find herself the object of anyone's affection, least of\n
all her own, from the scarred tissue across her cheeks and nose.\n
That same day, as she lay in a delirious fever mumbling about\n
Lysander burning her, the boy was forced from the caravan and\n
told never to return. His parents were heartbroken, but they\n
were unwilling to leave the Tinkers even for him. Their faith\n
in the Way was stronger than familial bonds, it appeared. This\n
exile and rejection spurred Lysander on into a dark fury, and\n
he left the Tuatha'an without another word.\n
\n
Upon reaching Cairhien, the channeling sickness finally struck\n
him. Burning with fever and freezing with chills, he was at the\n
mercy of the elements for two days as he lay unmoving in the\n
shadows of an abandoned stall just outside the city walls. Luck\n
would favor him this time, though, and he recovered with no\n
lasting damage. Well, at least no physical damage. Psycholo-\n
gically, he was an empty shell devoid of any feelings except\n
hatred and vengeance. Over the next two weeks, he quickly found\n
that he would have to control these urges if he wanted to live.\n
No one was willing to give food to a murderous loon, after all.\n
\n
By the time his eighteenth naming day arrived, he had pushed the\n
dark thoughts into his subconscious, letting them build roots in\n
his mind without giving any outward indication of the corrupt\n
nature of his soul. Two more times he accidentally channeled in\n
Cairhien, although neither with the disasterous results his\n
First Touching had wrought. It was on a whim that he decided to\n
leave Cairhien after hearing of a band of Tinkers spotted at\n
Four Kings, a small village west of Caemlyn in Andor.\n
\n
As of now, he has just arrived in Caemlyn. He doesn't really\n
know what brought him to the capital. Perhaps he needed to get\n
away from his heritage completely. Maybe those dark thoughts\n
festering in his soul are leading him toward the eventual,\n
cataclysmic reunion with his people. Only time will tell. It\n
might be interesting to note that he's been seeking out news of\n
Friends of the Dark quietly, however. But then again, pledging\n
his soul to the Dark One seems like a small step compared with\n
the journey into darkness his soul has already taken.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb  6 02:35:14 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 re: Newbie Handbook/Walkthrough
\nHey Syrah,\n
\n
I need some help on a big project. I am trying to fix up\n
the newbie zone.. I intend to make an actual zone, but\n
it will be a huge work in progress.\n
\n
Before I do that, I want to fix the zone we have now. Just\n
update the typos and make certain that the rooms are all\n
updated as far as the information goes. You know a great\n
deal about MUD policy, which is why I approached you\n
about this.\n
\n
If you have extra time, do you think you could help\n
with this? I would be immensely greatful. I'm starting\n
to get pulled in different directions, and I can't\n
seem to get any one project done.\n
\n
If you do have time for this, it's the newbie walkthrough\n
just down of recall. If you wander the area on BP, you\n
can just leave stickynotes of things that need to be\n
updated (and if you REALLY love me, any typoes you see)\n
and I will go through when you are done and do all the\n
actual work.\n
\n
I'd really appreciate anything you can offer. :D\n
\n
-Sads\n
