\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb  7 14:08:37 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Ileana
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Doors
\nOkay, I've figured it out. Here are the steps:\n
\n
1. Choose the exit you want to make into a door\n
2. Choose option 3 to name the door with "door <direction>"\n
3. Choose option 5 for "Door Flags"\n
4. Set it to option 1 "Closeable Door"\n
5. Back at the door options editor, it should now say\n
"Is a door"\n
6. Exit out of the editor and make sure to save as you leave\n
7. Close the door manually once out of the editor\n
8. Redit save <zone>\n
9. Zedit save <zone>\n
10. Zreset <zone>\n
\n
Voila! It should work if you did everything above.\n
\n
- Ileana/Myrene\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb  7 14:08:37 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Ileana
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Doors
\nOkay, I've figured it out. Here are the steps:\n
\n
1. Choose the exit you want to make into a door\n
2. Choose option 3 to name the door with "door <direction>"\n
3. Choose option 5 for "Door Flags"\n
4. Set it to option 1 "Closeable Door"\n
5. Back at the door options editor, it should now say\n
"Is a door"\n
6. Exit out of the editor and make sure to save as you leave\n
7. Close the door manually once out of the editor\n
8. Redit save <zone>\n
9. Zedit save <zone>\n
10. Zreset <zone>\n
\n
Voila! It should work if you did everything above.\n
\n
- Ileana/Myrene\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 14 11:43:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Myrene
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Bertran's Background (Heron Company)
\n`#B`3ERTRAN `#L`3ASSIRE`7                                   `#H`3ERON `8COMPANY`7\n
\n
Bertran Lassire was born into the lap of luxury... or at least\n
what the poor might consider luxury. His parents, Reighnard and\n
Melissand Lassire, were merchants based out of Caemlyn and Four\n
Kings. With such a lucrative business, it was not uncommon for\n
a merchant to accumulate much wealth if they were savvy in the\n
business of merchantilism. And if the Lassire family was any-\n
thing, it was savvy. By no means were they wealthy enough to\n
enter the ranks of nobility, of course, but they had little to\n
want for compared with the other residents living in Caemlyn's\n
Old City.\n
\n
As a child, Bertran was taught sums and letters while the other\n
children played outside. He was rarely resentful of this, how-\n
ever. Always a level-headed child, he seemed mature beyond his\n
few years. However, he always looked forward to the occasional\n
trips outside the city when his parents decided that it was\n
due time for a merchant's visit to the outlying towns around\n
Caemlyn. He would sit in the wares cart and stare out at the\n
world peacefully. There was always so much to see and do. When\n
they would make camp, he would throw caution to the wind and\n
explore the landscape like some explorer from Jain Farstrider's\n
legendary exploits.\n
\n
Much of his knowledge of terrain and outdoorsmanship was self-\n
taught as a result. Foraging was easy, of course, but finding\n
live food was another matter. Not one to trap animals, Bertran\n
settled for fishing instead. He rarely caught anything worth-\n
while, but when he did, it was a celebration like no other. As\n
a result, fish courses during meals quickly became his favorite\n
dishes.\n
\n
And all this outdoorsmanship and exploration began to affect\n
his future, as one would expect.\n
\n
His father, Reighnard, had expected that Bertran, being their\n
only child, would one day take over the family merchantile\n
business. It was almost expected of him to simply slip into\n
the role. But Bertran's head was not in it. He could do the\n
job adequately, of course. He'd been helping his parents from\n
a very young age with the easier tasks involved in selling\n
wares, but over time he developed different tastes in life. His\n
passion became exploration and new horizons. He also took a\n
liking to combat, much to his mother's chagrin. His first\n
weapon was a small butterknife that he would wield against the\n
various invisible monsters of his imagination. This early\n
choice of weaponry quickly developed into a strong affinity for\n
daggers and knives, an uncommon trait in most combatants.\n
\n
As time wore on and Bertran grew into a young man, he began to\n
hang around the mercenaries guarding the merchant trains more\n
and more. He would ask questions incessantly. What did they do\n
in their spare time? Had they been in a fight recently? Who did\n
they serve? Any knews from the outside world? And with each\n
question, his interest in mercenary work began to outgrow his\n
waning passion for merchantilism. By his eighteenth naming-day,\n
Bertran had decided that he would become a sellsword. His\n
parents did not take the news well at first, especially his\n
father. The family business would end with them. But it was\n
Bertran's life to live, and he wouldn't live under their shadow\n
forever.\n
\n
Shortly after his naming-day, he stumbled upon a vision of\n
beauty: Lady Valkaria Ankaer. While sitting in the Queen's\n
Blessing one afternoon with drink in hand, the lady entered\n
with her entourage of Heron Company thugs. Bertran could tell\n
almost immediately that she was nobility. She had that air\n
about her that was unmistakable, that sense of entitlement. But\n
this illusion was quickly shattered. Valkaria was not like most\n
noblewomen. She was flirty and uncouth. She toyed with those\n
around her. And she drank like a sailor ten days out from port.\n
Overhearing her conversation about the Heron Company, Bertran\n
was thrilled to learn that they were in search of mercenaries.\n
\n
This was his chance. Striking up the courage, he introduced\n
himself to the lady in a stuttering voice. All those years of\n
confidence seemed to melt away as he stared at Valkaria. Most\n
other women didn't have this effect on him. But there was just\n
something about her Domani features and her piercing gaze that\n
unnerved the boy. Stuttering, he managed to ask about the Heron\n
Company. To his mortification, Valkaria quickly took to him as\n
well. She took him under her wing for reasons unknown and\n
brought him to the Heron Hall to meet with Commander Delray.\n
Although he was wont to be only known as "Term," Valkaria took\n
to calling him "Termy" instead. After asking why Valkaria\n
called him that name, Bertran soon learned that if there was\n
one thing the lady liked, it was pet names.\n
\n
From then on, Bertran has become Valkaria's toy. She has more\n
nicknames for him than he can count. Every time she glances his\n
way, he bursts into a fierce blush. In fact, it would almost\n
seem that Valkaria is intent on pushing these boundaries to the\n
breaking point. Is she doing this just for fun? Or does she\n
have some ulterior motive in subjecting him to such cruel\n
teasing? Secretly, Bertran has come to suspect that the lady\n
has more invested in him than she lets on.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 14 11:43:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Myrene
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Bertran's Background (Heron Company)
\n`#B`3ERTRAN `#L`3ASSIRE`7                                   `#H`3ERON `8COMPANY`7\n
\n
Bertran Lassire was born into the lap of luxury... or at least\n
what the poor might consider luxury. His parents, Reighnard and\n
Melissand Lassire, were merchants based out of Caemlyn and Four\n
Kings. With such a lucrative business, it was not uncommon for\n
a merchant to accumulate much wealth if they were savvy in the\n
business of merchantilism. And if the Lassire family was any-\n
thing, it was savvy. By no means were they wealthy enough to\n
enter the ranks of nobility, of course, but they had little to\n
want for compared with the other residents living in Caemlyn's\n
Old City.\n
\n
As a child, Bertran was taught sums and letters while the other\n
children played outside. He was rarely resentful of this, how-\n
ever. Always a level-headed child, he seemed mature beyond his\n
few years. However, he always looked forward to the occasional\n
trips outside the city when his parents decided that it was\n
due time for a merchant's visit to the outlying towns around\n
Caemlyn. He would sit in the wares cart and stare out at the\n
world peacefully. There was always so much to see and do. When\n
they would make camp, he would throw caution to the wind and\n
explore the landscape like some explorer from Jain Farstrider's\n
legendary exploits.\n
\n
Much of his knowledge of terrain and outdoorsmanship was self-\n
taught as a result. Foraging was easy, of course, but finding\n
live food was another matter. Not one to trap animals, Bertran\n
settled for fishing instead. He rarely caught anything worth-\n
while, but when he did, it was a celebration like no other. As\n
a result, fish courses during meals quickly became his favorite\n
dishes.\n
\n
And all this outdoorsmanship and exploration began to affect\n
his future, as one would expect.\n
\n
His father, Reighnard, had expected that Bertran, being their\n
only child, would one day take over the family merchantile\n
business. It was almost expected of him to simply slip into\n
the role. But Bertran's head was not in it. He could do the\n
job adequately, of course. He'd been helping his parents from\n
a very young age with the easier tasks involved in selling\n
wares, but over time he developed different tastes in life. His\n
passion became exploration and new horizons. He also took a\n
liking to combat, much to his mother's chagrin. His first\n
weapon was a small butterknife that he would wield against the\n
various invisible monsters of his imagination. This early\n
choice of weaponry quickly developed into a strong affinity for\n
daggers and knives, an uncommon trait in most combatants.\n
\n
As time wore on and Bertran grew into a young man, he began to\n
hang around the mercenaries guarding the merchant trains more\n
and more. He would ask questions incessantly. What did they do\n
in their spare time? Had they been in a fight recently? Who did\n
they serve? Any knews from the outside world? And with each\n
question, his interest in mercenary work began to outgrow his\n
waning passion for merchantilism. By his eighteenth naming-day,\n
Bertran had decided that he would become a sellsword. His\n
parents did not take the news well at first, especially his\n
father. The family business would end with them. But it was\n
Bertran's life to live, and he wouldn't live under their shadow\n
forever.\n
\n
Shortly after his naming-day, he stumbled upon a vision of\n
beauty: Lady Valkaria Ankaer. While sitting in the Queen's\n
Blessing one afternoon with drink in hand, the lady entered\n
with her entourage of Heron Company thugs. Bertran could tell\n
almost immediately that she was nobility. She had that air\n
about her that was unmistakable, that sense of entitlement. But\n
this illusion was quickly shattered. Valkaria was not like most\n
noblewomen. She was flirty and uncouth. She toyed with those\n
around her. And she drank like a sailor ten days out from port.\n
Overhearing her conversation about the Heron Company, Bertran\n
was thrilled to learn that they were in search of mercenaries.\n
\n
This was his chance. Striking up the courage, he introduced\n
himself to the lady in a stuttering voice. All those years of\n
confidence seemed to melt away as he stared at Valkaria. Most\n
other women didn't have this effect on him. But there was just\n
something about her Domani features and her piercing gaze that\n
unnerved the boy. Stuttering, he managed to ask about the Heron\n
Company. To his mortification, Valkaria quickly took to him as\n
well. She took him under her wing for reasons unknown and\n
brought him to the Heron Hall to meet with Commander Delray.\n
Although he was wont to be only known as "Term," Valkaria took\n
to calling him "Termy" instead. After asking why Valkaria\n
called him that name, Bertran soon learned that if there was\n
one thing the lady liked, it was pet names.\n
\n
From then on, Bertran has become Valkaria's toy. She has more\n
nicknames for him than he can count. Every time she glances his\n
way, he bursts into a fierce blush. In fact, it would almost\n
seem that Valkaria is intent on pushing these boundaries to the\n
breaking point. Is she doing this just for fun? Or does she\n
have some ulterior motive in subjecting him to such cruel\n
teasing? Secretly, Bertran has come to suspect that the lady\n
has more invested in him than she lets on.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Feb 15 12:37:37 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 re: Cairhien
\nI had several ideas for Cairhien.\n
\n
While you are looking around for mislinked rooms, perhaps\n
you could make objects in front of each Inn, like signposts\n
or those hanging things with the pictures on them?\n
\n
Also, the room names of streets should be colored, so people\n
can navigate using 'brief'. That will actually be really easy\n
using RSET.\n
\n
The Palace needs recoloring.. `%fuschia`7 and `^blue`7 aren't\n
doing it for me. At all. :P\n
\n
Also, look at 'help builder commands'. We have several new\n
options to choose from. :D\n
\n
If you want to work on any of these things, let me know.\n
\n
I want to fix Cairhien, but it's low on my list now.\n
\n
Btw.. The Tower proper is officially done. :D The only\n
thing left are the basements.\n
\n
-Sads\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 21 19:40:22 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Newbie Zone information
\nI am creating a newbie zone that will be full of history and\n
events that a newbie would know ICly. I kept most of the old\n
information there, but changed it slightly. This is what will\n
be put in for the Seanchan.\n
\n
`7When Artur Hawkwing's Empire collapsed, a group of his descendants fled\n
across the Aryth Ocean. There, a new nation grew: the `8S`6e`7a`&n`8c`7h`6a`8n`7. The\n
seanchan are unknown to most people on the mainland, however they are a\n
fearsome army. They are very hierarchical, and their society is ruled\n
by "The Blood", or those who can trace an ancestry back to Artur\n
Hawkwing. The supreme ruler is the Empress, who has total power of life\n
and death over every person in the Empire.\n
\n
`7Recently, the Seanchan have returned to the mainland and invaded at\n
Falme. The Seanchan armies are a fearsome sight to behold, especially\n
due to the leashed Damane. Female channelers who wear a collar, they\n
seem to be at the bidding of mysterious women wearing dresses with\n
forked lightning bolts embroidered on them. \n
\n
`7Since the Return started, the Seanchan have taken hold of Tarabon,\n
Arad Doman, Altara, and Murandy. Besides these few facts, very little\n
is known of this mysterious remnant of Artur Hawkwing's lost descendants.`0\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jan 30 02:34:51 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 re: Builders
\n`7CC`6: `7Syrah Rissa Duren
\n\n
Hey bosses. *salute*\n
\n
I recruited Myrene to help me build. So far, she has been excellent.\n
\n
Duren mentioned to me that I should try and recruit more builders.\n
I'd like to do that, but so far the players we have now show little\n
sign of wanting to actually build.\n
\n
I spoke with Duren about recruiting experienced builders from\n
outside of the MUD. Before doing this, though, I wanted to talk\n
to Rissa and Syrah about what we could offer potential builders\n
who apply to the MUD.\n
Generally, it's hard to retain skilled builders. I would say\n
that having two more would be the perfect amount in order\n
to finish Tar Valon and the surrounding areas. However,\n
what can we offer thos builders to stay and actually work?\n
\n
I wanted to throw the question out to you all, to see if you\n
would be comfortable with me recruiting from without, and\n
what we could offer those people in the event they might work\n
out.\n
\n
Let me know your thoughts on this and how I should proceed.\n
\n
Tar Valon has been a year long process, but if we have 4 or so\n
dedicated builders, it could possibly be done in a month or two.\n
\n
Also, I could work on teaching mob scripting, and also over see\n
work being done on the other centers of RP.\n
\n
Thanks,\n
\n
A very busy,\n
-Sads\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Mar  7 02:46:09 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Sadren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 re: Things left to do
\nOk, Ile.\n
\n
I got the Sitter's Offices desced last night. I am proud to say\n
that we have very little left in the way of actual descing left\n
to do.\n
\n
This is what is left to be done:\n
\n
-The classroom wing needs to be desced. \n
-The skyways leading between the various towers and the White\n
Tower need to be described. You can find them by typing vnum\n
room skyway.\n
-The Yellow Ajah Offices were not desced. Leave those for Syrah.\n
\n
To be honest, I think that's all that is left. We're almost done.\n
\n
I have one small project for you.. this seems like it would be\n
something right up your alley. I was considering putting in a\n
bunch of books into the shelves in the Great Library. We have\n
a bunch in zone 3.. why not use those? But I know we could use\n
extras, and you already have several made.  \n
\n
If you decided to make any more book objects, throw them in zone\n
three. I will use them all from there. Remember, when you set\n
any of them, that you need to set the number on the MUD to 0, so\n
I can set as many books as I want to.\n
\n
After this, I am going to work on Cairhien. When I was discussing\n
fixing up Caemlyn on wiznet, Syrah said something along the\n
lines of, 'I thought I assigned you to Cairhien. :P' I wanna\n
keep her happy. :P\n
\n
Of course, I want you to pick a job you are happy with. I was\n
hoping that you could focus on the shops in Caemlyn, so we can\n
actually get EQ into the game. \n
\n
Let me know your thoughts about all of this. \n
\n
-Sads\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Mar  7 18:11:40 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Shava
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Shava's coverstory
\nName: Liria Javoin\n
\n
Cover Story:\n

Liria Javion is from Arad Doman, born and raised into a merchant's family, a rather wealthy one that primarily supplies foreign merchants of Arad Doman products. When the Seanchan invaded Arad Doman, her family swore the oath that the Seanchan insists on, though Liria was still young that she didn't exactly have to do it.\n

As she got a bit more into the world, Liria started to participate in a freedom group based in the area, attempting to rid their home of the Seanchan. However, as always, the Seanchan started to investigate into stories of this freedom group so they could smother it as they did all others.\n

Fearing her life, she fled from Arad Doman. Using her father's contacts abroad, it has led her to Caemlyn and the daughter of a merchant her father supplied before the invasion, Salome. There she has come hoping to at least get by under the radar, but in plain sight so that she could keep an ear out for how things are going back home.\n
\n
If any suggestions, feel free to make them\n
\n
Shava Nuril, Imperial Sul'dam\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Mar 18 20:13:35 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Jasil
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Thieves Guild
\nDescriptions\n
\n
Short yet agile he stands five foot five inches and has nice muscle tone\n
for his size, looks to be in his early thirties. He has rugged yet handsome features. He\n
bears a small scar across his left cheek. He has tattoo of a `#Rising Sun`7 on his left arm\n
the artwork is very bright and detailed.  There is certain darkness about him his face\n
emotionless most of the time. He has short black hair, light emerald eyes, and tan\n
skin.\n
\n
The mans clothing is very dark and covered by a `8black`7 hooded cloak\n

As he moves you may catch a glance of a `8black`7 leather tunic under his tunic he wears a `8black`7 shirt of silk. On his legs he wears `8black`7 breeches made of high quality material. The breeches are tucked into a pair of nice but worn `8black`7 leather boots.\n

On his waist he wears a well made `7grey`7 leather belt. A strong gust of wind may reveal two ivory hilts, the carving work on the hilts alone looks to be done very skillfully. Each blade is made with very high grade metal for Jasils purpose. One blade is slightly curved the other straight, each are very well polished and shine as so. His clothing is kept neat but shows signs of wear from the day.\n
\n
Description 2\n
\n
Short yet agile he stands five foot five inches and has nice muscle tone \n

for his size, looks to be in his early thirties. He has rugged yet handsome features. He bears a small scar across his left cheek. He has tattoo of a `#Rising Sun`7 on his left arm, the artwork is very bright and detailed. He always seems to bear a grin or smile of some type and a glimmer of mischief in his eyes. He has short black hair, light emerald eyes, and tan skin.\n
\n
The mans clothing is covered by a `7grey`7 hooded cloak. As he moves you may catch a glance of a very well made deep mocha leather tunic and dark `4blue`7 breeches\n

with `#gold`7 stitching. Under his tunic he wears a thin white shirt of fine silk. The breeches are tucked into a pair a very well made polished boots of a deep mocha color. Around his waist he wears a leather belt of fine quality the same mocha color as the \n

boots. A strong gust of wind may reveal two ivory hilts, the carving work on the hilts alone looks to be done very skillfully. Each blade is made with very high grade metal for Jasils purpose. One blade is slightly curved the other straight, each are very well polished and shine as so. His clothing is kept very neat and clean it is all made of high quality material, it looks very expensive.\n
\n
Background\n
\n
Jasil was born in the outskirts of Cairhien in the Foregate, his family was not wealthy.\n

His father worked as a small time merchant selling many different goods he made to make a living for his family. As a young boy Jasil got to visit the city and as far south as Maerone while helping his father out with his trade. A few years later during the first burning of the Foregate all of his family was killed, Jasil managed to get out of the house in time to seek refuge. He followed like many of the survivors into the city once he realized he had lost his family.\n
\n

Jasil met a young woman from the Foregate once inside Cairhien walls. They shared the story of loses and kept each other company for some time to. The woman took Jasil in you could say even if the first few months of life was rough in the streets. Not much time passed before she somehow managed to pull in a nice bit of coin to afford a decent if not nice inn for them to stay. She taught Jasil how to use daggers and knifes as well as how to move without being seen or heard for protection.\n
\n

After a couple years passed Jasil set out on his own to explore the world to see what else may be beyond what he knew. He traveled as far west as Arad Doman, Tarabon as far south as Tear, Illian, and north as far as Maradon stopping to see many things in his journeys. As you can expect that took time, it was well worth it once he was satisfied he returned to Cairhien to seek work with what he learned from the woman and his travels. For many months he worked just to get coin in order to have a place to stay and food to eat, honest or not he did what he had to. Many Houses unknown to Jasil took notice to this, most thinking how well the skills could benefit them.\n
\n
Jasil has worked with many plotting Lords and Ladies of Cairhien he built wealth fast.\n

With only being caught once he was given a light sentence for appearance sake as strings were pulled. He served a few short months as a Sun Guard helping with the night watch over the streets. Many thieves would learn that it might be better to fight him rather than flee. After his duty with the Guard was up he was once again back to doing tasks for Houses filling his pockets even more.\n
\n

Some may call him an assassin, thief, or troublemaker as dark as he may seem. Over the years his pockets have become fat and remain that way. He has laid down his trade and is back to traveling seeing the world for really no good reason other than he can. Jasil remembers his life as a young boy and is returning there as a friendly, laid back, fun loving man to all he meets leaving the life once lived behind. Do remember as nice as he may seem dont cross him in a wrong way or you may lay your head on your pillow for the last time.\n
\n
\n
Look forward to hearing from you I just came up with the background tonight so let me know if it needs work.\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

Many thieves would learn that it might be better to fight him rather than flee. After his duty with the Guard was up he was once again back to doing tasks for Houses filling his pockets even more.\n
\n

Some may call him an assassin, thief, or troublemaker as dark as he may seem. Over the years his pockets have become fat and remain that way. He has laid down his trade and is back to traveling seeing the world for really no good reason other than he can. Jasil remembers his life as a young boy and is returning there as a friendly, laid back, fun loving man to all he meets leaving the life once lived behind. Do remember as nice as he may seem dont cross him in a wrong way or you may lay your head on your pillow for the last time.\n
\n
\n
Look forward to hearing from you I just came up with the background tonight so let me know if it needs work.\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Mar 18 20:13:35 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Jasil
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Thieves Guild
\nDescriptions\n
\n
Short yet agile he stands five foot five inches and has nice muscle tone\n
for his size, looks to be in his early thirties. He has rugged yet handsome features. He\n
bears a small scar across his left cheek. He has tattoo of a `#Rising Sun`7 on his left arm\n
the artwork is very bright and detailed.  There is certain darkness about him his face\n
emotionless most of the time. He has short black hair, light emerald eyes, and tan\n
skin.\n
\n
The mans clothing is very dark and covered by a `8black`7 hooded cloak\n

As he moves you may catch a glance of a `8black`7 leather tunic under his tunic he wears a `8black`7 shirt of silk. On his legs he wears `8black`7 breeches made of high quality material. The breeches are tucked into a pair of nice but worn `8black`7 leather boots.\n

On his waist he wears a well made `7grey`7 leather belt. A strong gust of wind may reveal two ivory hilts, the carving work on the hilts alone looks to be done very skillfully. Each blade is made with very high grade metal for Jasils purpose. One blade is slightly curved the other straight, each are very well polished and shine as so. His clothing is kept neat but shows signs of wear from the day.\n
\n
Description 2\n
\n
Short yet agile he stands five foot five inches and has nice muscle tone \n

for his size, looks to be in his early thirties. He has rugged yet handsome features. He bears a small scar across his left cheek. He has tattoo of a `#Rising Sun`7 on his left arm, the artwork is very bright and detailed. He always seems to bear a grin or smile of some type and a glimmer of mischief in his eyes. He has short black hair, light emerald eyes, and tan skin.\n
\n
The mans clothing is covered by a `7grey`7 hooded cloak. As he moves you may catch a glance of a very well made deep mocha leather tunic and dark `4blue`7 breeches\n

with `#gold`7 stitching. Under his tunic he wears a thin white shirt of fine silk. The breeches are tucked into a pair a very well made polished boots of a deep mocha color. Around his waist he wears a leather belt of fine quality the same mocha color as the \n

boots. A strong gust of wind may reveal two ivory hilts, the carving work on the hilts alone looks to be done very skillfully. Each blade is made with very high grade metal for Jasils purpose. One blade is slightly curved the other straight, each are very well polished and shine as so. His clothing is kept very neat and clean it is all made of high quality material, it looks very expensive.\n
\n
Background\n
\n
Jasil was born in the outskirts of Cairhien in the Foregate, his family was not wealthy.\n

His father worked as a small time merchant selling many different goods he made to make a living for his family. As a young boy Jasil got to visit the city and as far south as Maerone while helping his father out with his trade. A few years later during the first burning of the Foregate all of his family was killed, Jasil managed to get out of the house in time to seek refuge. He followed like many of the survivors into the city once he realized he had lost his family.\n
\n

Jasil met a young woman from the Foregate once inside Cairhien walls. They shared the story of loses and kept each other company for some time to. The woman took Jasil in you could say even if the first few months of life was rough in the streets. Not much time passed before she somehow managed to pull in a nice bit of coin to afford a decent if not nice inn for them to stay. She taught Jasil how to use daggers and knifes as well as how to move without being seen or heard for protection.\n
\n

After a couple years passed Jasil set out on his own to explore the world to see what else may be beyond what he knew. He traveled as far west as Arad Doman, Tarabon as far south as Tear, Illian, and north as far as Maradon stopping to see many things in his journeys. As you can expect that took time, it was well worth it once he was satisfied he returned to Cairhien to seek work with what he learned from the woman and his travels. For many months he worked just to get coin in order to have a place to stay and food to eat, honest or not he did what he had to. Many Houses unknown to Jasil took notice to this, most thinking how well the skills could benefit them.\n
\n
Jasil has worked with many plotting Lords and Ladies of Cairhien he built wealth fast.\n

With only being caught once he was given a light sentence for appearance sake as strings were pulled. He served a few short months as a Sun Guard helping with the night watch over the streets. Many thieves would learn that it might be better to fight him rather than flee. After his duty with the Guard was up he was once again back to doing tasks for Houses filling his pockets even more.\n
\n

Some may call him an assassin, thief, or troublemaker as dark as he may seem. Over the years his pockets have become fat and remain that way. He has laid down his trade and is back to traveling seeing the world for really no good reason other than he can. Jasil remembers his life as a young boy and is returning there as a friendly, laid back, fun loving man to all he meets leaving the life once lived behind. Do remember as nice as he may seem dont cross him in a wrong way or you may lay your head on your pillow for the last time.\n
\n
\n
Look forward to hearing from you I just came up with the background tonight so let me know if it needs work.\n
\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jun  4 18:38:35 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Anson
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Anson's BG
\n`7CC`6: `7Parol Rissa
\n\n

Anson Long is a Mayener and son of a merchant class shipmaster, the Athene.  He spent a great deal of his childhood, and more of his adolescence aboard his father's ship, taking on a position with the crew in his teens, and learning his father's trade.  Cargo and currents, however, never particularly seemed to interest the young man as he grew.  He was delighted with the intricacy of sword-play and weapons of all sorts, and trained often with this ship's master-at-arms.  On his last several sea voyages, he actually traveled on ships other than his father's as a master-at-arms himself.\n
\n

He does share one commonality with his father: wanderlust.  He has traveled much of the land west of the Spine of the World, often working as a merchant's guard and a few times as an armed retainer.  All of this enables him to spend time each day training with his sword, and working on his journal - a collection of fighting techniques, diagrams, and martial philosophy that he keeps and develops.\n
\n

He feels he has reached a point in his training where he must focus more closely on his pursuits, and where he believes teaching will be a valuable learning experience.  Not given to wine or wenching in extremes, he has managed to save a tidy sum in his travels, and has settled in Caemlyn and is renting a small, one room building both to live in and to outfit as a school for fighting.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jun 11 19:46:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Tarem
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Tarem BG
\n\n
Tarem was born in the shadow of the Stone of Tear, \n
first son to a middle-class couple. His parents were\n
in the service of House Tesheira, the father as a \n
book-keeping scribe and mother as a lady in waiting.\n
All in all Tarem had a fairly comfortable upbringing,\n
surrounded by love and literature. He began learning\n
his father's trade at an early age, becoming well\n
learned in the arts of language, literature and stewardry.\n
Nothing disturbed the life path of the boy until, while\n
out of country nearing the completion of one of the \n
almost-yearly ambassadorial trips Tarem's father\n
\n
was obliged to take along with the Lord, their small\n
band of seaborne travellers was devastated by a storm.\n
All aboard were thought lost until young Tarem \n
was discovered, washed up not far from the city of\n
Ebou Dar. Luckily, he was discovered by a kindly\n
fishing family and quickly regained his health. Now \n
at a crossroads and perhaps struck with wanderlust,\n
the young man decided to extend his journey before\n
returning home, getting work with a group of travelling\n
holy men as scribe. Years passed and Tarem grew\n
into manhood, his fate all but decided right up to\n
the day he met a man named Jahar in the library\n
of a Caemlyn innroom. The two struck up an instant\n
rapport and, after a few day's contact residing in the\n
same inn, Jahar invited Tarem to return with him,\n
allowing no details aside from the fact that this was\n
a unique opportunity. Tarem, never the dullard, \n
eagerly accepted and, upon learning of his strong\n
potential after testing by Mazrim, joined the \n
mysterious fraternity of the Asha'man. He and \n
Jahar remained close friends through the years. \n
Jahar gave Tarem both his Dedicated and Asha'man\n
test, though Mazrim officiated the second. Their\n
paths diverted after attaining this rank, however, as\n
Tarem gravitated towards the pursuit of knowledge\n
and Jahar volunteered to man the front lines. For\n
a few years Tarem did many things. He administered\n
Dedicated tests in Jahar's absense, he studied old\n
writings and objects brought to him by travelling Asha'man\n
(most notably a complicated angreal, provided by Rand),\n
and he did the Dragon's bidding as far as keeping\n
order on the farm: taint and darkfriends detail.\n
Present at the Stone of Tear, Tarem served in Rand's\n
honor guard, a function he continued to serve during\n
the period Rand frequented the farm. Later he was\n
raised to the rank High Asha'man and leader of the Haran\n
Talon, appointed by Mazrim at Rand's request.\n
He still resides on the Farm, rarelly travelling further\n
than Caemlyn as he continues to train new recruits\n
and study his books.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jun 11 19:46:25 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Tarem

Present at the Stone of Tear, Tarem served in Rand's\n
honor guard, a function he continued to serve during\n
the period Rand frequented the farm. Later he was\n
raised to the rank High Asha'man and leader of the Haran\n
Talon, appointed by Mazrim at Rand's request.\n
He still resides on the Farm, rarelly travelling further\n
than Caemlyn as he continues to train new recruits\n
and study his books.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jul  1 11:30:07 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Kerow
\n`7Subj`6:`7 BG
\nHe was quiet from the outset, churigon having to spank the boy apon \n
birth in fear he simply wasn't breathing and ever since only spoke when \n
directly spoken too. Often caught out by lifes darker moments, Kerow \n
found himself under reign of an uncaring mother and hating father. Kept \n
inside all too often, the boy sustained a cruel weaning of control and \n
torture, measured out in rich amounts and resulting in his continual \n
sicklyness and withdrawal to places only he could fathom.\n
Then there came the day when he woke to a sliver of hope, the day after \n
a night where not even his own world could sustain the wealth of his \n
suffering. His ordeal had rendered him lost to consciousness, condemned \n
in his mind to finally staying in his world, his last act of defiance \n
lost to nightmares with but one memory. Rage. -His- day dawned as dull \n
as the rest, but his eyes opened beheld a sight most would cringe from, \n
yet he, he who had been given to torture and worse, saw nothing more \n
than the opening, the way out. So with mind still half delved to his \n
world and half the real, he stepped over the cold remains of his \n
nightmares and into something one hundred fold more frightening, yet \n
sweeter than anything his young mind could ever manifest... Freedom.\n
He lived hard, learning from trial and error in this world new to him. \n
He learned to beg from a man who saw the advantage of using him as bait \n
to the kind of heart, learned to steal from a boy who saw the gain in \n
his mundane and quiet demeanor. He was taught letters and numbers by a \n
whore who often sent him into the garments of her men while they were \n
occupied. He saw a map of the city 'Caemlyn' he lived in on the rudded \n
wall of an inn as he worked cleaning vomit and stale ale off the floor \n
for a copper and straw in the stable to sleep on.\n
All in all his days remaind dark, yet to Kerow, the dark others knew \n
were as bright as the noon sun for him. His life had changed \n
drastically for the better, yet his nightmares always returned apon \n
sleep. He began to wonder at the aftermath and his dead parents. What \n
he saw once as the way out soon became a new prison. How did they die? \n
Could he have? but he was weak, buckling always under the first kick or \n
punch of his parents... Conflict, the war of the light of his new life \n
and the dark of his former, waging endlessly throughout his years and \n
to this very day.\n
\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jul  3 16:43:23 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Rhadian
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rhadian's BG

\nRhadian was born to a small farming couple in Two Rivers. Since all they could do was farm, they didn't have much money which left him slighty greedy and a bit tempermental. His parents tried to get the best for their son. But he never spent much time with them. When he was a child he was always outside, even in the harsh winters. When he grew older he would disappear and go on trips through the surrounding forests. \n
\n

He trained himself in unarmed combat as well as spears and daggers. He would spend days on end practising his throwing until he was nearly an expert. On his trips he would live off the land and build small shelters. With his spear he would hunt small deer and take them down very quickly. Resulting from his trips into the forests, Rhadian developed excellent vision and hearing. Along with his hearing and vision, he became extremely durable. Not needing the regular rest the average man needs, he pushed himself to the limits of his body and found new levels of \n
strength. \n
\n

On the rare occasions he returned home he would be found in town instead. He would sit in the Winespring Inn with a mug of ale lost in his own world. When the Gleemen frequented the inn or Green he would pay apt attention studying every move. He would watch, enraptured, when the Gleemen played their instruments. He paid such attention that he actually learned a rudimental knowledge of the flute. \n
\n

One day he decided needed a change of scenery. Not wanting a big to-do about his leaving, he merely left a note on the kitchen table explaining that he was 17 now and wanted to make his own way in the world. Explaining that he would be in Caemlyn if they needed him for some reason, he packed a few objects and some clothes and left. He threw everything into a backpack, picked a direction and began his journey. Whenever he came upon a crossroads, he'd pick a direction at random and hope it worked. If he got lost, he'd use the knowledge of the land he gained from his forest trips to find the right direction again.\n
\n

His journey finally brought him to Caemlyn, though it took him several weeks. Fortunately, he always seemed to get lucky and find a small woods he could hunt in. He camped the small tent he had packed in his backpack. He had learned to spread branches to soak up an moisture under his tent, he rarely spent a wet night. \n
\n

When he finally reached Caemlyn his went in search of lodging. Finding a job in the stables of the Silvergate Inn, he arranged to stay in a small room in the upstairs inn rooms. As soon as he was settled in his new room, Rhadian went in search of Gleeman. Finding some in the \n

Queen's Blessing Inn, he settles in for a night of study. The days after were filled with mucking out stalls and brushing down horses, his nights were filled with either the study of Gleeman and their antics or his own small shows in the rundown taverns of the city. \n
\n

Learning everything he could from watching the Gleeman he listened to the inn's gossip. Hearing of the Asha'man amassing near Caemlyn, he found his interest piqued. He decided joining an army would be much more interesting than entertaining the rest of his life. He packed up his few things and headed off in the direction a local farmer pointed him in.\n
\n

On his trips he would live off the land and build small shelters. With his spear he would hunt small deer and take them down very quickly. Resulting from his trips into the forests, Rhadian developed excellent vision and hearing. Along with his hearing and vision, he became extremely durable. Not needing the regular rest the average man needs, he pushed himself to the limits of his body and found new levels of \n
strength. \n
\n

On the rare occasions he returned home he would be found in town instead. He would sit in the Winespring Inn with a mug of ale lost in his own world. When the Gleemen frequented the inn or Green he would pay apt attention studying every move. He would watch, enraptured, when the Gleemen played their instruments. He paid such attention that he actually learned a rudimental knowledge of the flute. \n
\n

One day he decided needed a change of scenery. Not wanting a big to-do about his leaving, he merely left a note on the kitchen table explaining that he was 17 now and wanted to make his own way in the world. Explaining that he would be in Caemlyn if they needed him for some reason, he packed a few objects and some clothes and left. He threw everything into a backpack, picked a direction and began his journey. Whenever he came upon a crossroads, he'd pick a direction at random and hope it worked. If he got lost, he'd use the knowledge of the land he gained from his forest trips to find the right direction again.\n
\n

His journey finally brought him to Caemlyn, though it took him several weeks. Fortunately, he always seemed to get lucky and find a small woods he could hunt in. He camped the small tent he had packed in his backpack. He had learned to spread branches to soak up an moisture under his tent, he rarely spent a wet night. \n
\n

When he finally reached Caemlyn his went in search of lodging. Finding a job in the stables of the Silvergate Inn, he arranged to stay in a small room in the upstairs inn rooms. As soon as he was settled in his new room, Rhadian went in search of Gleeman. Finding some in the \n

Queen's Blessing Inn, he settles in for a night of study. The days after were filled with mucking out stalls and brushing down horses, his nights were filled with either the study of Gleeman and their antics or his own small shows in the rundown taverns of the city. \n
\n

Learning everything he could from watching the Gleeman he listened to the inn's gossip. Hearing of the Asha'man amassing near Caemlyn, he found his interest piqued. He decided joining an army would be much more interesting than entertaining the rest of his life. He packed up his few things and headed off in the direction a local farmer pointed him in.\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jul  9 13:12:50 2008\n`7From`6:`7 Liahm
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rhadian's Background.
\nI'm responding to this mail in two capacities. In my first, as WM Imm\n
(Parol), I'm concerned by the claims that Rhadian taught himself the use\n
of arms. Knowing how to throw a punch, not stab yourself with a dagger,\n
and not trip over a spear is one thing. But actually teaching yourself\n
to be a highly effective combatant in any of the three methods is unlikely\n
and not in keeping with our WM policy. You'll have to cut it back to\n
familiarity with the methods of combat, but no great skill.\n
\n
In my second capacity, as Asha'man GL, my main concern is the direct\n
connection to Emond's Field and the possibility that the character may\n
have (and given his age, almost certainly would have) known the major\n
book-characters. I would very much prefer Rhadian come from one of the\n
other Two Rivers towns. A minor point is that Gleemen very rarely came\n
through the Two Rivers (as demonstrated by the clamor over Thom in Book\n
1), but you could have learned your rudimentary knowledge of the flute\n
during your time watching/talking to Gleemen in Caemlyn.\n
\n
Your description is a slightly more serious concern to me. On MiT we\n
don't include actions in descriptions, because it that would mean that\n
you are doing that action every time someone glances at you, and even if\n
you are tied up or otherwise immobilized. Chopping the last paragraph\n
from your description (the one with the actions regarding the dagger and\n
the book) should satisfy that concern.\n
\n
I'd like to see another background submitted taking these changes into\n
account, and I'll try to get back to you a great deal sooner this time.\n
\n
-Liahm/Parol.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7From`6:`7 Brailon
\n`7Subj`6:`7 rp reply 6

\nThe responsive is automatic, "Everyone calls me Pat."  Then she gives Cam a mock, stern glare with her hands on her hips, "Almost everyone."  The next few moments are spent going through the same questions and mild disbelief in his project, the lass appearing somewhat distracted at times, suggesting her thoughts are elsewhere.  She also continues to send glances towards the waiting room- reasonable enough for someone who is typically kept busy with those seeking aid.  When the last of her questions is answered she pauses, looking at Cam while thinking for what is a strangely long period before her original, beaming smile returns, "Very well.  I probably do not have time to do much, but I have someone who works with me who might.  Wait here and I will see."  Without much waiting for any reply she whisks off in a rustle of skirts to the other door from the hospice and is gone for a few minutes during which some sounds of conversation and creaking that might indicate someone walking are barely heard.  The door opens abruptly as Pat breezes back in, smile firmly in place and back in an apparent comfort zone, "There is still the matter of coin, but my assistant is willing to give you the names of what we use and the general purpose of each if that suits you Master?"  Her manner is quick and efficient, seeming ready to usher him into the other room on the instant.
\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Feb 22 17:44:08 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Xiron
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Background for Xiron Tulanas
\nXiron is a tall, lean man which hails from the country of Kandor.  He has\n
long, black hair, and is of a medium build.  He is a young man, wears his beard\n
in the fork style, and garments are usually of a causal attire, yet he\n
occasionally will be seen wearing some of the most expensive.  \n
\n
From the age he was able to walk and hold a weapon he was trained in several\n
weapons, as is the normal for borderlanders.  He is the youngest of the\n
family's children, consisting of three sons and one daughter.  His family\n
lacked for very little, and thus, was tutored by some of the best teachers that\n
could be found in Kandor.  His days was filled with training all throughout his\n
childhood until he became an adult.  Unlike his brothers, he did not enlist in\n
the army.  Needless to say his father did not like this decision, but supported\n
the young man in his interests to trade.  He set out at the age of eight-teen,\n
starting out small in his trade ventures.  Within a couple of years, though, he\n
became well-known for being fair in his dealings, and his business grew.  He\n
has a soft heart for the poor, sick, and homeless, often times giving large\n
sums of money away to such causes, yet hates thieves, murderers, and corrupt\n
lenders.  Such lenders have been known to come up missing while he is in the\n
area, suddenly replaced, selling out, or outright never seen again.  Currently,\n
his caravan suffered a brutal ambush, and he lost several men, himself being\n
injured in the process.  Accidentally, he stumbled across a brooding Aes Sedai\n
shortly after this incident.  She teasingly accussed him of being not good\n
enough to train with the best in Tar Valon.  This Aes Sedai, which did not give\n
her name until much later on, sparked his interests, even though she was, at\n
best, grumpy most of the time.  He intends to speak to this strange Aes Sedai\n
once more, even though he has set his mind on journeying to Tar Valon, and\n
seeing if these southlanders are as good as rumour has it.  \n
\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar  1 01:32:42 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Matylena
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Overcrowding Issues
\nOkay, I've been giving things some thought, and here's what\n
I've been coming up with.  Starting the construction on\n
Elaida's palace has given me an idea for what to do with all\n
those extra soldiers.  So here is what Maty is going to do:\n
\n
The lower floor of the palace will be used as a research center,\n
as planned.  Research designed to encourage cooperation between\n
Asha'man and Aes Sedai, and mostly under the supervision of\n
the Red Ajah, who will be required to make regular reports to\n
Maty of any progress made.  The upper floors of the palace\n
will be a Tower.  In the books, it says that Elaida was in\n
fact planning to make her palace taller than the White Tower\n
itself.  I'm not going to make a bunch of rooms for that. I'm\n
just going to make it taller, as in, a tower.  A tower in\n
which to house hundreds of soldiers.  Maty is going to call it\n
'The Tower of the Night Watch', and the entire palace will be\n
dedicated to fighting Tarmon Gai'don.  Maty will attempt to\n
see if she can rally these soldiers to prepare to fight in\n
the Last Battle, by giving them a place to stay, and giving\n
them a name: The Night Watch.  The White Tower will also\n
support their training, and the Tower of the Night Watch will\n
have its own kitchens, and its own staff, which can be taken\n
from any other extra people who have come to Tar Valon with\n
the rebel army.  The new palace will also have training grounds,\n
rooms dedicated to specific research, as well as gardens and\n
such.  It will be within the Tower grounds, and will connect\n
to the White Tower gardens via an elaborate hedge maze, as well\n
as regular walkways.\n
\n
To elaborate more on the soldiers, the Tower portion of the\n
palace will be their home.  Each floor of the Tower will house\n
bunks for the soldiers, like a huge barracks on three different\n
levels.  There will be a dining hall on the second floor, where\n
both soldiers, and researchers can join together to eat.  The\n
soldiers' duty will be to protect the research palace from any\n
unwanted visitors, such as darkfriends or worse.  The purpose\n
of the Tower itself is to act as a watchtower for any major\n
threats within or without the city.  The soldiers will keep\n
that watch, and perhaps be assigned missions to investigate\n
this or that disturbance that might be shadow-related, with\n
a number of Aes Sedai as well.  That way, not all of the soldiers\n
are actually in the Tower at the same time, so those who are not\n
on some mission, can rotate into the bunks of those soldiers who\n
are.  I'm not sure exactly how many the Tower will be able to\n
hold all at one time, but I think it will hold a good many if\n
the description I am remembering is accurate.  It's supposed to\n
be a huge building, but within the Tower Grounds.  I think it\n
will work.  What do you think? :)\n
\n
Maty\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar  8 20:53:12 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Sevristh
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker Sevristh.  Guilding.
\n`7CC`6: `7Maelyn Balinor I spoke briefly with Maelyn, and we discussed in brief\n
joining.  As such, I have prepared a BG with the hopes that it meets your\n
approval for guilding me as a guest so that we may conduct RP that will\n
eventually see me into the position of a Warder Trainee.  So here goes, please\n
note that I'm perfectly willing to amend whatever it is you feel needs\n
changing.  \n
\n
Born in the Town of Sidon, Sevristh Kigali grew up the only child of relatively\n
wealthy merchants of Alum.  Their estate, though not lavish or grandiose as\n
many in Jehannah might be, was quite well known amongst the community, as were\n
Sevristh parents.  Most of his formative years his father was absent seeing\n
about the family business, and his mother was preoccupied with many functions\n
within the town.  After a number of small incidents that revolved around his\n
naturally mischievous nature his parents had decided to send him to Jehannah\n
where he could stay with aunt and uncle and their sons.  \n
\n
In Jehannah, his aunt tutored him and his cousins: while his uncle, a bit of a\n
renowned swordsman in those parts, instructed in the basics of swordsmanship\n
and martial knowledge.  At the time, having no particularly great interest in\n
the craft Sevristh often found himself observing the city, and the people, or\n
spending time out on the River Boern.  \n
\n
Shortly after rumour passed of a great battle in the sky Sevristh made a trip\n
to Sidon to visit his family, only to find that everything had been burned to\n
the ground.  Shock paralyzed him at first, and the panic set in as he tore\n
through the ruins of his birth place.  He found bodies, but nothing he\n
recognized, and somewhere through the bleak horror of it he found an inner\n
peace.  He believed that his parents were alive, that perhaps something had\n
come up that required his parents attentions with the business elsewhere and\n
that they had escaped this awful scene.  \n
\n
Setting out first to Jehannah to let his extended family know what had\n
transpired, he then traveled South.  Taking fare aboard a ship he sailed down\n
the River Eldar to Ebou Dar.  In Ebou Dar he sought connections to his parents\n
company, sought anyone with any information.  Months past, his money used up,\n
and still no word of encouragement.  The realities of his situation forced him\n
to find a job in simple labour.  Anything that could be done to earn a few\n
extra coppers that he could save to help in his search.  \n
\n
Word of the Dragonsworn tearing apart Ghealdan eventually made its way to\n
Sevristh ears, and after so much work without results he decided to return to\n
Jehannah and be with his cousins and their parents.  Getting a spot on a ship\n
headed North up the Eldar he was once again sailing.  The ship docked in So\n
Harbor, the captain unwilling to travel further North once hearing more news\n
there, and so Sevristh was stuck for the moment.  Upon taking room and board at\n
the Golden Barge, a local inn, he was surprised to have ran into his cousins\n
who themselves had been traveling South.  Drink and dice were had, as his\n
cousins relayed the events of the Dragonsworn, of the King and his hunting\n
accident.  Sevristh eventually learns of the fate of his extended family at the\n
hands of the Dragonsworn, of his uncle falling in with them, and of his aunt\n
who simply vanished.  Soon after his cousins made for Ebou Dar, hoping they\n
might find Sevristh there.  \n
\n
After a few days Sevristh and his two cousins chose to stay in So Harbor,\n
finding wages working for local grain merchants and simple and inexpensive\n
rooming.  That is until, one day a group of armed men on horses came to the\n
town.  One of the men bore a top knot, much in the Shienarian fashion, and\n
another seemed like a smooth talking Andoran.  These men spoke of soldiering,\n
of working under the finest general in all the lands.  Sevristh cousins were\n
eager to join, they wanted to strike back at the Dragonsworn, they wanted\n
adventure, and they wanted to move on from hauling grain.  Soon enough they\n
were recruited to follow Gareth Bryne and his soldiers under the control of the\n
rebel Aes Sedai.  \n
\n
It was here, that Sevristh really learned the basics of soldiering, the\n
requirements of the physical labour, and the discipline involved.  And so, like\n
many other men, he found himself on the move with this great host, all the way\n
to Tar Valon.  It was here, amongst these men, that he heard the stories of the\n
world beyond his small life.  It was here, that he first glimpsed an Aes Sedai,\n
or so at least he believes, and though he was not close to her, he thought only\n
an Aes Sedai would ride such a fine horse in such clothing with so many\n
soldiers about her and the Lord Gareth Bryne in her company.  It was also here\n
that he first saw a Warder, and the solemn dignity that the man bore as he went\n
about whatever it is such men do.  So it was also here, where in his mind he\n
resolved to make something of himself once in Tar Valon, at least, should he\n
survive the siege.  \n
\n
\n
That is the end of the BG.  With this BG, I've tried to take into account this\n
characters RPEXP level of 44, while at the same time making him very much a\n
novice compared to the likes of Warders.  I have WM that could be transferred\n
to this character, but as me and Maelyn discussed, my interest is in the RP. \n
And for the sake of that RP, I'm perfectly willing to forgo whatever WM and\n
learn from the ground up in the tower.  \n
\n
Please take this under consideration.  Thank you, Sevristh.  \n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar  8 20:53:12 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Sevristh
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Seeker Sevristh.  Guilding.
\n`7CC`6: `7Maelyn Balinor I spoke briefly with Maelyn, and we discussed in brief\n
joining.  As such, I have prepared a BG with the hopes that it meets your\n
approval for guilding me as a guest so that we may conduct RP that will\n
eventually see me into the position of a Warder Trainee.  So here goes, please\n
note that I'm perfectly willing to amend whatever it is you feel needs\n
changing.  \n
\n
Born in the Town of Sidon, Sevristh Kigali grew up the only child of relatively\n
wealthy merchants of Alum.  Their estate, though not lavish or grandiose as\n
many in Jehannah might be, was quite well known amongst the community, as were\n
Sevristh parents.  Most of his formative years his father was absent seeing\n
about the family business, and his mother was preoccupied with many functions\n
within the town.  After a number of small incidents that revolved around his\n
naturally mischievous nature his parents had decided to send him to Jehannah\n
where he could stay with aunt and uncle and their sons.  \n
\n
In Jehannah, his aunt tutored him and his cousins: while his uncle, a bit of a\n
renowned swordsman in those parts, instructed in the basics of swordsmanship\n
and martial knowledge.  At the time, having no particularly great interest in\n
the craft Sevristh often found himself observing the city, and the people, or\n
spending time out on the River Boern.  \n
\n
Shortly after rumour passed of a great battle in the sky Sevristh made a trip\n
to Sidon to visit his family, only to find that everything had been burned to\n
the ground.  Shock paralyzed him at first, and the panic set in as he tore\n
through the ruins of his birth place.  He found bodies, but nothing he\n
recognized, and somewhere through the bleak horror of it he found an inner\n
peace.  He believed that his parents were alive, that perhaps something had\n
come up that required his parents attentions with the business elsewhere and\n
that they had escaped this awful scene.  \n
\n
Setting out first to Jehannah to let his extended family know what had\n
transpired, he then traveled South.  Taking fare aboard a ship he sailed down\n
the River Eldar to Ebou Dar.  In Ebou Dar he sought connections to his parents\n
company, sought anyone with any information.  Months past, his money used up,\n
and still no word of encouragement.  The realities of his situation forced him\n
to find a job in simple labour.  Anything that could be done to earn a few\n
extra coppers that he could save to help in his search.  \n
\n
Word of the Dragonsworn tearing apart Ghealdan eventually made its way to\n
Sevristh ears, and after so much work without results he decided to return to\n
Jehannah and be with his cousins and their parents.  Getting a spot on a ship\n
headed North up the Eldar he was once again sailing.  The ship docked in So\n
Harbor, the captain unwilling to travel further North once hearing more news\n
there, and so Sevristh was stuck for the moment.  Upon taking room and board at\n
the Golden Barge, a local inn, he was surprised to have ran into his cousins\n
who themselves had been traveling South.  Drink and dice were had, as his\n
cousins relayed the events of the Dragonsworn, of the King and his hunting\n
accident.  Sevristh eventually learns of the fate of his extended family at the\n
hands of the Dragonsworn, of his uncle falling in with them, and of his aunt\n
who simply vanished.  Soon after his cousins made for Ebou Dar, hoping they\n
might find Sevristh there.  \n
\n
After a few days Sevristh and his two cousins chose to stay in So Harbor,\n
finding wages working for local grain merchants and simple and inexpensive\n
rooming.  That is until, one day a group of armed men on horses came to the\n
town.  One of the men bore a top knot, much in the Shienarian fashion, and\n
another seemed like a smooth talking Andoran.  These men spoke of soldiering,\n
of working under the finest general in all the lands.  Sevristh cousins were\n
eager to join, they wanted to strike back at the Dragonsworn, they wanted\n
adventure, and they wanted to move on from hauling grain.  Soon enough they\n
were recruited to follow Gareth Bryne and his soldiers under the control of the\n
rebel Aes Sedai.  \n
\n
It was here, that Sevristh really learned the basics of soldiering, the\n
requirements of the physical labour, and the discipline involved.  And so, like\n
many other men, he found himself on the move with this great host, all the way\n
to Tar Valon.  It was here, amongst these men, that he heard the stories of the\n
world beyond his small life.  It was here, that he first glimpsed an Aes Sedai,\n
or so at least he believes, and though he was not close to her, he thought only\n
an Aes Sedai would ride such a fine horse in such clothing with so many\n
soldiers about her and the Lord Gareth Bryne in her company.  It was also here\n
that he first saw a Warder, and the solemn dignity that the man bore as he went\n
about whatever it is such men do.  So it was also here, where in his mind he\n
resolved to make something of himself once in Tar Valon, at least, should he\n
survive the siege.  \n
\n
\n
That is the end of the BG.  With this BG, I've tried to take into account this\n
characters RPEXP level of 44, while at the same time making him very much a\n
novice compared to the likes of Warders.  I have WM that could be transferred\n
to this character, but as me and Maelyn discussed, my interest is in the RP. \n
And for the sake of that RP, I'm perfectly willing to forgo whatever WM and\n
learn from the ground up in the tower.  \n
\n
Please take this under consideration.  Thank you, Sevristh.  \n
\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Apr  3 15:59:14 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Duren
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Runen's Request
\nI made you trust 98 on BP, so you should be able to edit\n
any zone you want.  If you do get permission errors, just grant yourself\n
access to the zone using the 'olc' command:\n
\n
olc grant <player> <zone> <type> <level>\n
\n
For now, the 'level' is always 2, we haven't coded other levels yet.\n
You can also grant other builders zone access as needed.\n
\n
-Duren\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Apr  9 23:20:08 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Your NPCs
\nSorry, I was mostly afk.  You need to edit the zones in the rooms\n
you want your mobs to load, so that they will load automatically.\n
Just type zedit in the room you want the mob to automatically load\n
in, then choose the 'New Command' option.  After that, choose the\n
'load mob to room' option.  Enter the vnum of the mob when asked.\n
How many should exist in the game?  1.  How many should load in\n
the room?  1.  Save.  If there are already other commands, you\n
might have to answer a question of 'Is this command dependant on\n
previous commands?"  Just say no.  Hope this helps.  That's why\n
your mobs don't show.  If the zone is copied over or the mud crashes,\n
your mobs will not remain unless you edit the zone as explained\n
above.  Then they will automatically reload when the zone resets.\n
That's why I gave you access to edit the Caemlyn zones. :)\n
\n
If you have any questions, just ask!\n
\n
Ayasha\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Apr  9 23:20:08 2009\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Your NPCs
\nSorry, I was mostly afk.  You need to edit the zones in the rooms\n
you want your mobs to load, so that they will load automatically.\n
Just type zedit in the room you want the mob to automatically load\n
in, then choose the 'New Command' option.  After that, choose the\n
'load mob to room' option.  Enter the vnum of the mob when asked.\n
How many should exist in the game?  1.  How many should load in\n
the room?  1.  Save.  If there are already other commands, you\n
might have to answer a question of 'Is this command dependant on\n
previous commands?"  Just say no.  Hope this helps.  That's why\n
your mobs don't show.  If the zone is copied over or the mud crashes,\n
your mobs will not remain unless you edit the zone as explained\n
above.  Then they will automatically reload when the zone resets.\n
That's why I gave you access to edit the Caemlyn zones. :)\n
\n
If you have any questions, just ask!\n
\n
Ayasha\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jun 25 06:43:38 2010\n`7From`6:`7 Allec
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Building standards
\n`7CC`6: `7Duren Ayasha \n
Greetings, I'm going to try and get into some building while I have the\n
time. That being said, I was looking at starting to flesh out the\n
ubermap a bit. Assigning names, room-types, etc. and then starting to\n
add descriptions. So far, have there been any standards set for room\n
naming conventions or descriptions, as well as room types? For instance,\n
when coloring room names, do you want simple colors or something more\n
flashy. I generally prefer one color per word and no more than one or\n
two colors per room name, but that's just me. I've seen both as I've\n
walked around, and just wanted to know if there was an established\n
standard.\n
\n
Also, as far as room types go, do we want rivers to be swimable or\n
non-swimable? Or should there be a variation of both? Has there been\n
any insight in the ubermap as to which is which? Right now I could\n
build them all one way, and just change them individually as it's decided\n
which rooms should be which. However, are most going to be swim or no swim?\n
\n
I know mobprogs are probably a higher priority right now, but fleshing\n
out the map seems like it will fit into my schedule a bit better. I hope\n
to come on and add descriptions a few rooms at a time as I'm able. I figure\n
if I can even knock out 3-5 rooms a night, in addition to adding room names\n
to zones around that map, that would at least be some help.\n
\n
Thanks,\n
James aka Allec\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Oct 14 14:48:12 2010\n`7From`6:`7 Leara
\n`7Subj`6:`7 State of the Aiel Guild
\n \n
Ok..hereiswhatIproposefortheAielGuild.\n
\n
The main group of Aiel have returned to the Three-Fold Land. \n
However, Wise Ones can travel now, and this should not impede \n
excursions into the Wetlands because I do not believe in \n
sealing all of the Aiel off and not being able to RP with \n
the rest of the MUD. \n
\n
I would like to set up a camp outside of Andor that is not \n
generally known about. Possibly a few hundred spears living \n
somewhere between Caemlyn and Alindaer. This would be the \n
spot that Wise Ones would gate back and forth from, giving \n
them a base in which to return should the Dragon Reborn need \n
them again in the Wetlands. \n
\n
Ill need to build a small Three-fold Land. Ill leave it \n
unconnected for the time being, just a few RPable rooms.. \n
a Wise Ones tent, a Sweat Tent, and one hold.. Just until \n
I have the time to build a larger Waste.\n
\n
The Shaido are in Ghaeldan. I would like for any Aiel to \n
be able to NPC a Shaido should the need arise. The Shaido \n
are raping and pillaging Ghaeldan, picking fights with \n
Whitecloaks, but I don't see the need for any PCs to create \n
Shaido alts for the time being. However, I would like to \n
use them as an RP tool and the reason that a small camp has \n
been left behind in Andor should the need arise to return \n
and combat them.\n
\n
I just wanted to run all of this by you so you could ok it \n
all. Hopefully Haile will return and Ill be able to RP with \n
her in the coming days. \n
\n
Leara\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Jan 27 15:41:56 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Test
`6Welcome to A Moment in Tyme!  After a long hiatus, and with the long-\n
awaited completion of `#A M`3emory of `#L`3ight`6, we appear to be making a big\n
comeback.  We are in the process of resetting the timeline.  There is\n
some work to be done, but we welcome any help from anyone willing to\n
bring Tyme back to life!    \n
`&Update`6:  A Moment in Tyme is currently undergoing a Timeline \n
Overhaul.  Spoiler Alert: `&This means that we are starting \n
from scratch at the end of Winter's Heart`6.  From there, A Moment \n
in Tyme will be a mirror world, where we write our own story.  Character \n
backgrounds will need to be re-written to exclude much of what has gone \n
before in the game, though original character concepts and backgrounds \n
can be worked into the new timeline.  `!Weaponmastery and Channeling \n
Mastery are a thing of the past.`6  The Imms are currently in the process \n
of reviewing the policies of the game.  Player input is welcome and \n
encouraged.  We have new guild leaders for Band of the Red Hand, the \n
Black Tower, Wolfkin, Children of the Light and Council.  There are still \n
guild leader spots to be filled.\n
`&Code and Building`6:  We need help with the code, and with building.\n
We will have a new turn-based combat system, auto-quests for quest\n
points, and a large Ubermap to explore, with all kinds of secrets\n
to uncover.  Tyme is currently an evolving work in progress, and RP\n
is going to be our major means of earning experience and levels until\n
the combat code is in. Volunteers to help are appreciated!\n
A current list of code/OOC updates is available under "`6help mitupdate`7".\n
IC updates and rumors are posted under "`6updates`7".\n
Visit our webpage at `6http://www.tymemud.com`7\n
Type "`2help newbie`7" for an essential index to help.\n
Type "`2timeline`7" for an overview of recent events.\n
Type "`2recall`7" at any time to return to Caemlyn.\n
Type "`2help cairhien`7" or "`2help caemlyn`7" for directions.\n
Vote for us at: \n
`2http://www.tymemud.com`7\n
`3Our condolences go out to the friends and family of `&R`7obert `&J`7ordan`3, who\n
passed away on September 16, 2007.  Without him, Tyme would not exist, and\n
we thank him for all of the memories that he has given us over the years.\n
Rest in peace, Robert Jordan.  You will be missed.  We also thank `#Brandon\n
Sanderson`3 for completing the books for the fans of a much beloved series.`7\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\nI would like to clean up the proj show board a bit, to remove references\n
to previous timelines, and perhaps get it a little less spammy.  I am going to\n
leave all the stuff about the new code, and the ubermap and stuff alone.  But\n
things like proj show 17.  Weather update.  That was like... 2 timelines ago. :P I\n
think those should go, along with anything else we don't really need.\n
\n

know if there is a way they can be removed.  Thanks! :)\n
\n
Ayasha\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Jan 29 19:33:12 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Laurane
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Wisdoms/Kin storyline

\nAt this point in the books, the Kin have mostly fled Altara and are at the palace in Andor with Elayne. Some have chosen to don the novice white, but the rest are helping out where we can. Those who are strong enough weave gateways for Elayne's messengers and the rest serve where needed. A few of us even continue to mount rescue missions into Seanchan controlled territory, trying to find other Kinswomen before they are leashed.\n
\n

I would say most of the 'active' Kinswomen should be in Andor for now, though there are plenty spread throughout the world. We can assist Elayne in preparation for the upcoming civil war that seems to be brewing on the horizon. We are still in discussion with Elayne and through her, the Amyrlin Seat, on what the future holds for the Kin, and those who do not wish to join the White Tower.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\nI've checked and re-checked this zone, and I am certain that whatever is wrong with\n
it is not in any of the commands available to builders.  It's a code issue for sure.  When\n
you can, please take a looksee?  Thankee :)\n
\n
Ayasha\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Jan 31 17:29:19 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Item Costs/Materials
\nHeya,\n
\n
I am still confused about how to set the costs and such for the equipment\n
and items.  You said it was based on the materials they are made from in econ.  But,\n
I cannot figure out how to set on each item what materials they are made of, or \n
how to figure out what they should weight/cost.\n
\n
I noticed that all of the objects in zone 35 have values (under option C in oedit),\n
but, I do not know what those values are supposed to be, or how to set them, even if\n
I knew what they were.  Are those the materials?  If so, how do I set those?\n
\n
As it is, I've just been setting weights on things that make sense.  I saw pants that\n
weighed 20, and thin silk veils that weighed 40, a pair of earrings that weighed 40.  It makes\n
no sense to me whatsoever, and if we're going to get this econ thing right so that shops will\n
work, I need a better explanation of how to do this. :)\n
\n
I set the weights/costs of all the objects in zone 35 to what makes sense to me, as a\n
person who might buy those things.  I just can't seem to figure out if it's doing\n
any good though.\n
\n
When you have time, can we sit down and talk about this so it makes more sense?  I really\n
want to get this right and work on it, but I feel stymied by the feeling that I don't\n
know what I'm doing. :P\n
\n
Thanks,\n
\n
Aya\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Feb  2 00:37:13 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Nedjma
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Growing Up
\nGrowing Up\n
\n
While her mother's roof was in Shiagi Hold proper, Nedjma spent much of her childhood\n
accompanying her father, who guided caravan merchants through the Three-Fold Land.  She \n
enjoyed life on the road, the constantly changing scenery andcompany, the long quiet walks \n
home with her father, and the deadly, still beauty of her home.  He taught her much about\n
the resilient plants and creatures that live in the TFL.\n
\n
Always At Home\n
Eyes on the Horizon\n
\n
Getting Started\n
\n
Nedjma's first trip to Rhuidean was a horrifying experience, as it is for so many apprentice\n
Wise Ones and Clan Chiefs, but she recovered and, in fact, redoubled her efforts at learning\n
the ways of the Wise Ones to help her people be strong enough to survive the coming era of\n
prophecy.  Her second was much worse.  Visions of an inhabited Rhuidean consumed in flame,\n
friends and a husband and children lost in the smoke, and the choking stench of death visit \n
her dreams even all these decades later.\n
\n
Building Strength for Tomorrow\n
Haunted by the Future\n
\n
The Crisis\n
\n
Nedjma has been married twice, both deceased, and given birth to seven children.  Neither of\n
her husbands  were in her vision from Rhuidean.  However, shortly after leaving the \n
Three-Fold Land to follow the Car'a'Carn, she saw a man briefly in Cairhien, just a face in \n
the crowd, who was - and he was not Aiel.  Only years of discipline allowed her to master\n
the impulse to lift her skirts and run without stopping until she recrossed the Spine.\n
Nevertheless, she has several times sought him out in Tel'aran'rhiod without success.\n
\n
Hiding from another Husband\n
Life is What it Is\n
\n
On Your Own\n
\n
Nedjma has traveled to Caemlyn with a large contingent of Aiel to assist Elayne Trakand\n
cement her hold on the throne.  It seemed important to the Car'a'carn, and Nedjma quietly \n
enjoys the idea of Rand having a roof-mistress to come back to.  She has made friendly\n
acquainance with the local herbalists to learn about local plants and animals.  While\n
initially excited by snow, the endless Winter has begun to weigh heavily on her, and\n
exacerbated her homesickness.\n
\n
Makes Friends with Strangers\n
Tired of Water\n
\n
Description (minus color codes)\n
\n
Standing straight and tall, Nedjma is a beautiful woman.  Her thick crimson hair cascades\n
down her back in waves and curls to the tips of her shoulder blades, with a shock of white\n
just left of her part-line.  Her tan face is marked by laugh lines at the corners of her\n
twinkling green eyes and her full, coral lips.  Silver hoop earrings dangle from her\n
earlobes.\n
\n
Nedjma is 5'10" tall and is dressed in the typical garb of an Aiel woman. Her algode blouse\n
is open just slightly at the collar to all the hollow of her throat to show.  A dark brown\n
skirt, cinched with a colorful sash, falls to her ankles and rustles softly as she walks.\n
Soft leather boots peak out from beneath th ehem.\n
Her writsts are adorned with various gold and silver bracelets that clink together pleasantly\n
\n
Her writsts are adorned with various gold and silver bracelets that clink together pleasantly\n
when she moves, and a beautiful silver righ set with amethyst adorns her right ring finger.\n
\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
