\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb 27 10:04:09 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Last Time
\nYou cannot have both of your alts involved in the same RP.  Period.  \n
\n
Perrin is in GHEALDAN.  Miniver was lucky to have heard that Sending.  Granted,\n
wolves may have spread the word of the incident, but Perrin is hunting for HIS\n
KIDNAPPED WIFE.  \n
\n
In the books, Perrin is obsessed with finding Faile.  If anything, he would be\n
using the wolf dream to scout out the Shaido camp, NOT some hill way far away\n
southeast of Caemlyn.  \n
\n
Please review POLICY BOOKIE.  One of the points I made there when updating that\n
file is that players who take on book characters are expected to play their\n
characters in accordance with the characters from the books.  \n
\n
Do you really think Perrin would leave Faile to certain death and torture, to\n
go off chasing rumors about something else?  \n
\n
The books say no.  Perrin is nearly insane with terror for what is going to\n
happen to Faile, and is very near to losing himself to the wolf.  He's so\n
obsessed with it that everything else is secondary.  \n
\n
Finally, like I said, I am going to be running a very large event JUST FOR\n
PERRIN.  I am going through a lot of trouble to do so.  Please be patient, and\n
you'll reap the rewards.  We will get Perrin on the grid eventually.  But you\n
can't violate our policies by having two alts involved in the same storyline,\n
and doing something that would be out of character for Perrin.  \n
\n
I'm sorry if I'm getting upset, but you just don't seem to understand, and I\n
don't know how to get through to you.  \n
\n
This is the final word on the matter.  Perrin cannot be involved in the\n
investigation of the hill.  Miniver is more than welcome to investigate in TAR\n
with Wyl and Ragnarr, and whoever else you want.  But not Perrin.  \n
\n
\n
Ayasha\n

The books say no.  Perrin is nearly insane with terror for what is going to\n
happen to Faile, and is very near to losing himself to the wolf.  He's so\n
obsessed with it that everything else is secondary.  \n
\n
Finally, like I said, I am going to be running a very large event JUST FOR\n
PERRIN.  I am going through a lot of trouble to do so.  Please be patient, and\n
you'll reap the rewards.  We will get Perrin on the grid eventually.  But you\n
can't violate our policies by having two alts involved in the same storyline,\n
and doing something that would be out of character for Perrin.  \n
\n
I'm sorry if I'm getting upset, but you just don't seem to understand, and I\n
don't know how to get through to you.  \n
\n
This is the final word on the matter.  Perrin cannot be involved in the\n
investigation of the hill.  Miniver is more than welcome to investigate in TAR\n
with Wyl and Ragnarr, and whoever else you want.  But not Perrin.  \n
\n
\n
Ayasha\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Feb 27 10:04:09 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Last Time
\nYou cannot have both of your alts involved in the same RP.  Period.  \n
\n
Perrin is in GHEALDAN.  Miniver was lucky to have heard that Sending.  Granted,\n
wolves may have spread the word of the incident, but Perrin is hunting for HIS\n
KIDNAPPED WIFE.  \n
\n
In the books, Perrin is obsessed with finding Faile.  If anything, he would be\n
using the wolf dream to scout out the Shaido camp, NOT some hill way far away\n
southeast of Caemlyn.  \n
\n
Please review POLICY BOOKIE.  One of the points I made there when updating that\n
file is that players who take on book characters are expected to play their\n
characters in accordance with the characters from the books.  \n
\n
Do you really think Perrin would leave Faile to certain death and torture, to\n
go off chasing rumors about something else?  \n
\n
The books say no.  Perrin is nearly insane with terror for what is going to\n
happen to Faile, and is very near to losing himself to the wolf.  He's so\n
obsessed with it that everything else is secondary.  \n
\n

you'll reap the rewards.  We will get Perrin on the grid eventually.  But you\n
can't violate our policies by having two alts involved in the same storyline,\n
and doing something that would be out of character for Perrin.  \n
\n
I'm sorry if I'm getting upset, but you just don't seem to understand, and I\n
don't know how to get through to you.  \n
\n
This is the final word on the matter.  Perrin cannot be involved in the\n
investigation of the hill.  Miniver is more than welcome to investigate in TAR\n
with Wyl and Ragnarr, and whoever else you want.  But not Perrin.  \n
\n
\n
Ayasha\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Feb 28 23:45:11 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Aalaryn
\n`7Subj`6:`7 templates?
\nWarder Template #1 - The Righteous\n
The Righteous "For the Light against the Dark"\n
These are the more common types of candidates seeking to train with \n
the warders. These are people with high ideals and goals for themselves \n
and their own place in the Wheel. At some point or another they have \n
decided that they wish to fight against the Dark One: even though some \n
of the more erratic of these seek themselves to the Children of the Light, \n
those without prejudice finds themselves in Tar Valon.\n
These people feel that the best way to fight against the Shadow is by \n
the Aes Sedai's side. The Last Battle requires the use of the One Power, \n
and Tar Valon is the obvious fortress of justice in these regards. They \n
are blindly devoted to the cause, and trust in the cause whatever means \n
are used along the way. \n
The Righteous makes a good Warder. He believes in what he does \n
without question. This may even be his flaw: without questioning the \n
mind gets no room for growth. Yet for the purpose of Tar Valon a man \n
of this devotion would serve quite well.\n
Warder Template # 2 - The Romantic \n
The Romantic "I want to be a hero too!"\n
Dazzled by old stories of heroism against the battle of evil, the \n
Romantic dwells within all the elaborated myths about the Gaidin. This \n
one wants to be a hero first and foremost. Naturally with this comes a \n
degree of wishing to contribute, though often this trait is overshadowed \n
by the urge to be special and important. \n
This kind of person is often grandiose in nature. He is more \n
self-preserved than The Righteous, more concerned with his own \n
progression and faith rather than those around him. He may even be \n
somewhat naive, and could also fail to comprehend the full extent of \n
what being a Warder entails. By no means a selfish person, he may on \n
occasion find himself too engrossed with his own self and maybe not \n
contributing in the way other people might expect. Still, these men's \n
bravery often matches that of The Righteous', and makes a good \n
contribution to the ranks.\n
Warder Template # 3 - The Dutiful \n
The Dutiful "My Duty is My Life"\n
Even though all Warders are supposed to live by their duty, many of \n
them apply this in various ways from person to person. This one lives \n
only for his Duty. There is a small urge to be a part of something large, \n
yet in the end, be it for the Light or personal reasons, the Duty is what \n
counts. \n
These men often arrive at the White Tower completely clear and \n
confident in what they wish to do, and what role they are to partake in. \n
There is little passion outside the cold brim of duty, and these are in \n
truth the "Cold, Leashed Dogs" of the Gaidin that most people hear \n
about. They often see themselves more as tools than maybe the Aes \n
Sedai does, not caring much for their own value and often quite morbid \n
in nature.\n
Warder Template # 4 - The Cryptic \n
The Cryptic "I do what I do for my own reasons"\n
Many kinds of people fit into this category, yet what all of these are \n
bound to have in common is the fact that at one point or another, \n
something happened in their lives that made them feel like repaying it \n
in a way by joining the Gaidin. Maybe some Aes Sedai helped this one \n
in the past in a way, and as compensation, he decided to repay this \n
favor by becoming a Gaidin. As all personal experience, the event that \n
led their path to the Shining walls varies as the colors of the rainbow.\n
Their personalities are a very mixed lot: there is hardly one that is the \n
other alike. But driven by personal reasons to pursue extensive training, \n
others may be suspicious of their true potential as Gaidin. They are \n
sometimes very unpredictable.\n
TG Template #1 - The Devoted \n
The Devoted "To Defend the Shining Walls till my last breath"\n
Aside from the regular Warder-candidates there are those who seek a \n
more structured life-style in the army instead. The guidance of the army \n
is like a beacon for these, clearing the path and allowing the person to \n
tread upon the lane of Light within the ranks. This type is similar to #1, \n
the Righteous, yet being indecisive about where his efforts should be \n
focused he chooses the army.\n
This type is a loyal and obedient man of the army. The desire to be a \n
part of something large and grand is like a star of guidance shining \n
brilliantly above him:  the Aes Sedai knows what is best, better obey \n
them, and maybe you will serve the Light in a most honorable way.\n
TG Template #2 - The Unemployed \n
TG #2 - The Unemployed "I needed a job"\n
One rare, though occasionally occurring, kind of person pops up every \n
now and then. In lack of other things to do, either due to failure in \n
other professions or without aspirations for any other kind of work, \n
the Unemployed is a Regular Joe. Often bred from the common level of \n
people he simply seeks the army, as many other idlers tend to do when \n
forced to take some step to get somewhere in life.\n
These men are often rather simple in terms of personality. They are \n
often unhindered by glorious desires to become something special, like \n
heroes or high-ranking officers: they merely wish to earn a living by \n
the means available. They are often practical commoners, unconcerned \n
with deeply involving issues that do not concern them or their kin. \n
Their reoccurring off-handed traits and views can often have a frank \n
charm of its own.\n
TG Template #2 - The Obligated \n
TG #2 - The Obligated "My family honor and tradition require me to"\n
The Nobility are often in the habit of sending their sons to be trained \n
at the White Tower. These sons are sometimes the heirs of their \n
families and thus never intend to bond or be employed by the White \n
Tower, but instead will leave back to their families once the training is \n
over. Some are second or third sons, and may, in fact, pledge to serve \n
the Amyrlin.\n
These sons have often received some form of schooling and training \n
since their childhood, but lack that something special, which would \n
make them stand out from any other men. Something which is needed \n
for the future Lord or to further the interests of the House.\n
The Noble sons usually have no higher aspirations than to fulfill their \n
family's obligations and traditions to the best of their abilities. To fail \n
at training, would be to fail and disgrace their own family. They make \n
very hard working and strictly disciplined students, but the nobility \n
rarely partakes with the camaraderie existing amidst the other trainees, \n
whom they see as being far beneath them. \n
*IMPORTANT NOTE*\n
You MUST submit your background to the Daes GL for approval of \n
the noble connection BEFORE sending it to the Tower GLs.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Subj`6:`7 Shops
\nCan we just delete all the shops?  Since I have to do the ones I did over\n
anyway, I might as well start from scratch.  I don't know how to delete the\n
ones I did.  They got ported over when you changed your room, because they are\n
in zone 0 so now they are all on the main port and they weren't ready to be\n
ported.  \n
\n
It won't take me long to re-do them in their proper zones.  It will be easier\n
if I can just sedit <vnum> as I go along, instead of relying on that\n
ridiculously long list in show shops.  Most of those 'shops' aren't even shops\n
anyway, as we discussed earlier on the wiz channel.  \n
\n
Once we find a way to get all the shops deleted, I can make shops match up with\n
room numbers, and then hopefully show shops will only show shops that are\n
actual shops, instead of a bunch of random vnums.  \n
\n
I hope this makes sense.\n
\n
Aya\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar  3 09:33:41 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Kaden
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Kaden
\n`7CC`6: `7Balinor Rayenia Denaad Jezz
\n\n
Hello, I would like to seek the White Tower as a candidate for the Warders or Tower\n
Guard.\n
\n
Kaden was born in Alindaer. He is the fourth son of a candle maker. Kaden never took\n
to any of the trades his father arranged for him to be apprenticed to. It wasn't that\n
he was lazy, stupid, or incapable: quite the contrary, Kaden could likely be successful\n
at anything he set his mind to, he was just easily bored and unhappy with the mundane\n
routine of a leatherworker, furniture maker, or baker. In fact, the only thing he really\n
excelled at was getting into, and out of, trouble. His favorite kind of trouble was to\n
chase girls. His second favorite was to aquire things that weren't, technically, his.\n
This often resulted in his getting into fights with the brothers and cousins of the girls\n
and running from the town watch. He usually managed to escape, but even when he didn't it\n
wasn't usually enough to deter him from his next ill-advised adventure. When his father\n
finally tired of him and kicked him out, he decided to go to Tar Valon. When he found out\n
that his second favorite form of amusement would get him into more than trouble in Tar Valon\n
he decided to try something new. Something that seemed like the most interesting adventure\n
possible. He decided to join the Tower Guard and maybe become a Warder.\n
\n
Description:\n
\n
Young Kaden is not tall nor is he heavily muscled, but he has the broad shoulders, narrow\n
waist and long limbs of an athlete. He has long black hair that is pulled back into a tail\n
and dark eyes. A half-smile seems to be his natural expression, as if he is secretly amused\n
by something.\n
\n
His clothing is well made but utilitarian. He wears an off-white linen shirt tucked into\n
dark brown trousers. His light brown coat has a hint of dark green embroidery at the cuffs\n
and collar. His boots are well worn, but sturdy. He is unarmed save for a small belt knife\n
and a small golden medallion hangs from a thong around his neck. A small pack is slung\n
over his shoulder.\n
\n
I appreciate your consideration.\n

dark brown trousers. His light brown coat has a hint of dark green embroidery at the cuffs\n
and collar. His boots are well worn, but sturdy. He is unarmed save for a small belt knife\n
and a small golden medallion hangs from a thong around his neck. A small pack is slung\n
over his shoulder.\n
\n
I appreciate your consideration.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Mar  3 09:33:41 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Kaden
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Kaden
\n`7CC`6: `7Balinor Rayenia Denaad Jezz
\n\n
Hello, I would like to seek the White Tower as a candidate for the Warders or Tower\n
Guard.\n
\n
Kaden was born in Alindaer. He is the fourth son of a candle maker. Kaden never took\n
to any of the trades his father arranged for him to be apprenticed to. It wasn't that\n
he was lazy, stupid, or incapable: quite the contrary, Kaden could likely be successful\n
at anything he set his mind to, he was just easily bored and unhappy with the mundane\n
routine of a leatherworker, furniture maker, or baker. In fact, the only thing he really\n
excelled at was getting into, and out of, trouble. His favorite kind of trouble was to\n
chase girls. His second favorite was to aquire things that weren't, technically, his.\n
This often resulted in his getting into fights with the brothers and cousins of the girls\n
and running from the town watch. He usually managed to escape, but even when he didn't it\n
wasn't usually enough to deter him from his next ill-advised adventure. When his father\n
finally tired of him and kicked him out, he decided to go to Tar Valon. When he found out\n
that his second favorite form of amusement would get him into more than trouble in Tar Valon\n
he decided to try something new. Something that seemed like the most interesting adventure\n
possible. He decided to join the Tower Guard and maybe become a Warder.\n
\n
Description:\n
\n
Young Kaden is not tall nor is he heavily muscled, but he has the broad shoulders, narrow\n
waist and long limbs of an athlete. He has long black hair that is pulled back into a tail\n
and dark eyes. A half-smile seems to be his natural expression, as if he is secretly amused\n
by something.\n
\n
His clothing is well made but utilitarian. He wears an off-white linen shirt tucked into\n
dark brown trousers. His light brown coat has a hint of dark green embroidery at the cuffs\n
and collar. His boots are well worn, but sturdy. He is unarmed save for a small belt knife\n
and a small golden medallion hangs from a thong around his neck. A small pack is slung\n
over his shoulder.\n
\n
I appreciate your consideration.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Mar  5 23:03:34 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Room Descs
\nNo, I don't need a report on every room that doesn't have an actual desc. \n
There are zones that were ported over incomplete back when Nicodemus was in\n
charge of the Ubermap.  Only the rooms directly surrounding the major cities\n
were desc'd, and all the others were left as 'The Open World'.  I definitely\n
don't need reports on those.  \n
\n
We are still working those zones.  If you would really like to help, I would be\n
more than happy to set you up on the builder port as a mort builder, and you\n
can help me take a crack at them.  It is a huge project, and I've been working\n
at it, but there have been other priorities, such as getting Ghealdan set up\n
for very immediate war RP needs, and getting the shop code to work properly.  \n
\n
Right now, I've just finished Ghealdan, and am working on a couple of towns. \n
After that, it will be linked up with the old Two Rivers zone, Baerlon,\n
Whitebridge and Four Kings.  This will probably happen within the next week or\n
so.  \n
\n
If you would like to help, let me know and I will set you up.  :)\n
\n
Ayasha \n

\n\n
`6For this performance Ailsa has forsaken her typical `8bl`7a`8ck `1a`8tt`7i`8re`6. Instead she\n
`6is garbed in a `1s`!al`#a`&c`#i`!ou`1s`6 ensemble that will likely cause the more `8fa`7st`&id`7io`8us`6\n
`6folk of Caemlyn to suffer palpitations. The whole costume is constructed of\n
`6thick silk in `3s`7h`&i`#m`3me`#r`&i`7n`3g t`7au`3p`7e`6, all the hems are lined with carefully sewn\n
`#m`&e`7t`8al`7l`&i`#c`6 embroidery and thinly hammered `7b`3ro`8n`3z`7e `8c`7o`3in`7s`6 which jingle and chime\n
`6faintly as she moves.  Her `8bl`7ac`&k `7ha`8ir`6 is pulled into a tight bun at the nape\n
`6of her neck and she walks barefoot along the cleanly-swept floors. Her `#w`3a`7r`3m\n
`#h`3o`7n`3e`#y `3e`7y`3e`#s`6 are outlined with thick, `7d`8a`7r`&k `7ch`8a`3r`7c`3o`8al`6 shading and her lips are\n
`6painted `!d`1ee`8p `1cr`!i`&m`!s`1on`6.\n
`6Her `1ample bosom`6 is only barely constrained by the `3t`7i`&g`#h`3tl`#y`&-t`#ai`3lo`7re`&d `8ha`7l`&f`7-t`8op`6\n
`6which exposes her `&e`^nt`6ir`7e `6to`^rs`&o`6 from the center of her ribcage to just below\n
`6her navel, displaying sleek `3d`7a`8r`3k s`8k`7i`3n`6 and smoothly toned abs.  The thick\n
`&l`7u`8s`3t`7r`&o`7u`8s `7s`3i`&l`7k`6 is sleeveless and cut with a `!d`1ee`8p`6 plunging neckline, and a\n
`6complete ring of the thin `7b`3ro`8n`3z`7e `8c`7o`3in`7s`6 lines the lowest edge, gently\n
`6swinging as she moves.\n
`6The bottom half of her costume is made of the same `3s`7h`&i`#m`3me`#r`&i`7n`3g n`7u`3d`7e`6 silk, the\n
`6waistline actually tailored to sit directly along her `7wide hips`6 at the sides\n
`6and slope to a lower point several inches beneath her navel.  Custom-fitted\n
`6to her `7hips`6, round `1backside`6, and firm `3thighs`6, the fabric flares out quite\n
`6dramatically just past her butt. The lower portion of her outfit is made up\n
`6of tight `7s`3i`&l`7k`6 pants and a wide, flaring skirt with an `#e`3x`7tr`&e`#me `&e`7xc`3es`#s`6 of\n
`6radiant material swirling around her.  Just like the small, tight top, the\n
`6hemline of her skirt is heavily embroidered with `#m`&e`7t`8al`7l`&i`#c`6 thread and many\n
`6brightly polished jingling `7b`3ro`8n`3z`7e `8c`7o`3in`7s`6.\n
`6Though the two pieces of her attire are doubtlessly `1s`!ca`#n`&da`#l`!ou`1s`6, the actual\n
`6focus of her costume is something else entirely.  Attached to the shoulder\n
`6straps of the half-top are two `2ex`@c`#e`&s`7s`&i`#v`@e`2ly`6 long, flat sections of thin silk.\n
`6Each of those strips of fabric, at least `7three`6 times longer than a man is\n
`6tall, hangs from her shoulders down to her hands.  Unlike the main part of\n
`6her `3e`#n`&s`7em`&b`#l`3e`6, the expansive silken ribbons are dyed in a color gradient\n
`6beginning with a `&l`%i`7gh`&t p`%i`7n`&k r`%o`7s`&e`6 shade at her shoulders and darkening into\n
`6a `!d`1ee`8p `1cr`!i`&m`!s`1on`6 along the last several feet of cloth.`7\n
\n
Whatcha think?\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr  6 12:14:47 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Talavin
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Talavin goes recruiting Rumor
\n`7CC`6: `7Ayasha Rissa
\n\n
Hey guys, to start off recruiting for Legions of the QG I thought it would be\n
best to lead with a rumor of Talavin going to visit former QG bannermen and\n
the younger sons of nobles in and around the Caemlyn area. The bannermen\n
would be men who were purged from the guard under Gaebril who didn't take a\n
side during the sucession. I know the Band has offered to help out in training\n
for new QG but the QG needs its own NCOs to build the squads around. The younger\n
sons of nobles would be potential officers and squad leaders/lieutenants. I think\n
this makes sense ICly and OOCly it gives people something to create characters\n
around if they would like to join in the fun. After this rumor has been out for a\n
while we could probably do a formal news/proclamation about forming the Lion Legion,\n
the the Rose Legion, ect.\n
\n
Potential text. Revise at will.\n
\n
A tall officer in a Queen's Guard uniform has been seen in the streets in and around\n
Caemlyn. He is always by himself when he arrives at the mansions of Noble families and\n
the homes of Common folk, but when he leaves it is often in the company of young men\n
from the former, and grizzled and scarred older men from the latter.\n
\n
I would be cool with anybody who wants to submit a BG corresponding to either of these\n
being guilded into Council and thrown right into the mix. If any other them want to\n
have that seeker RP where Talavin comes to talk to them I would be cool with that too.\n
Just have them give me a buzz/mail/whatever.\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr 13 18:16:47 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Rissa
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rumor 1 for Cairhien

\nRumors of discontented Cairhienin nobility have been circulating for some time now, and have finally outstripped the surreptitious, speculative whispers as many Houses are clamoring publicly for armsmen and mercenaries.  Now under-armed, several noble Houses have sent feelers through Cairhien and beyond, trying to tempt new men-at-arms to come off the account and don House colors.\n

With this comes new whispers.  A few who pay attention to such matters have started ruminating aloud that a substantial number of men who have abandoned their posts seem largely to have been those who had previously been affiliated with the disgraced Andoran militia known as the White Lions. Some say those men are hoping to let bygones be bygones now that matters in Andor have settled down somewhat, and have simply gone home. Others still say it is merely happenstance, and that the Cairhienin Houses simply couldn't offer to pay as much as what the young Queen of Andor is offering to boost her numbers - after all, it is not solely former White Lions who have left the Houses half-unguarded.\n
Whatever the case, it is no longer debatable that men-at-arms are likely to find hearty welcome among the City of the Rising Sun's decadent Houses.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Apr 13 18:16:47 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Rissa

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Mon Apr 15 11:17:09 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Amarise
\n`7Subj`6:`7 DD/Council Background for Amarise
\n`7CC`6: `7Rissa Elayne Ayasha She is the granddaughter of Aedmun Matherin.  A\n
minor noble Andoran house that resides approximately 20 miles from the River\n
Erinin.  The house, while not large or greatly influential, is quite old and\n
has always stood for the Queen's House.  When her grandfather learned that\n
there were contenders for the throne other than Elayne, he set off for Caemlyn,\n
despite being a smaller house, in defense and support of the rightful heir of\n
Andor.  \n
\n
Amarise has always been near her grandfather, close, but she married young. \n
Her husband was not of noble blood, but rather a well-to-do merchant seeking to\n
further his gain and by seducing the young noble of house Matherin, he got his\n
wish.  The two weren't married long, however, for he cheated one too many\n
times, and Amarise, by pure bad luck(for him) walked in on his final .. \n
Endeavor.  Now, Amarise, while only 20, was brought up to with honor, tradition\n
and law, and she knew her husband was not faithful to her from the start..  She\n
did something that is likely considered the norm with other larger houses, but\n
in her small world, it was more devastating than she could imagine.  After\n
running the young tramp off, she killed her husband, stabbing him with the\n
simple, and only, weapon she carries- a dagger to the back.  She got away with\n
it, quite obviously so, and after mustering up tears, screamed for the guards\n
and claimed it was a foiled robbery attempt.  \n
\n
After one year of assumed grief, Amarise, still feeling guilty over what she\n
had done, decided to take up law, and become a Magistrate.  Perhaps in the\n
hopes of keeping men like her dead husband off of the streets.  But, in her\n
heart of hearts, that night tarnished her, and she turned from a sweet, gentle\n
creature to a hard, bitter, angry woman.  Most fear her judgement.  Or\n
will(once this RP gets going..  :P) \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

further his gain and by seducing the young noble of house Matherin, he got his\n
wish.  The two weren't married long, however, for he cheated one too many\n
times, and Amarise, by pure bad luck(for him) walked in on his final .. \n
Endeavor.  Now, Amarise, while only 20, was brought up to with honor, tradition\n
and law, and she knew her husband was not faithful to her from the start..  She\n
did something that is likely considered the norm with other larger houses, but\n
in her small world, it was more devastating than she could imagine.  After\n
running the young tramp off, she killed her husband, stabbing him with the\n
simple, and only, weapon she carries- a dagger to the back.  She got away with\n
it, quite obviously so, and after mustering up tears, screamed for the guards\n
and claimed it was a foiled robbery attempt.  \n
\n
After one year of assumed grief, Amarise, still feeling guilty over what she\n
had done, decided to take up law, and become a Magistrate.  Perhaps in the\n
hopes of keeping men like her dead husband off of the streets.  But, in her\n
heart of hearts, that night tarnished her, and she turned from a sweet, gentle\n
creature to a hard, bitter, angry woman.  Most fear her judgement.  Or\n
will(once this RP gets going..  :P) \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Apr 28 15:53:28 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Rissa
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Activity report
\n\n
After spending the rest of the day tailing the two armsmen, your mounted scouts return with the following report on their activity:\n
\n

The two men traveled on foot out into the city, walking a concentric route from the Oval, around Inner Street, then out to Caemlyn Street.  They stopped and talked with several groups of all sort of people.  Young and old, men and women, all those traveling or idling in groups of more than three at a time.  They never forced anyone to talk to them, were polite and calm, even cracked a couple jokes with some of those they spoke with.\n
\n

They never went into any of the inns or taverns, though they did go into the Market Square to purchase some food and cider.  Any time someone stopped them, they spoke with the questioner until he/she was satisfied of whatever answers they gave, and then moved on.  Rarely did they stay in one place and longer than the course of a conversation.\n
\n
\n

Neither of them ever made an angry or violent move toward anyone, they were completely calm and polite to everyone they spoke with, and they did not antagonize the men sent to follow them.  When they stopped for food, the younger of the two even gestured toward them apparently offering to buy them some, which your men declined.\n
\n

About two hours after sundown, when most people were no longer on the streets, the two men made for the east gate.  They had stabled horses near the city entrance, and they retrieved the mounts - the only time they went inside a building of any sort - and rode out of town at a steady trot.  They traveled along the road heading east until your men felt it prudent to head back to town: at least twenty minutes' gentle ride from the gate.\n

column5: A request to visit the Queen

column1: \n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sun Apr 28 16:00:22 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Kaden
\n`7Subj`6:`7 A request to visit the Queen
\n`7CC`6: `7Elayne Denee Ayasha
\n\n
-delivered to the Palace by a young man carrying a long slightly-curving sword who moves\n
with the leopard-like grace of a Tower-trained swordsman, and wearing a color-shifting\n
cloak-\n
\n
Greetings Sister,\n
\n
I am in Caemlyn attending to some business for another Sister of our Ajah and I wished to\n
arrange a visit so that we may meet and so that I may congratulate you on securing your\n
throne. Perhaps we may even enjoy a cup of tea together.\n
\n
I am staying at the Lion Banner Inn with my Warder. Master Marston has agreed to pass on\n
any messages that are delivered there for me.\n
\n
Yours in the Light,\n
\n
Denee Brinalle\n
Aes Sedai of the Green Ajah\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat May  4 16:58:38 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Rayenia
\n`7Subj`6:`7 opinion needed :)
\n\n
`6Here's what I am thinking on approaching the Builders with.  Let me know if\n
it paints a clear picture.  Clearly it will take some time for it to be icly\n
crafted and placed in game.`7\n
Tapestry\n
Hanging motionlessly upon a wooden panel is a large, intricately crafted tapestry.\n
A majestic, golden serpent stretches out across the top and bottom borders of this\n
large piece of artwork.  Three separate windows, framed in silver and gold, make up\n
the scene depitcted in the tapestry.  In the left window is the White Tower of Tar\n
Valon and, standing beside it are Aes Sedai of each Ajah in their shawls.  In the\n
right window stands the Black Tower and, standing beside it are Asha'man in their\n
black coats.  It is the middle window that is the most intricate.  In the sky is \n
the ancient symbol of the Aes Sedai - The Flame of Tar Valon and what is commonly\n
known as the Dragon's Fang.  However the Flame and the Fang are not separate,\n
instead they are joined together by the man who stands before it.  A tall man with\n
reddish hair.  His coat is red with scrolling dragons upon the sleeves.  At his\n
waist is a crystalline sword.  The man is the Dragon Reborn and it is only through\n
him that both Towers can, at last, find a peace.  \n

A majestic, `3g`#o`3ld`#e`3n `8s`3e`#rpe`3n`8t`7 stretches out across the top and bottom borders of this\n
large piece of artwork. Three separate windows, framed in `8s`7i`&lv`7e`8r`7 and `3g`#o`3ld`7, make up\n
the scene depitcted in the tapestry. In the left window is the `&White Tower of Tar\n
Valon`7 and, standing beside it are `&A`7es `&S`7edai of each Ajah in their shawls. In the\n
right window stands the `8Black Tower`7 and, standing beside it are `8A`7sha`1'`8m`7an in their\n
`8black coats`7. It is the middle window that is the most intricate. `@F`2a`3r`8ml`3a`2n`@d`7, `2f`8o`2r`@e`2s`8t`2s`7,\n
c`8i`7t`&ie`7s, and P`3a`#l`&a`#c`3e`7s reside near one another. People, noble and common, Aes Sedai\n
and Asha'man, are gathered together. A large table with food can be seen as well\n
as children playing games. The sky in all three windows is a soft `6b`^l`6ue`7, thick and\n
fluffy wh`&i`7te clouds can be seen. The `#sun`7 is unobscured by the clouds. In the sky,\n
the ancient symbol of the `&A`7e`8s Sed`7a`&i - The `&Fl`8a`&me of Tar Valon`7 and what is commonly\n
known as the `8Dragon`1'`8s F`7a`8ng`7 can be seen. However the `&Fl`8a`&me`7 and the `8F`7a`8ng`7 are not \n
separate, instead they appear to be joining together by the man who stands beneath\n
it. A tall man with `3r`1ed`!di`1s`3h`7 hair. His coat is `!r`1ed`7 with `&s`#c`3r`#o`&l`#l`3i`#n`&g `#d`3r`7a`8go`3n`#s`7 upon the \n
sleeves. At his waist is a `&cryst`^a`&ll`^i`6n`^e`7 sword. The man is the `!D`1ragon `!R`1eborn`7 and it \n
is only through him that both Towers can find a peace, or fall into obscurity.\n
Sewn into the lower left corner of the border with `!r`1ed`7 floss is an intricately \n
forged band of `3g`#o`3ld`7 - that of a `8g`3r`#e`3a`8t ser`3p`#e`3n`8t`7 biting it's own tail.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue May 14 20:41:25 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Jondrim
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Jondrim Background Part 2

\nIt turned out that Jondrim had joined the Hunt after all, fueled by liquid courage and the fervor of the moment (and perhaps the dazzling smile of young noblewoman).  Gos had spotted him go into the Square that morning but had been unable to pull him out before the Oath was sworn.  Despite not being in full control of his mental faculties when he chose to join the Hunt, Jondrim decided he would honor this Oath.  He had already been theorizing that the Horn had most likely already been found and was on display in the foyer of some noble that had no idea what it was as an antique.  Though Gos and Laskon had not sworn the oath, they agreed that Jondrim's theory was just as likely as anything else and that it would fit to the plans they had already made.  \n

And so they followed their plans.  The trio spent the next six months heading eastward towards Tear and eventually ending in Godan. Jondrim spent that time growing his hair and beard out in the style of several nations as he pretend to be a noble of anywhere from Arad Doman to Ghealdan.  He dyed his hair black, forked his beard like a Kandori and even wore an eye patch for a week along the way as they pilfered and conned several nobles into giving them enough wealth to maintain their elevated life style, though saw no sign of the horn or a lead. In Godan a stack of bank notes and letters of credit were cashed in at reputable counting houses around the city before passage was booked on a Seafolk vessel heading towards Ebou Dar\n

They spent a few weeks in Ebou Dar as themselves more or less, simply posing as successful mercenaries with cash to burn while Laskon put his knife skills to work impressing the locals in several duels. Given the feisty nature of the Altaran nobles and the lack of rumors regarding collections of antiquities they decided to move onward without attempting any further "work".   From there they sold half of their remaining emeralds and took passage on another ship towards Tanchico with the thought that others in the country may have taken inspiration from the Panarch's Palace and begun collecting antiquities.  \n

While some of the Taraboner nobles the group managed to worm their way into the confidences of did have some small collections the Horn was no where in sight nor was there any credible rumors off of its location.  Still, there was gold to be had and the three made their way across Tarabon before cutting through Amadacian and Ghealdan.  Where the River Manetherelle skirts the border of Murandy they boarded a river boat sailing upstream towards Whitebridge and their group had its first tragedy.\n

They had had a few attempts at theft go bad and had had to flee, but in general the last year of Jondrim's life had been rather care free, exciting and a real adventure.  He had kept up on his swordsmanship, reading every book and treatise on the subject as well as histories and books of prophecy he could find thinking that they may hold some hint to the Horns location.  From Gos he had learned to play the bittern well enough to impress most people, though like with the sword he was no master.  On his own he had picked up the ability to mimic the mannerisms and accents of nearly all the lands of west through careful observation of those around him and practice.  In short, he felt like he was living a story out of some Gleeman's tale, but in those the heroes rarely die.  The crossbow bolt in Gos's chest changed all that.\n

Their boat was set upon by river bandits one night when they were nearly a week out from White Bridge.  The boat had been anchored near shore and Gos had been on deck smoking his pipe when a volley of arrows and bolts flew into the ship before more bandits in boats suddenly rushed the ship.  Gos had been unlucky enough to have been sillouted by the lantern behind him and proved an easy target for the archers on shore and proved to be one of the few causilities of the attack.  In addition to Gos, Jondrim and Laskon the ship had taken on a company of experienced mercenaries as passengers and where the bandits had been expecting a score of sailors at most to deal with they were instead quickly beaten off by veteran soldiers.\n

When they arrive in White Bridge Laskon and Jondrim decided to go their seperate ways.  While the two had grown into friends over the last year, Gos had truly been the glue that had held the group together and in his absence it fell apart.  Without Gos they would not be able to pull of their usual ruse and so they split what wealth they had and said their good byes.  Laskon went westward towards Baerlon to meet up with some assoicates of his while Jondrim joined with the mercenaries from the ship and headed east towards Caemlyn.\n

Over the next few months Jondrim travelled eastward, doing bits of soldiering with his new companions before breaking away from them in Aringill to go his own way.  There had been not further rumors of the horn to reach his ears, but he still thought the answer laid with in either a noble's parlor or some rare lines of text in a book.. and so he head towards Cairhien.\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Jun  8 19:18:47 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Anley
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Anley's background
\n`7CC`6: `7Mat Maethir
\n\n
Anley has no official last name.  She was found abandoned on the\n
side of the road by an elderly pair who raised her.  For a few years\n
at least.  When Anley was fifteen summers, first her 'mother' passed\n
and barely a year later her 'father' died as well.  By this time she was\n
already well on her way to being grown, having lived in the country\n
most of her life.  It also helped that a neighbor, a retired Captain of\n
the Queens Guard, took pity on the girl who acted more like a boy, and\n
began to teach her very simple, basic swordsmanship.  The young girl\n
took to it like a fish to water, but no matter how hard the retired\n
Captain tried to convince to try to join the Queen's Guard, Anley was,\n
even at that age, a rebel, and knew she wouldn't fit in.  Having to\n
follow rules, dress a certain way, and light forbid, get up before\n
the sun! - Eventually, when she turned 18, she sold her adopted parents\n
plot of land and went adventuring. She hasn't gotten very far yet,\n
however, having grown up just outside of Caemlyn, she's made it to\n
the city and has been there, a large pocket full of too much coin\n
for a single woman to carry around, drinking it away and trying to\n
figure out exactly what it is she plans to do.\n
\n
Her adopted parents name was Meruchan, so she's adopted the surname as\n
well.\n
\n
(A few truncuates, which bothers me, but I'm trying not to be so anal\n
these days, so I'm not going to fix 'em!) :P\n

\n`7Date`6:`7 Wed Jun 26 14:43:22 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Ayasha
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Re: Band Camp
\nHeya,\n
\n
You are more than welcome to build a camp for the Band.  In fact,\n
I encourage it, since there will soon be some major Band-related story\n
stuff going on, and a camp will be needed.  I have actually been\n
thinking about this, but don't have the time to do it myself, and haven't\n
really got a good idea on what you guys might want.\n
\n
So, if you want to build it, I can set up a zone for you to build it in,\n
give you access to the builder port, and show you the ropes of how to build.\n
Or, you can just email me the descs again like you did with the Embassy,\n
and I can do the work needed on the builder port.\n
\n
Tell me how many rooms you think you will need, and I'll get a zone set up\n
for it either way.  And let me know if you want to build it yourself,\n
or if you just want to send me the descs.  Ideally, it would be better\n
if you did the building on the builder port.  I'm happy to show you how. :)\n
\n
Aya's player\n

\n

give you access to the builder port, and show you the ropes of how to build.\n
Or, you can just email me the descs again like you did with the Embassy,\n
and I can do the work needed on the builder port.\n
\n
Tell me how many rooms you think you will need, and I'll get a zone set up\n
for it either way.  And let me know if you want to build it yourself,\n
or if you just want to send me the descs.  Ideally, it would be better\n
if you did the building on the builder port.  I'm happy to show you how. :)\n
\n
Aya's player\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Jun 28 07:45:02 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Jaager
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Jaager Schatyn Desc and BG
\n`7CC`6: `7Isadora Jezz
\n\n
Desc:\n
Jaager is tall, broad shouldered, and weathered by the elements. His skin is tanned\n
and there are crow's feet at the corners of his narrow eyes from squinting in the sun.\n
Long auburn brown hair is pulled back into a tail that is tied with a leather thong.\n
He is dressed in clothing that is reminicent of hunting leathers, with tall leather\n
boots and worn leather breeches. His wool coat is leatherleaf green with a beige linen\n
shirt beneath and around his waist is a wide leather belt. Unlike a huntsman there are\n
a pair of swords strapped to his back with a handle rising over each shoulder. The\n
blades appear to be straight backed with a single, wavy, edge. In a sheath around his\n
right thigh is a huge fighting knife.\n
\n
Picture of Swords: http://stories.draeconin.com/images/K-scimitar.jpg\n
\n
Jaager is from a farm in the Black Hills along the road between Maradon and Tar Valon.\n
This has given him a Borderlander sensibility and attitude without actually being from\n
one of the Borderland nations. His father was an Arafellan and taught him something of\n
fighting with paired swords though that skill was honed in the Tower. He is now, with\n
his natural physical and mental ability combined with Tower training, a very dangerous\n
man.\n
\n
As a side note, and this is why I was asking for a clarification on Tower policy, I\n
would like to know if it is possible to have Jaager be a Bonded Warder without actually\n
having a PC Aes Sedai to be Bonded to. That may sound selfish and unfair to Aes Sedai\n
who don't have Warders and want one, but I am not sure at this point if I really want\n
to tie my character that closely to the RP of another. I am not asking to NPC an Aes\n
Sedai but rather just have her be always offscreen, perhaps a Sister that never leaves\n
the Tower or who has suffered some sort of injury or condition that does not allow her\n
to leave her apartments. Perhaps a Brown or White Sister.\n
\n
Please let me know what you think.\n
\n
Adam\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Sep 13 17:43:01 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Esmund
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Esmund Swisher Asha'man

\nEsmund Swisher is from Jyall, Ghealdan. Now the only son of a miner and his wife. (his brother having died in the mines) A few months ago, the town had heard rumors of a man claiming to be the Prophet of the Dragon Reborn. Having already been through or rather hiding from the war with the false Dragon, Logain, Esmund wanted nothing to do with the Prophet. He packs his few meager belongings and heads out with no clear destination in mind. Months go by as he travels from one town to the next, finding work here and there to pay for food and shelter. A few weeks ago, Esmund was in Four Kings and heard about a man building an army in Caemlyn, thinking his luck may turn, he sets out for Caemlyn. Upon entering the city, he finds out that men are being called for testing for channeling. Not liking the thought of an army or the One Power, he likes the thought of returning home, to a man who has taken over, or the hunger in his belly even less. \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Fri Sep 13 17:43:01 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Esmund
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Esmund Swisher Asha'man

\nEsmund Swisher is from Jyall, Ghealdan. Now the only son of a miner and his wife. (his brother having died in the mines) A few months ago, the town had heard rumors of a man claiming to be the Prophet of the Dragon Reborn. Having already been through or rather hiding from the war with the false Dragon, Logain, Esmund wanted nothing to do with the Prophet. He packs his few meager belongings and heads out with no clear destination in mind. Months go by as he travels from one town to the next, finding work here and there to pay for food and shelter. A few weeks ago, Esmund was in Four Kings and heard about a man building an army in Caemlyn, thinking his luck may turn, he sets out for Caemlyn. Upon entering the city, he finds out that men are being called for testing for channeling. Not liking the thought of an army or the One Power, he likes the thought of returning home, to a man who has taken over, or the hunger in his belly even less. \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Research: Dragons      Week: 1
\nI want to begin the research for the Dragons.  \n
\n
Skills/Talents: Comprehensive knowledge of battle tactics and strategies. \n
Warfare experience in both this Age and previous Ages, though random memories\n
from other people locked in Mat's head.  Aludra has knowledge and experience\n
with fireworks.  \n
\n
Resources: An Illuminator living in my camp.  Well-funded by both gambling and\n
now the Queen of Andor.  Access to bellfounders.  Ta'veren.  \n
\n
Plan: Most of the testing has already been done in the books, since it's\n
basically taking a firework launching tube and launching a firework.  Aludra is\n
simply expanding on that idea and adding more powder and making the firework\n
itself larger.  There will be testing on various amounts of powder for the\n
distances we are wanting, as well as field tests in aiming.  Building the\n
framework to carry the Dragons would be easy enough once the designs are made,\n
then cover the Dragon itself with a tarp, hitch the wagon to horses and take it\n
a few days ride outside of Caemlyn.  Plenty of open space.  A few soldiers\n
would be all that is needed for testing, at least testing the prototype, once\n
more are built, more can be trained.  \n
\n
-Mat \n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Tue Oct 22 21:48:23 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Isadora
\n`7Subj`6:`7 A Moment of your Tyme
\nSorry to bother you, I know you've started work again and your time on the MUD is going to be less due to that, work is important.\n
However, I have a couple of questions which I would really, really, like answers for.\n

You said Aalaryn would be off the WT Farm on Oct 15th. Okay, I got that, am I to wait for Egwene to talk to her icly, and if so lets schedule that, or can she just leave (without going through another brow-beating or hall meeting because RP really died on the mud after that) and return to Caemlyn?\n

Then there's the whole rp with Sabine/Asrah/Sa'narisa and then the Vaelin/Jezz/Cerrim otherwise known as Sabine's Rescue. Asrah's part is minimal and really I'm not hurting there on the rp front but, this is locking up many other people's RP. And I mean Jezz, Cerrim, Vaelin, Sabine. Then there's Telir, Cathbad, Aalaryn.\n

We all understand about RL happening, I am a full time student, a caregiver for my husband during his foot wound as well as an assistant for a neighbor. Everyone has jobs, the need to spend time with their families and spouses, heck Jezz and I have a standing thing in the AS/WD/WT guild "if you're going to be inactive, please just drop us an email or a mudmail, a facebook message, let us know what's up so we can work out whatever RP is going on that you're involved in so others don't have to be locked up" this is what we are looking for as well. \n

We the mortal players, need responses. If we don't get responses then we will carry on as we did when Rissa and Anazail vanished, we will make our own stories, we will live without Imm involvement except for when we need a rename or something (of which there is one needed for Jezz's alt).\n
Tyme is a game, it is a place of fun and relaxation for people, lets get back to active people and RP again so we can keep building.\n
The player of many (Isadora, Aalaryn, etc), \n
Tina\n
/l\n

\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Sat Oct 26 03:19:39 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Jezz
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Aya
\n`7CC`6: `7Ayasha Cerrim Syrah Acral
\n\n
Aya\n
I think there is a misunderstanding somewhere.\n
Last Thursday you told me you were excited about getting the Rescue Sabine \n
plot line done and we would talk about it on Friday after your interview. \n
You also told me you would be on over the weekend. You didn't show up on \n
Friday, Saturday, or Sunday. Sunday evening I wrote my email. I still \n
didn't see you on Tyme on Monday, hence the nudge. Imagine how I felt \n
being told one thing, and being flaked on. If there was a verbal "I need a \n
break" message, it was never told to me. \n
I added you to the Google docs of recent rp and the rp that had been done \n
from Jezz and Cerrim leading up to our stuck spot. You wanted logs. I sent \n
them to you. Please do not give me shit for doing exactly what you asked \n
of me. I sent one more email giving you the heads-up about what the logs \n
were about (since I wasn't able to comment on the Google doc link). I let \n
you know about the email on FB because I remember you telling me once \n
that you don't check that account  very often. Or maybe it was the other \n
account. Hmm. I hate getting old.\n
I added Savina, despite knowing Savina couldn't do anything, because I was\n
drawing Wyl into it for TAR help in finding Sabine. Jezz knows Wyl, but \n
not on a personal friendship level yet. I know he can't reach the place \n
where dreamers are ('Gap of Infinity' is the Theoryland name for the place \n
Egwene goes to find dreams.), but once we have a bead on a location, or \n
a building, he could help narrow it down from clues within TAR. He's also \n
got the wolves, and could help with tracking - which might come in more \n
useful than anything they did in TAR. \n
We discussed Tear. At no point did I ever say I was doing two different \n
things on the same day or in the same hour, or at the same moment between \n
two or three cities. Ever. I've set out a timeline for Jezz (accounting \n
student and all-I budget my time), I know it can be frustrating for others \n
but this is how my brain works.\n
The timeline for Tear is as follows:\n
`^-`7Go to Tear for no more than 2 days. \n
Allow Vaelin to rest and give him things to do to gain his bearings and \n
wits about him. Listen for rumors. Get rental. Leave for Caemlyn -- Done. \n
Rumors I'm looking for are if there are Aiel or Aes Sedai in Tear. Period. \n
According to the end of Book 10, Rand is still in Tear, or just outside. I \n
would assume some Aiel are still around. Even old rumors of Aiel would be \n
fine. Jezz gives zero fucks other than finding out about Aiel and Aes \n
Sedai. She is in Tear to plan an assassination, not a picnic. The common \n
room rp wasn't necessary. Sorry if you felt it was. \n
If you need help determining the rumors I need, here's a suggestion.\n
Roll the dice. \n
1-5: no useful information found in the 2 days in Tear. \n
6-10: Only felt and/or seen Aes Sedai in Tear -or- Definitely no Aes Sedai.\n
11-15: Only saw Aiel occasionally -or- Absolutely no Aiel in Tear. \n
16-20 Saw both Aiel and Aes Sedai -or- Definitely saw neither. \n
Bam. Done. \n
`^-`7Caemlyn. Save Sabine. - In progress\n
However long this takes IC time. Jezz wont focus on anything else than \n
saving Sabine, now that they are in Caemlyn.\n
This includes trying to find Sabine's dream.\n
Here is my research on warded dreams:\n
Warding dreams, according to this source, is based on the OP, and needs to \n
be channeled. http://wot.wikia.com/wiki/Ward\n
According to Moiraine, she wards her dreams each night without thinking:\n

Aes Sedai learn to shield their dreams. I do it without thinking, when I 
sleep. Warders are given something much the same in the bonding. The 
Gaidin could not do what they must if the Shadow could steal into their 
dreams. We are all vulnerable when we sleep, and the Shadow is strong 
in the night.
TDR\n
Interview:\n
SHARON PERDUE\n
Did Egwene as Amyrlin happen to be watching people's dreams while Rand was \n
shielded?\n
ROBERT JORDAN\n
I'm not quite sure I understand the question. Again?\n
SHARON PERDUE\n
Since Rand was shielded and couldn't form any wards on his dreams could \n
Egwene have spied out that he was in trouble while in Tel'aran'rhiod?\n
ROBERT JORDAN\n
Ah. Yes, she could have. The problem is, when you've learned that \n
something is impossible, you have a tendency to stop trying it. She just \n
didn't try to spy during the period in question.\n
http://www.theoryland.com/intvmain.php?i=26\n
Extinguishing her lamps, she wove a ward to keep her dreams from affecting \n
anyone else's - that could happen with those who could channel: others \n
nearby could find themselves sharing your dreams - and crawled beneath her \n
blankets.\n
-New Spring, The Human Heart, pg 93\n

What this tells me is that Sabine will be unable to shield her dreams with \n
the a'dam on her because she is not allowed to channel without permission -\n
much like Rand could not when he was shielded.\n
Moiraine, in New Spring, warded her dreams nightly. This would also \n
conclude that Sabine will not be able to ward her dreams. If Moiraine does \n
not tie the weave to last a long time (only until she wakes), then this \n
would indicate that other Aes Sedai do not either. With all these \n
references, I'm going to conclude that Jezz can reach Sabine via the Gap \n
of Infinity. \n

and I. I've briefly told him about it OOC, but we haven't started on the \n
planning stages.\n

Damara will be making an Aiel WO and maiden to rp with me and Cerrim.\n
Acral and Sabine have also expressed interest in making Aiel alts. \n
No IMM assistance needed.\n

Jezz. I'm setting her up for something. I can send it so you have a better \n
idea of where I'm headed with her. Obviously the list will take months to \n
accomplish, nor does all of it need IMM supervision. As I mentioned to you \n
before, I have a chess-like mind where I consider 5 squares ahead. I'll \n
send it once Cerrim has had a chance to look at it and add his portions, \n
though I think he said it looked good.\n
As an aside, I knew Tina was getting antsy about Aalaryn waiting for \n
Egwene. I told her I had added her concern to my email. I added her \n
concern because, not only is she my fellow GL, but also one of my \n
guildees and BOTH of her Tower alts were tied up. I found this \n
unacceptable. So it was mentioned.\n
Jezz, player of\n

being told one thing, and being flaked on. If there was a verbal "I need a \n
break" message, it was never told to me. \n

Aes Sedai learn to shield their dreams. I do it without thinking, when I

dreams. We are all vulnerable when we sleep, and the Shadow is strong 
in the night.

being told one thing, and being flaked on. If there was a verbal "I need a \n
break" message, it was never told to me. \n
I added you to the Google docs of recent rp and the rp that had been done \n
from Jezz and Cerrim leading up to our stuck spot. You wanted logs. I sent \n
them to you. Please do not give me shit for doing exactly what you asked \n
of me. I sent one more email giving you the heads-up about what the logs \n
were about (since I wasn't able to comment on the Google doc link). I let \n
you know about the email on FB because I remember you telling me once \n
that you don't check that account  very often. Or maybe it was the other \n
account. Hmm. I hate getting old.\n
I added Savina, despite knowing Savina couldn't do anything, because I was\n
drawing Wyl into it for TAR help in finding Sabine. Jezz knows Wyl, but \n
not on a personal friendship level yet. I know he can't reach the place \n
where dreamers are ('Gap of Infinity' is the Theoryland name for the place \n
Egwene goes to find dreams.), but once we have a bead on a location, or \n
a building, he could help narrow it down from clues within TAR. He's also \n
got the wolves, and could help with tracking - which might come in more \n
useful than anything they did in TAR. \n
We discussed Tear. At no point did I ever say I was doing two different \n
things on the same day or in the same hour, or at the same moment between \n
two or three cities. Ever. I've set out a timeline for Jezz (accounting \n
student and all-I budget my time), I know it can be frustrating for others \n
but this is how my brain works.\n
The timeline for Tear is as follows:\n
`^-`7Go to Tear for no more than 2 days. \n
Allow Vaelin to rest and give him things to do to gain his bearings and \n
wits about him. Listen for rumors. Get rental. Leave for Caemlyn -- Done. \n
Rumors I'm looking for are if there are Aiel or Aes Sedai in Tear. Period. \n
According to the end of Book 10, Rand is still in Tear, or just outside. I \n
would assume some Aiel are still around. Even old rumors of Aiel would be \n
fine. Jezz gives zero fucks other than finding out about Aiel and Aes \n
Sedai. She is in Tear to plan an assassination, not a picnic. The common \n
room rp wasn't necessary. Sorry if you felt it was. \n
If you need help determining the rumors I need, here's a suggestion.\n
Roll the dice. \n
1-5: no useful information found in the 2 days in Tear. \n
6-10: Only felt and/or seen Aes Sedai in Tear -or- Definitely no Aes Sedai.\n
11-15: Only saw Aiel occasionally -or- Absolutely no Aiel in Tear. \n
16-20 Saw both Aiel and Aes Sedai -or- Definitely saw neither. \n
Bam. Done. \n
`^-`7Caemlyn. Save Sabine. - In progress\n
However long this takes IC time. Jezz wont focus on anything else than \n
saving Sabine, now that they are in Caemlyn.\n
This includes trying to find Sabine's dream.\n
Here is my research on warded dreams:\n
Warding dreams, according to this source, is based on the OP, and needs to \n
be channeled. http://wot.wikia.com/wiki/Ward\n
According to Moiraine, she wards her dreams each night without thinking:\n

Aes Sedai learn to shield their dreams. I do it without thinking, when I 
sleep. Warders are given something much the same in the bonding. The 
Gaidin could not do what they must if the Shadow could steal into their 
dreams. We are all vulnerable when we sleep, and the Shadow is strong 
in the night.
TDR\n
Interview:\n
SHARON PERDUE\n
Did Egwene as Amyrlin happen to be watching people's dreams while Rand was \n
shielded?\n
ROBERT JORDAN\n
I'm not quite sure I understand the question. Again?\n
SHARON PERDUE\n
Since Rand was shielded and couldn't form any wards on his dreams could \n
Egwene have spied out that he was in trouble while in Tel'aran'rhiod?\n
ROBERT JORDAN\n
Ah. Yes, she could have. The problem is, when you've learned that \n
something is impossible, you have a tendency to stop trying it. She just \n
didn't try to spy during the period in question.\n
http://www.theoryland.com/intvmain.php?i=26\n
Extinguishing her lamps, she wove a ward to keep her dreams from affecting \n
anyone else's - that could happen with those who could channel: others \n
nearby could find themselves sharing your dreams - and crawled beneath her \n
blankets.\n
-New Spring, The Human Heart, pg 93\n

http://books.google.com/books?id=RwSagN7EtoUC&pg=PA93&lpg=PA93&dq=moiraine+wards+her+dreams+each+night&source=bl&ots=aSc5Td1aE-&sig=xL_PeUKlv3of8xwVL1q096tN0P8&hl=en&sa=X&ei=32NrUrTpIo-5kQfTuYFg&ved=0CD0Q6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=moiraine%20wards%20her%20dreams%20each%20night&f=false\n
What this tells me is that Sabine will be unable to shield her dreams with \n
the a'dam on her because she is not allowed to channel without permission -\n
much like Rand could not when he was shielded.\n
Moiraine, in New Spring, warded her dreams nightly. This would also \n
conclude that Sabine will not be able to ward her dreams. If Moiraine does \n
not tie the weave to last a long time (only until she wakes), then this \n
would indicate that other Aes Sedai do not either. With all these \n
references, I'm going to conclude that Jezz can reach Sabine via the Gap \n
of Infinity. \n
`^-`7 Wyl and Savina's wedding (No IMM assistance needed)\n
This will be pretty quick moving, but probably will be several weeks IC \n
time to plan and set up. It will be a co-GL sponsored event between Mat \n
and I. I've briefly told him about it OOC, but we haven't started on the \n
planning stages.\n
`^-`7 Aiel Waste\n
Damara will be making an Aiel WO and maiden to rp with me and Cerrim.\n
Acral and Sabine have also expressed interest in making Aiel alts. \n
No IMM assistance needed.\n
`^-`7 Return to Tear, plan an assassination. \n
IMM assistance needed here. \n
I'll wait till you are rested up. Jezz and Cerrim will be in the Waste \n
until then. If you have not returned, then I can take it up with Acral \n
since he won't be involved with any of his characters in Tear.\n
I have the rest of the timeline of events that I want to accomplish with \n
Jezz. I'm setting her up for something. I can send it so you have a better \n
idea of where I'm headed with her. Obviously the list will take months to \n
accomplish, nor does all of it need IMM supervision. As I mentioned to you \n
before, I have a chess-like mind where I consider 5 squares ahead. I'll \n
send it once Cerrim has had a chance to look at it and add his portions, \n
though I think he said it looked good.\n
As an aside, I knew Tina was getting antsy about Aalaryn waiting for \n
Egwene. I told her I had added her concern to my email. I added her \n
concern because, not only is she my fellow GL, but also one of my \n
guildees and BOTH of her Tower alts were tied up. I found this \n
unacceptable. So it was mentioned.\n
Jezz, player of\n
\n`7--] `6A Moment in Tyme MUD Mail System`7 [--
\n`7Date`6:`7 Thu Nov 14 01:27:44 2013\n`7From`6:`7 Jezz
\n`7Subj`6:`7 Rescue Sabine info
\nThis is what I got from Acral tonight. \n
\n
You tell Acral, 'Unless there is information to be had in Aringill, the\n
towerites should head down river to some unnamed village along the river \n
nearest Far Madding, at least a port village. Abour 4 days from Aringill, \n
give or take.'\n
Acral tells you, 'There will only be information gained on what ship they \n
boarded and what direction the boat was headed...if that's information you \n
want to wait on.'\n
You tell Acral, 'Just whatever info can be gained while they are there.. \n
leave the following morning by Gate to a port closest to far madding -- \n
did you want to rp it out what Vael got from it? I hadnt seen Cerrim all \n
day. '\n
Acral tells you, 'I have to check some things for Syrah in just a few \n
minutes...and finishing up a few last tweaks on Connerie's comp.'\n
[Syrah had already logged out.]\n
You tell Acral, '*nods* It would be day 7, and morning of day 8 '\n
Acral tells you, 'Just looked at the map and figured up the best case \n
scenario for them to make it from Aringill to Amadacia is about 15 days by \n
boat.'\n
You tell Acral, 'Most boat captains stop at night along the river.'\n
Acral tells you, 'That was including only sailing 10 hours a day.'\n
You tell Acral, '*nods* Kind of betting that they would stop somewhere \n
close to a port, even if they dont dock, since a port village might have \n
room for multiple boats to sit'\n
Acral tells you, '10 hours a day to Tear, averaging between 6 and 7 knots. \n
The speed increases between Illian and Tear, but that depends on finding a \n
proper seafaring vessel. Then slowing back down going up river to \n
Amadacia. However, it does not factor in any delays from resupplying. It \n
does not factor in any delays from finding a different ship and then \n
another boat.'\n
You tell Acral, 'We'll be trying to get her before they ever reach Tear.. \n
I know this was to to give the SC Gate, but its gonna be extremely \n
difficult to get her in the belly of the beast. '\n
Acral tells you, 'I'm going to be working with Syrah when I see her on \n
again (should be tomorrow) to figure out a timeline for all of it. Give \n
them gate, or at least a basis on which to figure out gate. Give enough \n
time for Sabine to be severely emotionally damaged and Vaelin to be \n
severely emotionally damaged. But not drag it out.'\n
You tell Acral, 'So are we not wanting to actually save her till amedicia \n
then? Tear might be difficult for the SC, since, based on the books, the \n
sea folk are in the harbor. I'm just concerned about Gating into SC \n
territory. I'm not interested in getting caught too :P'\n
Acral tells you, 'I really can't say yet. Either way has merit. Syrah and \n
I will have something more final tomorrow.'\n
You tell Acral, '*nods*'\n
\n
But despite it, I wont be back till close to thanksgiving, and I doubt\n
everyone will be able to log on until that 4 day weekend is over due to \n
ll the family stuff going on. We don't have family close, so we wont be \n
going anywhere.\n
\n
Jezz, player of\n
